text: I love how they have no rice sushi options. They have a pretty good list of sushi and the sauces that they use for it. Food came out at a timely manner and service was not bad.

This is my new go to place for ayce sushi in vegas. Portions are small so that you can try a variety of different things. Quality of the fish is good...not what I would expect from an ayce place.  Service was top notch. Kid friendly....came here with kids and they were charged half price and a small trinket from the treasure chest to boot. I will be back.

One of the best all you can eat sushi spot. A lot of different variety on top of the sushi such as skewer, sashimi  and cooked food. They also have yellow tail collar that's not in the menu so make sure to ask your server.

Best AYCE sushi in town! Great selection with 6 rolls offered with no rice! All the rolls we ordered had excellent flavor and amazing freshness! The service was amazing including the owner coming to the table multiple times! Accommodated our large party with ease. Will definately be our new sushi joint! Thanks again jjanga!

Excellent food, great service, beautiful decor, relaxed atmosphere and reasonably priced. The AYCE menu offers everything you could possibly want and more and the staff are so friendly and helpful. I love everything about this place and I'll be back. Highly recommended!

Sushi here was very very good. Even the run of the mill salmon was very tasty. Highly suggest garlic tuna. The chefs are fast, and take care of you, especially if you sit at the bar. Very good off the strip sushi option; not too far so a split fare by cab from the strip is cheap (admittedly probably hard to get one coming back on the weekends though). Would definitely come again.

One year later and jjanga still doesnt disappoint! The quality of every piece of sushi is super fresh, and the rice underneath is small so in comparison you get so much more of your fav raw fish on top. For those who dont like raw foods theres also a huge collection of baked rolls and other cooked foods for you. The servers are very very polite and energetic, and all the orders came super fast, about one minute after i place the order. They do charge for left overs, but since each order has a small serving size you dont have to worry about ordering too much. I definitely recommend the garlic tuna, salmon belly(this isnt on the menu so ask them for it), poki salad, uni, flying fish egg, beef tataki, and the freshman roll. Also the choo choo special which is also not on the menu is amazingggg. I was worried that jjanga wouldnt live up to my impression of it last year, but it has most certainly surpassed it, and made me fall in love with jjanga once again. Thank you jjanga for this amazing experience! Hope I get to come back again next year!
We love it here. We eat a lot of nigiri (salmon and ikura among others ) and a couple of rolls. Always fresh and fast and friendly.
All Sushi is really fresh. My son love their Teriyaki Chicken. Everything is great! The customer is great also. Will bring my friends here for next gathering!

We stopped here on a Monday around 4 p.m. We opted to sit at the sushi bar, which was a wise decision. The sushi chefs were friendly and fun. We even got to taste some unique items the chefs were preparing for prep. Our plates never went empty and neither did our drinks. All of the staff were friendly and efficient. As stated in other reviews you do not have one specific server dedicated to you. All of the staff chips in to help serve. 

Be sure to ask the staff about a "stem" card if you do the AYCE option. It is a loyalty card and after you buy 10 AYCE sushi you get the 11th one free. 

We will absolutely return.

BEST JAPANESE RESTAURANT EVER. The chef at the sushi bar gave us a complementary pallet cleanser.  and I believe the owner helps serve and make all of the customers happy and he is hilarious. I always look forward to seeing the owner and taste the amazing food.

Fuck dude this place is so dank! I'm trying to just come back here, bro. If you come out here you gotta eat all the fish n shit.

UPDATE: they have the best green tea ice cream. Shit was so fucking delicious. My cousins and I had maybe 6-7 servings of ice cream! And bruhhhh the yuzu yellowtail slices are thick af!

Hands down, after 13 years in Vegas, my favorite sushi spot! The sushi is so fresh, the crew is an absolute blast, they remembered our names since first visit & remember our Fabs, likes & dislikes. I love to sit at bar, they get creative for you if you ask them to supeise you. Excellent service & food! All u can eat too!!
Food is always great, great price, great service and the speed at which they give you food is incredible. My favorite sushi place in town.

Lunch AYCE is wonderful if you upgrade to dinner price.  
yummy.   Glad to find this restaurant

My favorite sushi place in Vegas! Can't go wrong with all you can eat quality sushi. Food came out quickly and entire staff was attentive and friendly. I HIGHLY recommend this place! Excellent customer service, fun decor, and most importantly delicious food!

JJANGA is one of the best sushi places I've been to with some of the best prices! The nigiri are always delicious and the rolls are consistently amazing. Whether you sit at the sushi bar or at a table the experience is a great one. Everyone is so friendly and welcoming and very skilled. This is my go-to sushi spot and I HIGHLY recommend it to people!

This place is horrible. I came here under the premise that it was going to be a great place to eat based on the reviews overall. Not only did they treat me and my party differently when they welcomed us in, in comparison to other guests, but they were rude and not attentive.  The deep fried food was terrible. I was so sick all night after having the crazy ass deep fried roll and the Japanese lasagna. I only tried those based on the reviews I read.  Makes me wonder if these reviewers were paid to rave about them.  I left my scarf behind accidently and I called them to confirm and put it aside. They didn't even look for it and told me they did not find it.  Such disrespect and disregard is unfathomable. This is no way to treat people who give you business. Here I thought I was going to go back to this place right before we left.  Thank you for showing me the truth.

We picked this spot for lunch without knowing anything about it and we were very happy with the meal.  The sushi was fresh and tasty.  The staff was very pleasant and professional and service was excellent.  The restaurant is clean and cozy inside with separation between tables to reduce the noise.  I am vegan, so I cannot comment on the fish, but the vegetable sushi was perfect and the edamame and rice were great.  They do offer a children's bento box that was well received by my six year old, she would have given it five stars.  I will definitely stop in next time I am in town.

This is hands down my favorite sushi restaurant. I've only been there twice because it's a little bit further than I like to drive for food but if I'm in the area, planning a special night or have friends in town, I'm there. Every time that I've been there the food was excellent and the service was impeccable.

The exterior desigb of the plaza might fool you, but do not let the old fashioned brick walls and casual liqor store on the corner lead your judgemt towards a "hole-in-the-wall" kind of place. I was skeptical about visiting JJanga at first just because of the location, but I'm glad I took my friend's recommendatuon. The food is great, at a great price, and even involves a vegetarian special and a specially spicy section, for those of us with specific tastes. The staff was friendly and wanted to make sure they accomodated their custmers' needs. The design, the interior, spacious and very well designed. I can't wait until the karaoke opens up.

The owner seems to be a very well known sushi chef in town, and I think JJango is going to be the new Jang out for me in the future.

After one visit to JJANGA's, I'm sold!! This place is hands down the best sushi I have ever had.  My friend highly recommended it, as she has followed JJ in the past at all the sushi restaurants that he has worked at and was so excited that he opened his own place!  The atmosphere was energetic and fun and everyone was welcoming right when we walked in.  The sushi was simply amazing.  We did the AYCE and the food just kept coming.  The wait staff were all very attentive to our needs, our plates and glasses were always full.  The yellowtail sashimi was a favorite, along with spicy tuna and salmon, but pretty much everything we tasted was fabulous.  I don't particularity like grapefruit or sake, but the grapefruit sake was like nectar of the Gods!  After sake, and tons of sushi, we had mochi for dessert, along with a glass of red.  Even the wine glasses were fun!  They were painted with fun sayings on them.  Mine had a dog on it and it said "fetch me my wine" haha!  Loved it.  JJANGA is a great place if you are looking to have amazing food and fun evening out.  We will be back and hope to check out the karaoke room next time!
If you like Sushi...you definately have to eat here. The food is exceptional and the service is good. Trust me!

I ate here in March (I know, it's a bit late). However, JJanga is awesome! I had the AYCE and it was one of the best I have been to. The salmon belly was delicious as well as the unagi! I will definitely stop by since I am here again.

This place is great! Only sushi place that's affordable a la carte but too good not to resist the  all you can eat. Great service, hilarious sushi chefs, endless green tea and beverages. Recommend to all of our friends and family. We also appreciated the late hours they are open.

Great service and food here.  The sushi chefs have great personalities.  The only complaint is they need to use more manage.  Okay actually 2, the all you can eat menu is a little bit limited but manageable.  Good grade tuna,  some of the best pond,  almost as good as sushi fevers.  Loved their mango mochi. What else,  it's worth  it.

My hairstylist suggested this place a while back and everytime I went to see her, she'd ask if I ever checked it out, sadly my answer was always No...until one day my husband and I were killing time in the area and well...let's just say I definitely found my new spot
Thanks Karla!!

Awesome place. The chefs are great, you will experience rolls that you would have to pay allot more at other places. In a shady area but once there awesome place. Have know the owner for years, happy to see he got his own place. Staff is very attentive and polite.

I love this place the rice to sushi ratio is always on point! Their great service matches the great food they serve and make sure to check out their happy hour at 11 pm where they have lunch ayce price! 

Try the something wrong roll! 
And their halibut is super great here!
Great sushi for the all you can eat price!   Nice people and ambience!  Surprisingly fresh for an all you can eat place in las Vegas.   $26 for dinner,  not bad!

The service was atrocious, it took us over 20 minutes for our waiter to come to us. The wait on food was not bad, but the waiter was never checking in. The food was average. All of my fish was kind of chewy, not what I look for in sushi.

When we did get our check, the auto gratuity was 20%, which I have never seen for a party of 5. I understand why that rule is in place, but when the service sucks, you are not entitled to a good tip. I will never go back here.
First time and this will definitely not be the last. Great meal wonderful service along with atmosphere. If you enjoy sushi this is the place to go.

My favorite ayce sushi restaurant in Las Vegas. After my old favorite quickly went down the hill after a change in management, I'm glad that I enjoy Jjanga! 

Servers are friendly and patient! Service is fast for an ayce restaurant. Normally you never see your server. Or maybe because I try to avoid eating at a peak dinner time. 

Food is great and they have many variety! I'm glad to see they have some dishes that other sushi places doesn't. I can't really find anything negative to say about this place.

Great food and even better names!
All the food was delicious and the atmosphere is lively and friendly even at strange hours. all the fish tastes very fresh and all the rolls definitely lived up to their expectations! I have to say I still chuckle when thinking back on some of the names for their rolls. 
The pricing is also very good for an AYCE sushi joint, I will definately be going back to this place next time I'm in town.

My friends and I gave this place a shot on my birthday. & I've got to say that it was not only the best birthday dinner I've had, but it was the best sushi experience I've ever had. The servers are very friendly and this place is very upbeat. JJ is a trip! He's a pretty awesome host. 

As for the food, it was really great. We tried several rolls and it was just wonderful and quite different. Their poki salad was one of the best ones I've ever had & I actually managed to finish mine! I highly, highly recommend this place & I claim this to be my new sushi spot! 

Another awesome thing is that they have punch cards for AYCE, which I've never seen from other sushi places. I'm definitely going to to back for more!

Good all you can eat Japanese restaurant with a large menu. Service is very quick and servers are attentive. The fish itself could use a little less sauce however. The natural flavors were drowned out by the sauce. I myself like more tradition sushi that isn't drenched in sauce ergo your taste may vary. The uni was not young thus tasting a bit bitter. The fish to rice ratio was a bit poor versus other all you can eat places in Vegas. Over all I would recommend this place if you have a chance to stop by.
Great service, great quality sushi. All you can eat orders - nice piece of fish and a little rice. Just an awesome place. Will come back again!
One of the best place to eat AYCE sushi in town. Try their burritos!

The food was okay. It seemed like a nice setting. The one thing that ruined the mood of a pleasant atmosphere was one rude white male douchebag migonistic server.  My friend ordered the eel. When the plate was brought over he handed it to my other friend telling her it was chicken teriyaki.  
The server came back telling us that is the eel,  when he said it was chicken.  After she already ate like half of eel ("chicken teriyaki") he wouldn't give my friend a new batch.  Telling her to share and just eat your food patronizing her like a child.  Also demanding she still pay after not eating her ate off food.
Their nigiri is delicious. Great customer service too. Their all you can eat option is reasonably priced. They have a wide selection of food to choose from. Highly recommend!

Service was fast. We were really excited and ordered a billion things.. and everything came out within minutes! Waiting for food kills the excitement so the fast service was a major plus for me. Servers came back every now and then to ask us if we wanted to order more, which was great!!


AYCE menu has a wide variety of foods! From sushi to bulgogi to salad. I only ordered sushi - it was pretty fresh, but the rice ball was pretty big for an AYCE sushi. But I was most excited about AYCE uni sushi. i LOVE LOVE LOVE uni. Unfortunately, the uni here was disgusting. It was dry, chewy, and dark brown. The flavor was really fishy, slightly sour, and very bitter. We told the server the issue and asked for a replacement order and they gave me another sushi with the dry chewy dark brown uni. I was really disappointed and asked if i can get a fresh one that's not dry and nasty.... and he brushed it off and said "all uni is from the same box". But if you know that box of uni is bad, WHY ARE YOU STILL SERVING IT?? After getting bad uni for the third time, I gave up. 

I was really disappointed with this place. I don't think I would come back. Definitely wouldn't recommend thids place to uni lovers.

The best sushi I've eaten in my life ever! XXX and tastes like my exgirfriend rolls are superior, and I could eat their mango mochi ice cream all day! The decor is tasteful and the tables are very cozy. The host guy was hilarious, although I'm not sure if he was trying be or or not. A+ for the accent and atmosphere dude! ;)
Good food but service was horrible starting from the male manager, he have no skills and he's not friendly at all. We will stop coming back because of he's attitude .

My husband and I came here for the all you can eat sushi. We were seated quickly, got our drinks and food order put in right away. We waited only a few minutes for our food to start coming out. We love this place!! Best sushi we've both had and great customer service.
best service I have ever experienced at a restaurant! I would defiantly recommend trying it out

The all-you-can-eat dinner buffet was my favorite meal in Vegas. I'd give 6 stars if I could.

Unlike other sushi joints that set up cheaper, rice-filled cuts of fish for buffets, Jjanga is order straight from the menu. Any nigiri or specialty roll is fair game! All if which is delicious and fresh, coming from a sushi snob.

They're open late and a $10 cab ride from the Palms. Hit them up. Yuhee's a bomb server, she kept bringing us more and more 'chef's specials'. They even took our picture with a Polaroid at the end. Feel like Frank Sinatra here!

One of the best sushi spots in Vegas. The only spot where salmon belly nigiri isn't limited to one order per person which is a big thing for me. Their customer service is great and they're very friendly.
Great sushi! Chefs are fun and friendly lot of items on the menu to chose from and the prices are spot on! Plus get a stamp card 10 AYCE is free!
If the food doesn't wow you the upbeat and "super cool" staff will. Hands down the hippest sushi in town... Lost for what to order boss man will pick for you and you will like it every time!

5 Star Rating?? Hahaha, not quite. Although their sushi tastes somewhat fresh & rolls were well made, the bento boxes are tiny and quality are a dime a dozen back in LA. 

We came with a group of 7, and although the restaurant was slow with less than 7 other guests aside from our group, the food came out slow, and 5 minutes apart from eachother. So when the final entree came out, most were finished. And no daicon available either. Food was pretty good but not 5 Star quality.

Great food Great service we will return for sure thanks Erik  our great server he took care of us really well.

My personal favorite was surf turf but everything is good in here.

Please try.

Great service surpassed only by great food!   

It was lunchtime on a hot day and we don't think we can handle AYCE sushi.  But since we were craving for good sushi we decided to visit Jjanga at Decatur Blvd.  We were greeted graciously and were seated right away.  Sarah, our server, was quite attentive and made sure we had what we needed/wanted.  

We ordered Chirashi bowl from Chef Jjanga and were served with one of the best sushi bowls we've had so far!  All the fish cuts were fresh and tasted really great.  Can't help but take picture of the wonderful work of art.  Thanks Chef Jjanga for a wonderful culinary experience.  We will definitely come back for more great tasting morsels.
Jjanga makes miracles with sushi and he's the funniest ever! Amazing food and you can't beat the price!
Very satisfied with the service and food, happy we decided to try this place ! The food was excellent the fish was well cut and everything taste really good
Luv this place , first time here , from yelp . Luv it no rice roll. Luv the cucumber and the waitress has been awesome on recommending the best on the menu.
Jjanga always deliver great food,atmosphere,service, has it all!!!!!!have a sashimi plater hamachii kama yummy everything was good!!

Quite possibly the worst dining experience we've ever had. We wanted to try a new place and because of all the great reviews we decided to come to Jjanga. We were pleased upon entering, the music was cool, the decor was very nice and we were greeted promptly. Once seated we were handed menus and expected to give our order immediately. We decided to do the all you can eat. Aside from the nigiri, all of the rolls use the cheapest imitation crab mixed with lots of mayo. Most of the items use really poor ingredients. The Hawaiian Roll had veggies in it!? Who does that?! For example, in the sashimi salad there was iceberg lettuce, like the kind from a salad mix at the grocery store. The best items was the mochi which was probably store bought too. Definitely not a real sushi restaurant. I guess all of the rave reviewers have never had good, quality sushi.
Love jjanga we sat at bar  Sponge and Ethan were great, all we had to do was them what fish we liked and they were very creative. Everything was fresh . Service was excellent. Can't wait to come back

BAD BAD BAD.

AYCE is definitely a rip off.  Even with the "Happy Hour" for late night ($20 lunch price instead of the $25 dinner price after 9 pm or something like that) the place is still on my shit list.

First, the rolls were small and the portions of the appetizers were TINY.  An order of agedashi tofu literally means one cube of tofu.  An order of seaweed salad is about 2 inches in diameter.  An order of the garlic gingko is 3 gingko nuts plus a ton of garlic (which, if I may add, we were asked about why we did not finish. Yes, they expected us to finish all slices of the garlic that were used to stir-fry the darn nuts -- don't even get me started there).

That brings me to my second point.  The waiters stand over you and won't clear the table unless you've finished literally every freaking bit of the meal.  We ordered the udon noodles and they didn't clear our bowl because there was still some soup at the bottom.  No kidding.  I get that they don't want to waste food, but it felt more like eating in prison.

And most importantly, the food just didn't taste right - period. I started getting a stomachache in the middle of the meal.  Never again.
Awesome food and service!!! Would definitely be coming back to fill out a stamp card for a free sushi buffet. You gotta get the beef sushi and pork skewers (pork belly).

Non-fresh seafood at all. The color of urchin turned into the black and smelly but they still take them to our table. It's not a right way to running restaurant business especially a sushi restaurant. It's a horrible experience to us. Will never go there again.
Jay is awesome. Very good customer service and the food was delicious as well. I really liked both times i been here and i brought more people each time.Will be coming back soon !

Food was great, service was wonderful and prices were reasonable.  At the end of our dinner, the manager told our two boys that they could pick a toy from the toy box.  That was such a nice surprise!  We will definitely come back when we're in town again.

Good sushi especially considering it is ayce. The lines can be a little long as the venue is very small and the service can be a little slow due to the crowd. But good restaurant over all. Will defenitely be back.

I predict this place being the new "spot" in Vegas! --well it's definitely one of my new favorite spots to eat here. Friendly staff, in house sushi chefs are funny, ambience is good, decor is great! Love this spot & it's a must try!! 

Al a carte or ayce it will definitely be worth it! Prices are superb (please don't change it haha)

Warm welcome... Check
Good atmosphere.... Check
Awesome rolls... Check
Customer Service... Check. Check. 

All in all it was a great time and experience. Our chef KooKoo was KooKoo and made our night. 

Gotta try the Lasagna Roll & Grapefruit Sake. Just found my new sushi spot. Cha Ching!
Best place to get AYCE! Their fish is very fresh and delicious. On top of that, their lunch price for AYCE is very cheap for the quality they use! I would definitely recommend to friends and family.

First time coming here. The minute I stepped in, the atmosphere was very friendly. I was immediately escorted to a table, and was delighted by the variety of the menu. The waitress was extremely nice and even recommended popular dishes, which turned out to be very delicious. So if you don't know what to choose, don't be afraid to ask the waiter. Their recommendation will turn out to be more of the delicious dishes. She even checked up on us once in a while to see how we were doing.the fish was very fresh and the portions were hearty. Starting off with the appetizers and then the sushi nigiri will help you leave room for the rolls. Don't forget to take advantage of trying out the green tea and red beam ice cream to complete the meal! I think my time here couldn't have been any better! Would definitely come back :)
Greatest sushi restaurant in Las Vegas!!! Chef Sponge was most awesome :) I wish that I can eat everyday  I LOVE JJANGA

Great place. Scott is a great guy takes care of his customers. Hickey has made us some amazing sushi.  My recommendation is let him do his thing and make what he enjoys.  Great atmosphere very casual and comfortable
Great food, great ambience, really friendly and attentive staff. Food selection is great A+++++++

The sushi here is always very creative and yummy, and the decor makes for a nice environment to bring anyone to--even a casual date. Im giving them 3 stars because recently I've had pretty bad service. It appears the servers don't work sections or even tables. I had a group of 6 and we had four or five different people putting in orders and checking on us throughout the night. This worked out at first, but then of course we started getting ignored. I guess each server thought the other was checking on them, but it wasn't happening. We waited almost 45 minutes before flagging someone down to keep ordering sushi and to get a roll we head ordered what seemed like ages ago. Everyone was super friendly it's just inefficient. After all this flagging down we had to do, they of course tacked on a 20% gratuity and told us we could only split the check 3 ways, causing us to have to work out with each other who will be paying for who. All of this is making me less likely to return.
Just discovered a new great place. Both food and service are excellent!!! I really like super white tuna and albacore. Keep up the good work!!!

This is probably the best AYCE sushi place in Vegas. There are a large variety to choose from, including appetiser, sushi, sashimi, rolls and even deserts. Their uni and eel nigiri are amazing. I would definitely come back for more!

I LOVE THIS PLACE :) Great Staff, fun energy Awesome Sushi!!... Mr. CHOO CHOO is Awesome he's so Funny!!! A big plus is they have a treasure chest with goodies and toys for your lil ones to pick after their meal :)

We arrived at JJANGA at 7:45 with reservations and were seated at around 7:50. We ordered our food and it came to our table immediately afterwards. We got the All You Can Eat. It was all super delish. I would definitely come back. The only downside to this place is that the service was a little uncoordinated.

I love this place! It was rated one of the best AYCE sushi places in Vegas. They just renovated it so the interior is beautiful and clean and simple before it was kind of dark and claustrophobic. 

Pricing:
Lunch: $19.95 
Dinner: $25.95 

Food: 
 garlic tuna
 (part of their no rice roll) 
Tuna Naruto is refreshing- wrapped in cucumber
Spring mountain roll- wrapped in rice paper
Spicy tuna hand roll/ salmon hand roll ( packed )
Green tea/ red bean ice cream yes!!!! 

** a large extensive variety of rolls!!!**

Service:
The servers are nice and friendly but one thing that changed during this most recent visit was that they spread out our order, serving each item in 5-10 min intervals. The pace slowed us down and we filled up much quicker. 

Parking: 
In a plaza with an abundance on parking spaces.
Checked out Jjanga for the first time. Service was nice and quick. The food was okay. The nigiri tasted fresh, but came with a lot of rice. The few rolls and appetizers we got had too much sauce.
This our first visit with families of 12. With local family in town recommend to have dinner at Jjanga. Everyone of our gave it five star for this visit.

A great dinner option that will keep you full and inexpensive.  Service needs improvement but since it's an ayce place, it's inevitable that orders will get mixed up. Other than that, the ayce menu has many tasty options. It's worth trying if you have a car. It does get crowded on the weekends.

Food is the bomb!! Service is great, friendly staff. Love their tuna naruto!

The sauce of their shrimp tempura is the best I've had so far.  The rolls are of good portion, not too much rice in their rolls.  The monkey burrito is my son's favorite. 

They renovated their place, I like it better than the old one. It's more spacious and lighting is better. 

Too bad they don't have chocolate and green tea ice cream at this time.

Jjanga is awesome!  So glad we found these guys when they moved locations.  By far, the best sushi and atmosphere in Vegas.  We hadn't been there in about a month or so yet they remembered every sushi item that we normally ordered!  Now that's a great chef!  You have to try it!  "Pink Lady!!"

Pretty good sushi spot! They have a lot of items to choose from, and the price is pretty good! Went in for lunch for the first time ($20.95/person for AYCE), and the waiter we got was super nice and attentive. 

Tried a variety of things on the menu, and they were all pretty good. Four stars because you can't do half rolls so you can't try as many things!

Great restaurant. 
The prices for a la carte menu items were ammaaazing. I figured I'd receive dinky portions but no they were decent sized and tasted spectacular.
The sushi was stellar as well. The fish was fresh and the serving size of rice was petite and perfect. 
We received exceptional service and would most definitely recommend the restaurant to others.
This spot right here tho. It's on point! Food comes out SUPER FAST!!! Like I was astonished at the speed. On top of that the food is on par with what my taste buds deserve
I remember i came here for my prom with about 20 of my friends! Hands down awesome customer service, and the quality of the food was top notch!

The stars are for the food, when they have all components, it is yummy. I have taken away for slow service, lack of items to complete sushi rolls, and not being forth coming. Every single time, which is about four times, there has been something wrong. The last time was really the last straw. I didn't even get to eat, was sat down, brought water, ginger, wasabi and asked if I could order from the appetizer menu. I did and then tried to order nigiri. I was met with "well I asked you if you wanted to do appetizers first because we only have one sushi chef and he has 18 rolls to make." So I walked out. This girl couldn't tell me before she sat me down at a table and brought water, etc out. Come on now. Sloppy, wasteful, and on and on. I will not be going back, bye bye Jjanga.
All u can eat for $26& it's delicious!!! Never had deep fried rolls& now I'm in love. Can only handle 1 or 2 of those rolls tho. Hand wraps were great too! Will definitely be back!
Excellent customer service....let the sushi chef drive the ship. Eat anything he suggests...amazing!!! Would totally take a cab and go out of my way!!!!!!!

Over all the food was fine. If you're a fan of uni... You will be very disappointed.

Ive never seen any of the restaurants in my life which would put SESAME OIL with Sea Urchin!!!! This is a very very sad thing for me. Not just that, the color of uni is very dark, unlike any of the previous review.

BEST SUSHI EVER! We got the all you can eat for all of us. Scott was our waiter and made this place over the top on service and food. He would recommend different items that we had never tried before.  They had a wide list of different things on the menu for the all you can eat. If I could go above the 5 stars I would give more.  If you go try the grapefruit saki. I don't like grapefruit or saki and it was very good. It left me wishing we could take this place home with us. This place is a must stop if your going to vegas  and want to try sushi. Make sure you ask for Scott, he will only add to this awesome experience.

Quality has gone down since the change of owner. They cut the sushi into such thin slices that it is difficult to pick up the sushi without it falling apart. The nigiri slices are also tiny! VERY STINGY restaurant. Definitely will not be coming back to this location. The Fort Apache location is much better - sushi is cut and made the right way.

The AYCE is the best in town in my opinion. Plus, the atmosphere and service has always been great. I'm happy to see business is going good for Jjanga he is a really nice guy who I met within their first week of opening. Now for the food, the who's your daddy appetizer, spider roll and the Grand Canyon are RIDICULOUS! We order them every time... and occasionally we venture out to try new things, these are great for those who are not your average sushi lover. People that I know that say they don't like sushi find themselves amazed by those three items. You must give Jjanga a shot... it's one of my favorite places.

Haven't had much luck with AYCE sushi in Las Vegas, but at the suggestion of a friend, tried Jjanga and was definitely not disappointed.   What an AYCE menu!  Nothing was left out and the fish was the freshest ever.  Freshest tuna and yellowtail and my favorite saba was the best!!!!  Very friendly and attentive staff.  Excellent experience from beginning to end.

This place is AMAZING! Not only do they have great food but INCREDIBLE customer service! I made a reservation for 11 people and as soon as we walked in we were seated right away, not all of our party came in at the same time but we were still seated. Some places u have to wait until your party arrives. Food came to our table so quick! They were all very attentive, empty plates were taken as soon as it's cleared, they asked if there's anything we would like to order. This is WONDERFUL CUSTOMER SERVICE. Very impressed! Scott remembered us from our previous visit and that's very rare. Price is very reasonable. By far the best AYCE Sushi in town! And I'm very impressed with decor, atmosphere, and they played good upbeat music! Very modern!
Amazing sushi! So convenient to the Strip and great shopping. This places rocks. Also, insanely cheap!!
Yummy sushi! Gina is an amazing funny server! Check it out. You won't be disappointed!

if you are looking for something simple review, I LOVE IT JUST GO AND TRY THEIR FOOD.

As you walk in to the restaurant, friendly servers greets you and lead you to the table. Overall atmosphere of the restaurant is clean and fancy.
You can guess their food and service to be nice just because they just opened but, ever since my first visit, i've been going there every week now and their service is getting better and better each week! they are getting busier every week too which is a positive thing. I guess that everyone feels the same way as I do about this place. 
Foods are great, comes out fast and sometimes special sashimi orders come out to from the sushi chef which is unusual compare to any other restaurant that does AYCE.

The quality of fish are amazing! so does the kitchen orders. When I usually dine in for AYCE place, I do not bother ordering any of the kitchen foods but JJANGA is different. On top of all the nice sushi and rolls, there are delicious kitchen foods. It's as if I have to come back the next day to just to AYCE kitchen foods. lol 

This is the only place I dine in now for sushi.

Another great AYCE sushi spot in Vegas. Went here with my wife for dinner on a Friday night and we were seated in less than 10 minutes ... Good considering Friday is a busy night for most restaurants. The atmosphere is cool, clean, and modern. The service was fast and friendly. 

Now on to the good stuff: the food. Their menu is extensive and a little overwhelming. We filled up in nigiri which in my opinion had the perfect fish to rice ratio unlike most places where you get a tiny slice if fish over a huge portion of rice. The yuzu yellowtail was awesome .. The citrusy brightness of the yuzu paired well with the fresh hamachi. Other tasty nigiri we had was the garlic and Cajun albacore. Another thing I liked about the menu is they have some rice-less rolls which the wifey really appreciated. The Fresh-men roll was good and wrapped in rice paper and we had another rice-less
roll wrapped in cucumber. They have great appetizers too. The sashimi salads (there are 4-5 on the menu) are limit one per customer but are so good! Dessert is included in AYCE price and you can get 1 scoop of ice cream and 1 mochi. Wish they had better desserts but the quality of the fish makes up for it.

One of the absolute best AYCE sushi I've ever had. (And I've tried a lot of them all over the USA) Service was very fast and efficient... Food was delicious and the menu was huge! Fish was very fresh!! Can't wait to come back soon, even though i have to take an airplane to get here.

This was our first time at the restaurant and everything was wonderful! We tried a whole bunch of items, namely the bebe roll, sponge special, miso pork, and the Joe's special. Everything tasted fresh and delicious, and the portions for appetizers like the dynamite, bulgogi, and miso pork were surprisingly large! Our family goes to AYCE sushi quite often and typically appetizers are barely 1/4 cup of food and twice the price.

Restaurant was clean, and the staff was very attentive and sweet. Our server, Alex, had a lot of suggestions for us to try and was SO knowledgeable about the menu, that he could list ingredients in some rolls right off the top of his head. He was also very personable and was patient with all our questions about the menu.

All in all, extremely positive experience and I've already suggested it to a handful of my sushi lover friends

Phenomenal. The prices were remarkably good (dinner for three was around $50) and the sushi was incredible. It's a bit hard to find tucked into the back corner of a strip mall, but definitely worth the trip odd the strip!
Best all you can eat sushi! Great servers and fast service. Will definitely come back!!
Food was awesome.  Fish was fresh, great variety of specialty rolls and service was impressive.  We are from Southern California and eat a lot of sushi.  Definitely a place we will come back.

Amazing atmosphere and very friendly staff! I went with a group of 12 people and they did an acceptional job at keeping up with everyone's orders.  And of course the food was fantastic.  You must try their sushi burritos!

A solid sushi place with fresh fish and delicious tempura!  And kid-friendly too.  My favorite rolls were the surf turf and the dancing tiger.  Their spicy tuna is delicious and the eel sauce is on point.  I'd recommend making a reservation at dinner time because the place got packed and the orders started taking a bit longer.  Overall, the food was very good and the atmosphere fun yet relaxed.
Loved all the rolls we got. Pink lady was to die for. Sponge roll is nothing short of perfect and the x-girlfriend. Everything was fresh and quality was superb. Highly recommend.

20 Minute wait per dish. Never coming here again. Food is decent but if it takes this long who is going to wait. I got sick of waiting I left in the middle and went to a different restaurant. You CANNOT make people wait this long and expect people to be happy.

This place was very highly recommended/hyped so we decided to see for ourselves. Sushi was to par with other places I've been and the baby tako appetizer was really good. However the service was some of the worst I've ever had; rather slow and unfriendly. Sometimes service can be overlooked but it is a huge contributing factor to the overall experience. I had hoped to like this place as much as others, but I will not be returning.

This is my new favorite AYCE sushi joint! Even my mom really liked it and she is hard to please when it comes to sushi. The fish tasted fresh, there is a good variety and the service is great. If you get a chance sit in Choo Choo's section he is hilarious! Think the asian guy from The Hangover. 

I wasn't disappointed by anything I had there, of course I usually stay away from anything fried and with cream cheese but the rolls I had an nigiri were awesome! The Garlic Tuna was good. Ordered the amai ebi and you can ask for the deep fried head. I was in such an sushi eating frenzy that I didn't stop to note what I really loved. I will definetely be back and will have to take note to share next time! They also had a lot of appetizers if that is your preference.
Ambient is great, sushi chefs and staff are off the hook friendly, sushi and concept is fresh!

No Booze!

After reading all the positive reviews, I really wanted to like this place. First off, they don't serve alcohol...a first for me at the dozens of sushi haunts I've eaten at around the world.  Also, no crunchy spider rolls on the menu . Their Dynamite is decent.  I had a couple other rolls (eel and something else) and neither really stood out.  If you're ball'n on a budget and she wants sushi, their AYCE sushi should be considered.

For the Asians...another "Japanese" restaurant where the employees speak Korean.  I doubt I'll return.

Came for a friends birthday. Seated quickly and all servers super friendly! 
The sushi was fresh and delicious. Food came out quick and prompt. Also constant water refills and check ins!

Also have a great all you can eat option!

Very good sushi! The servers and manager are really attentive. We don't normally do AyCE but this place is definitely worth trying! Especially because they have so many rolls without rice. They are really tasty and you don't feel full as easily.

Too slow !!!!!!!!
Forgetful !
Food is so so.
Don't go there wast your time and money.

From the moment you come in, you are greeted by the friendly staff. To the moment you eat your last piece of sushi, this place is by far THE BEST. The chefs are excellent, the food quality is superb, and the ambiance is fantastic. This will be our regular sushi bar for sure.

Wow, this place really surprised me! I went with a group of friends around 8pm and we were seated right away. The place itself is very comfortable - dim lights, tasteful decor, and music that plays loud enough to where you can still hear. 

Half of our group got AYCE and the other half ordered a la carte. The food came out very quickly, and everything tasted wonderful. Even the Sapporo tasted better here! ;) If you don't mind a little spice, I highly recommend the spicy edamame as an appetizer, and the gyoza if you're really hungry. The crunchy roll was also delicious. I can't wait to go back!

Wow, stuffed with the all you can eat option.   they have great selection of rolls and sushi.   I can't even remember most names but we ordered quite a variety.   super spider roll was one favorite.   will be back when stomach returns to normal size.   service was very pleasant as well and came back often to check on us.

I came here the other night because there was an hour wait for a few of the sushi restaurants that I wanted to try. Apparently it was sushi Sunday.  

I've been here twice now and I've had a so so experience. I do like the oysters.  The most recent time I went, they changed their serving size to one because of the season. I'm not sure when oyster season is so I'm not sure if that's accurate information. The salmon nigiri wasn't that great, nor was it terrible. I really like the beef tataki. It was pretty tasty. It's a seared beef over rice. I was surprised that the golden scallop was deep fried. I should have read the reviews. I really enjoyed the baby octopus the first time that I had it, but the second time wasn't that great. 


Apparently you can order salmon belly, but that's only if it's available. I did try the spring mountain roll which has no rice. There was a lot of sauce on top. It was a pretty good roll except for the abundance sauce. 

Service was really great at first. They were attentive and took our order. Halfway through our meal, they had a few large parties arrive and completely ignored us. It took us a while to get our dessert. :(

Good service. Did AYCE. Food came out pretty quickly. However the tuna, salmon, & tobikko nigiris seemed very off to me. All three were a little too bright in color so they were obviously colored. The texture seemed different than usual as well. I kind of sat there questioning if what I ordered was actually the type of fish I was eating..

My friends loved and insisted we go here but we ended up disappointed. 25$ for all you can eat dinner, not bad. The rolls had a lot of rice and most of them were a really mushy texture. They have a wide variety or roll combos to choose from but not that many were fresh, heathy or spicy options. They have a lot of baked and fried rolls. Which were good but again mushy. Many of the rolls fell apart and you couldn't pick them up. We even sent one roll back because the salmon was "soggy." Our appetizers came out last, the service was slow and not that friendly. The best part was the kids meal. My daughter loved it. Very kid friendly. The edamame and mussels are delicious! Also, they didn't renew their liquor license so no saki or beer.

Jina was our waitress tonight and she did an phenomenal job, great atmosphere, fantastic food, and good prices. Would definelty recommend to anyone that enjoys great quality sushi and nice host staff.

They charged 20% tip charged without notified me and i wrote additional 20% tip top of that
Waiter look and take the signed check without telling me the truth
One of my friend think that we are paying more than what it suppose be
He demanded itemized bill because previous bill only shows total price only
We found out that they intentionally people pay tip 2 times
Also, Uni sushi color changed to dark brown  
It should be yellow or light brown color
I ate it and i spend whole night in toilet
I have come to Jjanga for over a year now. They have the best Sushi in all of Las Vegas! Make sure and ask for Nate- he will give you the best service hands down!! My favorite Sushi spot in Vegas
Amazing! The chefs are wonderful and the food is incredible! Definitely coming back every time we come to Vegas!

There are so many AYCE/Japanese sushi places in town but this one has definitely surpassed all my past experiences.  We had a few delicious appetizers and all were amazing!  the cream cheese stuffed jalapeos to the poki, all beautifully prepared and amazingly fresh.  We had a few nigiri such as tuna, salmon, beef tataki and ikura and again, all very fresh and very little sauce.  I don't like my rolls or nigiri's covered in sauce, makes me feel like the restaurants are trying to hide something that's not fresh.  We had the amazing house flavored sake which made our night even better paired with all the great food we had.  I would definitely recommend this to all my friends in town and out of town.

Another plus side, the staff were all so friendly and professional.  Can't wait to return!
This restaurant charge for the service 20% for the gratuity 6people or more.It is against the Law?Anybody know?
My second time here. The service n the quality of food are consistent. Even though there are one hr limit to order the food, the service is very fast. I will come back here again
Amazing service, all of their fish tasted so fresh as if it was caught right before I ordered it.
Great selection of authentic japanese food! Service is superb! Highly recommended restaurant in Las Vegas!
The food and service was great! The food came out really fast. The waitress was friendly and very patient about our indecisiveness.

A lot of people were telling me JJANGA was the best sushi place in town, so of course I had to go. I wanted to see what was different compared to a lot of other sushi places that I have been to. They have an AYCE menu and a non-AYCE menu which isn't a surprise. I'm unsure what the difference was compared to a lot of other sushi AYCE places in Vegas was. I believe all cuts are different since no chef is the same, but a lot of their menu items can still  be found in another sushi AYCE place in Vegas.
This place is still definitely really good, and I would definitely come back here! I love sushi all together, my favorite roles are spicy ones, and JJANGA has a fair amount of spicy roles. Delicious!

I arrived just in time for the lunch special bento set.  You get a choice of two items listed and pair that with a bowl of rice and a miso soup or house salad.  I opted for the sashimi (3 pc), tempura and salad.

When I asked what is included in the sashimi, the waiter asked the sushi chef (I believe he was the owner).  The sushi chef asked what I liked and catered the sashimi order to my preference and threw in two extra pieces!  He was awesome!  What was even more awesome was the fact that the sashimi was excellent, good quality product.  I was eating as slow as possible to savor the flavors.  The sashimi was so good I got an order of the yuzu yellowtail.  The sushi rice had the right amount of moisture, the yuzu sauce was addictive and green on top added a nice crunch.

The tempura portion of the lunch was fine.  The breading was done well and it was not greasy, but I wish there was eggplant tempura.  
 
The house salad was also fine.  The lettuce was fresh and crisp but the salad dressing was just okay.  I believe it was a mix of shredded carrots, mayo/salad cream and ginger.  

After all that, the chef spontaneously offered me orange slices for dessert.  It was a nice way to end my meal.  

As for service: overall, the sushi chef mentioned earlier is the star of this experience.  The other two servers on the floor were polite and friendly, but one did forget my water for about five minutes.  

The part that was most surprising though was the price of my experience.  For five pieces of sashimi, two pieces of hamachi nigiri, bowl of rice, salad and six pieces of tempura:  under $12!   

I am definitely a fan and I will definitely be back for the all you can eat!
The food was great but the service is subpar, hence the three stars! That is all I have to say about this place. Check it out and only you can formulate your own opinion!!

Cool little spot right near Chinatown. This was my first time here and it was lit. Top 3 AYCE spots in the city. Highly recommend the super white and baked mussels. Service is top notch. Will definitely be back.
Its a really good place to eat with ur family. The chefs are hilarious . One of the chefs nickname is captain choo choo

Very inconsistent!

I've been here several times and you never know if it will be a good experience or bad. It's always a hit and miss. Sometimes the food is really good and sometimes very poor quality. And sometimes, within the same meal, you can have inconsistent quality of food.

But when it's good, it's really good, though. Perfect rice to fish proportion, fresh ingredients, food comes out fast, very fast, efficient and friendly service, seasoning on point! But when it's bad...too much rice, too little fish, the same kind of sushi on the same plate can be made different shapes and sizes - some will have more rice, the fish will be different thickness, different size and different shape, the seasoning will be different. Once I ordered the grilled mackerel and not only was it overcooked, it smelled so bad. When the server came to take it away after our meal, I pointed out that it wasn't fresh, she took one look at it and said, "Oh yeah, it's not fresh." So why serve it?

But the one thing that they've managed to be consistent in - rude chefs. The customers see how rude they are to the servers. When they make a mistake, they're pissed off and blame the servers. Under the old management, the chefs were rude when the owner was not around. But under the new management, they're rude all the time. Once, one of the chefs asked a man sitting at the bar to give us our order (I'm assuming that the man owns the restaurant or he is the manager because he walks in and out of the kitchen), the man turned to us and rudely said, "Hey, is this your order?" and made us get up and get the plate from him! We could also hear him yelling at the workers. Fantastic management style!

Have not gone back and probably won't.

I used to like Jjanga a lot better and not saying the quality has gone that far downhill but I think I finally come to a realization that quality should surpass quantity, especially sushi... .

For AYCE place, Jjanga is pretty good I guess.  Most AYCE are run by Koreans, no exception here, not like I have  a problem with it.  The fish/rice ratio is great, some places definitely pack lots of rice on you, but Jjanga is pretty good on smaller nigiri with decent size fish and little rice.  

Service is always great.  Everyone's happy to help and always come check on you.  All the sushi chefs, Jjanga, koo koo, choo chop, Ricky.. all friendly and try to be buddy buddy with you when you sit at the bar.

Not the cleanest place, the table/bar often feel greasy.  They do wipe down after each use of course, but don't wipe down enough or just same greasy towel over and over again, especially the edge of the table where your elbow touches... ok enough of that.  It's only $22 lunch and $26 dinner for sushi, what do you expect.

Food:  for the most part, sushi taste ok.  Your typical pre frozen, thaw out pieces of fish from typical AYCE places.  The thing I have a problem with is how all the fishes are laying right next to each other, which you'd notice in not AYCE sushi restaurants, that's a NO NO.  Each type of fish should have their own space, not necessary cross contamination on fishes but it's just not right.  And the bad part is that they service seared beef as nigiri and on some rolls too.  When the whole loin of seared beef sits right on top of a filet of salmon sashimi, that's JUST WRONG.  I was very tempting to take a picture of it and send it to the health department.  You don't mix poultry with fish, especially they are both raw!  Beef right on top of fish, and you serve that?  How are you kidding me.  And it's not just a one time mishap accident type, It's often that.  All the different type of fish are laying next to or on top of each other, along with beef, come on?  Even though i didn't get food poisoning after dining there, it sure leaves a bad taste in my mouth and in my mind.  

And oyster lovers.. if you think they freshly crack open fresh oysters to serve you, then you are SO WRONG.  They recycle the oyster shell (they have a bucket for that) and they use pre packaging oysters (no shell on, like the ones you see in a glass jar at your grocery store) from a box to fill the oyster shells and put garnish on it.  Definitely NOT fresh and frankly so gross.   If you sit at the bar next time, you can watch they make it.  How clean can those oyster shells be, especially they've been recycled from other patrons, do they clean and wipe each shell good before they put another oyster meat on top?  Think twice before you order it next time.  When I went the first time, I had no idea, ordered it, tasted gross, then saw how they make it.. go figure.

Jjanga is probably still my go to place for AYCE when I feel really cheap and have a moment weakness of spending less on sushi. But honestly, I wouldn't want to go often as knowing how much germ I've consumed by trying to be cheap....
The AYCE lunch option is really good, the servers are friendly and the service is quick. The quality of the fish is always fresh too. Highly recomend!
This is my favorite sushi place in Las Vegas quality is very consistent and really great. Service is great and the sushi chefs are entertaining. As they should be! I definitely recommend trying it.

I've checked out pretty much all the great sushi buffets in Vegas and must say this one has everyone beat! Well i say umiya comes very close but what I love about jjanga besides their huge selection of sushi.. (Hand rolls included) is the freshness of everything they serve! I haven't had a bad uni (sea urchin), salmon or hamachi here ever!!! And I eat a lot of em.. 

Definitely worth the wait and worth the $$

My boyfriend and I eat here all the time, it is the best sushi place in Vegas! Koo Koo took care of us tonight and sent us a bunch of off menu sushi rolls for all you can eat. Hands down my favorite place to eat sushi and do sake bombs in Vegas!! Thanks Koo Koo!

RAVE!!!

Jjanga is a sushi oasis in the middle of the desert!!!

We saddled up to the bar, b/c the place was packed, only to be served by JJANGA himself!!!!  Vegas luck baybee!

After selecting all you can eat, we were stumped by choice and items titled "Slap your momma" and "slap your mother in law". 

No matter. Jjanga asked us if we had any allergies (NO!) and liked spicy food (YES!)  and swept us right up into sashimi heaven. 

Between bites and murmurs of pleasure, we watched dish after dish appear... and disappear. Most were works of art and ultimately the subject of a snapchat portfolio of images. All looked too good to eat. ALMOST...

So... here's where I pull the "my-partner's-Asian, we're foodies-from-NY, have-lived-in-Cali, eaten-our-way across-Asia-yadda-yadda" card and say how much we were BOTH IMPRESSED  by the flavors, and freshness of the plates JJ served that night. 

So hyped that we tried to get him to open a spot in DC. Lucky for y'all in Las Vegas he declined. 

JJ: if your reading this, the offer still stands! Reverse manifest destiny and find your fortune!!!

Fellow gourmands and friends in the feast: get your butts off the strip and head to Jjang for Unforgettable, melt in your mouth sushi and an experience that whet's all five senses!

GOOD EATS (and more) at JJANGA!

This is my boyfriend and my favorite spot in town! The prices are great and the rolls are creative and always very fresh. The service can't be beat! We have never spent more than 30 minutes doing AYCE! The only thing that could make this place better would be a liquor license.

I've been eating here for the last year and a half and it's been the best sushi spot in vegas and in California by far. I haven't gone to any other place since, until tonight. Please forgive me Jjanga, I cheated on you tonight with another spot because you closed early tonight. I greatly regret my poor decision and will never do that again. You have proven to be the best sushi spot of my 26 years of living on this earth. Your staff has always been amazing and your manager Nate, is always ever so entertaining and welcoming. You definitely have the best tasting, most fresh, sushi/food my little taste buds could have ever encountered. Please don't ever change.

We are sushi-holics. We eat sushi twice a week. Tried this place for the first time. We were not disappointed. I would recommend JJANGA to any family and friend. Also Ericka our server gave excellent service!!

I would rate this an overall 4.5 stars. I really like the location being real close to the strip compared to other AYCE jap places. We were greeted and seated quickly without a wait. Our initial server was rather rude and disinterested in being there. She was reluctant to explain the concept to one of our guess. Fortunately she was replaced by someone much more attentive
Sushi was simply excellent and just the right small amount of rice combined with super fresh ingredients. In addition they have Uni which is a must for me. Their rice-less rolls were interesting but did not have wow factor. Poke and sashimi salad was great. Stay away from the sushi burritos, too much rice and fake crab. 
Overall I will definitely be back to try it again
Went here for a mellow dinner. Hickey served us up some killer creations for a special occasion.

Lunch is $20.95 all you can eat. (Dinner is $25.95 with sashimi)
Quality of the food: 3.5 stars, sushi was okay, sadly lunch doesn't have sashimi, many variety of rolls and appetizers.
Taste of the food: 4 stars, all of the food that we ordered was pretty good. 
Service: 2 stars, waiter doesn't seem to speak English well, our orders was forgotten many times, and we had to order 2-3 times until we get what we ordered, also waiter ignored us many times when we tried to order/ask for water)
Waiting time: 0.5 star, each dish took more than 10 mins to arrive to our table. We ordered 3 times miso soup and cold tofu, but we still did not receive after 2 hours of wait. (It was Friday lunch time, restaurant was not full)
Over all: if you don't mind the wait time and some confusion over ordering food you can give it a try, but if you want to bring your friends and try to impress them, you will leave disappointed with a full stomach of wait time instead of food.

The best AYCE sushi restaurant in town. The food here is orgasmic! Sushi is so fresh and soft. It melts immediately when in your mouth. Servers are very polite and attentive. When you ask for the recommendation, they will give you many options depends on your taste preferences. Also, Owner lady seems very friendly and passionate about her business. I been passed by this place so many time on the way to go to different sushi places. But Im so glad that I gave this place a try. This place is definitely hidden gem.  If you like AYCE, you will love this place. Especially, try 90%, the baked scallops dipping with special sauce will give you extreme happiness. Also as dessert, try the baked coconut flake ice cream... it is so delicious!

I absolutely love this place! I was referred here by a friend. Loved my first experience there. I went there again for my birthday. The sushi is so delicious! The staff is great, some comedians and really nice people! I met Mr. Jjanga at they end of the night, so nice. The All you can eat menu is totally worth is. There are endless choices on sushi rolls, like baked rolls, no rice rolls, fried rolls, appetizers, etc. They even have a punch card for each time you go! Highly recommend. It looks questionable from the outside area, but it has a great ambiance!

What a treat! They have a all you can eat menu that way surpassed my expectations and includes over 100 items. The sushi was masterfully crafted and was light on rice. In fact the rice was nice and thin grain. The price was very low - $20. 

Amazing staff- 6 stars! Say hi to Hickey and Koo Koo.

This place is legit. It's not the best sushi I've ever eaten but who can compare japan sushi to American sushi... For the price of $3-$8 a roll you can't beat it! It's wicked fresh and the atmosphere is relaxing and hip. My favorite place in Vegas to eat. If you don't eat here you are dumb

Great experience. Great music. Good Sushi. Umm. They have a 10% discount if you write a review, i literally just downloaded this app for the discount. If you come with more than 6 people you pay 18% more for some reason don't ask me why. They also have a rice ice cream thing that is weird. Lastly order all of your orders up front so you don't have to wait and get full.

Ten stars for this place!!!  Thanks to the girl we meet as we was leaving to go somewhere else because the wait was too long.  She is a local and told us this is the best sushi place around!  SUPA happy we waited.  The fish was so fresh and the rice size on each sushi was perfect bite size.  Service was fast and friendly with the waitress making sure our orders was in.  Really nice and clean place with cold beers too.

There is also Karaoke rooms too.  How's that!!! Back home in Hawaii there is nothing like this.  Sing and Sushi!! We have found our go - to place for Vegas!!

This place got revamped with new owners, new sushi chefs, and a new menu. They have two different menus--an all you can eat and an a la carte. The good thing about the new menus is that they now have pictures of the rolls, so it's easier to identify. I also think the flavors of the new rolls are more distinct than before. 

Also, this place now has alcohol with the new owners!!!There's Asahi on draft (my favorite), variety of bottled beers, hot and cold sake, and soju. 

I alternate between all you can eat and their a la carte menu. The a la carte menu has a lot of different things than the all you can eat like sashimi platters with beautiful presentation and fresh fish. 

This place definitely can satisfy a lot of different people and is definitely worth checking out when you're in Vegas.

One word ... Awesome!  I don't even know what we ate because the chef asked us what we wanted and when we were undue he just started making things he thought we'd like and they were fantastic!  With and without rice, the seafood was super fresh and the atmosphere sitting at the sushi bar was fantastic. I will definitely make this a regular stop when I'm in Vegas
Sushi chefs are great but the rolls and nigiri are just average. Its definitely not as good as Sakana or Goyemon.
amazing ayce, about 25 for dinner and 20 for lunch. great selection, fresh sushi, fish/ratio was good. great customer service

Had sushi around the globe and this is one of the best! Been to Vegas before and found this totally by accident, seems to be a local's secret treat. Great atmosphere, quiet and cozy. Staff was very personable and the food quality was fresh and tasted excellent. Easy to locate and parking was not a problem since it is well off the strip. Good for non-sushi eaters too, choices other than sushi on the menu. Didn't try the All You Can Eat menu (available for lunch & dinner under $30) but had a few sushi rolls, miso soup, gyoza and the hibachi. Orders came fairly fast as compared to the average sushi place, even though they looked busy. Menu had plenty of choices and laid out in plain language what is contained in each roll. Will try their AYCE when we go back in a few months, since most of their rolls were $8.00, AYCE would be a better deal.
The sushi chefs are absolutely amazing!!! Everything is delicious!!!! Baked salmon roll, add cream cheese, and you cant go wrong!!

Great food .Worst male Caucasian server ever my. friend was served my meal and when he gave her rightful  meal he expected me to eat it. "EAT your Food".was what he told me and I stayed polite and asked for a new meal order He refused to give me a new plate that wasn't half eaten I didn't cause a scene and waited to pay for my bill classy and politely at the regester. I only paid for what I ate and didn't pay for the Eel.he yelled at me and had crude comments even said he'd call the cops I told him to I had done Nothing wrong.  He talked to his manager and told me I cost them 17.00usd. My friend told him to stop yelling at me I was on the verge of tears. Im not a rude person and I felt I was harrassed by his rude comments and the fact he kept looking down my friends shirt.The manager stood there on his cell the whole time.   ..
One of my favorite ayce sushi places. I love the extensive selection of items you could choose from. The fish is always fresh and the wait staff is always friendly.

Service was second to none. Food is so incredible. Ambience was just right. Came here at 12:15am and they know how to tend to walk-ins! The AYCE places in SoCal could definitely learn from this place. SHEESH! And when I ordered and ate a lot, the nice waiter said "you sure you done? You didn't eat much." Most places in SoCal would be like "you sure you can finish that?" So they're nice people too. The menu is extremely diverse and its selections are vast and clever. In conclusion, this place rocks! I will come back every time I go back to Vegas from now on. Thanks y'all! :)

Today is the first time in 2 years I've been back to this restaurant.  The decor has been updated and the same menu is still being served.  The service here is very bad. They cater to the Korean customers and the manager who was also our waiter was not tentative. It took very long for our food and almost 1 hour to get the kitchen items. Had to remind the manager more than 3 times to check on our order. He said he had only 1 waitress..on Christmas Day. If I had to rate my experience today it would be no stars. At this post still waiting for dessert....Cancelled that green tea ice cream. So unorganized.....never coming to this place again....
Service and food was delicious! Try the monkey brains! It's fried banana with spicy tuna. Yum!

This is the one of the best all you can eat sushi restaurants that I've ever had in Vegas. 

More appetizer choices than any other restaurants.

Service is great and food comes out quick and fresh. 

I had a great experience!! Thank you

the best ayce sushi restaurant in town. great service and great food quality. highly recommend tuna naruto, something wrong, age dashi tofu and sashimi salad. check them out when you want to get your sushi fix.

Food is still good, nicely renovated, wait staff seem  nice. But all these don't make a difference if the service is really bad and they make you wait for 30 minutes for your next order to arrive! I followed up on the same order three freaking times and they still didn't get it right!
This place is great! The sushi chefs are awesome! And so funny, eat at the bar. The sushi is great!

Jjanga's Restaurant is the place to go
to- they have the freshest and finest sushi and delectable Japanese dishes, mouthwatering and superb in presentation.
The wait staff are attentive and service was quick.
Jjanga, the owner and one of the sushi chefs , offers the best quality of food-it  was not only excellent, but flavorful and  fulfilled beyond expectation.
We are definitely coming back and will always recommend this awesome place to our family and friends.
Way to go- Jjanga!!!!

My girl friend and I thoroughly enjoy eating sushi at jjanga. We are always warmly welcomed and the staff know us so well that when we sit down at the sushi bar they already know the rolls we want and have started making them for us... The sushi is always fresh, tasty and the rolls here are unique and delicious. It's hands down the best sushi place in town!
I love this place! the sushi is great! I especially like the no rice rolls. Erica was super friendly and on top of the service tonight. I'll keep coming back.

Oh yes yes yes. This seedy parking lot is coming up roses!

The staff here is hilarious. They have a great sense of humor about their culture's stereotypes and bounce around from table to table taking orders and making jokes. Do not be fooled by the neighbors construction or the pool hall's dumpiness. It is very nice inside and much bigger than you would anticipate (heh).  

We did not do the AYCE, but it was reasonably priced at $25.95 (dinner). Our a la carte bill turned out to be about $50 for two people and here's what was on the menu:

2 Cold Draft Beers and 1 Large Hot Sake
Nigiri (at $3 a set- splurge on the smokey and regular salmon)
Fresh Men Roll- Holy Rolly. Riceless but delicious.
Candy Cane Roll
Red Rock Roll- I might pass this one up in the future due to a weird mint taste that we couldn't find the origins of.
We decided to go off the Strip and so glad we did. Its all you can eat sushi or la carte. Everything was on menu was tasty. Service was great as well. Definitely will dine there again when in town.

My favorite sushi joint. 
Service was great and the food is greater.
Had all you can eat. Dollars well spent.

One of the best Japanese restaurant located west of the strip.  Great service and amazing food.  They have a karaoke lounge but reservation is required to access the room.  :-)  Can't really remember which of the dishes I liked the best so that may be a good thing.

The food is good but since the new owner ship it has gone down!  The service isnt as friendly as it used to be, my husband had 2 ends of his roll left and the waitress wanted to charge for left overs! I miss the old owners and probably won't be back

I love Jjanga! 

One of my favorite AYCE places in Las Vegas! They prepare their fish really well, really good mix of flavors and pretty good service. I recommend anyone looking for AYCE Sushi in Las Vegas to try Jjanga.
I was suprised how sushi was tasty and servers were realy nice. Try sushi without rice and wraps! Very nice place. Gonna be now one of my favorite sushi place for all-you-can-eat:)

Good food!
However horrible service , especially at the front .The manager and the host were rude and sounded like they were doing us a favor by switching our table.
We told them it's too cold, he told us to put a sweater on.
So 5 star for the food but 1 star for the service !

so I was out late with my friend and found this place on yelp and the good reviews attracted me. plus I love sushi. the menu was jst a normal AYCE sushi menu. nothing special. same with the food. nothing special. except the last sushi I ordered with the shrimp on top of it, I did not finish it as it tasted like windex or sumtin. you know like if they had cut the shrimp on something that had recently been wiped with some strong chemicals. it smelled like windex too and my friend tasted it and he agreed. he told me to stop eating that. I didnt complain because I was also alredi full and done eating. however, the next day I was sick. idk if it had anything to do with the sushi though. the server was nice btw. idk his name. Oh also he didn't charge us for the leftover shrimp sushi we didnt finish which was good because it was full of some chemical.  I did order sake, good thing they didnt ID us. Honestly idk why it has such good reviews. like I said, nothing special. have been to plenty of better sushi places around here. I wouldn't go bak though because it is far, out of my way, and didn't exactly enjoy my sushi like I usually do.

Looovvveeee this place!! Not only really good but so affordable!!!
**Favorite sushi place!!!! And the staff are so nice!!!
10/10. Bone app the teeth.  Great food, great service, great prices. I highly recommend.
Great atmosphere, good food, marginal to bad service.
First time here. Awesome sushi great staff very friendly. Gave us some delicious new treats. Will definitely recomend it to others

I LOVE THIS PLACE!! Jjanga has THE BEST All You Can Eat in town!! Sushi is so fresh, so good, and so addicting.. The staff is wondeful and full of personality.. you will laugh the whole time.. Jjanga, himself, is hilarious and loves his repeat customers! Will toast sake with you at any time! Honestly, not a bad item on the menu..
Food was good, (highly recommend the Burning your ass roll if you like spicy, the lava sauce is legit) Food was just slightly overshadowed by our server Elise who was fantastic!

This location is now under new management. This was my favorite sushi place to go to in Las Vegas. I went there tonight and the Management and menu had completely changed. It is no longer the JJANGA I've been coming to for years. The menu is much smaller. All the staff and chefs are new. We waited to get service the whole night while they focused on one table. There was much attitude from the server when asking just for a sauce on the side. In the end he wouldn't take our punch card which was full and he said they were under new management and don't take them any more. They just need to change the name of the restaurant! I have nothing bad to say about the Fort Apache location and will drive across town to go to that one! My family and I will never return to the Decatur location. So rude. The food wasn't worth it either. Sushi Way is the best AYCE in Vegas!

Perfect!  Went last night with a party of eight. This is my new favorite place!  The sushi is amazing and everyone who works there is so friendly. We can't wait to go back!  One of the guys in our party asked if they are open for breakfast!!!  Delicious!
First time here...staff is super friendly! Some rolls were a little plain, not much to them, however the Dancing tiger ,Burning your @$$  and OMG rolls are AWESOME!!! Amazing flavors!!

We walked in to this dead place with a party of 5 waiting for our 6th they said they wouldn't seat us or let her join when she got there we would have waited stayed and ate but they were rude and seemingly patronizing. I don't recommend going here unless you want to feel like you are inconveniencing the staff. 

I've never wrote a yelp review before but the owners of this place need to know that their staff is rude and running money out the front door. 
   At least they could have offered us a seat at the dead bar or an empty table for drinks while we waited. 

Until management starts to care about their customers
DONT GO!

The staff was friendly and helpful answering questions while ordering. She has patience and helped us decide quickly and easily on what to get. The restaurant was unable to serve alcohol at this time for some reason even though alcohol is on their menu in store and on their website. The restaurant was very clean and well lit. It was a nice atmosphere. There was no wait-time to sit down on a Saturday night around 6:30pm when we arrived. The drinks and our appetizers came out quickly. Overall it was nice and I would come back again.

Let me begin by saying it was my first time doing all you can eat sushi,& I found about this place thanks to someone from work that recommend it.to be a Sunday afternoon it wasn't busy,the staff friendly and the food was freshly made. I started with a "What the heck" and just kept going one after another. The time limit is one hour but is worth and I strongly recommend it. I hope the next visit they do have alcohol though. But other than I give it a 4 out 5

I'm from Orange County where we have sushi bars everywhere BUT Jjanga's got to be by far one of my favorites & definitely my go to when being in Vegas!

The whole ambiance of the place was relaxing & comforting. Right away, the staff welcomed us & sat us within 2 minutes. They offer an all you can eat menu or a la carte. We did a la carte & the portions were just right! 

The quality of the food is to die! The fish in the sushi tasted to FRESH! I had to BURNING YOUR ASS* roll & it was bomb! So much flavor & it's not as spicy as it sounds lol 

All the servers were awesome! GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE! I myself am a General Manager of a restaurant so I appreciated great service! Lucy was my favorite server! She hung out with us & chatted a bit with us- we got to know her a little & she made our experience a great & fun one with non stop laughter! 

GO TO JJANGA!! It's the BEST!

I've been to this place before and after the owner changed. I think the restaurant and plating look much better after the change.

Some of the dishes I highly recommend are: baked mussel, poki salad, boom boom, and coconut flake ice cream (chocolate flavor). I don't like coconut, but the coconut taste was subtle and the texture was very crisp. Poki salad gave a refreshing taste after eating several rolls with cream cheese and eel sauce.

Other menus that are worth trying/regular are tempura, Screaming O, Bunny & Bonny, and nigiri. 

I wouldn't order Touch Down, Mountain, and Green Tea Ice cream & Mochi. 

They don't do half rolls, but the price for AYCE was great.
No stars. Worst sushi I've ever had. Restaurant is dirty, service is poor and there are no words to express how bad the sushi actually was. Please don't waste your money. You will be so disappointed.
