NOTE: This review doesn't reflect the food or service. But honestly, I don't think it's meant to be for us to try this place. We have literally attempted to eat here THREE times already with no avail & we are f*cking tired of wasting our gas AND our time! 

1.) We came at 8:30pm on a Saturday & the hostess warned us that if we ate there, they would be closing in half an hour. I asked if that was a normal since Yelp & their doors say they close at 2:00am, and she said, "No, just tonight. We are closing early at 9 tonight for a special occasion." Being our first time & planning to do all you can eat, we didn't want to be rushed & opted to eat somewhere else. Strike one. 

2.) We attempted to come again at 5:00pm on a Sunday. Yelp showed they were open so we headed over... only to find the doors locked & a handwritten schedule on the door with whiteout over Sunday that read, "CLOSED ON SUNDAYS." This had to be new because the same information was on Yelp and on maps. Strike two. 

3.) And lastly... we drove over just now at 6:00pm on a Saturday. Checked Yelp and verified they are open until 2:00am... only to find the venue filled with construction and a note on the front door that says they are renovating until October 8th. Seriously? Seriously?! 

Three strikes, you're out. We give up now. Bye.

I found Jjanga from a post listing the top 10 ayce sushi restaurants in the country. I went, and LOVED it. I'm from California, but go every time I'm in Vegas, and everyone I take loves it! The rolls are fun and different and the fish is very fresh with a great selection! I highly recommend trying this great place

Always come to JJANGA when in Vegas, awesome sushi variety, rolls and apps!

The best eel, salmon, yellow tail sushi. For apps I love the dynamate, shrimp tempura, gyoza and who's your ex-wife, golden scallop. 

Roll's, lasagna, fat ass and Lobster.

Servers were very friendly and nice with my party, Erika and Yuri tks for the experience!! Always recomend
Good atmosphere for a couple or a big group of friends! Clean, friendly, great sushi prices, fish was very fresh!  Get off the strip and come here for sushi overload.

I don't even want to give this place 1 star right now. I am so disgusted by the fact that I saw my server walking over to my table carrying my food and sneezed directly on the plates. I will never eat here again!

I am still fairly new to sushi, but I believe this to be one of the better sushi spots in Las Vegas. They have a really good all you can eat special and a huge menu. Service is really friendly and fast. I recommend the TNT if you want a lot of spice.

Updating the review because the service, while friendly, can be wildly inconsistent.

This place blew me away!! Came in on a Saturday night and it was packed. Food was great! Service was top notch. Our server always had a smile, she was also attentive. The manager was also nice and courteous. We will definitely be back.

Came here on the recommendation of a friend and were not disappointed - we waited longer for our check than we did for any of our sushi rolls because our rolls seemed like they took 30 seconds! Great food, fast service, and awesome pricing. The nigiri rolls were especially reasonable. We found our new sushi place!

I had the AYCE dinner for 26 dollars before tax. I have to say, this is one of the better ayce sushi restaurants in Las Vegas, as the fish was very fresh, and the creativity with the rolls was a fun experience.

However, I have one big overall gripe with the restaurant. I'm not sure if it was just the time we came in, or just a bad night, but the service got progressively worse throughout the evening. The service was fine towards the beginning of our meal, but after the second round of plates it would be a good 20 minutes before we saw our waiter again. 

Another more minor problem was the proximity to other customers. The tables are spaced very close together, which can lead to an uncomfortable dining experience for some. In fact, the lady next to me practically sneezed on me and made me very uncomfortable throughout the rest of the night, as her child was also climbing around our table. Not necessarily fault of the restaurant, just bad patrons, however I think this is something that can be fixed very easily.

So so good!!! We loved this place. Every roll was so different and we enjoyed the freshness and originality. The seating is a little strange as you are right next to another group of people if sat in the middle, but not an issue. Yum! We will be back.

4/12/2014 6pm I have been around the world to a few thousand sushi bars and this one is in the TOP 20. CHOO CHOO is the master of creative sushi... If you want to have a fun night and laugh sit at the sushi bar. If you want to chill out sit at a table. It's all good.. The servers are also on point. P.S. Grape Fruit Sake is something u must try! I will return with my wife and son... I approve this message J K KUHL...

Tried JJANGA for the first time tonight. It was awesome! The decor of the restaurant is very nice and cool. Their menu has lots of yummy options. AYCE is a good deal AND they have a punch card with 11th AYCE free which is the best thing ever for those of us who are super addicted to AYCE sushi. They have lots of staff and they are the best I've experienced at any sushi place. They are super attentive and super fast. The food came out fast, the waiters/waitresses came around at the perfect times to take our orders, and they were really quick with taking away our empty plates. Staff were very friendly, enthusiastic, and down to earth. Will definitely be coming back often!

I had runch today for my business trip. It was great time from good food and wonderful service. Our server was very kind and friendly to us and served nicely. We all members felt happy from her service. We want to visit again cause the service. We loved some rolls. We recommand to try many kinds of rolls because it was the best taste rolls I've eaten ever.

This is the best AYCE sushi joint ever!  
Absolutely love it.  
Love the chefs, servers, helpers, management...
First place I go from the airport.

Thanks for the wonderful food, and great time!
Loved it! AYCE great price, great service great variety. I would have given it 5 but the fish cuts were smaller than I am used to. Will come back the next time we are in town.

I am giving this restaurant 4 stars with guarded optimism.  We started going there about 4 months ago and it seems to be slipping in quality.  Perhaps the most annoying thing recently has been their a/c issues. Hopefully it will be truly fixed soon.  Unfortunately, we had to leave during one of our attempts to dine there.  According to their own thermostat the temp in the restaurant was 89 degrees!  One of our party is 89 years old and we felt it unwise to sit and swelter. I admit to being disturbed by the attitude of one of the servers who was chiding me for leaving after all the trouble he went through to setup a table for 5.  Really? No compassion for the senior with us.  One wonders how good an idea it is to serve sushi in such a warm room.  Scott the manager was not there but probably would have handled things better.  Hopefully they will fix the a/c better and not complain if people choose not to stay.  Actual sushi is good but again the quality seems to be slipping.  Service is ok.  Hardest working person there is the young busboy.  Guardedly 4 stars but beware of future decline.

Excellent food quality. Reasonable price. Awesome service. Great atmosphere. We come here every time we visit Vegas. 

Sushis are fresh. I love their Big Easy Roll and Burning My Ass roll. 

Amazing Japanese restaurant off the Strip that won't burn a hole in your wallet!

Good service, good food.  I came here with my boyfriend, we wanted to try this place heard good things . Only inconvenience is that we usually try a couple of rolls. In other sushi restaurants you can usually do half rolls; we just didn't know and only got 3 full rolls  .  If we would have came with more people we could have explored the menu a little more . Besides that it was an excellent experience and I'll be back for sure .
Jjanga is our favorite spot for sushi with no rice. They have more than one roll like most ayce places. We love them and the service is fast.

I can't recommend this place. And will not go again. There's nothing special enough about it to go back. The service was just barely ok. The host was busy on his phone at the same time he was sitting people. The food was underseasoned. The benches with the jagged planks are strange to me. Overall this place is just not worth going to and seems to have a dark cloud over it. There are so many great restaurants in the Asian District and this is not one of them.
I always come here for the best All you can eat sushi in Vegas. Been a loyal customer for years now. Great staff and nice environment

This place is fantastic! 

The All you can eat sushi includes many more options than any other AYCE sushi joint I have ever been to.  There was a wide variety of sushi and sashimi including rice-less options and sashimi salads.  We sat at the sushi bar and the sushi chefs were engaging and funny.  They would make us specialty rolls  based on the other things we ordered without us even asking. The price is unbelievable. Two of us had appetizers, soup, salad, tons of sushi, dessert and drinks for under $100 total.  This will definitely be a "must have" every time I come to Vegas.

I got here with my family and really enjoyed the "all you can eat"?The location at the west of las and only 5 mins drive from las strip.Large Space ?fresh seafood and nice facilities ?so many kind of sushi and dishes I can choose ?if you want a quiet place for your meal with friend or family ?you will like here ?will come back for sure.

Favorite Japanesesushi restaurant I've been to in vegas! Great service and outstanding food. Had the all you can eat part of the menu and great section. You can taste the freshness and good quality! Will be back more often!

I dug this place, Instead of giving you three order attempts the (kinda ) base it on time. I say Kinda because the menu said we had an hour, but we're there much longer. So when you put in orders they come up quick. Huge selection of rolls, nigiri, sashima and appetizers. Despite the look of the strip mall, a very pleasant place on the inside. Do yourself a favor, wander off the strip and hit this place up if you want Sushi!

Never in my life have I written any sort of review for anything, whether good or bad.

However, this place was the BEST sushi I've ever had for the CHEAPEST price I've ever seen Sushi cost. Came here because it was Good Friday, and I DEFINITELY recommend this to any sushi lover. The customer service was amazing, the food was amazing, the food came out VERY quickly, and I will DEFINITELY be coming back here.

I just felt like I had to tell someone about how great this place was.

This is an AYCE place so the sushi is OK. I had the Big Easy roll. Just ok, nothing to write home about.The Bento lunch deal is the way to go if you're not going balls out for an AYCE experience which I'm not a fan of. Not because I'm a snob but I'm NEVER gonna get my monies worth there. So Bento Box lunch for me. I had the Teriyaki Salmon & that was awesome. it was grilled to perfection. Even had a little teriyaki crispy end goodness to it. The tempura was really good too. Light, crispy outside, juicy inside & had a good sauce for dipping. My PIC got a 
Bento Box too of  spicy chicken &  pork mini steak. They were  Meh. Nothing bad about it just Meh. So go in for AYCE or Bento Box lunch (skip the specialty roll - not too special) & you won't be disappointed.
Awesome sushi! I liked the atmosphere and the friendly staff. Great customer service!  I'll be back for sure.

I believe this is the best sushi spot in Las Vegas. My wife and I go here whenever we feel like eating sushi. When it comes down to staff, service, the great modern vibe, and specially the food, it is always the best. 

I'm not sure what people are complaining about this place because we don't see it or feel from them any negative vibe but I believe it's the best AYCE sushi. The taste of the food has great flavor and also you get the food pretty quickly.

I recommend this place whenever you want sushi or you got some friends or family to visit this is the place to eat.

Went last night with a large group.  We had a great night. Wide selection of choices on the all you can eat menu. The service is slow and spotty. We had a good laugh over it. The rice in sushi is very moist but that is fine with me. Place should be part of your future sushi restaurant choices. Enjoy. Cheers!

We came here on a Friday night around 630 pm to celebrate a special occasion. We had 6 in our party and had to wait a short 10 mins before we were seated.

It was $26/person for dinner and it is all you can eat with limited items listed in red (you can only order one per person). The all you can eat also includes dessert - mochi ice cream and/or ice cream. The food is decent, not the freshest, but the value is incredible. The menu is definitely tasty and our group felt the food was good and for a great price. We all left happy!

The boyfriend frequents the restaurant and his advice is to come early as he has waited over an hour for a table on multiple occasions!
Love jjanga.. awesome staff and I like the veggie options! The grapefruit sake is super tasty too.

Just venturing out with trying to find a new sushi spot and we come across Jjanga. Entered with a great atmosphere and nothing but a friendly welcoming staff ! Me and my friends have nothing bad to say about this place ! Thanks Hickey & Koo Koo

A colleague tipped me off to Jjanga...and he wasnt kidding! We sat at the bar(imo the only way to eat ayce) and we just let the chefs know what we didn't want, and they went to town! If you do this I think tipping early helps get the best dishes. The sashimi was beautiful, not what you would expect from all you can eat spot. I live in Portland and this place would ruin all places where i live. I may have to come back tomorrow;) 
Dinner was $25.95 and it gives you free reign over the entire menu. Enjoi!
My friend highly recommended this place and i am glad i stopped by. We had AYCE sushi and probably had 30 different items. Food is delicious and service is great as well! 5 stars
Here from out if town and looked to Yelp for a sushi recommendation. VERY pleased! This place is really good! Great sushi chefs. Great all you can eat menu.

The food is as good as in any All You Can Eat sushis. It is the same quality and flavor than Oyshi. However, the service is bad. They made us pay for the extra cream cheese and avocado. I have never had to pay for it in an AYCE in Vegas. Moreover, the server was rude and did not even say "bye" when we left, even though we walked in front of him. 
I won't recommend it.

After seeing so many people go to this place and mention how good it is, decided to go try it out with my family.

Korean owned japanese restaurant, located in an EH area of town. Not the nicest area lol... 

Decor, gotta give it to them. Overall i think it looks pretty nice. Lots of wooden fencing accents and along the walls. 

AYCE (All-you-can-eat) sushi is $20.95 for lunch (1130A - 300P) and $25.95 for dinner (300P - 200A). Also mentions about having an "ordering time limited to 45 minutes for lunch, and 1 hour for dinner. dining time is not limited". This doesn't really make sense to me but its never really enforced anyway. 

As always, order a sample of nigiri to test, and order more if good ! so this is what i ordered XD (not at the same time, over course of dinner) 

A mention of the rice. I'm not the pickiest but im not the kind of person that will say everything and anything is good. I do have a favorite place in terms for rice used in sushi. Rice is a compliment to the fish that it is paired with. Both have to be good in quality for a good experience. One can not be good without the other. 

This rice. Not much flavored. Breaks apart. Mushy. If i had to rate just the rice? 1 out of 5. 

Tuna (Maguro) - dark red. mushy. little to no flavor. doesn't seem really fresh either. cant sense any metallic taste to the fish either 

Yellowtail (Hamachi) - nice pinkish color. sweet. 

Red Snapper (Izumidai) - nice color. good texture. 

Halibut (Hirame) - not really fresh. no "bite" 

Salmon (sake) - probably one of the better items of the nigiri list. tastes fatty and fresh. too bad rice was bad. otherwise would have been good. 

Smoked Salmon - the most awkward one (ordered by cousin). not like any of the usual smoked salmon i've had before. Thick slice. slightly lighter and firmer than a normal salmon piece. you can smell the smoked aroma fairly quickly. taste was a bit salty but expected for a smoked salmon. 

Fresh Water Eel (Unagi) - not bad. the eel was a little cold. not sure if it's because of sitting on table or what. eel texture was mid mushy mid firm. sauce was normal. sweet. 

Salmon Egg (Ikura) - "fishy popping boba" as what my cousin called it. had its usual salty flavor but may not be fresh either. had a "fishy" taste. 

Egg (Tamago) - surprisingly, this was nicely made. Thick cut piece. presentation was a bit non-traditional. imagine the size of a fish nigiri cut. folded in half. and cut mid way to make a pyramid over a small ball of rice. not only did it not hold the rice, it was a bit weird (presentation wise). taste wise, it was good. nice and sweet. 

Sweet Shrimp (Amaebi) - Not really sweet. Small shrimp as well. Not exactly sure if its even real amaebi. A tip had mentioned it is not real amaebi. more like regular shrimp marinated in a sweet sauce. 

Beef Tataki - worst one of all. Not saying the way it is done is bad. but the quality of the beef was bad. almost all the beef had a fairly big chewy piece that made it seem like you just ate a piece of beef chewing gum. beef wasnt seasoned either. so quite plain in taste overall. 

Kake Udon - small bowl of udon in a kake (light broth made with laver, bonito flakes, soy sauce). udon was cooked pretty good. still a good "bite". not overcooked. Good way to stuff yourself cuz there wasnt much other items that caught my attention 

Appetizers ! 

Baked Green Mussel - not sure what sauce they used. some sweet sauce mixed with the japanese mayo.... mussel was warm at best. mussel was in whole pieces. not cut in half. 

Shrimp Tempura - also one of the better items of the meal. nicely breaded and fried. nice light golden color. crispy and hot. 

Golden Scallop - deep fried to a light brown color. overcooked (for my preference) in terms of scallop. even the center was fully cooked. at least its a real scallop. 

Grilled Mackerel (Rec' by Michael K) - overgrilled. meat was a bit dry. as expected from mackerel, lots of small bones. not skilled to eat it fast XD 

Salmon Skin Handroll w/ Fresh Salmon (Rec' by Michael K) - also one of the better items of the meal. Fairly stuffed hand roll with crispy fried salmon skin, but also cuts of fresh salmon pieces as well. Good recommendation ! 

Spider (soft shell crab, crab, avocado, cucumber, gobo w/ eel sauce) - Soft shell crab was a bit cold. Not sure if the crab was fried before hand or what not. Didn't notice the gobo in the roll. 

Burning Your Ass (spicy soft shell crab, tuna, cucumber, crab, spicy tuna, spicy kiss sauce, mustard sauce, jalapeno, sriracha on top) - to be honest, i did NOT notice there was soft shell crab in this. yeah there was sriracha and jalepeno on it. and spicy tuna, but eh... its no where near burning MY ass XD 

Overall experience, eh. Service was good. Tea is $1. Food was not up to what people have said. Most likely won't come back again.

AYCE sushi at $25.95 for dinner is pretty great, especially when the foods quality is pretty brilliant. 

The uni wasn't fishy or an overpowering taste of iodine either, it was a great sea urchin roe, also the oyster was a decent size and was paired with a nice neutralizing sauce. I really loved the no rice rolls, it was a fresh change from the usual heavy, but fluffy and still besutiful, Japanese Sushi rice. 

There were also a few things that my family and the only thing that we would've liked to see was a little more contrast in the creamy sauces. It was a bit much for some of the rolls. Perhaps a squeeze of lemon would change that?

But besides that one bit, the staff were very kind and atentative. Plus the resturaunt's enviroment is very unique and cool. I would come again for sure!
Got some good vegan options. Avocado roll, veggie roll, and veggie tempura roll were all tasty. Wasn't worth it for me to do the all you can eat. Really fast service.

Came here for lunch with the family, great good and fast service. All the sushi rolls come fresh and the nigiri is also very fresh. This is by far the best place to come for AYCE Sushi, the staff is very friendly and also provide great service. 


I recommend getting the calamari for an appetizer and the best sushi roll is the spicy spider!!

We were there a week ago with a party of 20 people. Got our own room to dine it. The employee and their boss were outstanding. They got everything started right for us. Alcohol and plenty of sushi to choose from. We all got the all-you-can-eat sushi that night. The food kept coming. Service was outstanding. Really reasonable price for sushi. Just think, you can get 3 rolls of sushi for the price of all-you-can-eat sushi. It was $25.95 for dinner with 20% gratuity added to the bill. I would have given more since the service was so good. Thank you, my family will definitely come back again.

Very interesting restaurant. They a have all you can eat option or a la carte and your table doesn't have to all order the same option. This is great for friends who can't or don't want to eat as much. Space is big and clean. Bathroom is clean and has mouthwash, toothpicks and floss! The fish is pretty good quality for an all you can eat place. My friends ate lotss of salmon. My favorite roll to get is salmon skin roll. The first hand roll I got was good and crunchy so I ordered another in the cut style, but the salmon skin in the cut roll wasn't crunchy and more soft. But my friend's cut salmon skin roll was crunchy. So it's not consistent. 

Service by Kara was great. Friendly & great sense of humor. Got all our complicated orders for our vegetarian friend right. Helpful and checked in on us a lot. Very patient with all our requests. 

10% off your bill if you write a review on yelp. Cheaper AYCE price at lunch. Some items cost more if you order a la carte. The menu can be a bit confusing but they answer all your questions if you ask.

This is an excellent sushi spot. We came with a friend who knows what to order and we didn't leave hungry. Everything was fresh and delicious. We really enjoyed the baby octopus and will definitely be back. The service was outstanding too.

My sister and I are always skeptical about sushi places but this was one of the only ones open on Sunday and had great reviews. This place was awesome!! Food was delicious, staff was attentive, sushi chiefs were entertaining, and the price was great!!! We have now found our go-to sushi place in Vegas... Highly recommend.

Went here earlier this evening and my overall experience was so-so.  I had the All You Can Eat dinner for about 26 dollars per person not including tax and tip. 

I really liked the food. Overall, it was very fresh and a lot of really good flavours and variety. Many different types of rolls including baked, deep fried, vegetarian, basic, no rice, etc. Also a BUNCH of appetizers. 

The only complaint I had about the food would be the size of the nigiri. They were about half the size of nigiri you would get elsewhere. Obviously, this wasn't a problem since I got the All You Can Eat but I would have been VERY upset if this was A La Cart. 

As far as the environment of the place went, some of the tables can be a little close to other customers. Also, the booths are large compared to the table. Both my partner and I were sitting at the edge of our seats in order to reach the table, and at the edge of our seats neither of us were very comfortable. 

Finally, my biggest complaint about this place was the service. We were getting served and checked up on a decent amount at the beginning of our meal, but after the first round of rolls came around the service just started getting slower, and slower, and slooooower. After our second round of sushi came, it was at least 20 minutes after we finished until we were asked if we wanted anymore. After that, it took another 30 minutes until they brought our check around. They didn't even ask us if we wanted more, they just brought the check. I would have given this place five stars had it not been for this terrible service. I hope tonight was just a fluke. 

Favourite Roll: Japanese Lasagna
Favourite App: Cheese Croquette
If you're in the mood for some late night sushi...this is the place for you!  Great selections at great prices!

This review for AYCE only. 
First and definitely last time in my life I tried AYCE!
 Looking at all 5 star reviews for JJANGA, husband and I decided to give it a try. What a horrible mistake. 
Tiny pieces of not so fresh fish. The smallest appetizers I ever seen. 
Should mention ikura and uni. I am from Russia, so I know a thing or two about caviar. Black caviar and and red caviar (salmon roe). My guess is that salmon roe served to us in JJANGA, was stored in a refrigerator (not in a freezer, which is fine) for minimum 2-3 weeks. It was bitter and smelly!  
I've eaten a lot of uni. A couple of times we even drove to CA just to get fresh uni. However, I must don't know enough about sea urchin, because I cannot imagine, how spoiled uni must be to turn BLACK? 
 I am not even going to talk about rolls. Will just mention that 99% of rolls are made form spicy imitation crab meat and cream cheese. I cannot call "sushi" cream cheese wrapped in rice.
Thank you JJANGA for teaching me a lesson..

My husband and I were more than happy with our favorite AYCE sushi joint in Summerlin, but then we moved to the Southwest and needed to find something closer. JJANGA is by far the best. The key to determining good sushi is in tasting the sashimi and this my friends was the freshest and tastiest you can get at an AYCE sushi place. The color of the fish was vibrant and it tasted like butter.

The creativity and quality of the rolls are excellent and there is always someone walking by trying to take your order. Just the best and I cannot wait to make this our weekly sushi spot!
Simply awesome! Many items on menu with no rice for the diet concious. Will be back:)

How is it I drive clear across town with a party of ten and you have no alcohol AT ALL! On top of that our server completely stopped coming after the first order to where I had to go hunt down a new one. It turns out he was done for the day and didn't say anything! What a horrible place that I will never ever come back to!
Theres no signs letting guests know about last call. We come here frequently and never had any issues. I am very disappointed in the customer service.

I came here for the first time with a friend who was visiting.
At first it looked super sketchy because it was 10pm and dark outside and in the parking area. When we walked in, there was actually light inside and it felt vibrant being in there. The workers were super nice especially our server. We couldn't finish like 3 of our plates but he didn't want to charge us a la carte price so he told my friend while i was in the bathroom to just tell me he ate everything while i was in there LOL 
Good sushi, I don't know what makes it different from other AYCE sushi bar and restaurants other than the interior decor but it was still a good place to try. Dinner was about $27 a person. It's wprthit if you can eat a lot and they also have stamp cards! lol
Favorite all you can eat sushi place! The Jjanga burrito hand roll is soooo good! I always leave in a sushi coma because I want to eat every roll on the menu.

I've heard great things about this place and live nearby, but am very loyal to my favorite sushi chef at another place... or I was. I've been avoiding him since I found this place, with an extensive menu, innovative rolls, and super-fresh fish!

Menu has a lot to explore, and I love that the rolls aren't just your standard "special" rolls on everyone else's menu in town. The cowboy roll with seared beef on top especially caught my attention. Mega bonus points for having SIX RICELESS ROLLS! SAY WHAT!? Unheard of, and they're almost all delicious. Freshmen Roll, Spring Mountain Roll, and Tuna Naruto are my favorites in this category. The handrolls and "burritos" are huge and delicious- pick from the Monkey Roll or go classic with salmon skin. 

Side and appetizer dishes here are also pretty unique (ask for several of the mushroom ball), and the nigiri is thick-cut and delicious- appreciate how they use a proportionate amount of rice rather than gigantic mounds, as found elsewhere in town. 

AYCE lunch price (til 3PM) is a super-reasonable $21, dinner is open til 2AM and goes up to $27- adds extra dishes like uni and amaebi nigiri, grilled mackerel, sashimi or poke salad, and mochi for dessert. Bummed that the mochi isn't available at lunch price, wish they'd add some desserts as they are a bit lacking in this area.

Great sushi and amazing service. As soon as i walked in the manager already notified me that they just got a big party seated and are falling behind, but of course I will get my food, it will just take longer. I had no problem. I was seated right away and the food came out faster than other sushi places i had been to. The staff are very nice and loud just like you would expect at any sushi restaurant. Sushi is fantastic, and they are open late which is great.

This is one of my new favorite sushi places! The menu isn't as large as some of the other sushi places in town, but sometimes simplicity is key. 

Their food is fresh and well prepared. I've gone a total of 3 times already and I have to say I have not once had a bad experience. In fact, I'm impressed at the friendly and efficient service. The waiters come around frequently, but it's not intrusive. They're pretty attentive to your needs. 

The thing I like the best is definitely the staff. They make me want to go back again and again. 

One downside I foresee as business picks up would be the questionable location and parking lot.

Trust me if you haven't been here yet you must try this AYCE! The service was quick and friendly. ALL the servers were proactively checking up on our table. We never had to wait and our orders were constantly coming. Everything was flavorful and fresh. Presentation on point. Also, if you like mushrooms. Do yourself a favor and try the Grand Canyon. We found out new go to AYCE sushi. 

There's a private karaoke room! AYCE sushi and singing...yes please. I think I've found my next birthday party spot. Who's in?

Lunch $20.95
Dinner $25.95

I have been here several times for AYCE and it is definitely one of my favorite sushi places in Vegas. The no rice rolls are light and decadent, and the rice to fish ratio is perfect so it doesn't fill you up to fast. The only downfall is the service. While still friendly, staff seems very slow and forgetful from time to time.
I absolutely love this place! Definitely my favorite place to get sushi in Las Vegas and the staff is always friendly.

We did not take advantage of the AYCE and ordered right off the menu.  The sushi was fresh and delicious.  They even have decent vegetarian options which one of our guest took advantage.  For the price, it was good.
Sweet shrimp sushi is delicious.... dinner buffet is awesome !! ;)

Yay! There's a closer sushi place to me that I actually like a lot for food and service! 
The boyfriend and I went on a double-date with my sister and brother-in-law for dinner around 5-6PM. We had been greeted and seated right away. LOL. The entire staff enthusiastically acknowledges any patron that walks through the doors. 
Liked the setting, and we enjoyed the fact that it wasn't as crowded as our original favorite AYCE establishment. 
2-sided menu for AYCE sushi, and separate menu for drinks or specials. We liked everything we ordered, but our favorites were Three Some Special, Mistake, Japanese Lasagna and Sunset Special. Hahaha... I still don't know what to make of the Bacon Roll though - savory, yet sweet. Maybe it's just the idea of having bacon at a sushi place? 
We were constantly checked up on here, and I liked the way they made sure the tables were clear for upcoming dishes.

I came here solely because my co workers rant and rave about this place. We were seated quickly upon arrival. I don't know my servers name probably because he failed to pay attention to us, and give us a proper greeting. I heard this place gets pretty packed so the fact it was dead made me extra excited to eat! The first few orders come out, the salmon nigiri had this weird like blueish/whitish circle on all every piece and I was kinda freaked out about eating it, it resembled mold. The first roll came out and it look super good, the crumbs, the sauces, and the cuts were all equal. And for each roll after that it was down hill. For one there was only four tables max but three sushi chefs behind the bar with no one seating there. I tried to make eye contact with ANYONE and they all failed to pay attention. The chefs were more focused on themselves, they seemed to be able ot have conversations with everyone the host, servers, and some guy not wearing the uniform, not sure if he was a shift manager or what.. The didn't really want to make the sushi and that is for sure. The effort all around just sadly lacked, some rolls didn't have sauces on them at ALL. Some fish was left out, and my biggest pet peeve of all time is when the rolls are not cut the same size! And some were large some were tiny, and ontop of everything the food wasn't even rolled tight. The server wasn't taking plates from our tables, and was kind of just going around us the whole time. We didn't get our water refilled, and I am surprised we even stayed for as long as we did. I also have heard this location isn't as great as the other one. But I will NOT be checking this brand out again. Fish quality and service took a big 0/5 for me. 
Also when my man had asked about substitutions for fish he just blurted out no, and anyone who works in the service industry (I DO) knows you never say no! Just word it differently and be polite about it!
 
*Mind you this was at 11pm and their happy hour had just begun sloppy food is expected when its close to the end of their shift but three hours before?*
Incredible staff, very friendly and helpful. Great food and atmosphere. Many meat dishes but vegetarian friendly. Sit at the sushi bar and have jjanga whip up some great food!

AYCE for $25 is a great deal!!! Delicious sushi and fun atmosphere... We sat at the bar and the female preparing the rolls in front of us was very nice and asked us what we wanted as soon as we finished whatever we ordered. We also had the apple Saki which was DELICIOUS!!! I didn't give it 5 stars because I ordered garlic eddomomes as an appetizer and they never brought them. Also the green tea ice cream was delicious. My favorite roll was the "I love my ass"
They have the best sushi in town. Best specialty rolls. I come here ALL the time. I LOVE the touchdown roll and the playboy special. Go here. Do it.

This is probably my favorite place to have sushi. Everything is always super fresh, customer service is great and we have never had a problem with anything there. The best part is they stay open until 2am! My boyfriend and I went to eat here around midnight and it was perfect there weren't many people there. The only bad thing is they remodeled this place and they did a horrible job. The booths used to be super secluded and romantic and the remodeling they did totally changed the vibe. The Durango location is equally good so maybe check that location out first.

Korean-style Japanese restaurant.

This place isn't as authentic as many other Japanese restaurants nearby, but offers cool ambience and good food.

I really like their bulgogi bowl for lunch.

Great place for AYCE sushi in Chinatown. They have a very good and generous ayce menu which includes many items excluded at most others. The fish was on point, and the service was attentive. Love that they are open late, and on Monday! The interior was very vibrant and inviting. The rest is in the pictures, Cupcake.

My friend referred me to this place as the "Best possible Sushi in Las Vegas." At first I was skeptical since there are many Sushi spots in Vegas, so I figured why not? 

Everything from the atmosphere, to the servers and then ultimately the food is 5-Star. Me and a few friends did AYCE and ordered numerous dishes ranging from appetizers, sashimi, rolls, and then dessert. We could NOT find a dish that we didn't love. Overall, I would have to agree that this is by far the best Sushi place in Las Vegas, bar-none. 

P.S. If you have a chance make sure you order the "Choo Choo Special" have fun!

After hearing so many positive reviews, we were so excited to try this AYCE sushi for lunch.

To be expected at AYCE sushi, the quality of the fish wasnt great but not bad... the nigiri was good, but most of the rolls fell apart before we can dip it in the soy sauce.  The "no rice rolls" seemed like a great option, but unfortunately, they were tasteless and covered in so much of the spicy mayo sauce. 

Menu is also inconsistent and not intuitive. While 1 order of agedashi tofu is a single cube of fried tofu or 1 piece of gyoza, you get 2 pieces of shrimp tempura or 2 pueces of nigiri sushi.  While one side provides an explanation of each of the specialty rolls, the back side is confusing with so many "rules" - some items are available for dinner only while other items are available both meal period but only 1 order per person.  The server was nice; however being so new, she didnt know the ingredients in the big menu nor the Japanese equivalent. 

Hopefully, it was just an off day
Amazing they are open till 1AM! They always make a Sista feel at home! Spicy Albacore out of this world!

JJANGA is a 5 star in my book it was very good. Korean own but I would say it's a lot better then most Japanese places. The all you can eat is amazing get deal. Lots of options on the menu one of my favorite place to visit. If you a beginner or a pro sushi eater you will find something u like here. The place is very upbeat and great environment to visit with friends. Easy to find parking and open late. So many great things about this place.

Jjanga and his staff are friendly, energetic and make you feel like they are welcoming you to their home. 
The sushi is fresh, is deliciously amazing with pops of flavor throughout!  We are so happy for Jjanga to have his own place. We've been loyal fans for 4 years!
Order everything on the menu!!!  You won't be disappointed.

We decided to give this place a try and was stoked that I did. We were served by Ricky and he was great! Very friendly, knew the menu and was very fluent in the preparation of the sushi that we ordered. We had the AYCE,   and was very happy with all of our selections!  The rolls that stood out to me was the spider roll, Japanese lasagna,  the garlic ahi, and the tamago! they were so tasty that we ordered three orders of the nigiri and two orders of the rest. This is a very social resturant in  the sence that they have their sushi chefs  all in one area and they are really friendly and engage with the customers that sit at the bar. Ricky  recommended us to try out the grapefruit sake and wow, was that amazing! It was literally like drinking squirt! we also had the monkey burrito (amazingly ridiculous! !) its a sushi burrito, cucumber,  spicy tuna, served with two different sauces. I mean how can you go wrong with that?!?!?! The sushi was executed well and fish tasted fresh and had a very clean taste to it! the garlic ahi is absolutely a must try, the garlic sauce compliments the fish very nicely and adds that kick it needs, the fish was soft and tender, rice prepared well and with the tamago which was just amazing!! This sushi house is great and I will recommend them for all to try, its great to find a sushi house with such a laid back atmosphere and great high quality food, I will definitely be back for more awesome sushi!! Great job JJANGA!

Worst service ever! DO NOT GO HERE. 

Summary:
We waited 4 hours for our food
Not all our food came
We left AYCE sushi hungry
They had the nerve to charge us and even include 18% tip!

I came with a group of 7 and they were busy and understaffed so they sat us in a private room because they didn't have seating in the main room available. This was fine with us except they seemed to forget about us. After 30 minutes some girl came in and asked us for our order without giving us menus. We asked for some things then asked for menus to order additional items. 1 hour since we got there... another girl walks in brings us one menu for the 7 of us and then takes our order again because apparently the first girl who took our order was a busser. So we order again. After another 40 minutes they bring out some food but not all of it. And some of the rolls they brought us we didn't even order. We wait another hour and at this point have been there for 2.5 hours. No more food. One of the guys in our group goes to ask them where our food is and they say they lost the order. So we order again (this is our third time ordering) and we wait... and then after another 30 or so minutes they bring us one or two rolls out of the eight rolls we ordered. So we asked where the other rolls were and we were told they were having a problem in the kitchen but they would come. So we keep waiting and they don't bring out the rolls. At this point we're fed up so we ask to speak with a manager. We've been there 4 hours and just want to leave. The manager offered us 15% off but that wasn't enough so after complaining more they gave us 50% off. None of us even wanted to pay because we were still hungry and you shouldn't leave AYCE sushi hungry. They also never bussed our table and left a bunch of trash, dirty plates and leftover food. It was disgusting. 

Overall this place sucks and it's the worst sushi experience I've ever had. Unfortunately their food is good but the terrible experience and awful service means I will never be going back.

After all the rave reviews of this place, my friend and I decided to try this Sushi restaurant out.  This place did not disappoint!  My friend and I decided to do the All You Can Eat and each dish that was brought out to us was excellent.  From the first to the last bite, we both enjoyed our meal. My friend and I highly recommend this restaurant and we will be both be back again soon.

To say this is the best sushi and dining experience in Las Vegas is an understatement.  I was introduced to Sumo Sushi from my high school best friend and went for the first time on NYE this past December.  My fianc and I really went because it was close to the house and an easy spot to eat before celebrating with champagne at home.  We were blown away by the staff and especially Captain Choo Choo.  They made us feel like family and asked us to become friends on Facebook so he could share with us updates on his new restaurant which we now know well is Jjanga!  

We visited Jjanga the week they opened and wow this is the most special, amazing and innovative sushi/japanese restaurant in Las Vegas.  I was blown away by the sushi masters Choo Choo, Jjanga, Koo Koo and Hicky who welcomed us with open arms and even let me school them on the ways of Instagram to take a photo of us all!  I love these guys and the entire staff so much and think of them as family.  Choo Choo even gave my fianc advice on what moves in the bedroom would ensure we have a boy or a girl baby...tips we will use when the time is right.  Can't get preggers yet as the sushi is just too good to miss out on for 9 months!

Fantastic quality in proteins and fast friendly service! No alcohol yet, but I think they are working on it! Very high quality AYCE menu that includes hot dishes and specialty items. Mango mochi to finish it all off!!!

This place is definitely up there for AYCE Sushi.  I really enjoyed everything I had which was damn near the whole menu.  I wish they had tempura ice cream though.  The only thing I disliked was the space between the table and the seat in the booth, it makes you have to lean over a little much to eat.  good booth seating for groups of 6-8.

The venue itself is very nice and spacious. The food was just ok. Nothing really stuck out to me saying "oh my gosh this is so good I want more of this." I don't have any complaints or negatives comments but I probably won't come back.

So so good! Great service and the no rice rolls are amazing. Specifically the fresh men roll, so refreshing! The Cajun albacore and super white tuna were also my favorite and tasted so fresh and melts in your mouth.

In terms of AYCE in Vegas, this one won't even crack my top twenty list. Seems to be a favorite of the locals, but outside of an occasional uni that didn't look fresh, this is your typical hundred and one variation of the California roll AYCE. In other words, they fill you up on rice. They had prompt service, and were fairly friendly but nothing to stands out at this place, even the large monitors playing non-stop K-pop is no longer the hip thing.  Also for parents, the names of some of the "creative" sushi rolls are either PG-13 or R-rated. What's invokes a chuckle or laugh to you as an adult, is inappropriate on a dinner menu.
The beeeeest sushi in town! If you don't like joking And laughing with the ppl making ur food don't come here. You're treated like family here.. ALWAYS!

Another AYCE joint to be added to the list!
A+ all around! Was very impressed with the service, food and kid-friendly environment!

Dinner AYCE price - $25.95, pretty normal compared to other places.

Menu includes tons of items from nigiri, soup and salads, appetizers, special handrolls, spicy rolls, no rice rolls, baked rolls, fried rolls, and shrimp tempura rolls!

Loved that they don't believe in smothering everything in the rice.. Or sauce..

Fianc had tons of their nigiri from the looks of it, the rice to fish ratio was good --not too much rice!
I started off with the salmon skin handroll, had chunks of the actual salmon meat with the crispy skin! My fave at any sushi restaurant!

Then proceeded with a couple rolls :
* Riceless Fresh Men Roll - had tuna, crab, shrimp and avocado wrapped in rice paper, side of the ginger, mustard sauce. It was a bit too gingery for me, regardless it was still a good, fresh roll.
* Monkey Burrito Roll - this was SOO good! An actual sushi burrito with shrimp tempura, spicy tuna, and crab wrapped in soy paper came with spicy mayo on the side, decent size, and wasn't too filling!
* Something Wrong #69 - shrimp tempura, soft shell crab, tuna and salmon with their spicy garlic ponzu! I love anything garlic ponzu! This roll was not that spicy, just had a lil kick to it! 
* Brown Rice Mountain Roll - my least favorite roll only because there was nothing mind blowing about it -- cream cheese, avocado and salmon all baked together. The brown rice was overcooked, in my opinion. 
And I couldn't handle the cheesiness of the roll.

We also had a couple appetizers or sides : 
Chicken Wings - really good (I mean you really can't mess this up)! Not too much breading just like how my son likes it!
Fries - natural cut, real potatoes!
Bulgogi - delicious grilled, marinated beef! 

Service was quick! There were too much bodies, making it a bit confusing on who's waiter is who's. But waters were always filled, dishes were taken as soon as they were empty, and food came out within minutes!

Can't reiterate enough how much I love that they're kid friendly! They even have a treasure chest filled with toys for the kids to take before they leave! So awesome! 

Must try and definitely recommended to families and everyone else! 

FYI! They do karaoke next door, $20 an hour for a room, one room fitting about 6 people!

Music is way to loud for a restaurant.  
Food is hardly ok.  Sushi rice fell apart. 
Servers are not very helpful.  Missing 3 orders during last visit.

This place is awesome. I love coming to this upbeat sushi house. Very welcoming and has an awesome modern decor. The fried baby octopus was pretty good as well as the baked mussels. The vampire was on of my favorites nice and spicy. What I love about this place is their rice less rolls. They got very creative with these rolls with my favorite being the Tuna Naruto ! I've been here for a birthday and they have really great private rooms. We all had a great experience.

I waiting my food at list 10min..
I can not keep eating..
Most roll was opened...
Server doesn't remember our order.....

I don't want to go back.......

So I stumbled on this place by Yelping (thanks all you Yelpers out there!) AYCE sushi off the strip (preferably). I guess I just didn't wanna have to deal with all the madness and crazy sushi prices on the strip. Anyway, we ordered a good amount! We got the dinner price so that we could get the "special" items, like sea urchin, sweet shrimp, etc. I think the uni could have been a little more fresh, but it was still good. They only allow one order per person, which is fine. The other sushi was still fairly good for AYCE. I love the variety and expansive menu for AYCE. I would definitely come back again if I'm in the mood for AYCE sushi in Vegas.
This place is one of the best AYCE we've been to.  The Uni and flying fish egg was absolutely delicious.  Great service and the restaurant is clean.

Since moving the Las Vegas this has been my favorite sushi place! Great service great people great food. They never disappoint! 

5 out of 5 stars

The rolls were gross and the server made the experience even worse. I asked the server which is their most popular roll and he responds "Can't you see we have millions of rolls?" Seriously? Going back to sushi KAYA as my go to AYCE sushi place. KAYA ALWAYS HAS A WAIT but its so worth it. JJanga is a dump. Gross...... negative -10
Really fresh fish they had the best Saba I've ever had and service was great. the chiefs were happy to work and very open to take your order. It's very clean and they have great appetizers.
Terrible service and terrible food. And on the way out the manager told us not to write too much on Yelp.
The food and service was mediocre. There was way too much rice in all our nigiri. The rice overwhelmed the fish. The only good thing was probably the ice cream and mochi.

Great spot but overall mediocre food.

Let's start off with the good stuff because there's definitely good things about this place. The ambiance is awesome with oversized booths for large groups which I loved & it felt like you were in a village somewhere in Japan (loved it). The music was great with hip hop all night & we had a great group ordering a ton of food. 

The food unfortunately didn't match the ambiance. The slices of fish were like paper. The super white was chewy and resembled octopus (major disappointment). The rice to fish ratio was very high with rice winning and they ran out of green tea ice cream. Really? 

The service was good however they kept bringing us other people's food. They would just quickly sit the plates down without saying what we were getting & eventually we noticed that none of us had ordered what kept coming over. This was pretty annoying as we must have received 4-5 wrong items. 

Some of the ok stuff was the garlic tuna (great flavor but paper thin fish), the big easy roll (great flavor but loaded with rice) and the screaming orgasm. 

Overall the food was ok with some small highs & too many lows. With so many sushi choices in town this place doesn't make the cut for me. The ambiance was awesome so it's unfortunate.

Awesomeness wrapped in seaweed! Had 4 different rolls. Each was a delight. Although this place is about 2 miles from strip, I would drive to other end of Vegas for this place. Definitely the place in Vegas for modern sushi. Service was exceptional. Prices for a la carte was really good. Two of us ate to fill for $45. Definitely coming back!

This sushi place definitely isn't what it used to be customer service wise. Since the new management, their hours changed so they close earlier now. Last call is at 11 don't go within the last few hours of closing because it'll be really bad customer service. We went around 10:45 and we didn't get anyone to take or orders, got no straws, and the waiter was rushing us and he even spilled our water and didn't bother to clean it up. They messed up our orders and tried to bring us more rolls than we asked, and when we asked for straws the waiter gave us attitude about it and handed us one single straw when both of us needed them. Our waiter was a talker asian guy with big square glasses, on the chubbier side. I wouldn't recommend this place anymore. Definitely better places in town with a lot better customer service. When we wanted to pay we waited for a long time for someone to take our check because all the employees were too busy focusing on closing. We've been coming to this location for years and this new management just isn't cutting it for us. Not worth the money anymore.

This use to be my absolute go to place in Las Vegas. Once Jjanga himself left that's when the decline started. First the staff was left and the food which I thought okay hopefully nothing changes. They revamped the restaurant giving it a make over and I thought... awesome! But eventually the staff I grew to love started leaving too. I use to come to this 3-4 times a month and always brought my friends/family and tourists. I ended up moving back to Texas and got to come visit it after a year and oh my gosh to say I was heartbroken is an understatement. There was only one familiar face left. The whole menu changed. The basic spicy mayo got kicked up 10,000 and over powered all the other flavors. I had to take breaks and chug water due to my palate being destroyed. My very favorite roll was the tuna Naruto and it was completely gone off the menu so I begged the waitress I recognized to see if the chef could recreate it which they did try but it was not the same roll or flavors. I'm so so saddened at all the new changes. I hope the owners know what they are doing with all the revamping they are doing. As this place use to have long waits and delicious sushi.

Nothing but THE BEST at Jjanga Japanese Sushi Restaurant! I know that I will never go anywhere else! Why would I if the place is clean, beautiful and so fun. Music is good and food is even better. 
Tried this new place out after our Jabbawockeez show for my 1 year/Valentines Day celebration and I couldn't be happier. The bf and I are huge beef lovers and we were so excited to find out that they serve a roll with actual seared steak on top!Jjanga himself made us an amazing steak dish with a delicious ginger/mustard sauce that was absolutely to die for! Never heard about this dish or sauce anywhere else before. 
We also tried all of their appetizers since we were doing AYCE and it was so tasty! We had the pumpkin soup which was rich, creamy, yet light all at the same time. The best juiciest and plump baked green mussels I've ever had at a sushi joint too (super happy about that!)
The atmosphere was very enjoyable. The way the place is setup is really interesting but it all makes sense. There's a separate side to the left where they have rooms where you can rent for karaoke (going to try that at least once!) The music was playing throughout just loud enough to still enjoy dinner. The staff was so funny and made us laugh throughout the night. 
I am telling everyone about this place because I'm expecting to return as many times as possible. I know I'll never be disappointed every time I go.

This is easily our new favorite AYCE sushi spot in Vegas.  We used to frequent most of the popular sushi spots on the entire west side of Vegas but from now on we have no reason to go anywhere but Jjanga.  The chefs are amazing and have great personalities (take good care of them and they'll get creative for you) and the staff is friendly and attentive.  The grapefruit sake is awesome on its own or in a sake-bomb and the menu is refreshingly different from other places around town.  We like the fun, upbeat atmosphere and have enjoyed the sushi bar, small groups in the main dining area as well as large parties in their private room.  If you like sushi and want a new favorite spot I highly recommend you check this place out.

My parents live in Las Vegas and had been there before and did not care for their food.  When we were in town visitng they thought they would give this restaurant another chance.  However, both our experience and the food were not great.  The sashami did not all seem fresh.  It was  served at room temperature rather than cold and when it's fresh it's floppy on your chopstick.  Some of them were stiff.  They were also sliced really thin. The nigiri was below average.  Udon soup was ok.  When my husband ate one of the mussels from the soup he said he could tell immediately that it wasn't fresh and didn't taste right.  Sure enough, he later got sicker than a dog.  Service wasn't great at all.  Our party was missing three sushi plates and several soy dishes.  When I asked for three soy dishes the waiter brought back two.  When I asked for one more he said, "Can't you just share?"  It was so insulting!  The waitress did not come by to offer us more beverages.  Music was also too lout.  I've had superb sushi in the SF Bay Area, and this restaurant paled in comparison.  I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Trying this new sushi restaurant.  So far so good.  Had then screaming orgasm, fresh men roll, monkey burrito, who's your ex-wife, sexy girl roll, and tons of nigiri.  Love the service and the quality of the fish.  I could use a little less rice on the nigiri, half roll option, and more options for dessert but all in all great and we'll be back.
yummiest freshest sushi in all of las vegas!! so good and amazing and so many choices. all you can eat is greatly priced and they do not skimp you!!

Dined here once about two years ago and again on 02/26/18.

We were seated promptly as the restaurant was nearly empty and waited on right away. We chose to do the a la Carter menu as opposed to the all you can eat because we weren't that hungry.

The main reason I gave 3 stars is because the menu options here are very limited. The choices are raw fish, sushi, raw fish, and well, sushi. For a name that includes "Japanese restaurant" my boyfriend was hoping for some steak or shrimp skewer options like most places have. 

As far as the all you can eat sushi goes (which I had on my first visit) it is really nothing special. The sushi is good and fresh, but nothing to write home about. I can name about three other places that have a better all you can eat options for a better price and with more variety.

The food we did order, edamame, two carpaccios, and two rolls, were very good and tasted fresh. The server was also very generous with the ginger which I love.

Overall, I may return to this restaurant at some point, but I'd recommend checking out other all you can eat options in Vegas as they are plentiful.

My boyfriend and I LOVE this place! They constantly make sure we're taken care of and have enough to eat. I recently won a photo contest they have on Facebook, Instagram and other social media sites. They took such good care of us! Jjanga is really cool and Choo Choo interacts with everyone at the sushi bar. The atmosphere is great and the food is obviously delicious. We'll be back many times and recommend it to all of our friends.
Great place for AYCE sushi. Expect a wait but will worth the wait time. Great service and Julia the manager is super awesome!

Very busy sushi buffet restaurant in Las Vegas.  Food is reasonably priced and service is ok. It is a type of restaurant you would visit for quantity not quality. The ingredients were not as fresh as you would wanted....don't order anything with Unagi, it is disgusting.  However, some of the tofu dish was not bad and sushi was ok. They have one of those rule of not leaving food behind but this could be a touture when some dish doesn't taste good. If you have dinner buffet, they have sashimi salads in various way. Some of them with no mayo tasted much better than one with. Some of the appetizers were better tasting such as tofu, skewers and calamari. They do have various rolls and Maki for almost everyone's liking. Please note, if you are a hard core Japanese food person, this is not the place, but if you occasionally have Japanese food with your friends and family, you might like this place more than I do as they do have karaoke etc. I also saw lots of families dine here as well. This restaurant has 3 locations in Las Vegas, one on Decatur is the best one.

I'm super late at making a review but this is one of the few places I go for AYCE sushi because other places can't compare! They have amazing service they're always on it & quick with orders. The first time I went our server was JJ & he was hilarious & gave us an amazing experience. He even offered us some random roll to try out. Their nigiri is the main reason why I love this place, which is what I base my sushi places off of. It's always fresh fish & a good ratio of rice to fish. I love the super white tuna, salmon, unagi, & uni just to name a few. They have a good variety of appetizers (my fav is the baby octopus), rolls & also have a selection of sushi burritos. I prefer to come for lunch when it's less busy but even when it's busy they're still providing great service. I will always come here when I'm craving sushi!

It's a chill place and a mildly upbeat. let's get to the sushi review: It's was mediocre Seems like some pieces were dry as if buffet style sushi and not freshly prepared However I enjoyed my time there 3 years ago
- was good. Tables were not clean. Food tasted good to me, but my friend I went with got food poisoning from eating here on December 16th 2017. Most likely I will not go back.

My first Sushi experience not my last Love this place. My friend and employer tried to get me to try it for almost a year I finally gave in.
It was love at first bite.  They always treat us very well and never run out of food
Great sushi!, great price point, servers super nice, fish was fresh, cool place to go, cool decorations, clean,

They had some tasty rolls and not so good ones. I personally didn't enjoy the fact that their appetizers had funky names with no explanation of what it actually was. I had something ex girlfriend and the only reason I ordered it was because a fellow yelper posted a pic and it looked good (it was good). The service was great even tho we had 5 servers, makes you feel bad that you can't tip them evenly.
Came here after shooting at a gun range for a friend's birthday and wow, definitely amazing sushi! Their saki is pretty good and the sushi is great.

I had heard many good things about this new sushi place called jjanga. I knew that it had replaced the old restaurant Shobu that was there - for this reason, I was not really sure if I wanted to go eat at this sushi place, because I thought it would just be the same as Shobu but just a new name. But when nurses and doctors of all races were raving about how fresh the sushi was and how good everything was on the menu, I knew I had to check it out. 

When I first arrived, I was seated immediately, but then the seat was taken from me haha The waiter did not know there was a waitlist and apologized like 10x for the mistake. It wasnt a big deal, because we were seated within 10 minutes anyways. The decor of the place is exactly the same as the restuarant that used to be there, except there are pictures of all the sushi chefs on the walls - really huge pictures of them as if youre in an episode of iron chef! 

My friends and I chose the AYCE option - dinner is 24.95 and I think lunch was only 21.95. There were lots of choices to choose from, especially in the appetizer section. I have never seen an appetizer menu that big and full of different things. I probably tried about half the things on it! They come out in very small portions so its perfect in that you can try a little bit of everything without getting too stuffed! When our sushi started to come out, I noticed that the rice to fish ratio was great! More fish than rice is always a good thing. Also, the fish was very fresh and so dericious. They don't do half orders though. oh well. 

If you have trouble picking something, the waiters are more than willing to help you pick something. Just tell them what youre feeling or what types of fish you want with what type of style and BAM! they tell you what you should get haha

I am definitely coming back here again!!! They also have a happy hour session that I am planning on trying out!!!

Unbelievable! We first met all of these guys when they worked together at Sumo 2. We would go for every special occasion and referred it to everyone. Now that they have moved Sumo 2 has gone completely downhill and so we went to try their new place. A: they remembered our faces as soon as we walked through the door and B: their rolls were out of this world. I thought they were good in the last place but it is nothing compared to what they make now. We will stay loyal to these chefs because they have always taken care of us and make our experiences special! I recommend the fresh men roll and the sexy time roll. We all shared and everything I tried was amazing but these 2 were my favorite because they were new on their menu. I will be taking all of my friends and family there for my birthday since they have tables to accommodate parties. I love those guys and their amazing food!

JJANGA is definitely a must visit whenever staying in Vegas! The sushi is always fresh and bursting with flavor.

There's a huge selection to choose from for AYCE. Would recommend the fresh men roll, beef sushi, yuzu yellowtail, and screaming O.

Excellent selection. I've been to A LOT of sushi places and this place had combinations and sushi selections I've never even seen before. It was almost overwhelming. It took me 15min just to read the entire menu.

All the rolls were creative and delicious. Pretty much every combination you can think of was on there which is awesome. For instance, I hate cucumbers in my rolls, but instead of having to ask them to hold the cucumber, they have a whole selection of rolls without it already.  Also they don't overload their rolls with rice like other AYCE places do. 

The nigiri was thick and fresh. Appetizers were all pretty good. The only thing I didn't enjoy, was the house salad, but whatever. Who besides me goes to AYCE and gets salad anyways?!?

Service was fairly attentive. We had a part of 10, so I understand it can get overwhelming with all the orders and reorders coming at you constantly, but they had 2 girls waiting on us and a busboy as well and they just weren't refilling or clearing the empties as well as they could. 

But honestly, that's the worst of the review. So do yourself a favor and try this place out. You won't regret it, and if you do, it'll be because you regret stuffing yourself so full!

Wow! This is going to be my new sushi spot. The garlic tuna, yuzu yellowtail, and the bulgogi is a must here! Satisfied with every bite! The fish is maybe the most fresh in town. 

The service is quick, Evan was great. He let us sit down at our while we waited for our party. 

If you're at the strip. Please stop by and try this place.

A was a avid eater at Oishy , including my family but after I eat at JJanga our eating habits have changed. Reasons:
-great taste
-less rice
-flavor is awsome
I want to underline  the speed with which the food is served, all employee courteous, respectful end and humble in the real sense. Keep up the good work guys.
For sushi lovers: keep going there, keep them busy, that will bring the restaurant more revenue and with that hopefully more choices to eat.
Thanks a lot JJanga
Claudio T
The service here seems a lot better than in the past. My go to spot for sushi. Love the staff. The trick is to sit at the sushi bar.
Not the most creative in terms of serving sushi or sashimi.  Pretty good sushi and the All You Can Eat deal is pretty good.

This place was great. Good service and great people. The quality was good and service was fast and speedy. 
Quality was nice and fresh. I would have like it better if sashimi was offered instead of sushi the whole time. I would like to taste the freshness of the fish better that rice. 

On that note. I recommend them to everyone that like sushi. the proportions are perfect. Great place.

One of my favorite sushi places - second time here. As always - Great selections!
I love their lobster roll.

Got the burning my ass roll and the fresh man roll. I loved the burning my ass cause it was super spicy. The only problem was the second roll had a hair in it so I sent it back. They chef did send me back a different complimentary sushi that was very good that I really liked. The service was a little slow and they took forever to give us our check and to come back for it so we ended up going to the front to pay. Other than that the food was good minus the hair and service.

This place was so fun! From the chefs to the managers it is so lively! Almost a place you can call home!! 

I know that Goyemon is the ultimate sushi spot but this place wins for atmosphere. The sushi is just as amazing and they have some really fun rolls and chefs willing to offer recommendations and create special rolls with the things you like.

The ultimate winner of this place..... GARLIC TUNA. Drool, it totally melts in your mouth. 

Looking forward to my next adventure!

I haven't been to this location in over a year and they renovated the place really well! The service was quick, friendly, and the serves were very attentive. The quality of the fish was spot on! The only downside was that a lot of their nigiri/rolls had a little too much sauce on them. Other than that, this place was delicious!

Before I get into details about the Sushi, etc., I must first say that the service here is AMAZING! The first time we ever stepped foot into JJANGA, they were seating us at one table, and I asked if they could please sit us at another table. It may not seem like much, but the second time we went, the gentleman remembered us and promptly took us to the same table and said, here's your table again. He then went over the menu with us, which is pretty extensive and suggested some of the items on there that we hadn't tried before. 

Moreover, he also then surprised us with a special roll just for us and some free sake on the house. The gesture was awesome, but too bad we don't drink alcohol. As I started to place my order, which by the way, I always order the same thing at any Sushi Restaurant, Salmon (Sake), Yellowtail (Hamachi), Fresh Water Eel (Unagi), Crunch Rolls, Caterpillar Rolls, and Seaweed Salad. The waiter also remembered this from our first visit, and noticing that I am probably a creature of habit when it comes to Sushi, the gentleman also suggested that we try the JJANGA Burrito, which is Shrimp, Broccoli Tempura, Crab, Masago, Green Onion, Furikake, and Layu with Soy Paper. May I say that it was pretty darn delicious and we are now addicted to it. If you haven't tried it yet, well then you should. The fact that he remembered that was pretty impressive! On a side not, I also like the fact that they use a proportionate amount of rice and not like most other places where they put an enormous amount of rice.

FYI: AYCE (All-You-Can-Eat) is $20.95 for Lunch (11:30am-3:00pm) and $25.95 for dinner (3pm-2am).

All-in-all, all of my experiences here have been awesome to say the least. They captured me with their service and this is my go-to spot for Sushi in Vegas. Every time this gentleman, which I don't refer to him by name because I just don't remember it, sees us, he always does something out of the realm of just basic customer service.

One of the best AYCE sushi joints you can find in the west part of Vegas! My last visit was one of my most enjoyable AYCE experiences at a reasonable price. All of the rolls were unique and creative. Not one of the rolls was left unfinished. Their nigiri was fresh tasting except for the uni.. Which was a shame! But at least the fish to rice ratio was just right.. Only a little bit of rice with a nice cut of fish. My group came in around 7-8pm and it was pretty busy! It's my second time here so we'll see how today's Dinner AYCE compares to last time's experience!

1/8/2015:

Came in around 3:30pm.. With a group of 4. Kind of empty.. And seemed like a few sushi chefs in the back were working at a steady pace. The first thing I noticed was that our food came out at a much slower pace.. Practically one plate/roll at a time with pauses in between. Me being an AYCE type of guy, this "portion control" kind of bothers me. Didn't experience that last time. Although it's not too much of an issue because everything that came out was delicious! 

The favorites for nigiri were the yuzu yellowtail, Cajun albacore, beef tataki and the garlic tuna. Even the uni had a much fresher taste. Each roll was pretty good, too. Don't remember the names, although I did prefer the special rolls over and of their baked/fried rolls. Also, the baked mussels and the oysters were pretty basic but tasty nonetheless. Other dishes/appetizers that stood out were the mini pork steak?? the baby octopus and the baked dynamite.

Also beware!! They sometimes either miss an item or forget your order.. This probably doesn't happen to everyone, but just a little reminder to the waiter/waitress is a simple solution.

All in all this place does it for me! Although, I keep this place in rotation when it comes to AYCE. There are too many sushi joints in this town to keep count.. This place deserves a solid 4.5 for the food and ambience. Plus, they have stamp cards for AYCE

Under new management again (3rd time I think). Food is bland. Nigiris not so fresh. Rolls are bland. Rice is not sushi grade. Hamachi Kama bland. Miso soup BLAND! C'mon guys.. too much cutting corners already. 

Not as great as when they first opened (original owner). From the 5 stars I originally gave, to 4 stars for the previous management. Now i'm giving them 2 stars. Where's my freshmen roll??!! Gone from the menu. I hope they step their game up to revive their once great status.

Sushi chefs and servers look so stressed out = food tastes stressed out too.

You're better off with the likes of Yama Sushi and Sakana. Both of which get my 5 stars.
really friendly staff, very attentive servers. we got seated right away w no reservations. we went for ayce w my brothers and enjoyed everything we had. great flavors and fresh!

This place is the new kid on the block when it comes to sushi on the West Side of town, but it comes in with a bang! I was pleasantly surprised at the spacious restaurant setting and the ALL-YOU-CAN-EAT Menu and prices. But the real treat came when the food arrived. The garlic tuna and smoked salmon were delicious, also had popcorn lobster and awesome baked green mussels. I also tried the lobster roll, the Johnny roll ( wrapped on cucumber) and their bacon roll. You should definitely try the golden scallop and the bbq chicken off the appetizer menu. But my absolute FAVORITE dish at Jjanga was their Mini Pork Skewer... It rivals Sushi Goyemon's pork belly, and to be honest, I think it is much tastier overall. All in all, JJANGA was a pleasant surprise and will now be part of my monthly sushi rotation...

3.5 stars. 

This was my third visit here. I liked my first visit years ago when they had Korean entres like bibimbap and budaejigae more than their conversion to a sushi place. The only items that are remotely Korean are the bulgogi app, sweet rice cakes and pumpkin soup

I ordered three nigiri, super white tuna, yuzu yellowtail and salmon as well as two rolls, the salmon and Alaskan roll. Yuzu and Alaskan roll were my faves

Although the sushi al a carte is more cheap compared to most places, (which is one reason we came here) you get what you pay for here.. Nigiri sushi was tinyyy! Lol salmon was lean, no fatty white lines that give it an almost buttery flavor and texture. Cuts of fish were also thin. Maybe they gave us the less appetizing parts idk. Rolls were just as small, but I appreciate that they didn't try to stuff the sushi with rice to make up for size. 

You're probably better off getting AYCE here but I would honestly go to another place with the better quality fish,  not for what we were served here. 

Service was good when we came cause we were the only ones in the restaurant but after another party came, it went kind of downhill.

I did like that they had Shirley Temple, twas great.

One of my favorite AYCE sushi places of all time. The quality is excellent (although somewhat inconsistent) and the service is great. The non-rice rolls are all excellent and you can get beef tataki and uni with the AYCE special. If you sit at the sushi bar, the chef's have their own signature rolls that never fail to disappoint!

 They also play the most eclectic background music I have ever heard.

The BEST all you can eat sushi place I have ever been to!! The selection they have is huge and with fun names (threesome, playboy etc.) The food was very fresh and so delicious!! A must stop Anytime you visit Vegas or if you live there.
You must try the mango soju here.....it's all I wanted! The food was amazing too! Fresh and the service was awesome. I am so glad I tried this place out! Thanks fellow yelpers!!

Food here is awesome.

Flavor is unique and so many great rolls.

A lot of funny named rolls, but a lot are a must try.

Great little place for ayce sushi.

Big easy roll is amazing, the spicy Ponzu sauce is super good. There are a lot of unique appetizers. Beef tataki, golden scallop, garlic edamame. Many more.

A must visit if you go to Las Vegas.

The boyfriend and I love coming here!  One of our go-to sushi restaurants for date night, which we were long overdue that last night was the night.  

The moment we walked in (no reservations) we were immediately greeted and saw the place packed that we waited less than 5 minutes.  The host apologized for the wait then finally sat us at a booth. 

What I love about this place is how every server is on top of it!  I would forget the water was instantly refilled or how a finished plate disappeared from sight. 

My favorite sushi rolls are the no-rice rolls like 'fresh men' or 'Johnny roll'! It's fresh and refreshing, and makes you feel like you didn't overdo it. A different spin to sushi! 

Boyfriend's review (his two cents): it's live,  it's festive,  it's fun! Most sushi places are quiet and this place is always lively.  The food is great and service is great, bruh! (He insisted I added the word "bruh" on his behalf)

First time here. Great variety of sushi rolls! Good quality fish! Service was decent but not the best!  They were out of ice cream which was a let down. But great go to place for AYCE. I would return again! Get ready to be so full you can barely walk!
