Absolutely love this place every time we come. Never disappointed. Love the remodeled one on Decatur and the other on Ft. Apache.
The two extra spicy rolls were great! Amazing service, no wait for a roll, nor for them to clean up the dirty plates. I really enjoyed the Nuclear and mussels. If in the area I would try again!
I love coming to sushi bar, is the one of the few restaurants that I recommend to my friends.

Best sushi restaurant I've been in! I'm absolutely floored that it isn't busier. Everything is made to order and absolutely fresh. Very courteous servers and delicious food. We were visiting from New York but this will definitely be a stop on any future trips to Las Vegas.
Love this place! Great sushi, reasonable prices, clean, attentive staff and cool music. What more could you want?
the best all you can eat sushi spot. my fam n i literally order like half the menu, with just my sister and I lol I have to say everything is good!
Found this hidden gem from a friend.  I'm kind of a sushi snob.. but I loved it!  Everything is great. Especially "Fresh men".  Service is excellent.  GREAT SUSHI!

The only good thing about this restaurant was the rainbow roll and how big the cuts of fish were on the nigiri. 

All of the sushi looks good on paper but 3 out of 5 of the rolls we ordered tasted and looked exactly the same. The service was dismal and when you asked about your order you were given the same excuse you'd hear them tell other tables. We asked about ordering something else on top of what we had been waiting for and the waitress didn't even listen to us and again stated the same excuse of why we had to wait for the sushi.. We said we knew that and were just trying to put in another order.. When your order finally came, it was thrown on your table. It took an hour for smoked salmon nigiri to come to our table. 

When we got our bill we ended up finding out the waiter had calculated it wrong and instead of just bringing us the wrong calculated bill.. he voided it and charged us twice. 

We only came to this sushi place because our normal place was too busy. Never again. Big mistake.

Really fresh fish. Loved their yellowtail and super white tuna!  Cute decor and very clean place. There are larger than life self-portraits of the owner (?) mounted on the walls for your viewing pleasure.

I would frequent Sumo Sushi when Jjanga and choo choo were there just to have a good experience and the sushi was pretty good. But, not that Jjanga has opened his own sushi restaurant it is the best of both worlds, including excellent sushi and a fun atmosphere. Jjanga has the best sushi in town, it is fresh, tasty and unique rolls. 

My favorites are the superman burrito, freshmen roll, something wrong 69 and the mixed Karai has such a great flavor and spice. Their screaming orgasm is the best I have ever had. My favorite nigiri items are the garlic tuna, Cajun albacore and yuzu yellowtail. 

This place has my favorite sushi chefs, delicious sushi and a fun party atmosphere... What more could you need for a sushi meal? I am so happy for Jjanga and will continue to drive the 10+miles for the delicious food!!! Woooo Jjanga!!

.This is one of mine and my husband's favorite sushi spots. the fish is fresh and very yummy. the wait staff are very nice and prompt. We've lived here 3 years and Jjanga is high on our list of All You Can Eat sushi spots in Las Vegas. oh and the cool thing is that they have a stanp card system. For evey all you can eat you get a stamp and after you fill your card your next all you can eat is free. I highly suggest checking them out. I don't think you will regret it.

This place has really stepped up their customer service. The food has always been amazing. It was customer service that was holding them back form a 5 star. So long as hey keep up the pace and friendliness, this place will thrive. If you are at the bar, sit with Choo Choo, aka the Asian Sushi Super Hero. He's entertaining, and his creations are delicious..

Yummy and clean, staff was friendly and we always come here. All you can eat is worth it. Fish is fresh and everything is great. They also have 10% off if you post a review so it's totally worth it. 

Love the dynamite, uni, and all the rolls

This place hits on all cylinders! The freshness and variety of fish, the atmosphere, the service, and the comfortable seating are all GREAT! 

The menu is divided into sections for appetizers, rice and no rice rolls, nigiris, baked, deep fried rolls, specials, regular rolls, etc. in other words - something for anyone!  The freshness was unreal!  

We loved the funky upbeat music they had playing. It really set the "light party" mood and everyone was happy!

The service was impeccable, fast, and super friendly. We never felt pressured, yet the food came out lightning fast. 

The booths were very comfy and added to the pleasant atmosphere. 

This is definitely a place to try when in Vegas, and it's worth the $15 taxi ride off the strip.
Cool place. Good music. Lots of good and tasty choices. I would def cone back with friends
My new favorite sushi spot. The sushi rolls were delicious. My favorite was the touch down. Service was great. The food came out very quick. I highly recommend this place.
Sushi is Amazing! Service is excellent! I'm always eating here! And the Value what can you say, nothing better in Las Vegas!!
Jjanga is now my #1 ayce in vegas.  Great food, fast service and centrally located in Vegas...

This place is amazing! The sushi is super fresh and there's so many options to choose from. The service is great, and very friendly. We had Sarah as our server, she's awesome! This is maybe the fourth ayce sushi place we've been and I can say it's in tie for first with another place nearby;). Another awesome  thing about this sushi spot is they have happy hour 11-1 on weekdays for 20 bucks which a lot of other sushi places don't offer, definitely a plus. Definitely will come back again and again.

I wish I could give this 4.5 stars. 

The food here is about 3.5 stars. The AYCE deal is pretty great; tons of special rolls and sushi, appetizers, and desserts to choose from and everything gets made pretty quickly and to your table so you don't run out of time. (You get 1 hour of ordering time for dinner, which really is quite enough if you're ordering a couple to several things at a time). I have had many items here that were delicious, almost every single roll and cut of fish has been excellent. The only roll I didn't like was the Red Rock--it has some sort of sweet-ish sauce that just didn't work for me. Unfortunately, I had to finish it or pay a la carte price for it due to AYCE rules.

It's the service here that really rocks. There are several servers roaming at all times, taking orders from everyone (which makes sense, since they don't have to keep track of prices for each table). That means it never takes more than a few seconds for an empty plate to get picked up, an empty glass to be filled, or an order for more food to be taken. Everyone is super friendly, efficient, and really obviously trying to make sure you have a good experience. That accounts for much of the high rating for me.

Been to Vegas 8 times or so and this is the best place I've been for any meal here. Fun energetic atmosphere, friendly sometimes goofy service, delicious sushi and a huge variety on the menu for those who don't necessarily want fish.   Great pop music, some American, some Japanese overhead.     Will definitely be back.

I went in for lunch 3/15/16 around 12:30. I was expecting it to be busy but I was seated right away. I had a whole booth and pretty much whole corner of the restaurant to myself. I was then given water and a menu. I opted for AYCE lunch @ $20.95. AYCE includes most apps, rolls and dessert, but all of the items listed in RED are for dinner only.  I chose the following items: 

Gyoza 
Kiss Me roll
Japanese Lasagna roll
Double D roll
Joe's Special Roll

The rolls are broken down on the menu by type. So for example all the spicy rolls are listed together, as well as the baked rolls and shrimp tempura rolls etc. My server recommended to me two rolls;  the kiss me and double d. And I chose the lasagna roll and Joe's special roll myself. Turns out 3/4 rolls I ordered had shrimp tempura in them. 

The gyoza were tasty, they came fresh and hot to the table. There was 2 per order. There was no dipping sauce that accompanied them, but instead the sauce was drizzled over the top. I would order these again. 3/5.

Next came the kiss me roll. Inside it had shrimp tempura, crab, cucumber, and on the top was avocado, spicy tuna and screaming orgasm sauce. I really liked this roll and would order again 4/5.

Double D roll had shrimp tempura and cucumber on the inside, and spicy crab, tuna, salmon and orgasm sauce. This roll was similar to the kiss me and I liked it. The orgasm sauce is different than most sauces, it's not very heavy and it's quite tasty. 4/5

Joe's special roll had shrimp tempura and cucumber inside, and tuna, avocado and spicy garlic ponzu sauce on top. I enjoyed this roll the best. The spicy ponzu sauce was a good complement to the fish. 4/5

Japanese lasagna roll is my go to roll whenever I eat sushi. It's a california roll baked with cream cheese and eel sauce on top. It's really yummy but super rich.I chose to eat this last because of the richness, and actually It turned out to be my least favorite too. 3/5

All in all, I would come back here for lunch. My waitress was sweet, the rolls came out quickly and the price can't be beat for AYCE. Also they have karaoke rooms so I think I will bring some friends and we will have sushi and sake and do some singing.

If you are craving sushi, come here! Husband got AYCE and I ordered ala carte. Love that I had that option. Sushi burrito (Monkey) was delicious. Hubby liked everything he got. Service was great. Leaving full and happy. Kitchen closes 30 minutes before closing time.
Amazing. The ambiance is great. The food is amazing. The staff is attentive, polite and helpful. And now, I'm stuffed.

Love this place.  This is one of my regular spots when I'm in Vegas...  Great quality AYCE sushi.   Great for recovering from a long night of drinking or to prepare for a long night of drinking.. 

They have great variety and the atmosphere is nice as well...

Had a late lunch here and decided to go AYE lunch.  AYE off their regular menu, the place was not crowded and service was very decent.  FIsh fresh and rice portions just right.  Hamachi, Hamachi belly, and various other specials off their menu were very tasty! Their creatively named rolls, burritos and such have such explosive flavors and present well when brought to the table.  If you are in town and looking for a dependable, filling Japanese restaurant, go to Jjanga!  Not sure how they arrived at the name, but it is a Japanese robot character from the 70's as I recall...

Lucky to have come across this AYCE sushi restaurant! 

They have very fresh fish, and lots of appetizers to choose from. It's $20.95/person for lunch till 3pm, then 25.95/person for dinner! Pretty reasonable prices for the quality of the fish & their extensive menu. 

However, out of everything I ordered, I would not recommend the cocain special sashimi and the spicy garlic edamame. 

The servers were attentive & the service was quick. Erica was our server and she was amazing!! We never had to wait for our orders to come out which was great b/c we were starvingg

Definitely recommend this place if you're looking for some AYCE sushi in Vegas.

Also you can get 10% off your bill if you write a review~

Great price! Open time has to be exactly at the right time. I am 5 min before the open time and had to wait with 2 other people. I don't see why we shouldn't be seated since no one is using any seat and all seats are cleaned. 

Price here is much cheaper than other sushi. Roll for $3 Baked salmon and avocado. Naruto is the best. The sauce is coconut or cream. Taste pretty good. Miso taste like bleach water. I don't know why. I have tasted many miso but I have never taste anything like so. After coming here tasting bleach miso I decided to try the pumpkin soup. The pumpkin soup taste like American pumpkin soup with no cream or pumpkin spice. Just pumpkin! I thought it will have something Japanese or Korean flare. No sesame. No nori or seaweed. Nothing. I want to order uni but was advice it is for dinner only, but when I looked at it I thought I can add $3 to the a l a cart price. OOOps my bad. 

Atmosphere is dimmy and pretty cook. Had a few Iron Chef pictures. Services is pretty good compare to the JJANGA on Fort Apache x Russell. That's a very confusing place. The whole place have only a few buffet and bar seats and the rest on grill and no one can seat at the grill. Waited for 15 minutes.

The best vegetarian sushi that I ate in Vegas. They little bit rude and cheap but it's ok we understand each other LOL
Thank you for the all you can eat.

So we decided come here since Goyemon ran out of
Uni. And we had to have Uni with our AYCE. 

It was completely empty! Maybe with one other party but empty with waiters pacing around. 

We pretty much tried everything on the sushi menu. It was honestly not that bad. The portions were reasonable and fish wasn't fishy at all. 

I loved the screaming o salad and I loved the yuzu yellowtail! Plus the service was attentive and fast. But maybe cause we were the only ones there...

I would come back here for AYCE. It's not the best but it's doable.

The staff, ambience and sushi are ALL on point. They've done a great job correcting what various complaints I have with all other sushi joints and have managed to simultaneously keep their prices low in comparison.

It's also very cute that they have pictures of all their chefs hanging around. How homely!

Can't say enough about this place - I recommend it to all my friends looking for fast service, good food and just a regular enjoyable meal.

I'm so sad that I went here. After reading the review I thought it would be a great experience to see if I can find a new AYCE restaurant and clearly I won't be coming back. My rule of thumb for people who are iffy on sushi is try something fried or has some cream cheese in it.... clearly this is where I went wrong. The tempura on the fried sushi tasted soggy and greasy and the sushi had so much cream cheese in it was just overpowering any fish that was in the roll. Some rolls was soo fishy I couldn't take it. Lastly, for some of the stuff we ordered to be fried, it didn't come out as hot and some tasted old. It was literally taking bites of regret each time I ate a new piece.

WOW what an EPIC meal!  Hubs and I came here for AYCE sushi dinner and had to be rolled out.  Speaking of rolls, my only regret is not being able to try ALL of them.  The rolls all sounded so good and they were so creative with naming them!  Menu items like Burning Your Ass and the Playboy Special..FUN!  We only tried 2 rolls out of maybe 100 varieties because there were only 2 of us and the rolls were about 8 pieces each.  We ordered the Cowboy Special (since there was a cowboy convention this weekend in Vegas) and the Big Easy.  I really really wish I had my AYCE sushi buffet loving family of piggies back home in Toronto with me for this so we'd be able to try EVERYTHING!  

This was definitely the BEST AYCE sushi dinner I've ever had.  Mind you I have no basis of comparison for the other AYCE sushi places in Nevada but I've probably eaten almost all of them back home in the Greater Toronto Area (there are a LOT of them there) and this one is no comparison.  The quality of the fish was excellent for an AYCE and they even had premium items on the menu like Tobiko, Uni, Amaebi, Beef Tataki, and Oysters.  Sure you were limited to 1 order (2 pieces) per person of these premium offerings but kudos for putting them on the menu in the first place.  We ate mostly off the Nigiri and Appetizer sections of the menu because of the small sizes and wanting more variety to try different things.  We also tried all of the special sashimi - all yummy!  I loved that even their simple sushi was not simple.  It wasn't simply a piece of fish slapped on top of rice.  Oh no, the fish was first perfectly seasoned, then placed on the rice (i.e. garlic tuna sushi - soooo good).  Also liked that their 1 serving portions were small so you were able to try different things.  I'm sure it wasn't easy making a dish with only 3 little baby octopuses on it.  They could have piled more on in one serving forcing you to be full on less items making it easier for the chefs.  And each item came out fresh and piping hot too.  

Almost forgot to mention they have ICE CREAM MOCHI in the dinner dessert menu!  I LOVE ice cream mochi!  Drool!  Only downside was only 1 per person :(  We tried the green tea and mango.  Both were excellent.  

Might have to drop in one more time before I leave sin city.  

Ever consider opening up one north of the border?  Please?  :)

Omg how did I finish the review without praising the amazing hospitality from the servers?!?!  A server came by every few minutes to ensure everything was OK, drinks were topped up and see if we wanted more food!  Also everything that we ordered came out exactly as ordered and fast.  This might seem like a weird comment but in AYCE sushi places in Toronto its quite common that you put in an order and it doesn't come out so you order again and all of a sudden you get double your order.  OK, this time I am done :).
Food is really really good with many varieties to choose from. Definitely be coming back!!!

Went there the other day after a day at the pool and their food hit the spot.  5 out of the 6 of us ordered AYCE and all of the food came out rather quickly which was perfect since we were all famished and rather tipsy.  The only bad thing is that I believe they overcharged us but we were all in too much of a hurry to get home and sleep to really worry about it.

Fabulous! Super quality and selection usually do not get combined with AYCE but JJANGA does it with style. Tasty, unique Japanese food and excellent service all four $26 a person. A must go but left STUFFED!
I only have 3 words to describe this place ... Cheap Delicious & Good Customer Service!!!
I love it here. Both the sushi and service is great! I definitely recommend it. Check them out!!!

Wow do they have great service! I dined at 8pm and even though it was a 30 min wait for our table, our server began serving us within ten minutes after we ordered. Our food came out plate by plate, so we had time to indulge in each inividual order. We were never sitting waiting for more food, and our server continually took our order. 

The all you can eat menu offers a lot of variety. The appetizers are unique-- grilled mackerel with dipping sauce; shrimp, pork and beef skewers, fresh oysters, and fried rice. The staples of baked mussels and shrimp tempura are also perfection! The nigiri is fresh, it has a good rice to fish ratio, and you can order pretty much any fish (I like uni, salmon belly and garlic tuna).

The servers are very knowledgeable of their menu. They offer great suggestions on which of their many rolls to order. They serve no rice rolls which are my favorite to prepare my belly for more food! I LOVE the Fresh Men Roll. 

The last thing that makes Jjanga stand out is their poke. Not many AYCE joints serve poke yet this place has four different poke/sashimi dishes! That alone makes it worth the dinner price. 

Jjanga my #1 sushi spot in Vegas!

Best sushi in town hands down. Jjanga, Koo Koo, Hickey, and Choo Choo make everything fresh and treat their guests like family. The atmosphere is very cozy and quaint. The food is out of this world. The nigiri is always fresh and the rolls are creative and scrumptious. The must haves are the salmon belly, garlic tuna and classic unagi (fresh water eel). I have been here dozens of times now each time has always lived up to expectations.

$20 for lunch AYCE sushi (mochi ice cream is an extra $2)? Excellent! $26 for dinner (mochi ice cream included).

Sushi: fresh
Staff: very attentive
Presentation of food: excellent
Restaurant ambience: clean, decorative, and looks new
Price: Excellent!

Been to Rainbow sushi, Sushi Goyemon, Sushi Mon...This one I enjoyed the most.  Sushi Loca is still my favorite but it's too far away, so JJANGA is perfect. =)

I'll start my review by saying I read an article that named Jjanga one of the best AYCE Sushi places in the world so needless to say I had HIGH expectations. It's not in the nicest part of town but that's not a big deal. On to the sushi...it was GREAT! Everything I tried was amazing with the exception of the yum yum sauce which tasted like straight up mayo egh! The reason I gave 4 stars is because the service was horrible. They would forget to bring items we ordered or they wouldn't come check on us to see if we wanted to order more. That was very frustrating, but luckily they weren't strict on the 45 minute lunch time limit. Overall great sushi with horrible service.

Okay, so as my profile shows I am a HUGE sushi fanatic, so what better way to celebrate in Vegas other than eating at an All You Can Eat Sushi joint! 

First off, customer service is a huge deal to me (isn't it to everyone?) I called to make a reservation 3 days before the actual dinner, and the hostess put me down no problem, asked if I have ever been there and if I knew how to get there, I said thank goodness for Mapquest and we were excited to try it out!

I made the group reservation for 9, and we were seated immediately, given menus, and asked for our drink order. Sake bomb time! Beer was served in a fancier cup, and the sake in the typical shot glass. 

Time to order! Unfortunately the bill was only allowed to be split four ways, (not sure why that's a rule of theres) Only complaint.
but the menu was extensive, there was SO much to choose from! I went strictly Nigiri, Salmon, Tuna and Shrimp....I ended up eating 38 pieces all together and it was delicious, fresh, and quick. The pieces are a little smaller which is a given being its AYCE, the rolls I did get to taste were just as amazing. One of the rules is you cannot share with someone who is doing Ala Carte, but we didn't mind. 

We will definitely be back. We were so happy with the food and service.

Really good place , the sushi is delicious  highly recommend. The workers are nice 
The all you can eat has A lot of chooses choices to try is affordable and delicious

All of the food was prepared with thought and tasted like Jesus. I will definitely be back to this little gem. Somewhat tucked away, and worth the stop. The Red Rock roll was surprisingly sweet and honestly grossed us out at first bite, but we ate it anyway. The Kiss of Fire and Volcano were absolutely exquisite! Plus, $3.50 sake bombs. Yes please!

Jjenga has Good food and Good service. You get ice cream for dessert. 
Waiters are nice. Lunch price: $20.95 and dinner is $ 25.95
A lot of different sushi options.

Wife and I went on a sunday night, and it was busy but we only had to wait 10 minutes for a table.  Throughout the night, I'd have to say we got some of the best service I've ever seen at a restaurant, out of any low budget burger joints through high end suit-and-tie places I've been to.  The staff, from the managers to the waitress, were all extremely attentive and eager to make us happy.  We did AYCE, and some places make you wait too long before each order, but our table was constantly being kept full of sushi.  The first order came out in less than 5 minutes.  The sushi itself was excellent, you get full rolls for each order unlike the small half-rolls that some AYCE places give.  The selection is huge and includes appetizers and dessert (included in AYCE).  My only regret is not having a bigger stomach because I got stuffed quick and want to try the whole menu!
Yum! Sushi was so good and fresh! We sat at the bar and the chef was awesome. The sushi spot to go to when we're in Vegas.

Ordered via Postmates food delivery. Been to this restaurant for sitdown meal couple times in the past. Food was always Excellant as it was this time. Apparently they have changed their menu and a couple items I tried to order are no longer offered.  Delivery was timely and direct to me in hospital room.

Everything tasted fresh and plentiful portions. Too stuffed to eat the last half a roll. Unfortunately, sushi high in so this is an option only rarely.
Love this place love food servers are friendly dinner show is entertaining and includes everyone

Amazing AYCE! Staff are wonderful, friendly and attentive. All our food came out so fast! They always nail my favorite appetizer, Dynamite. Also, the Monkey Brain roll with deep fried banana was a lovely surprise, delicious combination of flavors.

We come here quite frequently and never had any issues with the service or food. But tonight, we came in 35 mins before close. Waited 5 mins to be greeted, and was told they are closed. Wait....you guys close at 11...not 1030. The server said that last call is at 1030 for sushi. We waited 5 mins! I have never been denied service at a restaurant before. The door was still unlocked and there was still a lot of people being served. This is not customer service. I'm not sure if I will be coming back.

We used to love this place until tonight. They sat my husband and I at the sushi bar.  I have never been bumped so many times in my life. For some reason the waitresses felt that it was ok to squeeze in between my husband and I to get their rolls. I'm not just saying a few times they reached in between us at least 15 times. Then standing right behind us the manager was screaming a conversation to the sushi chefs. Then to top it off not once were we asked by the waitresses if we wanted to order anything off the menu. I couldn't take the reaching in between us so I asked for a table figuring the service would be better and the manager told us we couldn't have one of the three tables open even though they only had one group of people waiting. I couldn't believe how poorly the manager handled everything. Young...couldn't get the rest of his name should be fired as a manager.
I normally come to this place for my fall back on sushi. They have great variety and they have a good happy hour late at night.

Your ex wife, screaming organ,  spider Roll, Monkey Burrito all delicious! My server Minjee super nice with her recommendations and answering questions. If the Air Conditioning was Cooler I would rate this place 5 star but that won't stop me from frequenting this place madly

It is a pretty decent AYCE place. They do not enough server but they have very good service ! 

They have variety of sushi rolls and very funny name. 

Con: We waited for the ice cream a little bit long.

One of my favorite sushi place in Vegas I've found so far.
I've been here a total of 5 times. Today, pretty much everyone remembered me, which is nice. They are very friendly, personable, funny, but professional. The waiter and the (manager? Owner?) were very attentive, always checking on us without being overbearing, filling myself and my friends waters, sushi was fast, delicious, and fresh.

I got an order of yuzu yellowtail. It's very interesting and I love it.
My friend and I both got two rolls to ourselves (playboy special, kiss me roll, double d, and the Washington roll) one to split (tuna naruto) two special things the chefs made us, an order of the baby octopus, and two orders of mango mochi. 
Everything was delish. I left very full, but not gross full of like some other sushi places leave you feeling. They don't overload and swim their stuff in sauce and overload with rice, it's all just perfection.

This is the best place I've found so far, nothing I've ever had was bad. I love me a choo choo special! ;)

The sushi here is the best that I have ever had. I wish I could take Jjanga to Tucson with me as I will miss this place when I move next week.  Erick is a personable server and takes pride in delivering excellent service.

First off, let me say the food is quite great. But everything else, not so much. 

When we got there, the host was kind of rude and didn't even acknowledge us. He got our name, didn't tell us a wait time, and proceeded to get back on his phone. We waited for another 20-30 minutes, even though there were many open tables and a completely open sushi bar. 

The AYCE has a great selection, but the serving sizes of apps are very small. Roll sizes are normal, but no half rolls.

Overall, the food was great, the service was not.
Oh! Amazing food! Gorgeous decor! Great service! I can't say enough good things, so I'll keep it simple. This place is fabulous. Go and enjoy.
The food was ok. Service really sucked. Not sure if it was because we were in a group (6 people). Won't be coming back - at least not anytime soon.

The sushi was really good for an ayce, the nigiri to rice portion is good , the garlic tuna is one of my favorites I shall return , the only negative thing I have is that they stopped asking me if I wanted more when I told them it was my last roll it looks like they were celebrating , they have to live up to the ayce name but I'll be back
This restaurant is assome i really like here so clean and fantastic food and services

Jjanga definitely raised my expectations for AYCE sushi. It was my first time trying AYCE and I've always expected the fish to be below average quality but everything was excellent. Our server, Sarah, engaged with our party with a sense of humor and gave great recommendations since the menu was filled with various rolls and appetizers. A friend of ours is actually a vegetarian so it was nice to see that there were options for vegetarians. Great food and great service. I guess it's time to time to go hunting for AYCE sushi restaurant in LA....

I had heard that this place was good, but I wanted to try it out for myself. It's not good, it's excellent. The ingredients are fresh, the service is on it, and the food is great.

The restaurant is clean and inviting, a nice atmosphere to enjoy your meal in.

Not even hearing the Korean version of "Footloose " on the house system gave me a negative feeling.
JJ is the best person here!! Always request him!! He's funny, sexy, entertaining, and his right nipple is to die for!!! He keeps us coming back for more and more!! We love Jjanga and JJ

This location's customer service is GARBAGE!! You only see your server once, which is when they ask you what you'd like to drink. Otherwise, you'd have to flag down any server that walks by because your table will not be checked up on. The wait time for the food is RIDICULOUS! Expect to wait a long while for food. I can't even blame it on being busy either because there weren't much customers dining, probably about 4 other tables. Also, expect to repeat your orders more than once because it will be forgotten.

If you are a very patient person I would suggest this place, because although service is super slow the food is really good. Otherwise, I suggest their other location on Fort Apache.. MUCH BETTER service with much more attentive staff.

I wish we have one of those in the bay area. 

My bf is a huge fan of Sushi. This place gives you decent amount of fish for each sushi you order. And according to my bf, their fish is very fresh. 

Service is very efficient. 

Only bad thing is that we were too sleepy to eat much. How can you go eat AYCE with sleepy stomach?

I will definitely be back the next time I visit Vegas.

Really good sushi at a great price! thank you
Great service + great food = happy guest
service was so shity  the food was really bad chicken  not cooked all the way thru also they tried to charge  us for things that never came to our table  will never go back

We waited for their renovation to finish taking place and went back excitedly last week. The renovation looks great, more open feel, but as others said, new management. Hickey is no longer there, or taking a break, it was hush hush when we asked about him and if he was coming back or not. Open bar space but only two chefs working the night we were there so they could not accommodate us at the bar and we got a table. Big mistake. The table next to us put there order in when we sat down, 4 people....we got our drinks, put our order in. The parade of sushi dishes start coming out for them. We still wait.....they put in like 4 more orders, and again the parade of sushi comes to them, we're still waiting. Different servers come by to see if we need assistance and we tell them a couple times we're waiting on our order. Finally we everything at once. The quality has gone done. No passion it seems. My roll looks like it was put together by a child.  When I attempted to pick it up, the tuna on top fell off, the rice fell apart inside and outside the roll, it was a disaster. Wasn't even appetizing anymore. They've deleted some rolls from the menu as well, which I get if they're not bringing in profits.  We always get a couple orders of super white and it normally came out white, this time it was yellow in color.  Not sure if that's a quality issue or the wrong tuna, but meh.  Not to make this totally negative, the manager on duty did notice our wait and gave us 20% off, but I'm not sure we'll return. It's a drive from where we live, but we liked the "going out" factor so for convenience purposes we'll find something closer.

I came here for AYCE dinner because this restaurant averaged 5 stars after 71+/- reviews. We made a reservation for a party of 9 and was able to be seated on a very timely manner. The waiters and servers were friendly. There was also a very amusing manager or owner walking around yelling funny comments throughout the night. He definitely livened up the atmosphere. Their decor was nice too. They have these giant banners of pictures of the sushi chefs behind the bar. They're hilarious! Oh! And they also had a female sushi chef. I don't think I've ever seen one before so that was interesting. 

The sushi itself was really good. I think this is one of my new favorite spots for AYCE sushi. Amazing rice to fish proportion! Each piece of nigiri had a very small ball of loosely packed rice. I loved it!  Their special rolls were alright. I don't remember being super impressed on any of them. The appetizers were decent as well. They ran out of oyster so we couldn't try any :( 

I'm definitely coming here again. Huge fan of their nigiri! The only reason why I didn't give the full 5 stars is because we had a pretty large group of people... 2 tables... And each time they brought out a big order, they'd put it all on one plate. Most places would separate the servings into two plates so that it's easier to share amongst ourselves. We ended up taking the plates and passing it down all throughout the night. Not a big deal.. Just an inconvenience. Oh, and another thing... They completely missed our entire second round of orders. We just kept sitting there with an empty table waiting and waiting. It didn't seem too bad because I was with my chatting with my group of friends the whole time. Once we realized the food wasn't coming, we just asked them about it. They were able to put in the order quickly.

Very bad place..
They don't have good service the food is under the average..
I was dining with my girlfriend and we order all you can eat..
Because they said that we cannot order 1 all you can eat on the same table..
She don't eat row fish..
The only roll she want was 2 roll of Californians add cream cheese..
The first reaction of the server was "no we cannot do it"...
I told him that I will add money for this he went to ask the manager and the manager approved..
I end up paying 65$ for 2 California rolls..

If you come in not really hungry and you end up eating a lot more than you wanted to then the place has to be good, that's exactly what happened to me.  Let's just skip straight to the food. Going from what I took a picture first: 

Salmon Skin Handroll and Something Wrong #69 Roll - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/jjanga-japanese-restaurant-las-vegas?select=GB-a9JAvq6PMaqA4MylUbA#GB-a9JAvq6PMaqA4MylUbA 
Ever since Blue Fin Sushi turned me into a Salmon Skin Handrolls junkie I gotta have it every time I do AYCE sushi, if it's offered. It wasn't that bad; it was missing the crunchiness, but did the spot. The Something Wrong #69 was probably one of my favorite rolls. It's a shrimp tempura roll, which I usually a fan of, topped with spicy soft shell crab, tuna, salmon, white fish, and a spicy garlic ponzu. I devoured everything in that picture on my own. Sorry for not that great of a pic but the real stuff looked and tasted delicious.

Oysters - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/jjanga-japanese-restaurant-las-vegas?select=GB-a9JAvq6PMaqA4MylUbA#2sMNzctANegqVqvPkGG0lQ 
It was one of the items you could only order one of.  Honestly I love oysters but because I was only limited to 2 I don't think I had enough to like it too much. I inhaled them and don't remember the flavors.

Who's Your Ex-wife and Shrimp Tempura -  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/jjanga-japanese-restaurant-las-vegas?select=GB-a9JAvq6PMaqA4MylUbA#wyCtws-hZWHCkw_c3C1EUw 
Now the Who's Your Ex-wife is my kind of eats. I don't remember what exactly it was but I think it was a stuffed fried jalapeno with fish. I kind of wished I went back for seconds so I could've remember more but I liked it a lot cause it was spicy and delicious. The Shrimp Tempura was not bad just know that 1 order is just 2 pieces not your usual handful else where.

Spicy Garlic Edamame - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/jjanga-japanese-restaurant-las-vegas?select=GB-a9JAvq6PMaqA4MylUbA#cwzi6JqmNpr2L7IMg3KDlw
No one usually make um like this but I enjoyed them, though I didn't fill myself up on them because I was eating sushi. I'd order um.

Now for the other items:

Screaming O Sashimi - Why not!? I'm always a fan of the sauce as long as it's not too sweet. It was made right to my liking.

Nigiri - Not a great selection but I liked the garlic tuna, hamachi, cajun albacore, and sweet shrimp. Didn't care for the tamago or uni. A lot of the pieces were smaller than I'm use to but it's AYCE so ordering more is fine.

Apps - I liked the Golden Scallops and whatever I already mentioned. I ordered and really wanted the baked green mussels, agedashi tofu, and calamari rings but never got them.

Rolls - Well there's too many I liked so I'll say that there's an awesome selection of spicy, baked, deep fried, and shrimp tempura rolls. Should there ever be anything else!? Some honorable mentions Burning Your Ass roll, Fat Ass roll, Taste Like My X Girlfriend roll, Stacy Mom roll, Sexy Time roll, never mind I just started being immature.   For those try to cut back on rice there are a few no rice rolls.

The customer service was very friendly and brought food out in quickly but struggled keeping track of everyone's order. Jjanga is funny and loud great for kids. Anyways I'm still a fan for mostly everything so I'll be back.
I went for all you can eat sushi. The sushi was good. I feel like it's hard to find a good all you can eat sushi place in Vegas. You defiantly get your money's worth.

We have been here about five times and the one time we sat at a table with a larger group we were very disappointed with the service.  Other than that, sitting at the sushi bar has been great with a solid variety, good flavors and entertaining sushi chefs.  Choo Choo has been the most entertaining but Hickey gave us some great chefs specials.  Go here for the best AYCE sushi in LV but avoid the table service and hit the sushi bar.  Sorry to say, but when we had Sponge at the sushi bar she was a bit slow and not customer centered,

We always enjoy this sushi spot. My husband is one of the most critical people I know, especially when it comes to seafood, and this is his favorite place. I don't even like seafood, not even a little bit, and I come here to eat other items. I always try something different when I go, and am never disappointed. If the owner J is there he'll make some recommendations for me. Sushi isn't just about the food, but the fun experience as well. This place is has great energy and talented people putting out the sushi.

The atmosphere is great not to small not to big perfect for friend gatherings and dinners.. the yumyum sauce they have is different from other yumyum sauces I've tried it's more thick and has a great taste to it the eel sauce is awesome too.. got : rolls from here amazing nothing bad at all about this place and I think it's family owned....



They have 25.99 all you can eat sushi......I've heard of others places doin this but I guess quality of the food is top notch.....only tried sushi last year for first time In my life and been turn on ever since haven't had any bad sushi but I r only been to 4 sushi spot in Las Vegas but it's on my top 5 for sure.....
decided to check out this restaurant after hearing friends rave about it.  location is off the strip so the prices are reasonable. food tastes very good !!

Trust me, Jjanga was so good when they grand opened. I went there almost everyday. I haven't been to Jjanga for so long since they changed. When I went there for the last time, they put so much rice in the sushi, the appetizer sucked (especially dynamic), all the sushi was so bad and not fresh. I stopped going there. I was very disappointed that they began to put so much rice.. Food qualities got worse and worse,,, It was pretty good in the beginning, I admit. But anyways, I haven't been to Jjanga for so long even though I collected all the stamps. Probably would never go back anymore.

Service was kind and ambiance was standard. 

I did the  AYCE and it was a lot of food. I definitely got my money worth. However since I was there for lunch, I think my experience suffered. 

When I was dining the first sushi cooks didn't seem like the cared. After a few items, the cooks changed and so did my experience. I'll say that after the cooks changed, you'll see an uptick in my dining review. 

Amaebi: Beautiful but very bitter
Uni: Very cold and fishy tasting. Could have probably been frozen before and definitely has been out for a day or two. 
Beef Skewer: overcooked and not flavorful
Oyster: delicious. I would eat 5 more if I could but they only allow one. 
Garlic Tuna: pretty good. 
Raw Beef: cut too thick. It felt chewy but not because of the quality. 
Yuzu Albacore: Perfect. I'd eat this all day. Allow the Yuzu to cook your albacore for like a minute or two. Then dig in. Acidic, firm outer flesh but very tender with the plump rice. Seriously great. 
Salmon Nigiri: fresh and tender. Nothing special but it was a good couple bites. 
Mackerel Grilled: the ponzu sauce wasn't good to me and I think if it was just seasoned more with salt, it would be delicious. 

Overall, I'd want to eat here again if i was in town. But I'll be pigging out on nigiri the whole time.
The fish quality is good, but service is mediocre...they misheard us order edamame and the manager made an example out of the waitress.

YUM! Had a few options for vegetarians - and the Inari special (deep fried Inari with broccoli etc) was something I'd definitely go back for. Didn't get AYCE, but they had tons of great options for it. :)

Worst experience I've ever had. Because I didn't get the all-you-can-eat deal and order an individual roll I ended up waiting 20mins for my rolls while my colleagues were getting rolls after rolls by the time I got my order.  Then they automatically took 20% gratuity fee when the bill arrived.  Never before have I ever wanted to leave no tip or had to wait this long for my food.  If you come here make sure to get the all-you-can-eat or else they'll treat you like 2nd class citizen

Been here many times before! I can never get tired of it. Hands the best Garlic Tuna in Vegas
Kinda sad they took away the late night special

Love love loveeee the fried sushi rolls the offer. 
The only roll that I've tried and did not like at all was the Red Rock roll.. only because it had way too much sauce poured on it IMO. 

Depending on when you go, you could be waiting a while. I went for dinner on a Sunday night and waited about 15 minutes for a table for 2.. another couple walked in a few minutes after we arrived and weren't seated until we were getting ready to pay and leave. During the week is a bit less crowded.

Prices are not bad either.. Would recommend AYCE if you're hungry, but 3 rolls split between 2 was enough for me.

Great place!!!!!! We came on late got a couple dishes we wanted and then they just started bring us stuff and it was amazing.  So after that we just told them to bring us whatever they wanted to make cuz all the food was 5 star.

This place is spacious and the decor is pretty cool. This place also has karaoke rooms! Yassss. I have yet to plan something with the crew though.

Customer service has been great every time I've been here (which has been about 4 times so far, I think). Everyone's on point when it comes to clearing off empty plates & rolls come out quick so no complaints there.

On the AYCE, everything's categorized so that's great too. Just wish that the appetizer portions were bigger (i.e. that Agedashi tofu is delicious but I gotta order like 3 at a time for myself).

This location isn't too far from the Strip either and I think it's a convenient location cuz I drive from the NW side.

All in all... Love the garlic tuna. Love the fast customer service. Love the variety of rolls, appetizers, etc. I am now a regular!

We tried this place because Sushi Kaya was so packed and we were very disappointed. A server named Sarah? Was very rude!! The food was decent. The best was lasagna & volcano... everything else... eh. The bathroom was horrid. Disgusting. The biggest upset was it was my birthday and the first menu Sarah? Hands me is a drink menu and when I go to order Sake they don't have alcohol... uhm I'm pretty sure that if you don't serve alcohol you don't hand a drink menu.. I won't return ever... thanks but no thanks..
Food was good! Lots of appetizers, rolls, and nigiri to choose from; however Sushi-Mon (similar restaurant) is better. If you like your experience here I would recommend that you try Sushi-Mon

This place is amazing my absolute favorite place! Service is pretty good and atmosphere is nice! I have yet to have a roll I didn't like and I don't usually like the really raw ones but this place makes them all so good love the red rock roll

I would say this place is one of my top three AYCE sushi joints in Vegas. Their uni was the best quality of all the AYCE places I've been to. Other favorites include fresh oysters, yuzu yellowtail, dynamite, & fat sweet shrimp. I pigged out mostly on nigiri and the appetizers. I was full so I didn't get to the sashimi and poke section. I rarely do rolls so I can't comment on that.

Service was very attentive. I think we ordered too much in the beginning because the waiter stopped us and said why don't you start with that? Haha. It wasn't even that much! We had another guy helping us toward the end who was a lot friendlier.

Our food kept on coming and our waters were constantly refilled. I was constantly eating. No breaks! The minor thing that was missing from my usual AYCE sushi favorites - I didn't see white tuna on their menu. Maybe they had it but I didn't ask for it. I was full at that point so it wasn't a priority. The monkey burrito was not memorable. I didn't care for their beef tataki. Their dessert is not much of a selection but I'm not one to come to an AYCE sushi joint for dessert so no big deal. Just mochi and ice cream.

I'll be back to try poke and their sashimi!

Thanks fellow Yelpers for seeking this place out (it's located in a strip mall that we usually avoid).

This review is for the A La Carte menu and not the "All You Can Eat" option. We were apprehensive about the restrictions of the AYCE. Number 2 on the Restriction List states: "You will be charged A La Carte prices for Leftovers, including sushi rice". We decided not to go down that road. Plus when we do the math the A La Carte is always a better deal for the amount we are able to eat. 

If I was to compare the sushi here to another in LV, I would say the quality is at the same level as other Korean/American sushi bars like Kabuki or Sushi Samba. The interior is cute and comfortable. The Classic Cut Sushi menu options were all tasty. The Monkey Burritos was made out of Soy sushi wrappers (same stuff I buy at Whole Foods).

Pro: Crab balls, Baked Salmon Roll, fried rice, Gyoza, Cali Roll, ginkgo garlic

Cons: Bulgogi was awful ( too many onions and too much stringy fat). I had to spit out almost every bite. Kind of ironic, a Korean run sushi bar where they can't make a decent Bulgogi (one of the only Korean dishes). Sometimes the Mayo sauce they put on the baked Salmon roll is too sweet. Lastly, I hate the smell of Lysol or PineSol they use when cleaning the tables. I wish they wouldn't spray that stuff while I'm eating. The smell on chemicals ruins the dining experience. 

The guys who work here are all so very nice so that's what keeps us coming back. It's comfortable here.

My friend and I met up at JJANGA today for sushi. As I am from out of the area and didn't have any idea of places to eat, my friend recommended that we go there. The experience was definitely solid. No complaints there. The biggest surprise was the items on the menu and what they were priced at. Generally speaking, sushi rolls were $8. There was also an All You Can Eat Option for $21 (lunch) and $27 (dinner). I opted to not go this route as I wasn't super hungry, and ordered items a la carte.

The sushi seemed perfectly fine. The first thing I said when I first looked at the menu was that there had to be something wrong with the food or the price. I've never seen fancy sushi rolls for $8.

Anyways, it is a few hours later, and none of us have gotten sick. I would tell you to give this place a try!

5 stars out of 5 for having extreme value. I don't think I've seen sushi prices like these at home!

The place is bright, airy, and open. Nicely decorated. The wait staff friendly and helpful. Food was good. Service was great and the food ordered was delivered to our table in a timely manner. Rice on the sushi was not bad but I wish it was less. I will be back and I hope the food remains unchained. I have given 5 stars to some sushi places and  when I returned, food & service changed. I like this place. I will re-Assess after my next visit.
Great for those late night sushi cravings. Can't beat the prices. Best quality for all you can eat sushi

Gone very downhill!!!! 
Just left after not going for long time.  It used to be my only sushi spot but no longer. Place was dead!  Rude waitresses, all new waitresses and they lost their liquor license. Lost a repeat customer!  Will not return

An okay, fun place for an AYCE sushi joint and frankly, the price isn't that bad. This place does lack high quality seafood so if you want pure sushi, sashimi and nigiri, this is not the place. The food mostly consists of "fun" sushi rolls with hilarious names covered in sauce after sauce. Like I said, it's just okay. Gets rid of the sushi craving and for the price of AYCE, it could be worth it due to that you can try a lot of things for one fixed price of $26.

Love the fast service at this place. The waiters are always checking up on you to make sure you have been helped. The interior has not changed much (it use to be Shobu), but I like it. We did AYCE sushi & everything was delicious. 
My favorite are "I love my ass" roll & the "spring mountain" roll (no rice).

Yama Sushi on Flamingo is usually my go-to sushi place but we decided to try something different for a change. Their rolls selection is more to my liking than other places I've been but that's the only pro I can point out. They put more rice in their nigiri than I'm used to, which I'm sure is done on purpose. The fish on their nigiri was breaking apart. I also had to ask for my seafood salad order three times. We ordered it right when we got our waters and then we had to ask for it again after 15 minutes. When they finally brought it over, they only brought one so I had to order it again, which took another 15 minutes. They lack dessert options and variety but that's expected. Their service was subpar. They were nice but kind of slow. At least my water never ran low.

This place is excellent! They have a great selection of sushi and appetizers. I think I was more excited to try the appetizer than the sushi because of how big the selection was. I had three sushi rolls and they were all perfect and yummy. OMG the green tea ice cream is the best I've tried that's for sure. The only reason I didn't give them five stars is because they don't do half rolls so I didn't get to taste many of the rolls other than that Yama has competition. Oh and they do a punch card!

This is one of my favorite AYCE sushi spots but only reason for the 4 Star review is that they are not currently serving alcohol and they took the spicy tuna crispy rice off the menu. Other than that, this place serves consistently good sushi.

Hidden gem!  Some of the best sushi I've had in a long time.  Honestly, read no further and go to the restaurant, you won't be disappointed.  Here's why:

We were staying at Mandalay bay and wanted sushi but not looking at spending a lot of money.  We rented a car and I was a little nervous we would not use it but wow I was wrong.  We've used it everyday to find awesome restaurants like this one.  I was craving sushi but did not want to spend over $100 and I knew if we stayed on the strip we would.  So I found this place on yelp, I was skeptical because it was all you can eat,  it's way off the strip, in a strip mall and it appears to be in shady area of town (I'm from Chicago, what do I know).  But let me tell you this place was a lot fun!  The food, the environment, everything was great.  First, the environment was very welcoming.  My wife and I sat at the sushi bar and Choo Choo (sushi chef) was awesome! He was a ball of energy, entertaining, funny, he made the experience great!  Now the food was surprisingly super good.  The fish was super fresh, soft, the tuna melted in my mouth.  I was super impressed how fresh the fish was.  I have many food allergies and they were very accompanying, made changes to the rolls for me and gave me suggestions.  The wait service was just okay, hard to track down for the bill but the sushi chefs made up for them with there energy, enthusiasm and entertaining factor.  Lastly the price, cheapest meal of the trip, so crazy!  We opted out of the all you can eat and just ordered.  Our bill was only $38 after taxes and we had sake.  If I'm ever back in Las Vegas I will absolutely eat there and I'm going to recommend it to everyone I know.  If your looking to have fun, eat great food, and not pay a lot, then I highly suggest.  You will definitely need to take a cab or drive here but it's well worth it.

Best sushi restaurant in Vegas. Decent price and fish to rice ratio is perfect. I only eat nigiri and I love all of the nigiri options they have. The garlic tuna is amazing. A friend of mine is not a fan of nigiri, tried the garlic tuna, and it's now her favorite! Other favorites are the white tuna, salmon and yellowtail. It's my go to sushi spot. Service is also always friendly and prompt.

This is it. Done and over with. Second to none and simply the best AYCE sushi restaurant in all of Las Vegas. Service is amazing. Interior is great. Price is unbeatable. The food.....oh the food. Appetizers selection is amazing, alcohol is great at a good price. The sushi is a reason to come here every other week. From the sashimi, the nigiri to the main selections of maki (rolls), its simply cannot be beat in terms of flavor. 

Recommended roll: Something Wrong #69. This roll has been my favorite for the past 8 years and I simply praise Jjjanga for having this on their menu (used to go to another place for it until quality fell). Come here during the weekday night for it might become a bit packed during the usual high-times of the week but other than that its just worth the wait. 

Hands down Jjanga is a must for anyone who loves sushi here in the Valley and I will always come back here as my go to place for AYCE here in Vegas.
Amazing nigiri. AYCE option is amazing. If you go at night you can get the fresh water shrimp, beef nigiri and much more as part of the dinner option.

Absolutely love their quality of food! I definitely recommend this place to all my friends when they're visiting Vegas.They have a great selection of rolls, nigiri and appetizers to choose from. I always go for the ayce option and order tons of my favorite nigiri. The fish quality is great and they don't pack too much rice into each piece. Great ayce sushi for $25!

Service was great. Our server was very friendly and always checked up on us. Food was good but I wouldn't say it's the best. Too much rice was served with some of the rolls My favorite was the popcorn lobster roll, I say it's  a must try.

Planning on going to Inyo for dinner the other night, but they were closed due to kitchen appliance issues... so checked around and found jjanga near by.  

AYCE Sushi for us... seats were old and worn... and was somewhat warm in there.  Sushi and appetizers were good, but nothing really stood out.  Highlights were the shumai, escolar, spicy pork and jjanga burrito.  Lowlight was the Cowboy roll.  Never heard of seared beef on a sushi roll before... now I know why I haven't heard of it before.  

Servers were very nice, but service was a bit slow and unorganized.  Not a bad experience overall... but with so many choices in town, not sure if or when we'll be back.

This place is horrible. We normally go to sushi way on paradise and they are incredible. Came here today because our friend invited us. Our server took our drinks and disappeared and came back saying he was at lunch or something. We had to order a Diet Coke refil 3 times before anyone got us one which is crazy. Servers were changing the trash and serving plates. Sushi we ordered never came out and the servers just argued and argued. Horrible experience. Will NEVER eat here again. Horrible.

This restaurant is, hands down, the most legit AYCE sushi restaurant I've ever been to. The food was great! Fresh fish with nigiri and sashimi (YES! SASHIMI at an AYCE place) dishes; a variety of traditional and non-traditional sushi items; a great variety of hot and non-fish items; and some damn fine red bean ice cream and green tea mochi.

CHICKEN. WING.

My first time having sushi out in here in Las Vegas, and I am impressed! The quality of the fish was really good and this is being compared to an sushi I have had in Hawaii and California. I came here with group of 7, all of us AYCE, and Gia our server was very attentive, to our table and provided phenomenal customer service! She is one of the best servers I have ever had! It was real honor to have her as our server.

Unfortunately, the reason for the 3-stars is because the customer service in the last half of my group's time here was terrible. From my understanding Gia went on break, and Victoria was covering for her. With Victoria I had requested more ginger near the beginning of our time here, I never received it. We had also put in 3rd order for some muscles with Victoria, and unfortunately we waited close to 30-45 minutes to hear anything about them, when our previous first 2 orders came fast.. When we brought it up to her, we just asked her to cancel those muscles. She was polite to let us know she'll check up on those muscles, and if they were started then she'll bring them out, but if the chefs didn't start them then she would tell not to make them. I am not trying to pin everything Victoria, there was a clear misunderstanding going around. I am assuming Gia was the manager based on how smoothly things went when she was on the restaurant floor. When she left, things did not go as smoothly.

We came here on a Wednesday night, restaurant was nearly empty. If the customer service was consistently as smooth as it was when Gia was helping my group, I would have given this place 5 stars.
Belly up to the bar and enjoy great conversation and a free show. Tip tell them make what you like and enjoy the surprises

And then there's Sunday.

Got to a really late hour (~8:30ish), and I hadn't had dinner yet. This place popped into my mind, and I decided to drive out.

Got there, had to put my name on a list, and he refused to tell me how long of a wait it was at first, claiming he didn't want me to get angry if it was longer.

Hello, every other restaurant is able to do this. You're not the type of restaurant to be able to pull this.

To his benefit, he eventually did provide a time frame, and they did come in well under.

The AYCE menu was standard fare. I guess I'm spoiled locally where I live where I can just say "meh" where others might really enjoy this.

Service, once I sat down, was fine.

This restaurant is a 3.5 but the service made me decide to go for a 4 star rating! What sucked was that they're currently not serving alcohol anymore so if you're looking for some sake with your sushi, stay clear! The garlic tuna and salmon here was super good thought but what was a downer was that they put way too much rice that I took some out to eat comfortably and to enjoy the fish more. 

However the service was great. They were efficient on clearing plates and refilling our drinks. I would come again but I wish they figure out their alcohol situation.

I could have given 3 or 4 stars, however the service was HORRIBLE! We even left the table and no one noticed. Once owner came up he finally noticed, and without us saying anything, he says "Oh sorry about that?" Horrible business ethics, the waitresses faces will break if they smile or show courtesy. Will NOT be coming back!!!
Our new late night addiction! Great service and even better food. Even the music is amazing!

I have multiple friends who would recommend this place and even say this is their go to sushi spot. I mean, it's good but some areas could use improvement. 

We came on around the beginning of their dinner time (4pm). We were the only two customers for a while so we were seated right away and served our drinks. The front hostess is a little awkward. I felt like she was talking too slow and lingered around our table even after I said we needed more time to look over the menu. 

We automatically connected with this petite blonde server who served us the rest of the time we were there. She was pleasant and even made little conversation with us. She constantly checked on us  and even recommended some things for us to try. She kept forgetting our some of our orders though. I'm not sure if it's her or whoever is making them in the back that kept making the mistake. That's mainly the reason for the one star deduction. 

I would personally recommend their no rice rolls so you can save some room for other things. Rice can be overwhelming when eating AYCE so my best tip is to avoid them unless you're eating it with the Nigiri, which we got a lot of. The fishes were fresh and delicious. Ordered the salmon, yellowtail, Cajun albacore, garlic tuna Nigiri. My friend ordered a spicy tuna hand roll and a side of spicy mayo sauce and basically ate multiple of those all night. 

Overall good service. The chefs could be a little faster with our orders though considering there was no one else there. 

Also, they were fixing their lights during business hours. The lights kept going on and off which bothered me.

Will be back! I'm the food was good, everything else needed improvement.
Took them an hour to bring out our rolls. We had to consistently remind and ask them to bring our orders. Worst service .
One of favorite places to come eat sushi! Check them out. Lots of options, the wait time isn't that long, and everyone is friendly here
This place is amazing!   Best bang for your buck!  Good service and the food comes out fairly quick.

The rolls are very tasty but the service needs improvement. We sat right in front of the sushi chef but chef Sponge continues to make rolls for other orders and not ours. It is a good thing we weren't starving. I ordered the age dashi tofu from the kitchen and waited 40 mins and 3 waiters later to get the order.
We have eaten here on three different trips to Vegas and never disappointed.  Their yuzu yellowtail is the best.  Ono is great too.  Everything we tried was tops.

By far my favorite ayce sushi in vegas and even better than most in LA. The staff is friendly and quick to refill drinks and bus plates.  No for the nigiri nice slices of fish and not to much rice good fishbowl rice ratio. And just like the nigiri their Maki is very well done they don't fall apart and it isn't packed with rice like allot of other ayce places they want you to enjoy the rolls not just get you full so you leave.  Their a assortment is quite large and they have no qualms making slight adjustments to their rolls, I don't mean go over board but I came with my pregnant wife and ordered every cooked roll the had and they would omit stuff for us linking back to their friendly service.  A+++++

My fianc and I have been going to JJanga on Decatur for approximately 4 years now and we love it! What really caught us off guard was the sushi chefs and how welcoming and adaptable they were to each patron. Now we are people who like to have fun and make people laugh and it was very warming to see the chefs react to us so well and not be stiff. The servers are always attentive and quick. Super sweet staff and they seem to coordinate well! Now the food is one of the reasons why we refuse to go to any other place. My fianc loves all their rolls that have to do with cream cheese, especially their Baked Lobster Roll and their Popcorn Lobster Roll. I'm a sucker for their Cowboy Roll, which I usually start off with because the flavor is so intense so its a good starter roll rather than finisher. Then I usually follow with a Tuna Naruto because I love the mild sweetness of the crab paired with the cool cucumber wrapping, super refreshing! My favorite meal finisher would be the green tea mochi, I can't get enough of that little ball of cold deliciousness. My favorite appetizer would have to be the Udon Noodles and Miso Soup, always hot and fresh. The Udon Noodles have such a tantalizing flavor that always leaves me wanting more, they are so awesome. The Miso Soup feels like its preparing my stomach for the awesome rolls to come, it really puts me into a good mood haha. The pricing is fair and we are always willing to drop a pretty penny on this place! We love you, JJanga!
If I could give the serves less then one star I would the lady laughed at me when I asked her if they had a teriyaki roll, the rudest I've ever been treated at a sushi place! Never coming back

Seriously a gem of las Vegas.  

Skip the buffets one night and come here if you're looking for an excellent sushi place, let alone an ayce one at that.  Even being from los Angeles, a place with probably as much sushi places than Japan, this place beats most if not all.  Jjanga is definitely better than ka.  

Recommendation's:

Salmon nigiri
Surfclam nigiri
Something wrong #69
Candy cane
Golden scallop

$26 for all you can eat RICE? ---Cool. Not! 

Get the heck out of here with all of that rice you try to stuff wherever you can. 

I can no longer recommend Jjanga as a solid spot for AYCE sushi. Their quality and credibility has gone down. Waaay down. They used to be decent but, man, I was utterly disgusted on our recent visit. 

- Their AYCE (all rice) nigiri are soaked in an offensive chemical tasting "yuzu" flavor
- Their (rice) rolls are literally all rice and a dot of imitation crab with a paper thin sliver of dried out salmon
- Watery-bland-miso-soup
- Sinewy, dried out, paper thin fish
- Skimpier than a mofo "special sashimi" poke salads, that all have questionable, stringy, bad cuts of fish
- Oh, they also don't do half sized rolls so be prepared to Tetris the shit out of your food

No can do. This is not the spot for AYCE sushi or value. They are drastically inconsistent, which is why I am confidant in awarding them with a 1 star review and never plan on returning.

Pro tip: Try Sakana on Maryland Pkwy, Las Vegas - they don't skimp on their rolls or their nigiri (plus their yuzu actually tastes good)

Went here last week for the first time. Sushi quality was very good. I'm a nigiri lover and that's pretty much all i order, but since I went with family I tried some rolls that were delicious. You can't beat the price for AYCE. 

Service was great for them to be a little busy that evening. My water cup was always refilled and everyone was friendly. I'm giving 4 stars because I noticed that they were a little confused with table numbers when they were running the food to our table and others.
Very fast service. Rolls are really good. Great looking environment. Clean. Nice employees.

This is my new AYCE spot ever since Sushi Doh closed in chinatown. I like that the variety in rolls, sashimi, and appetizers here always keep you coming back to try something new. The quality of the fish and flavors are also good enough to come back for the same old favorites. Immediately upon coming in you are greeted by a welcoming crowd, but aside from the friendly servers the chefs and kitchen staff are quick and efficient! You never have to wait long to be fed here. The atmosphere is spacious, clean, and well-decorated.

They also have a fully functioning karaoke room here but I did not partake so I can't speak on that. Maybe next time. Will definitely be back!

TIP: You can receive 10% off your total check with a Yelp review!

Amazingly fast and great quality, best quality food and service. I can not explain how crazy good this place is. The service is awesome. Get all you can eat, or a la carte... make sure you eat everything. It

I absolutely love Jjanga!!! My husband and I drive all the way across town just to go have sushi here. The restaurant atmosphere is really upbeat and the owner Jjanga is really nice. The staff is very friendly and they have really unique rolls. Great place for lunch or dinner!

Good selection of rolls and sushi, with some cool creative twists. I liked my monkey burrito quite a bit, the unagi donburi was a little over-sauced but tasty. The food was overall pretty decent, but not super high-quality. 

The all-you-can-eat vs a la carte menu was confusing, but our waiter helped to explain it. He also forgot one of my rolls, and someone kept trying to bring me a roll I hadn't ordered. Overall the staff seemed hurried, and there was quite a bit of shouting. It fit right in with the loud dance music and loud conversations. It was 8pm on a Sunday, but they were pretty busy, and we had to wait 20-30 minutes for a table. 

Overall, I've had worse, but I've also had better. Okay for a fun group evening, but certainly not a relaxed dinner for two.

I've been to both the hibachi side of the restaurant and also just the normal dining side. 

Id give the hibachi side a solid 3.5/5. It's definitely a novelty, and it's also a hit or miss depending on who you get as a chef. Some of the chefs are really entertaining and some are there to just make your food. The food itself is decent. They use lots, and I mean lots, of butter and garlic. Everything tastes better with both of these things so the food really is impossible to be bad. 

The dining side is a 5/5. The servers are attentive but not overbearing. Their sushi specials are a great price! They have 3 rolls for $25 bucks, which is plenty for two people. And according to my friend, their Saba is the best she's ever had. 

I'll definitely come here again for normal dining!

Came here tonight only because our regular spot Goyemon had a long wait (as they often do). I noticed the score on yelp and we were very pleasantly surprised. Staff was friendly, our sushi chef Hickey was quite entertaining. After ordering my first 2 items and noticing I'm a fan of spicy tuna, he then made me a special spicy tuna poke which was delicious. He also later made us an interesting tuna carpaccio type situation which again was quite tasty. Overall I was quite impressed. Particularly with the quality of their fish which I actually favored over my old favorite. I will be going back. 
The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because the Ecstasy Roll at Goyemon is my favorite roll anywhere & they had nothing comparable. That said, there was not one thing we ordered we did not like.

READ BEFORE YOU CAME!!! My friend introduce this place for me and I  gave it a try( usually I eat at Sakana). It was slow on Wednesday so the servers and the chefs were so chill. They chatted and ignored us for a while. The worst point was when I called uni nigiri. It was bitter and rotten so I had to spit it out immediately!!! They even didn't say sorry when I told them! " Don't worry about it!" That's all I got from eating rotten uni! Never again!!!

Jjanga has been a friend for a long time. He is hilarious and keeps you entertained. His sushi restaurant is clean, hip, and has a nice vibe to it. The chefs are very talented; the food presentation is amazing!! It's a must try.

My experience here was nothing short of fantastic! I don't have a single bad thing to say. From the second I walked in, to the minute I left, my dinner date and I had excellent customer service, delicious food, and we enjoyed the fun music and ambiance. Let me highlight my favorite parts:

Our server was so helpful, especially because we did the all you can eat for $26.
He suggested his favorites and also asked us what we liked so he could make suggestions off that. He was personable and funny, never making us feel rushed even though he was really busy! 

Everyone working there was working together. Our table got bussed by multiple people, our drinks always stayed full, and we never had to wait to order more.... And everyone was smiling! 

The sushi was fantastic, all made to order. 

Did I mention the all-you-can-eat sushi is $26 at dinner?! :D 

The variety on the all you can eat menu is epic! I didn't feel like I was missing out on anything by not ordering a la cart. 

What more to say? It was great, and I will most definitely be back!

one of the worst restaurants ive ever visited! we were 3 adults and 3 kids under 4, came around 4pm, the place was empty but somehow the hostess made us wait 20min to get sited. once we got a table i noticed it was sticky, the service was not so good, i felt like they were mad at us coming with small children. at some point my kid dropped my car keys behind the banch and i used my phone plashlight to look for them, the sight was not pretty!! it was so dirty and dusty i dont think anyone ever cleaned there!!
will never come back!!!

What immediately sets Jjanga apart is the tasteful and spacious interiors which oddly transitions to the Iron Chef like posters at the sushi bar, quite quirky.  This would be a good spot for group dates and families.  It was the first time I went into a restaurant that had a pirate chest with complimentary toys for kids.  How sweet!  This grown up joint definitely caters to the little one's needs, complete with a panda face bento box and st. Patrick's day green utensils.  The service is also very accommodating and friendly.

The food was great, but we did experience a discrepancy between sushi orders.  Some were cut beautifully and some were kinda butchered (I didn't take photos of our salmon nigiri and the follow up orders because they looked bad).  There were 2 sushi chefs at the counter that day and I'm not sure if the bad ones all came from 1 guy, but I do hope when you eat here you don't experience this.  We were bummed that super white tuna sushi isn't available on a regular basis but their fish cuts were substantial in ratio to the rice and quite fresh.  The rolls are large and you cannot order half rolls, but the rice doesn't drown out the other ingredients.  Their bbq chiken appetizer was very tender and tasty and the other item that we thoroughly enjoyed was the Freshmen no rice roll.  It had tuna, salmon, avocado and crab wrapped in rice paper and drizzled with a ginger sauce.  It was very light and refreshing!  Even my husband really loved this!  This is something I haven't seen anywhere yet and it was lovely.  

It is a tall order to be pitched against Goyemon, Sushi Koma, Blue Fin and the many AYCE sushi options in vegas and I'm not quite sure if their nigiri necessarily equals in quality, but the vibe of the place, the friendly service and the inventiveness of their menu definitely warrants a visit.  I will be rooting for this place to keep up the good work.

I can best describe this place as the "Cheers" of Japanese Restaurants in Vegas! Make this place a regular stop on your eating out and you will soon not need to order.   I am not a big sushi fan but the menu provides a lot of options for those of us no fish guys.

It was our second time to visit  Jjanga's, first time we came was because of the recommendation of our son to come here as the first time have a good impression and believed that Jjanga's cuisine reigned supreme in AYCE sushi. 
The ambiance is casual and trendy with their hanging banner pictures depicting the 4 iron chefs of sushi in their own right! 
What more can you ask for- being served by courteous staff and the sushi Chef's are fun to deal with- they always smile and are attentive to every order and gives us the freshest and mouthwatering sushi and Japanese cuisine.
Love everything about Jjanga- will always patronize and recommend his place it's definitely the bestest in town!!!:)
More power, Jjanga- you are the man! To you and your team kudos!
Jjanga Sushi = Best in town. Great environment and amazing chefs. Every roll is A++. Ask for the Choo Choo special.

Ok so there was a large group of us and my turn to pick so we got to go to the new sushi place in town! The biggest part of dining out for me is the experience, it can make or break a night out! This place is top for service, multiple servers bring you your food as it's ready, fill your drinks and keep you satisfied. Jjanga himself was comedy entertainment, even entertaining the one kid with us between the treasure chest, light up toys and verbal and nonverbal jokes! 
The quality of the rolls, appetizers, soup and everything Inbetween was great! I can't even say what my fave was as we lost track as we all just kept ordering and tasting! They have great tuna poki! Great flavor and freshness! The appetizer selections were huge, I didn't have any but I know the crab balls were a hit at the table! The 6 no rice rolls were the favorites with the tuna one (forgot the name) and the fresh man rolls being top! The 69 tempura roll and the jackpot were also big hits! Great flavor popping in them all and nobody complained.... We must have ordered at least 25 things between all of us! 
The mochi was great with the mango being my fave but chocolate and strawberry were hits! 
I know we will be back... Jjanga knows we want tshirts and he is ok with us being corny and playing Jenga sushi at Jjanga! Oh and don't forget your frequent buyer card! The 10th is free!

Great food and fun atmosphere.

I been here two times already and I really like it. My brother (who is a die hard sushi connoisseur) was the one who introduced me to fine place. 

Overall:
The atmosphere is urban and casual.
