The staff is very friendly and they always make sure that you're being taken cared of (making sure they keep your drinks filled and you ACYE orders are taken and fulfilled). Jjanga has a unique All You Can Eat menu; which rangers from "no rice sushi rolls" to their bacon roll. One of my favorite items is their pumpkin soup; it's super creamy and delicately sweet. Their dessert menu is simple: ice cream and mochi. It's a great place for groups. My older brother had his birthday dinner in their private room and it hosted 20 or so guests. 

If you're looking for a fun and new sushi joint that's not the typical and cookie cutter go to Jjanga.

THE ABSOLUTE WORST LOW GRADE SUSHI AND SERVICE IN  ALL OF CLARK COUNTY!! This place failed on all levels!! Don't believe any of the positive reviews on this sushi place, they must be fluffing them. Food? FAIL! service? MAJOR MAJOR FAIL!! Ambiance? FAIL! Place is awful! The sushi is low grade garbage when you even get it. They totally ignored our table! I am not even kidding, my daughter never even got her food in 52 minutes and we asked them 5 times and every time it was, "don't worry" what does that even mean? She only ordered Ikura and Masago. The plates came out one at a time every 15 to 20 minutes. Omg! They must be manipulating the reviews Yelpers! My wife and I are sushi snobs and we figured we would check it out because of the reviews on yelp, boy were we disappointed! YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!! This was the first time in my 49 years of eating that I did not even tip 1cent, as a matter of fact, I honestly feel the server owes me money! I repeat... ***The absolute worst*** don't waste your time or money on this failure!

The music selection is just one reason to love this place. After searching yelp for AYCE sushi restaurants that included screaming orgasm (dinner price only and worth it) last year, we have made the 25 minute drive four times now. It is totally worth it.

The staff is very friendly and attentive from the minute you walk in to the minute you leave. The food is delicious. The special sashimi items are only at the dinner price, so pay extra if you like those. 

Yuzu yellowtail is the best.

This is one place where you will want a full punch card!
Loved the service & all the quality sushi, appetizer! I can't remember everything I ordered but I highly suggest picking random things!! Be adventurous :)
This is my second time came eat, it's the best all you can eat sushi place i ever had in vegas. Will come again.

JJanga's AYCE menu doesn't disappoint. So many choices from Nigiri, sashimi, shrimp tempura rolls, spicy rolls, baked rolls, deep fried rolls, and even vegetable rolls. You can't forget the array of delicious appetizers from scallops, calamari, soups, salads, baked mussels, and heck even a spicy chicken wing if you want. 

I'm not a big fan of completely raw sushi but the must try rolls are definitely "taste like my ex girlfriend, Cali on top, and the play boy special. Delicious. 

The location was recently remodeled and looks great. Staff is friendly but expect a wait on Fri/Sat for dinner. It was voted #1 sushi place so it draws a big crowd. 

Love this place!

JJanga might be the most fun I've ever had at a sushi bar. We sat at the bar and were entertained all night by the sushi chefs and even some of the wait staff. It came pretty highly recommended and it didn't disappoint. My friend and I ordered a wide assortment of nigiri and specialty rolls, and like at any restaurant, loved a lot of it and had a few things we didn't love. Overall, the quality was great, creativity was fantastic, and the ambiance was fun and energetic. And if you're not too full, try the mango mochi, which is excellent.

Servers and chefs are super nice and the hosts are very friendly.  Food is amazing and they serve imported Japanese beer and sake, which is fun to try and delicious. The all you can eat is very worth the price if you're hungry and there are quite a few vegan and vegetarian options on the menu. Only four stars because sometimes the service is a little slow and they'll occasionally forget things. Check them out on Facebook and you can win free food. Great place and I suggest everyone try it.

I honestly love this sushi place! great sushi & staff! it's always been a fun experience going here because the managers are just so nice. 

my nigiri favs include: garlic tuna, super white tuna, yellowtail, sweet shrimp, salmon belly...I could eat those all day long! 

my fav rolls: volcano & something wrong #69...I'm pretty sure I have more but can't remember the names off the top of my head. 

one thing that I really like is that you're able to make reservations, which is NOT common for ayce sushi places, really great for large parties

The food was ok but the service was horrible! We went there for the All-you-can-eat, we got seated promptly but our server barely talked to us. As we were ordering he would just jot it down not say a word and walk away. Other people kept coming to take our empty plates away but no one ever asked how we were doing or if we needed anything else. We were obviously ready for round two as we sat there staring at them as they passed by and ignored us for about 5 mins, finally I decided to flag our server down so we can order more. He stood there and jotted our order again, never once did he apologize or smile. Best advice i can give here is hire someone with somewhat of a personality because the robot of a person that helped us was just horrible. I feel bad for writing this review but I think customer service is the key to the success of all businesses.
Servers were really nice and and accommodating. The service was a little slow but the quality of the food made up for it

Vegas can never have too many all-you-can-eat sushi restaurants in my opinion. I love stuffing my face with all the sushi and rolls that I can muster. For $25.95, it's totally worth it. After trying a bunch of items, I'd have to say that their nigiri is better than their rolls. The unagi was the highlight of the meal for me. With its crispy charred edges giving way to a mildly sweet tender and meaty body, this fresh water eel was the best I've had at any AYCE spot. Other solid options were the tuna, halibut, yellowtail and red snapper. On the flip side, I wasn't crazy about the beef tataki nigiri because it was too rare and fatty than I would have liked.

My favorite roll was the tuna naruto (tuna, salmon, white fish, and crab wrapped in cucumber). I also tried the Hawaiian roll and Joe's special roll but both had too much sauce, either masking the taste of the fish or rendering the rice mushy and causing the roll to fall apart.

Other items tried were the gyoza and chicken katsu. Both were satisfying.

Food came out unusually fast, so I'll have to request them to pace it out more next time. Service was exceptional as they stopped by often to take additional orders, refilled water glasses, and inquired about our food.

3.5 Stars

Went here with a party of six friends after a long day of an escape room. Someone recommended Jjanga, and glad we went. Good food, great service (from server Jina and everyone who served us in general), no wait on a weekday night. Don't recommend the uni, however the other items we ordered were good considering AYCE standards. Would return.

Everyone is so nice and the food is amazing. The chef really suggests amazing items that I wouldn't think to order. This is the kind of place where the menu is optional, you could sit at the bar and just take whatever you're given and it'll be great.

This is one of the best sushi and appetizer restaurants in town. We've been too many of them, and this Compares with the best. Fantastic! The only problem for us was the only had one guy behind the counter when we first got here, so the service will slow, but they said that wouldn't count toward any time of all you can eat. Beyond that, the service was very attentive and excellent.
Amazing AYCE place! We've been here three times in the last six months! They always take care of us, and the fish is incredibly fresh! The best part: they are open late!

My birthday week ended with AYCE sushi! What more can a newly 23 year old ask for?

The ambiance at JJANGA is probably the best I've seen with the sushi joints I've been to. The wooden walls and cute couches were a nice touch. The decor made me feel like I wasn't in Vegas anymore. 

Before I get into the food. I highly highly highly recommend everyone get the grapefruit sake ($10 for the large). It is the best thing I've ever had in my life! Our server, Scott (might've been the manager), recommended it. He even took a shot with us. After I told him we were there for my birthday, he brought out another large grapefruit sake.. On the house! Thank You Scott!! 

The items that really made me want to try this place were the "riceless" rolls and the burritos. Started with the Johnny Riceless roll! Oh my goodness it was so delicious. Then the Monkey burrito came out and I almost died and went to sushi heaven. Besides the Grapefruit Sake, that's another "you must try".

Everything else was really good. I honestly can't go through all the different rolls we ordered. There were to many. & to be quite honest it was all a blur, once the food came out I didn't think about anything but how I'm  going to fit everything in my belly. What is pictured isn't even half of what we had ordered. 

This place is very kid friendly. They even have a "treasure chest" in the front for the little kids to choose a toy. Probably was put there to shut the crying kids up so the adults can eat. \_(?)_/ 

There are Karaoke private rooms that you can go in for $20. We peaked inside and it's pretty darn cool. We can UYE in there! Rent all the rooms out! who's with me?! Lol

If you are looking for AYCE sushi, fast with a bit of entertainment involved then this is your place.

You walk in and from start to finish it is on blast.  I myself not fan, it is too loud and too in your face.  But for the younger crowd and none caring sushi fans Go for it! 

You walk in (we are sushi bar fans) and we felt a little accosted.  We are kind of attacked with food, we are just being handed plates and rolls randomly and can finally add our  choices to the mix.  I/we like to sit at the bar and choose our pieces selectively accordingly to our bar chef.  Well this is a AYCE and the food is great and fast and really fun.  

I am giving the 4 stars on the AYCE scale not a high end sushi restaurant.

Omfg, one word.... Amazeballs! Altho, might be a wrong word for a food critique but i dont care. Absolutely great service! Food was delicious! The price is ridiculous! Tip: if you only eat like 4 or less cut rolls, i recommend single order instead of AYCE (only if you order simple sushi, ex. Spicy tuna, spicy salmom, salmon skin, etc). I have found a new home for my tummy's sushi cravings!!! Kid friendly, clean, casual to romantic ambiance and easy to read & understan

1/16/16 update:
Food was great, friendly staff but tonight they are not on point... Waited 15mins after we ordered, orders were confused taken to wrong tables... We had ayce sushi and there is a 10-15 mins wait between the orders. And they get upset when I tried to order 2 at a time... Well, i dont want to wait 15mins for next sushi. Im grown girl, I know how much I can consume! Disappointed this time around. Dock 2 pts for service.

I went there with two friends. We all enjoyed it very much. Lots of selections for all you can eat. The fish quality is great, sushis are delicious, and the service was excellent. I definitely recommend this restaurant. As a matter of fact, I plan to go back this weekend with my nephew and my niece.

This JJANGA location has a cool rustic interior. The space is cozy but nice. If you haven't taken cue from the name, this place is Korean. Which is why you'll see Korean fare like bulgogi on their list of side dishes. Daebak! 

Went here for AYCE and tried their yummy beef steak side dish and the grilled pike mackerel. I don't usually bother with a lot of side dishes when getting AYCE sushi but I couldn't resist and they were worth it. On the other hand, the nigiri sushi could've had better fish to rice ratio. I thought the fish seemed pretty tasty after you get past all the rice but I had serious doubts about the uni quality. The uni I'm used to is golden and sweet. The uni I had at JJANGA was kinda gray and on the bitter side. 

This place probably kills it with their rolls but I prefer nigiri and avoid the sauce and rice-laden dishes. They also charged for iced green tea. Tea is usually free in the better sushi places I've visited.

This place is my favorite sushi restaurant in this country.  The fish is always delicious and they have great special sashimi that isn't on the menu.  Sit at the sushi bar and talk to the chefs and you will have a fun time in addition to the amazing food.  

Definitely get the baby octopus.

It's impressive. How do they know what my x girlfriend tastes like?  We are die hard sushi lovers. We are picky and expect excellence. This measured up. Excellent service, excellent fish quality and fast service. We will be back! Truly excellent. And the double D(name of roll) is certainly a mouth full! The Tastes Like My X Girlfriend roll rocks. Great place. We are way over $26 each in sushi we ate. Awesome!!

Thank you Jjanga crew, you deserved the five star and I can see why they hold a 4.5 on Yelp!
AYCE is a good value at $20.  There is a large menu with plenty to choose from the eel was delicious & the service was quick and excellent!
One of my favorite sushi places in Las Vegas!! Such a reasonable price and great, attentive service!!

Well color me disappointed :-/  friends and family came in from out of town and this is the place I present to them, go ahead and take away my sushi whore status. They weren't really disappointed but we all were drinking and enjoying each other company so the food really wasn't a focus. They were on a budget so the happy hour AYCE for $20 was a saving grace :-) only 2 out of the 6 people did AYCE. The ones that didn't did get a kick out of the low price of the rolls, but with those low prices corners will be cut. 

The sushi was little rice and paper thin cut fish. I wasn't hungry so I just had a Joe's Special roll which sounded better than it actually was. The garlic sauce tasted like burnt garlic. The tuna was low quality and very thin. I also had a Philadelphia roll, not sure why I ordered it but I did. There is a reason the cost was $3, don't expect much more than a couple grains of rice and a sliver of salmon, with a nice chunk of cream cheese :-/ yuck! My two rolls plus tax and gratuity came out to $14. I'm not breaking the bank at all with that meal but I can still think of others places I rather eat for that amount. 

The services was hit and miss, the new guy was very nice and helpful. He had zero clue what was going on but he ran to find out. I like that :-) I don't expect people to have all the answers but I do expect them to make a effort to find out. The seasoned pro that came to answer of question was lacking in the personality department. My cousin was placing her order with him and asked to keep out cucumber from her roll. He snapped back with a, well then you want a "blah blah roll then!" Sir, I don't know your damn menu! Don't snap at a customer and make us feel like we need to be better versed with your menu! At least the newbie dude chipper go get 'em personality won us all over.  

I'm tempted to put this place at a 2 star but the prices reflect the quality so I'm keeping the 3 stars. I'm cool with never returning to this place. I rather spend more for sushi that puts a silly grin on my face :-) Just like everything else in my life, it's quality over quantity.

Jjanga is by the far our favorite Sushi place. The best all you can eat menu, the price is reasonable and they are open for lunch. The food is good and the waitstaff is nice and friendly. Totally recommend it to everyone!

I tried Jjanga for the first time and I was impressed. Their nigiri was fresh and flavorful, their portions are generous too. As far as rolls go, I highly recommend trying their Coco Shrimp or Handjob rolls!!! I loved the toasted coconut on the coco shrimp roll. Their Japanese lasagna is one of the best I've had so far. I'm already planning what I'll try next time I'm there! I'm thinking of ordering sashimi from the a la carte menu. The service was attentive and fast as well!

Awesome place to go for AYCE sushi. It's never too busy so I never have to wait. The yuzu yellowtail is a must get. I probably get about 10 orders of these every time. It's yellowtail nigri with this yuzu salsa on top. They have a huge selection of appetizers you can choose from as well for AYCE. The fish portions are decent size while the rice in minimal. You also get a stamp card so every 10th meal here is free. Service here is always on point. The wait staff continuously walks around making sure you have everything you need
Have a very good food, and Kevin is a very nice person also in side service is very good too.

A coworker of mine introduced me to this place. I have been four or five times now and have yet to have a bad experience. Everything is flavorful, fresh and the chefs are all fun people. I've gone in by myself twice between job shifts, and they make it seem like you're not eating alone which I love. The rolls are delicious and I even had a few of their grapefruit sake which is also really good. Haven't been in awhile but I can't wait to go back.

It's hard to believe a 5 star review. I questioned the validity of some reviews (people who only have 2 or 3 other reviews). But I can honestly say this place deserves 5 stars. The AYCE was one of the best (sushi category) that I've had. Far better than any I've had in San Diego (my hometown). And their AYCE menu is huge: nigiri, appetizers, sushi, sashimi, and even desserts! The sushi quality was good and their rolls were very flavorful and unique (not to mention most of them having phallic names). 

And, as a group, we all thought the biggest reason this place deserves 5 stars (besides the awesome food) is because of the service. JJ, one of the servers there, was the coolest and funniest. He have the best recommendations, made us laugh, and just made the experience that much better. The owner was also pretty cool, hooking us up with mochi and a few other things here and there. We will definitely be visiting this place the next time in Vegas.
Jjanga  is very good food great sushi beautiful company. You must try if your in the area.

I actually haven't been here since their remodel about 3 months ago. The place feels much more homey and welcoming. The food menu also simplified a bit making choices easier. The fish is very fresh and full of flavor, I enjoyed everything from their yellowtail to their sea urchin. The appetizers were also to die for, I personally loved their dynamite and vegetable tempura. 
My only regret is not trying any rolls tonight, but I definitely had my fill of everything else. ANDY and SUNNY took real good care of us as our sushi chefs. 

I definitely recommend the sushi bar for seating if it is a small party. They haven't lost their touch making two hungry guests feel welcome!
Definitely will come again!!
Amazing and yummy sushi and great prices. Rolls start around $4 for 8 pieces, we bought four and it filled up the both of us. Great dinner or lunch date for under $25 !!! So yummy !!

Mind blown!!!! The all you can eat sushi is incredible. They don't overload on rice and the service was FAST!! Literally had 4 people taking and delivering the non-stop orders from our group of 6.

So unassuming on the curb appeal, and then you walk in to a quaint little space with loads of character. 

Not to mention the cheekiness of hip-hop playing with the cute Asian servers walking around with flat - bill hats!!

Time to go nurse my sushi coma

The BEST sushi in town! The quality is always on point, the staff loves what they do and are so hospitable.. Everyone that passes you're table will greet you with a smile on their face make sure you're okay. The chefs go over an beyond, so creative and talented.. They'll also keep you entertained if you sit at the bar. Hilarious guys. If it's not too busy and you're feeling adventurous they are more than happy to make something custom for you. I've tried so many other sushi spots in town suggested by friends but none come close to comparison. I'm forever hooked. You always leave with an experience and positive memories.
Sushi is delicious. Bento set is very big and yummy. Good place for japanese food in Las Vegas!

This is my second times here,  I love this place 
Sushi was so good n They have many choices for sushi. 
I recommend Japanese Lasagna if u like baked roll  
n the server is very nice.

I absolutely love it here! The garlic tuna is by far the best I've had and its really tasty! And the way they serve/cut the tamago is cute lol. The AYCE menu caters to all tastes from the raw stuff, to appetizers, and so many different kinds of rolls-and so far ,there hasn't been anything I didn't like. Quality of ingredients is great and it matches their service. The staff definitely aim to please and are super friendly! I also love the decor and ambiance- it's modern and welcoming. They also have reasonable lunch specials. Eat at jjanga! You won't be disappointed!

Went to Jjanga with my boyfriend for a celebration meal, we were NOT disappointed!
The all you can eat sushi was a great deal. Both of us enjoyed our meals, it was fantastic.
I also loved the names of their rolls, so funny! Our sushi was fresh, fast, and very presentable. Sadly, I forgot to save some of my photos I shared on snapchat with some buddies!

Next time we go, we will have to bring friends to have some Karaoke fun!!
Love Jjanga! Amazing owner and sushi! Great environment and I'm happy they have a full bar instead of just sake and beer. Great location. Definitely worth checking out.
Ive been coming here for quite awhile now. I like the ambiance and the selections they have. Very clean and very friendly chefs and waitresses.

Came to Vegas from LA with friends and had to stop by an all you can eat sushi place. Saw Jjanga on yelp and decided to give it a try. It turned out extremely great, the food was amazing, servers were very friendly and would definitely come back again.

Simply put, best AYCE sushi in Vegas.

This place is so good, I'm not too sure where to start this review, but this is yelp, and it's always about the food itself.

Food here is just awesome. The fish is so fresh tasting, I would argue that it comes fairly close in quality to Noshi Sushi in Hollywood. Unlike Yama which precuts their fish (a decision I completely understand due to how busy they get), all the fish at Jjanga is sliced only when you order it. The fish to rice ratio in both their hand and cut rolls is spot on. They don't pile on the rice to fill you up faster, and the chefs are extremely generous with their portions. My favorite sushi here are the Yellowtail and Alaska hand rolls, which are just heavenly. The fish is so smooth, without any of the fishy smell and taste so common with cheaper sushi. Another amazing plus are their appetizers. I know it sounds strange, but try their plain chicken wings and the french fries. Hell, I'd come back just for those two. For their desserts, the red bean icecream is so fragrant and full of red beans, you'll with that you saved room for more than 1 cup. My only dislikes of the food would be some of the sauces they put on the sushi, but everything can be ordered without sauce. Additionally, their salads (Poke, shashimi, etc) are a bit weak when compared to their sushi lineup. If they made their salad like how Yama makes its shashimi salad, I would rate them 6 stars. As it stands, I would rate the food 5/5.

Service is also great. You aren't required to order with the same waiter who took your first one, if you want more food, just flag down any passing waiter. They don't mind the least and actually encourage it. Food is brought out at a constant pace instead of a giant glut common at other AYCE places, which helps keep the food at its correct temperatures. The servers are so friendly and I've never gotten the smallest hint of judgement for the sheer armount of food I consume. My only qualm is that once in a long while a small mixup will happen and an order might be forgotten, but since it's an AYCE, just order it again. Who cares if they forget? 5/5

Price/Ambiance/Cleanliness - Price is inline will most other places, ~21 for lunch, ~26 for dinner. Ambiance is casual but not too loud. Restrooms and entire restaurant kept pretty clean. No complaints in this one. 5/5

TLDR: Everything here is great, but also try the plain (must specify this) chicken wings and french fries. You'll thank me later.
WOW FIVE STARS ALL THE WAY Great service Great cooks when I am in Vegas this is the place to have great Sushi all u can eat made fresh love it

Go Choo Choo go!  He is a super awesome chef.  We told him "omakase", which means I leave it up to you.  He didn't disappoint us.  His special dishes were all very delicious.  I love good sushi and will cut off my right arm for a good piece of Toro.  And yes, Choo Choo delivers!  

Great ambience, great services from servers, great food, friendly active chefs.  

I love this place.

TONS of choices for sushi. Very authentic and offfers all sushi with AYCS (25.85 at night) which is way cool (even if I max out at 2 rolls so I didn't get it). Nice clean interior, friendly service quick to clean up. Most customers seemed to be Locals and many were Asian which goes to prove authenticity. Free drink by posting pic on FB too!

This Place has the worst most disrespectful host I have ever experienced in this town.. I was with a party of 3 showed up at 7:30pm this evening.. The HOST with The huge black rimmed glasses said there are no table  sand Nothing at the sushi Bar and no tablea available.. He flat out Lied to me.. Then after waiting 45 mins and we are the only people left waiting (seated on small wooden bench)  we watches several families walk put of the restaurant and then another party of 4 comes in and he immediately seats them!! I promptly walked out Hungry tired Never to return to this place!! Please dont  even bother going here there are plenty of other great sushi bars in Las vegas!!!

First time here, so I was a bit curious and skeptical. Heard many good reviews about it and it definitely met my expectations. Absolutely delicious. All their rolls were amazing.  Customer service was good and the ambiance was delightful. Definitely coming here again!! :)

AYCE or affordable a la carte, JJANGA is a good fusion of price and taste. 

Go in with the expectation that you just paid $3 for a spicy tuna roll; fish is not freshly caught and sliced a-la-Tsukiji, nor is rice lovingly fanned like a form of art. Instead this place just hits the spot with affordability as well as a lack of formality or pretentiousness.

AYCE rules: 
- $20.95 for lunch (45 min only)
- $25.95 for dinner (no time limit)
- Extra charge on unfinished items. No sharing between AYCE and a la carte people of course. 

A la carte:
- Small hot dishes priced around $3
- Basic rolls at $3 for 8 pieces
- Soup and salad $2
- Fancier rolls $8

A good fit for sushi on a budget.
This place is so yummy! Always excellent food & service.  They have a great selection of rolls - my favorite is the jackpot.
Get off the Strip for your Sushi.  Fresh and flavorful, with a reasonable AYCE menu.

My boyfriend and I came here to celebrate our 11 months together. We really enjoyed the cajun albacore and spicy garlic nigiri. We could eat dozens of those two. It's so delicious! He ordered all of the special hand rolls, and it's so filling! We also had the uni nigiri, and it practically melted in my mouth. The service was fast, and didn't have to wait for our table too long.

Best sushi spot I've been at. Cheap ( in price ) but great sushi. Off the strip but worth the drive. $20.95 (lunch) $25.95 (dinner) for all you can eat that is made to order. So no dealing with buffets. Soups and ice cream included too

So disappointed. Go to SAKANA!! Quality, selection, and service is so beyond even comparing. Since the moment we arrived for lunch our orders were subpar, late, and WRONG. 3 orders crab balls only got 2, 2 rolls never came, spicy salmon and crab hand rolls came out completely smushed, and the fresh men roll only had TWO pieces of fish and was missing a lot of ingredients. Plus one piece had nothing in it. The sushi guys looked lost behind the bar like they were pulled of the street that morning and were going through a crash course. Granted there were three other tables so it was super busy (NOT!!), and our waitress was either purposely delaying food or forgetting since we the three of us were doing AYCE but she was definitely more concerned acting like a secret agent with her collar mic. Go to SAKANA! Plus they play psy!

In an unseeming corner of an old business complex next to a small grocery store sits a new restaurant with a fresh facade--Jjanga Japanese Restaurant.  I came across their Yelp listing under New Businesses and decided to take my husband there for some lunch.  From the moment we walked in to the place, the service was positive, efficient, and ever-present.  I was surprised to find that this restaurant has a sushi bar, the main cuisine for their all-you-can-eat (AYCE) menu.  There are hundreds of AYCE sushi bars in Vegas, but this one is run by a very loved sushi chef from another very popular sushi bar, and his name is Jjanga.  Obviously, he owns the place, thus the self-titled restaurant.  He comes packed with three other sushi chefs at the helm: Koo Koo, Choo Choo, and Hickey.  You will remember their names because their Iron Chef photos with names on them sit high and mighty behind the sushi counter.  I fell in love with the place before trying the food just for that Iron Chef whimsy.  The other thing that caught my attention were the place settings at the bar.

Choo was our first sushi chef experience at Jjanga and is and forever will be dubbed the "sushi hero", because he rescued my negative ideas of certain pieces of fish and their delivery from the bowels of my personal food hell pit and resurrected them into favorites and desires.  To get to this point with Choo, we started off with a few familiar options for AYCE--saba and red snapper.I will be honest--from all my other sushi bar experiences in Vegas, I detest the sight and smell of saba.  I really, truly do.  When my husband orders it, I shove the plate his way to avoid that strong odor of saba in my nostrils.  This, however, was different.  I was puzzled by this plate; there was no fishy smell (despite it being fish), nor was there a dull gray tint to the saba.

It is clean, well cut, and topped with this crazy ginger cream sauce that is to die for.  I decided to check out this enigma for myself, closed my eyes, took one by the chopsticks and popped it in my mouth.  I chewed, waiting for that tangy taste to hit my palate, but lo!--no such thing occurred.  A nice, cured flavor of saba hit my taste buds with a hint of the sauce and well balanced sushi rice.  I actually fell in love with saba at that moment, ordering another round.  The snapper was clean tasting, just the right cut and was perfect without wasabi, soy sauce, or ginger.  I was excited to move on, and decided to tell Choo just to take the wheel.  We switched on omakase ((???, o-makase meaning "I leave it to you").

Choo made his first creation--a beautifully wrapped roll that was rice-free, included salmon and tuna, avocado, radish, and topped with two sauces that, when intermingled on the tongue, just exploded with a bit of spice, sweetness, and citrus.  This experience was the most unique out of all the other sushi places we fare for one reason--the flavors are clean, the fish is beautifully cut and great quality, and those sauces are uber-umami powerhouses.  I was excited to see what would arrive next.

Unagi, or eel is what my husband ordered.  Another nigiri that I truly detest, one that has plagued my palate with nothing but oily fish residue and the smell of fish death topped with what I assumed was metallic, salty eel sauce.  Disgusting, right?  I was dead wrong.  Taking a chance based on my saba experience, I went mouth-first with the unagi, and I was completely shocked.  First, the eel sauce isn't really eel sauce in terms of flavors we are used to at other sushi restaurants.  It isn't gritty, metallic, soy gel.  This stuff is complex, umami, and gentle with whatever it compliments.  As I took one, the first thing that made it pleasurable was the unagi's temperature--warm.  It is reminiscent, to me, of foie gras, and in the best way possible.  The fat is delicious, the meat flakes and melts in the mouth, and with the eel sauce it's a double hitter of flavor, from a symphony of sweet to a hint of salty, and dissipating with that beautiful fatty flavor that eel should always provide.  I ordered six more of these babies in one sitting.

At Jjanga, they are doing things right by curing their saba in house, cooking the tako until tender, making their sauces, and getting their sushi rice to the right flavor.  By presenting each piece of sushi at different temperatures to enhance the experience, the fish tasted the way it should; I truly admire and appreciate that.

All whimsy aside, Jjango is fun and fresh, just like their offerings of sashimi, nigiri, and rolls.  It's about creating the right experience, presenting the fish in a way that creates a sumptuous moment. I sum it all up in three words: engrossing, thoughtful, and balanced.

We were a little hesitant at first. . .man at the front was a little stand offish and kept grimacing at us.  Then my FIL bit into what looked like plastic but turned out to be a mussel shell. Manager apologized profusely and sent over free sashimi. . .food was excellent and service (except for guy at the front) was friendly.  If the guy at front was friendlier it would get 5 stars. . .first impressions so important!

This place used to be amazing but ever since they opened the second location it has gone completely downhill. Having been a chef at a sushi bar I can guarantee you NONE of the fish was fresh. In fact not a single piece of food I ate was fresh. Everything from the crab mix to the baked mussels reeked of fishiness. Even the Mochi ice cream was so old, the soft outer shell had become hard and disintegrated into a rough powder in my mouth. They recently fired most of the chefs/staff and you can definitely tell. The service was slow but it's really not the servers fault because the new chefs don't have proper training or ingredients. I'm honestly not one to write bad reviews but I feel their food is a legitimate safety concern, I myself had stomach pain the entire day after. I would highly recommend not going to Jjanga until they have figured things out once again. I'm definitely rooting for them.

I'm not an avid sushi eater, sushi is sushi to me and sushi everywhere seems over priced for what it is. 

This sushi seemed good and fresh to me, they lost stars due to horrendous and irritating service. 

Coke products are a big plus, tho they are served in Pepsi cups? 

I would come back without a doubt, but again, I eat sushi maybe twice a year.

Overrated

Pros:
   Cool service
   Karaoke rooms
   Fushion rolls (if you're into this kind of thing)
   Sake and beer
   Fish seemed fresh
   
Cons:
   This place really built for AYCE. You can taste it in the quality of the fish.
   Not a traditional Japanese restaurant (think Korean fushion rolls)

I used to love this place! Its the only AYCE I go to when its late at night but lately its starting to become quite disgusting! 

I understand they are renovating the place so theres no alcohol but they could at least do better with their food!

*Rice portion got bigger
*Fish is not fresh at all (came back different days in a week still not fresh)
*FISH is not FRESH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! (I wish I still have the recent picture)

I don't mind if the appetizers is not all that because I come here for sushi. 

All the servers were really nice!!! They also apologized about everything.

I had my first bad experience at Jjanga but at the Fort Apache location, and I thought I wasn't coming back. Well yesterday, a close friend of mine took me out to the Decatur location and I decided on the  la carte menu. 
I was surprised because this location was fairly busy and the menu was extensive. The server was very nice and overall, I had a good experience. 

I came back today with my sister for all you can eat,  and we ordered 8 plates of sushi. I say if you have not eaten at all, you can finish those 8 plates in -6 minutes. No joke. They're just unique but definitely worth it.
Our whole order came out super fast despite all the other demanding customers going wild on this fine New Years Eve. 
I'm glad I did give them another chance because their ayce is amazinggg.
Man, everything we had was delicious! The quality was definitely worth the price for all you can eat. I only wish they served alcohol, but the waiter said they would be getting that in a few weeks.

New ownership. New decor. New staff. Same high quality fish! Still the only place in the area (that I know of) that offers ayce salmon belly and doesn't put a limit on this delicious slice of heaven.  I'll be sure to keep returning whenever I'm on the area because Jjanga is a cut above the rest!  Enjoy!
New menu and layout to the place. Our server was very nice and timely on everything. She also gave us 10% off for writing a review.
Outstanding sushi at a great price. Always get it to go. But the staff is very friendly and appears to be quick. I never have to wait very long and food is fresh.

My favorite place in the city for AYCE sushi. So many places are too heavy on the rice and Jjanga is perfect. The sushi is fresh and all of the rolls I've had are yummy. Love the tuna naruto (no rice), playboy special, and touchdown.

They get a extra star only because the sushi was So-so.. My fish falling apart.. Salmon all broken cause they rationing the fish::couldn't cut a new piece for the customer.. Ordered a chicken Teriyaki appetizer I arrived here at 6:20pm and it's currently 7pm and still NO CHICKEN:: what is up with the service here? No one smiles and everyone has a attitude!! No thank you.. Never again:: try another all you can!!!

First time to go here and it was a hit!!!! We loved it. I swear this is the best Sushi in town. The service was great and the ambience was awesome. You guys have to try everything and also try the Flavored Sake Lychee. I promise you won't regret eating here.

Jjanga is one of my favorite sushi restaurants, it is amazing! My family and I have followed Jjanga since he was working as a chef at another sushi restaurant, we absolutely love sushi and we are all sushi snobs. If you are looking for heavy rolls with lots of flavor jjanga is the place to go. It also has AYCE which I love.

The banners of the sushi chefs at the sushi counter are the sole reason why I will be back! Sitting at the sushi bar is the only way to go! Jjanga and our chef Hickey were a riot.  

We usually order nigiri and a few appetizers and stay away from the rolls so if you're a roll fan look for other peoples reviews.  For an AYCE joint, the sushi was pretty Damm good.  Amaebi was fresh, not dried out like you'll find at most others.  The beef tataki was good as was the yellowtail with yuZu. I probably had the best AYCE salmon skin hand roll- it was so good Hickey made me two!

I've stayed away from AYCE for maybe 5-6 months as I've been spoiled paying 2.5X for fresh fish but for the price and definitely the service and atmosphere you can't go wrong with Jjanga.

Sit at the bar and you'll have a great time!
Great food.  Love the garlic wings.  Only issue is u can't do half orders.... Not a real issue for me however
Never a bad idea to eat at Jjanga ! The service good and the food is even better. 26$ for AYCE and trust me it's worth it!
Best price, best sushi, awesome wait staff, and great with kids!! We LOVE this place. It's the only place we go for sushi!

My favorite items are the yuzu yellowtail and the bulgogi bowl. I like the fact that they have no-rice rolls. I am not a fan of the rice because it falls apart no matter how gently I try to pick up the nigiri. This is the only sushi restaurant by far where I experience this issue. Fried items are served in very small portions so I usually double up on these.

Customer service has always been quick. I've eaten here three times.

Ala Carte prices are much lower than most other sushi joints which is a plus.

Wow!  The best All You Can Eat sushi I've had!  Trust me.  Just ask the chef to make you what ever he thinks best.  He made rolls that were some of the best I've had, especially for 26.oo lol...  Aron was fantastic!

Although the food was top notch, what really sets this place apart is the unbelievable service and showmanship of the staff.  If you are looking for a quiet dining experience, this may not be your favorite, but if you have some personality, chefs like choo choo will entertain you and provide you with some of the best sushi in town.  It's a Vegas must!

Yellowtail, Tuna, Ex wife, Vegas roll, spring mountain roll....some of my favorites. I also really enjoyed the Bulgogi.

I came here with four other people and from the beginning I wasn't feeling it because the man up front was unfriendly. He told us the wait time was 25 minutes and it ended up being about 45. I had to go ask him how much longer instead of him coming over and  keeping us updated.

After looking over the menu, I noticed it was very Americanized, contained a lot of cream cheese and imitation crab so I was not excited to try the food. 3 of the people at my table got the AYCE and me and my other friend decided to go al a carte. We started off by ordering the pumpkin soup and cucumber salad to see what type of food we were dealing with. The pumpkin soup came out luke warm and had no flavor. The cucumber salad was cut sloppily and did not taste fresh. We decided to pass on the rest of the food.
HIGHLY recommend. The staff was great, the sushi chef took great care of us. Uploaded 5 pics, so see for yourself. It's off the strip but worth the trip!!!
Loving Hickey, best sushi chef of all time, makes great food and what a great entertainer

Bomb! Ass! Food! You have to try it before you get any other ideas! It's really good. You can tell that everything is made fresh and after the second you order! The rice was very soft and tasty. The fish looked/smelled/tastes very good! The staff were amazing! Very nice and quick! You're missing out if you haven't tried their food yet!

The best AYCE sushi I've ever had. Place was nice, workers were nice, every dish I had was delish, they even had red bean ice cream wish most restaurants only serve green tea! Please open one up in LA and HI!

Great place! Best service and sushi I've ever had, definitely wasn't expecting this place to be that good. Always had a waiter to refill water or ask if we wanted to order more. Great upbeat type of environment and very friendly. They actually wanted us to keep ordering! Went with my brother before we left Vegas and got the all you can eat. Most rolls there are $8 and special sashimi is $12. Easily ate our money's worth! Definitely will return there whenever I go back to Vegas. They give you an all you can eat punch card too so you're 11th time is free!

BEWARE!!!! RUN FAR FAR AWAY!!!  So disappointed after being frequent customers at 2 locations!!!! Ate dinner with friends and the service was horrible!!!!!! Not to mention, they served us raw chicken!!!!!!!! RAW bloody chicken!!!  Management gave us a $7 "promotional discount!" What a joke!!! Manager asked us what we wanted...uhhhh, hello??? You're the manager, act like one!!!!  Never again, Jjanga.....

This is my girlfriend's favorite ALL YOU CAN EAT SUSHI IN Vegas.  We come here about once a month and we have not been disappointed yet.  
I get the chicken teriyaki every time.  It is all white meat which is great.  They use good quality chicken.  
Great place.

(This restaurant is under a new management according to a waiter.) 
It was my first time eating here and I've noticed a lot of things. The restaurant looks nice. The AYCE was good! The quality of the food is great. The chefs are nice and very attentive. 

The only thing I didn't like about this place is the service. The servers seems not to friendly and not very welcoming. This Korean waitress seems like she hates her job so much that she was bored and impatient. I noticed that she wants us to hurry ordering up every time she comes to our table! My husband and I are generous tippers but this time I feel like she didn't deserve it. 

They also ran out of a lot of stuff and this is really bad especially that most people come here for the AYCE. The dessert menu was also misleading. They said that you can have a limit of 2 pieces of mochi ice cream but once you order they will only give you 1 piece sliced in half!

By far my favorite sushi in Las Vegas! I was blown away at the freshness and amazing flavors put out by chef Jjanga and the other chefs. I have been in a couple times now that I found it and feel as if I am cheating on my lover if I eat elsewhere!  The staff is so pleasant and welcoming and the ambiance makes me want to stay longer. I can't tell you how much I have loved everything I have tasted at this sushi bar! Good job chef!!

Great food!!!
We came here for dinner which was $25.99.
Oyster was fabulous. 
I would recommend this to anyone!

Constantly awesome sushi plus they have all you can eat I recommend sitting at the bar if your gonna do all u can eat otherwise the servers can take a wile to get back to you for your next roll order and you start to get full.
Best ayce Japanese.  20% tip is worth paying for yummy food.  Cucumber salad is the best, refreshing.

We were a party of 4 for all you can eat on a Saturday night. We got there right before the rush and were seated promptly. We were told we couldn't order sake because the restaurant was having issues with their liquor license, so that was a downside for my friends. All tje food was great, however the waitress had an attitude everytime we ordered more food. It made me uncomfortable and not want to order any more. I understand people have bad days, so I cannot hold the wait staff to one person with a bad attitude, but it just made the whole thing uncomfortable. We still tipped well over the minimum and left around 9pm. I will give it another try and update review then.

Love this place and the owner is so friendly. The customer service is on point and they never leave your water empty. The food is amazingly fresh and reminds me of home. Good experience and will always be coming back.  This is my second visit in a row. Thank you for the quality atmosphere.

Eh. The food was okay but I don't think I'd call this my favorite place.

The service was excellent, we had 2 servers helping us and they were attentive and polite. 

But the food was not as good. 

I actually got so nauseous from the weird spicy tuna that I couldn't finish my roll. 

Perhaps it was because the chef was more concerned with the baseball game on TV than my food?

Nothing really had that "wow" factor that I look for in a restaurant. 

I wouldn't eat here again.

Came here for dinner on Sunday and the restaurant was busy.  Jjanga has a lively atmosphere with K-Pop playing throughout the restaurant.  The one thing I can say with total confidence - You will not find another sushi bar in Vegas with better service than Jjanga.  

Every server that passes by your table asks if you need anything.  Between each server passing by...there is a busboy who stops by to clear empty dishes or refills drinks.  I was so amazed that I actually counted how many servers stopped by our table within a minutes timespan and I lost track.  

The food is good. I found the sushi to be warmer than I would prefer. I don't think they cool down the rice enough.  Their spicy tuna mix was pasty.  I don't think it's freshly chopped per order.  Nigiri fish to rice ratio was really good.  Big pieces of fresh fish.  

Definitely worth a visit!

Fantastic experience

Sat at the sushi bar area and am I so happy I did

Came back after year, best sushi in Las Vegas, period

Sunny was the Sushi chef and he was awesome

Ordered sashimi, lobster roll and dancing tiger roll
Each exquisite than the other

Excellent job

First time we came it was a great experience overall on regards to great food and good service. 

The second time I went there was a drastic change. Service was slow, lazy and it felt as if they just didn't care. We were checked up on only when I had to look around and even then they were reluctant to help. I hope the service gets better.

If you do go, do so during the evening hours because the service is much better.

Quality has gone way down. Tonight, I was served Uni turning black in color. Every piece of nigiri drenched in sauce. Service is poor and slow. I did voice my complaints to our server and she did her best to make us keep coming back but unfortunately this will be our last.

We really enjoyed this AYCE over most of the others around Vegas. My wife liked the fact that they had a lot of rice-less rolls.  Where do they come up with the names for some of these rolls, lol?  Not a mochi fan, but my wife is. That was her main disappointment of this place. The skin on the mochi was not silky smooth. I liked this place better than Yama Sushi. The service was better, and I think the roll choices were better. I also think the quality and taste was very good.

Do not eat here! I've been to many ayce places and the rice to fish ratio is usually pretty decent, but jjanga nigiri is almost all rice. The fish is slice the thinnest I have ever seen. 

We came in around 2:30 in the afternoon and the place was completely empty, yet the orders came out excruciatingly slow. 

All the waiters kept giving us dirty looks, presumably because they actually walked up to us and said we HAD to eat their rice.
Good food. Not just sushi . Sushi chefs are fast quality good rice is what makes the sushi. Service was fast.

I kept hearing about this place and we finally decided to go today.  I wasn't too impressed. We walked in and I'm used to a greeting, but there was no one at the front. A couple of servers seen us but never greeted nor asked how many in our party till 10 minutes later.  Then we were told to wait another 15-20 minutes. Service/food was okay. We had to ask twice to refill our drinks. They kept forgetting 1 thing each time we asked for something. Ordered Uni and it tasted bad. Uni is not supposed to be grey/brown color...was nasty. Don't plan on returning there any time soon.

Very good sushi , quality and atmospher very good 5/5 star , our sushi chef was koo koo , very nice costumer service 5/5 , they have meeting room or party room ( like Private VIP room ) karaoke room , kitchen food was great 4/5 .

So over all these place is very good , my new spot to come

I'm definitely a fan!  Was in town for business and our group was craving sushi, and this place did not disappoint!  Quality of the food was good.  I liked that the portions were smaller so you could try a little bit of everything without being full after the first plate.  This was probably the absolute fastest service I have ever had. Before we were done one plate, the next was being brought over.  Like, within minutes.  Crazy.  Only complaint is that at the end of the  meal, our server basically went awol.  Couldn't be found anywhere, so it took about 20 mins to get the check and get out of there.  I would definitely return next time I'm in town!

I came in here on 2 occasions, the first one being with my cousin and the other time with my girlfriend.

The first time with my cousin was kinda "eh" in terms of the customer service. I felt that they were kinda trying to get us out of there (even though we stopped ordering food and were just talking because we were catching up). I also found it funny that they would not add jalapeo slices to one of the rolls we had ordered because it was "too busy, and they only add it if you are buying a la carte". To be honest, I really don't understand the point of that because regardless of how busy other locations are, they'll do whatever you want to the sushi (at least to the places I have been). Regardless, the sushi was awesome so I decided to come back a second time with my girlfriend.

The second time I came here, we sat at the bar, and it was completely different than the first visit. I felt that the waiters and waitresses were more attentive, and things came out faster. It was just as busy as the original time I went...maybe it was an off night for them the first time around. 

Overall, both times, the sushi was great. The fish tasted super fresh, and the quality was on point. I highly recommend the "freshmen roll" and the "monkey burrito" among other things that I forget the names of. The chefs are all super friendly and will cater to whatever you want, just don't expect that to happen if you're sitting at a table because you'll probably get denied from your server. 

I will probably be back... the sushi is great!

I don't usually go to AYCE sushi restaurants because of the stigma of low quality.  I always get the feeling that quality is diminished when the restaurant is just churning out sushi for all of their hungry customers.  So I came to JJanga wanting to try the food, but not for the AYCE deal.  

I ended up ordering a la carte, which actually offers some solid prices at $3 for appetizers (small portions but wide variety and tasty), $3 normal sushi (california, tuna, etc.), $5 rolls/burritos, and then $8 for specialties.  AYCE was $25 so considering I stuck with a few minor rolls and appetizers it wouldn't have made sense anyways.  I got the mushroom ball and agedashi tofu appetizers to begin, and then the spicy tuna roll, yummy vegetarian roll, and Jjanga burrito.  The appetizers were of high quality but for $3 were very small.  The spicy tuna came with 8 pieces, so although it wasn't the best roll I've ever eaten, and not the cleanest prepared, the price was too cheap to say anything negative.  It was solid. The vegetarian Yummy roll was very good.  Tempura and a nice spicy sauce for a good kick.  The burrito was an interesting concept but nothing to shout about.

I do have some comments about the restaurant.  To start, wasabi was a $1 extra charge.  This is a sushi restaurant so that was very weird, although they brought out like a full ice cream scoop when ordered so that makes up for the surcharge.  They also have no liquor license, yet advertise sake and beer both in their menu and on their wall in the restaurant.  Next, the waitstaff had no idea what they were doing and we had 3 different waiters take our order so we never really had that server experience or have a personalized waiter to request stuff from.  And finally they messed up our receipt.  The price was the same as what we ordered so we didn't bother complaining, but they replaced two different sushi items on the receipt that we did not order.  So either they ned to update their cashier system or take better order noted to cite the price correctly.  

I'm not a fan of AYCE, as I said, so I probably won't be back.  But they have a huge variety of sushi (albeit most consist of the same crab, tuna, avocado, etc. ingredients) so if AYCE is your thing, then $25 isn't horrible and the quality is fine for the experience.

This is one of the best AYCE sushi restaurants in Vegas. I've been here about 5 times over the past 2 years and the sushi always tastes fresh. I've never had to spit anything out because it tasted gamey or rotten (unfortunately, I've had to do this at some other sushi restaurants before...). The service is also attentive and efficient.  No complaints. Amazing value for the quality of food you get. Don't forget to save room for ice cream mochi/dessert!

Jjanga is definitely added onto my go-to AYCE sushi spots in vegas! Very nice atmosphere and setting for this type of cuisine.  Servers are always on point with making sure you've ordered and making sure the food keeps coming out.

I enjoyed their Jjanga burrito, Yellowtail w/ Yuzu, salmon nigiri, as well as an array of appetizers like their bulgogi, crab ball & chicken wings. I love their "Something Wrong 69 Roll" which came with an amazing ponzu sauce. The "Q Roll" was amazing as well.
For dessert I got a scoop of their chocolate ice cream. Im not over exaggerating when I say their chocolate ice cream is THE BOMB! Try it and you'll taste why. 

I cant wait to try their new location on Sunset and 215!

The prices, the service and for that food...unbelievable. The names of the rolls were provocative especially with our kids reading the menu but the sushi was excellent. And at 5P on a Monday, avocado rolls, a veggie roll, tastes like my ex-girlfriend, and dancing eel. Those were the good rolls minus the veggie roll that we did not like (it had a nice crunch and was very fresh).

What made this excellent sushi were a few unique "dishes": the screaming orgasm (appetizer of seared tuna on a bed of radish), the spring mountain roll, and the monkey burrito (we ordered a 2nd). 

The first few rolls were delivered within 5 minutes after we ordered and the rest not all at once but in a nice progression. Freshness, great taste, and spicy sauces. Our 9 year old and 11 year old provided the ultimate compliment. In general, they both enjoy and will answer "Sushi", when we ask 'What would you like for dinner?' but they what they like and they do not like all sushi. After one bite of those three, all they could say was "More please."

Get some...

Our first night in Vegas left us wanting to wander off of the strip to get our grub on.  We were craving sushi and saw so many mixed reviews around the area, but decided to take a chance on Jjanga and I am glad we did!

THE MOOD:
Jjanga is located a little further down from Chinatown in a small plaza.  It seems like the only happening place in this plaza is Jjanga - all the other stores are in dire need of customers.  Imagine the $$ they could be making if they were located right in Chinatown!  The decor inside looks modern/Asian.  There is a bar where you can sit with the enthusiastic sushi chefs.  Patrons who come and sit at the bar are warmly greeted by the chefs.  If you opt for sitting in the dining area, you will have plenty of space between your table and the one next to you.

THE FOOD:
Andrew D. and I decided to go for the dinner AYCE for the $25.95 per person.  I especially loved the appetizer dishes since each one that was brought out was unique and each was packed with flavor!

What we ordered:
- Garlic Tuna (Delicious and packed with strong garlic flavor! I loved!)
- Salmon Egg 
- Sea Urchin (This was melt in your mouth goodness)
- Sweet Shrimp (Big pieces of tasty succulent shrimp)
- Seaweed salad (I'm a lover of seaweed salad and this was so delicious I had to order 2)
- Baby Octopus (They come in 3 and are crispy, tasty!)
- Golden scallop (These also came in 3.  These are marked off on the menu in red to show that you are only allowed 1 order of these per person - and for good reason! They were delicious!)
- Mini Beef Steak (These came in 4 pieces - the beef was super tender and dripping with lovely juices)
- Jjanga Burrito (This is not really a burrito, but rather a handroll - the tempura was a nice crunchy complement to the rice, crab, and shrimp)
- Salmon Skin Roll
- Washington Roll
- Jjanga Special Roll (This was a surprisingly refreshing dish.  I loved the crisp of the chopped tomato with the special chef sauce - they were so fun to eat and this is perfect for the hot weather!)
- Spider Roll (The soft shell crab was absolutely delicious - the roll was made to perfection!)
- Q Roll (Jjanga have sushi rolls without rice - good for those who are counting those carbs/calories - very refreshing!)
- Green Tea Ice Cream (I want to say that this is probably the best green tea ice cream I've tasted! I loved how each bite was delicious, milky, green tea goodness).
- Strawberry Ice Cream (You are only allowed to order 1 per customer and it was delicious! Get at least one to try!)

THE 'TUDE:
If you thought the list above was a lot of food, you are right!! lol.  Andrew D. and I eat like champs and we love good sushi!  The waiters did not miss a beat in stopping by our table to refill our drinks and pick up our empty plates as we efficiently chomped through each dish.  Our waitress also kept checking in on us to see if we wanted to order more or needed anything else.

OVERALL:
Jjanga is doing sushi right, but most importantly, they are doing customer service right!!  I loved my time here and would come back again!

Oh Jjanga, Jjanga... I was so excited. I didn't know what to expect. This is what I experienced.

Food:

Interesting, different, and adventurous. 

Jjanga burrito - boring. So boring. Didn't finish.
Red rock roll - interesting fruity pebbley. I think I liked it. It looked really cool.
Smoked salmon nigiri - smoked salmon on sushi rice. Nothing more.
Amaebi - just like any other amaebi.
Beef nigiri - bland.
Screaming orgasm - yummy, laughable portion.
Half rolls - non-existent.

Everything seemed fresh. I wasn't sick the next day or anything. Overall the food was okay. Not bad, not good.


Drinks:

$12 for a little bit of cheap house sake. The staff didn't even want to tell us what brand it was.

We were charged for our hot green tea even though it was Brown. It tasted very watered down like they have been using the same ol' tea leaves all day. The tea came in very small cups and needed to be refilled often. The staff would sometimes show that they were annoyed to do so.

Service:

We weren't greeted when we came in. No one acknowledged or existence when we left. The whole time we just felt unwanted. They just started at us simultaneously avoiding us. The busser was pretty good though. He was nice and attentive.

Overall:

Not a bad spot. I've definitely had worst. I would go back if someone wanted me to join them there, otherwise I have no interest to go back.

I give this place five stars because it's like really my second snow third sushi place that I've been to out in Las Vegas and I am pretty particular about when it comes to seafood and fish only for the fact I prefer to be living right by the ocean if I'm going to have seafood and you know the only water that's close to Las Vegas is Lake Mead and nobody eats fish from there at least they shouldn't I like to place it was very clean very cute it's all you can eat which was nice and I got to just have a very large variety of a sushi and so much so that at my eyes became bigger than my stomach and I didn't get to finish everything but I would definitely go again as a matter of fact I do plan on going next Saturday

Double D Roll - one of the tastiest, freshest rolls I can remember!  My friend and I enjoyed the Rainbow Roll which was very fresh and delicious.  While we did not choose the all you can eat, we noticed that the prices for individual roles were very reasonable. The decor is cute and adorable, and not what you would expect from this particular shopping plaza. We will definitely be back,

So freaking good! Especially for a buffet. Great price and great hours of operation. 

They had over 24 choices of sushi. Maybe more! I'm just roughly guessing. The buffet even includes mochi ice cream. And the green tea ice cream was pretty good too. I would definitely recommend this to others :)
Really good sushi.. my recommendations are the I love roll....sexy time..and yellow yellow... head up they don't do half rolls.
Great place. Lots of variety.  Tons of good flavor.  Small portions that are perfect for AYCE to maximize ordering.  They are also very fast and there was no wait.  Well come back.
Food is DELICIOUS and service was on point! Definitely coming here again!! And they got mochi ice cream and ice cream too!!

Coming to JJanga I was not expecting this great of quality of sushi. We were exceptionally surprised! The 4 of us sat at the sushi bar. It's enjoyable to watch the rolls being prepared. We had a few sake bombs and our friends tried the grapefruit sake, it was amazing! 

I became obsessed with a few of the riceless rolls. They were rolled in cucumber, which made them so light and fresh. The next time we come here I honestly will stick to those. The Johnny Roll was my absolute favorite. Shrimp tempura and crab wrapped in cucumber then topped with a light fruit sauce... I'll take 5! The Q Roll and the Vegas Roll were great as well! My only complaint was it was super awkward trying to order from the chefs. They were super busy and it was difficult getting their attention. Other then that everything was perfect, can't wait to come back!
I walked in not expecting much of it. But the nigiri was hands down the best I've had in a LONG time. The special rolls was either a hit or a miss for me.
Always great to come here! We have been for 2 years :-) We always get the sponge roll, caterpillar roll, James Bond and the Vegas roll!

There's bound to be at least one thing on the menu that you make YOUR FAVORITE each time you come to a restaurant and the one thing I absolutely fell in love with is the JJANGA BURRITO.  The one thing that will always bring me back here for.

Over six months ago a friend and I tried this new sushi place called JJANGA Japanese Restaurant.  Everything we tried was good but I honestly couldn't remember what we ordered.  All I know is that we ordered so much food that we couldn't finish.  Just a few days ago, we returned with a few other people.  I never thought that I'd ever return here because I have this thing with places not doing half order sushi rolls.  I like doing half orders so that I can taste a variety of rolls.  This place served chicken wings and so a member of our group who loves chicken wings, well, we ended up here again.  

My friend ordered the Jjanga Burrito for the first time and she told me that I should try it because it was really good.  So I decided to give it a try.  The moment I took a bite I said, "Oh my god this is good."  Then after every few bites I'm saying how amazing and how amazing balls it was and how I was going to order another one.  So inside of this roll, there is shrimp, broccoli tempura, crab, masago, green onion, furikake, and layu all wrapped in soy paper.  I think layu is some kind of chili oil.  

It's so hard to describe the taste, and all I can say that it's AMAZING.  The rice inside of it is almost like fried rice, but not fried rice (may not make sense but you just have to try it).  The broccoli tempura gives it a crunch with every bite and the flavor with everything else mixed with it is just BOMB!  By far my favorite on the menu.
Food is delicious. Yummy yum yum. Ate till full. 10/10 would eat again. Every single bite is like a taste of heaven
A go to spot when it comes to all you can eat! Great service and food, a little outside of Chinatown but worth it. Just try it and you won't be disappointed...

BEST SUSHI EVER! 
Also, great customer service!
I highly recommend you get the grapefruit sake, and their volcano roll is the best I've ever had! 
I always leave happy and satisfied from here.
Best sushi in town and the most fun!

They accommodated to me and my friends very generously! I ordered teriyaki chicken and he used some of it to make a roll he thought I would like. I love the service, atmosphere, food, and especially the staff! A must go if you're in Vegas or looking for a new sushi place!

3.5 stars

Felt like AYCE sushi and decided to check out a new place. I had Jjanga bookmarked so I decided to check it out. It's located in a small strip mall.

The interior is quite nice, much nicer that the exterior. Service was attentive, and I opted to sit at the sushi bar since I was dining alone. Servers came by regularly to refill my water and ask if I wanted to place any kitchen orders (i.e. appetizers, desserts). Sushi orders I placed directly with the sushi chefs sitting behind the bar.

I ended up eating quite a bit of food, definitely got my money's worth. I am pretty sure that I ordered over $60 worth of food for the AYCE dinner price of $25.99.

The quality of the food was okay for AYCE. The uni was mediocre, and the agedashi tofu not impressive (a bit cold, not that crispy). Some of the nigiri weren't the freshest either. I noticed that a lot of the fish was pre-cut, which makes for faster assembly, but not up to higher standards. The sushi chef also forgot one of my orders, though he apologized profusely when I reminded him and made it immediately.

The menu was large, but the variety just so-so (a lot of the rolls were similar). 

Like many other Japanese restaurants across the country, this is a Korean-owned establishment, and the servers and sushi chefs were all speaking Korean to each other. This is not a problem for me, but just don't expect super authentic Japanese fare.

Overall, I had a pleasant meal, though I have had better experiences at other AYCE sushi places in town.

P.S. The menu says there is a 45-minute time limit for placing order for lunch AYCE, and 60-minute time limit for ordering dinner AYCE, but no time limit for overall dining time.

Great food!! Taste like my ex girlfriend is my fav..I recommend making reservations..the staff was great until they got busy then they basically forgot about us best AYCE I've had that remains good time after time.
Great service and solid menu. Did the lunch AYCE and thought it was great value. They usually have salmon belly if you ask ( not on menu ).

First time trying this place out & I wasn't disappointed. The ambiance & decor are pretty unique. I liked that the tables were divided by bamboo curtains & walls. It gives you a sense of privacy while you're enjoying your meal. And the food was great! I went during their happy hour time after midnight, where it's all you can eat & it came out to be very worth it. The prices are reasonable & the menu has plenty of options to choose from. The only thing that I didn't like was that they didn't offer any kind of cocktails. They only had beer options & I'm not much of a beer drinker. I would have loved to enjoy my sushi with a nice cold Mai-Tai. Other than that, the place looked great & the food was delicious. I also noticed they have a karaoke section that was closed. I'd definitely love to come back & next time try to do some karaoke! I love karaoke!

Low key, this is my favorite all you can eat sushi place.  I've eaten at a few different places on the west coast, but this is by far the tastiest with the highest quality fish.  My family loves coming here for the riceless rolls (fresh men and Chinatown are our favorites) as well as the chicken wings.  Ending the meal with a little scoop of green tea ice cream never hurt anyone!  

But in terms of quality of fish and freshness, this is great.  Some rolls are a little heavy on sauce or on the fusion side, but the nigiri negates all of that.  The garlic tuna is by far my favorite, a smoky garlic taste.  The hand rolls are fun and there's a great variety on the menu overall.  There is something for everyone here, you don't have to eat raw fish if you don't want to.  The service is also very quick and friendly!
Great service at Jjanga, wide variety of menu selection. Perfect for anybody next to the Vegas strip but doesn't want to pay Vegas prices. Would recommend.

This is my new favorite sushi spot in town!!! The restaurant is beautiful with a cool ambience. We sat at the bar, and Chef Choo Choo was a blast! He was fun and lively, and made the best sushi I've ever had! All you can eat was $20, a great price for sushi that was creative, artful, and delicious. Choo Choo made us custom dishes that he thought we would like. We also got to meet the owner Jjanga, who was so fun! On our way out, both chefs gave us hugs and thanked us for coming. Its an amazing place, and we will be regulars!

My wife and I tried Sushi for the first time and it was Yummy. Our friends said this is the best place and I would agree. Make sure you go with people you know and have been there before. They ordered and we just ate. I have only had sushi once so I don't know any better, but i want to go back.
This is my favorite sushi place! There is never a long wait, the service is amazing! The management is super friendly. If you're looking for some good sushi I highly recommend it!

I'm not sure what happened to this place but it is now terrible! We used to come here all the time and had very good experiences. The menu has recently changed and is now missing a lot of our favorites.

The food is decent, if you don't mind waiting  20 to 30 minutes for one little order...btw there's a 1 hour limit so order wisely ...

Jeez what a joke. Safe to say that we won't be returning.
Super delicious! Had all you can eat with my cousin, baked mussels, baked lobster roll, popcorn lobster roll, something special  everything was great and fresh
Best sushi hands down been coming here for a while and i love it service is good and food is good as well.
Great prices, good sushi and a quiet comfy atmosphere! Would definitely come again! Fresh, yummy new choices and a friendly staff makes this a win win on a date night

Excellent! Very good flavorful fish very well prepared and very friendly staff! This was our first visit here, but were pleased to see some friendly faces, including the owner that was once a chef at one of our favorite restaurants we have enjoyed in the past. All in all, great place....go there!

I came with coworkers after work, sushi was delicious the sushi chefs are very nice, choo choo took care of us this time he was very nice and fast with our order i really recomend people to come here!!!!

For ayce sushi this place is pretty good. Here on a Tuesday night about 6 pm and it's not crowded at all. Servers all working together bringing out the food and refilling the drinks. Some of the rolls took a little time to come out but they were baked rolls so it's forgivable. I love unagi  nigiri and I felt like the rice to eel ratio was appropriate. The knife cuts weren't perfect but listen this isn't sushi on the strip that's going to cost you $20 bucks a roll either. If you want decent sushi for a decent price then Jjanga is the place to go.
Everything we tried was great. The service was spectacular. The fish was fresh and delicious.  Whether you like rolls or sushi.. Both were phenomenal.. Highly recommended!!!!

Man, I used to be a Kaya fan but after having JJanga I can't go back to sushi kaya.

Food: Their fish is top notch. Always fresh and delicious. Their nigiris are proportioned, good rice to fish ratio. Their special rolls are out of the ordinary as well.  I personally love the big easy roll and dancing tiger roll. Ask for the hickey special roll of Hicky is working:) Lissa hand roll is soooo good. I've tried a green tea shot and man, that was unforgettable!

Ambiance- all sushi chefs are fun to hang out and talk too. My favorites are obviously Hickey and Kookoo! I love sitting at the bar and hanging out with the chefs. They definitely take care of you and always asks if you want anything special.

Cons- sometimes the servers are not that attentive specially if your sitting at the bar and wanting to order dessert or appetizer. I usually find myself looking for someone to place an order.

Overall, I love this place! There is definitely room for improvement but the food definitely keeps me from coming back!:)

Sitting at the sushi counter was definitely the way to go here! The chefs were fun and personable, and kept passing us excellent creations from the AYCE menu. From poke two ways, to riceless rolls, and amazing yellowtail the sushi chefs made sure to fill our bellies with fish and not a ton of rice. The grapefruit sake was the perfect cleansing drink between courses. We were here at around 9pm on a Sat. night and it was busy but we had no trouble with excessive noise. this place is now on our short list of" must return" on our next Vegas trip! Thank you Jjanga for a truly great evening! You helped make it a great birthday dinner for our daughter!

I had wanted to try this place for so long and I finally got to when my boyfriend wanted to meet up with friends here. We went in a little after 11 pm and were stoked to see they have all you can eat sushi for $20. What a steal! We weren't staying long so we only ordered miso soup and the spicy tuna roll. Both we really yummy! Our friends had the AYCE and there were so many rolls that looked delicious, I was jealous! We will definitely be back and get the AYCE next time!
I came here again with my husband this time and everything was just not as great my 1st experience so I guess I'm still on a hunt for the best ayce sushi
Good food and service as usual. I'm definitely not writing a lengthy review because of the 10% off they offer

Yesterday I would have told you I have given up on AYCE sushi in Las Vegas.

Not that I have given up eating AYCE sushi (I would rather give up sunshine), but that I have given up expecting anything better than marginally fresh, questionably acceptable slices of fish on a ball of tasteless rice. This is what we have come to expect from the AYCE joints in town - from joints that pre-cut the individual sashimi slices, letting oxygen start to kill the taste and texture, to places that serve a thin slice of lemon on top to mask the tell-tale signs of fish that is about to go bad.

Today I am singing a new tune - watch me do my little happy dance (clap along if you feel that sushi is right for you).

JJANGA has restored my faith in AYCE sushi and brightened up my whole year. I have once again found an AYCE joint that serves fresh fish (Rod my friend - if you're reading this, I watched them pull the fresh filets of Salmon out of the ice myself, so maybe they got your message).

But the star of the day wasn't the salmon, or the yellowtail (which were both amazing BTW), it wasn't even watching Choo Choo perform with graceful precision - the star of the day was the tuna. Absolutely gorgeous to behold and a joy to devour, the tuna was just about as perfect as perfect can be. The same delicate quality of fish you can only find in some of the better pay-per piece sushi joints, with the added glory of a never-ending supply. (Oh, this has gotta be the good life, this has gotta be the good life.)

When was the last time you remember an AYCE sushi joint serving eel that is still warm and fresh from the toaster oven and not cold because they precooked it to save time? When was the last time you remember Cajun albacore tasting like Cajun at all (has it ever)? When's the last time the garlic sauce on the garlic tuna made you go "Ooooo"? When was the last time they served you REAL wasabi at an AYCE? Huh? Go ahead, try to think of a time!

Simply an amazing lunchtime AYCE, better than expected by far, and they managed to top off great sushi and great service with an AYCE price a couple of dollars lower than most everywhere else in town - money! (I gotta feeling, that tonight's gonna be a good night!)

Anyone care to join me on Monday for round two?
