I just ate here today and the food was delicious. The service was really good- we only had to wait maybe 10 minutes before the food was served. Overall, I give this restaurant 5 stars because of the great service and amazing sushi. I will definitely come back here for more!

Awesome place they just remodeled it , good food , good service and clean definitely will come back , I tried the what the heck roll it was bomb.:) it had shrimp tempura spicy tuna crab and what the heck sauce !! We didn't do the all you can eat , our rolls were $9.95 a piece. Me and my coworkers came in on our lunch break which was only an hour long at noon and they were very attentive we were in and out of there right on time :)

4.5 stars!

Came here for a lunch buffet at the recommendation of some local family. Probably the best meal we had during our Vegas trip!

Lunch AYCE is $21 (I think dinner is $26). Some of the more expensive items aren't included in the lunch meal, but that was fine. Kids are half priced and you can opt for the AYCE option for them, or order the kids meal separately.

I love how they give you small portions of everything, so you don't get full from eating just one or two things, but can try everything. They don't give you big balls of rice with your nigiri or in the rolls either. The fish was super fresh, and even their hot food items were good (garlic chicken wings!). They even have a small bowl of udon and a bunch of other appetizer dishes... all are small portions so you can try a lot of them.

Service was alright. They came to take our order, but you can tell they slowed down by the time the 3rd or 4th round came along. We love to eat!

The only thing to watch out for is they charge a 20% tip for large parties. I've heard of 15% or 18%, but 20% seemed a bit high, especially since the service wasn't all that great. It's the only thing keeping my review at 4-4.5 instead of 5.

Oh yeah, AYCE includes dessert!!! Green tea and red bean ice cream is so good!

I wouldn't hesitate to come back next time I'm in Vegas!
Visiting from AZ. Pretty good sushi! Great selection of rolls. And for a decent price as well  the waiting staff were also very nice and helpful!

This is my go-to AYCE sushi restaurant. Like if I were to move out of Vegas, this would be my sushi spot I would miss the most. And although they have a location that's only 5 min drive away, I'd rather do the 10-15 min drive to visit this location instead. Two words: SPEEDY SERVICE.

|| SERVICE ||
For awhile I stopped visiting here just because it was more convenient for me to dine at their new location, but service was always a struggle. Since we were in the area, myself and 10 others decided to go for some AYCE sushi and chose JJANGA. TEN PEOPLE. You know you're asking for some long wait times for anything. We were seated within 10 minutes in their private room. I only hang with sushi pros, so we were ready to order immediately. Pages and pages of orders for our poor server, but I kid you not, as soon as the last person finished ordering, the first dish came out. WHAAAAAT?? I know, doesn't that sound so wonderful!? We were so shocked, and 3 min after that, the plates just started rolling in and filling are table. 

|| FOOD ||
I love the fact that they have a good handful of options for no rice rolls and they don't limit you. Probably my favorite thing about this place really, because I hate filling up with rice. I'm not going to say that the quality is absolutely impeccable like its fresh fish that's being flown in twice a week, but for an AYCE, I am definitely quite happy with the quality. As for the rolls, I'm not a roll person, but they do have quite a bit of variety so you roll lovers have lots of options! No half roll orders though! 

|| AMBIANCE || 
A causal spot that's great for dates. If you're flying solo, definitely grab a seat at the sushi bar. Sushi chefs are friendly and great company! 

Happy eating!

Late night AYCE sushi and drinking place. Average sushi at a great price if you get the AYCE which ends before 1am so arrive well before that to take advantage of it. The yuzu yellowtail was the best nigiri option when we went. I liked the crispy rice and spicy tuna from the rolls. Lots of rolls to choose from and you can also get brown rice sushi for $1 extra charge. Staff is quite friendly at this Korean owned place.
The food was really good and fresh. Played sports games on tv which was good. Recommend if you like sushi.

Best sushi in Las Vegas 
We sit at the bar every time and the service is perfect. Their flavored saki is the best (grapefruit) 
Tabiko is super fresh
Best all you can eat sushi in Vegas! Highly recommend it. My favorite rolls are the freshman roll and the Playboy special. Their fish is fresh and delicious. Lots of roll options. Reasonably priced
excited. service is attentive and friendly :) a little loud but its sat night, lol what did i expect, right? ive veen here once before... its gonna be good
I ate here twice when I was in Vegas May 2015. I ate the all you can eat and ordered off the menu the second time food is very good highly recommend it.

This is absolutely one of my fav all u can eat sushi spots!!! The staff is awesome & attentive.. Food is always terrific & Choo Choo the sushi chef will blow u away if u can find room in front of him @the bar

How can i not like this place.  Aside from the well decorated interior there was a fun personality to the workers and banners behind the sushi bar.  I was brought to this spot by a friend.  The names to the sushi menu were also very fun and worth a conversation.

It was our first experience in las vegas!this place iz amazing!we did't expect tt everything will be so delicious and not expensive! We  Reccommend to visit this place!
5 stars!
Really bad service . Very slow. Not fresh . They make you feel like you still the food from them. So many sushi place in Las Vegas don't come to this place ! very slow service.

We Yelped this restaurant on our way from Zion to Los Angeles stopping in Vegas for a bite to eat. The service was great and the food was delicious. The sushi and tempura as excellent. I also ordered a tasty combo with chicken katsu, spicy chicken and salmon teriyaki. Miso soup was perfect and the green tea was nice. I would certainly recommend this Japanese restaurant to others.

Awesome sushi! Great service! Time for food coma to kick in lol
A must for people new to sushi and professionals alike

Very good quality food, good prices, and friendly staff. Felt very comfortable as soon as I walked in. The food selection was great as well. They had pictures next to everything for their selection of rolls that made it a little easier to choose what to eat.

The sushi here is amazing, and I'm very picky with sushi. The staff is friendly, the happy hour late night is amazing, but the only thing I wish they had was alcohol!!! You need beer and sake at sushi places for sure
I like this place, mainly because they have no rice roll options. I get too full off of too much rice, and not to mention, ask the carbs you're ingesting.

HATE  Nothing.

DISLIKE  Female server forgot to put in a couple of orders. Not a good variety of desserts offered. Fried rice took a while to cook and still came out barely warm.

LIKE  Ambiance and decor. Well-dressed male hosts/servers. Streamlined a la carte pricing. The appetizers. A good variety of sushi rolls. Sushi was fresh and came in good sized portions.

LOVE  The Fresh Men roll. All the hand rolls.

20 mins to get a scoop of rice with sesame seed, a blob of gritty mashed potatoes and dried up pork katsu. 20 effing minutes 

Don't come here during your lunch break or you basically have to inhale your food.
Decent sushi but small portions. Good variety of rolls. Hole in the wall. I would return.

Came by the other day with a group of 7, and although we were unable to make a reservation ahead of time, it only took about 10 min. for us to get seated & served at a table (at around 7:30 on a Friday night, mind you.) Heck yeah! Also, as someone who is bad at doin' the sushi (and an AYCE first-timer), their menu was pretty impressive! And affordable! My personal favorite was the Jjango Burrito. I had to keep myself from just ordering that over & over ... & over again.

To sum things up, the service was great - quick & friendly - and the sushi was tasty, so no complaints here! I'll definitely be back.
My new favorite sushi restaurant.  Raising the bar on flavor and quality.  Plus, AYCE at a great price!

I hit this place last night on the recommendation of a friend.  I am not really into AYCE sushi.  I find AYCE places usually serve sub prime fish with ridiculous rules.  Also, I find the clientele at AYCE places usually makes my appetite diminish.  Not this joint! The food is AWESOME!  A hip scene and just a fun eating experience.  I sat at the sushi bar at JJanga was my sushi chef. He is funny, creative and made the experience so enjoyable.  Uni?  No problem!  Sashimi?  No problem.  Anything goes.  Also, the restaurant is not big.  That being said, there were 5 sushi chefs standing in wait to make food.  This meant a great flow of sushi.  Check it out.

I've come here twice and both enjoyable experiences. I'm vegan and they have 3 different roll selections as well as some appetizers like edamame. Which was good enough for me ! I got the all you can eat and I just ordered multiple of the same rolls.
Still the bad service. Never coming back here again.  Very unprofessional sushi chefs are working here

sashimi was amazing. oyster was very fresh and sauce was very unique and delicious. i also recommend hamachi and tofu agedash. i had all you can eat and it was worth it. overall amazing service and new chief chef is really good.

Everything here is good. The service is great! They're always passing by to see if you want to order more food. They take finished plates away when they see it on the side. It's just a great place to eat sushi! 

If you're a sushi burrito person, the jjanga & superman burrito is yummy!

Screaming O and Poke Salad is fresh! No muscles or anything chewy. 

Oysters are delish! Wish they would let the limit be more than 1 

I personally don't order the rolls, just nigiri but my brother said the rolls are very good. 

It's a must try, you won't regret it !
Good atmosphere and dining experience.   Food came out quick.   Probably want to pace yourself and not order all at once.

Another spot for AYCE sushi!

Coming from OC, my girlfriends and I met up with a local friend here for dinner on a Friday night to catch up. 

Some of the pieces I liked:
- yuzu yellowtail
- salmon
- cajun albacore (and I think either cajun salmon/tuna if they offer it)
- unagi
- sweet shrimp
- beef tataki

unfortunately I didn't eat to my heart's desire because I didn't want to feel too bloated and stuffed when we went out that night, but I was satisfied with what we had. They ran out of uni, which really bummed me out (booo!)

Service was friendly, but a bit slow. Although the fish-to-rice ratio is about equal, I'd come back again.

The fish not fresh , I ordered a kid meal cost $7 took them 30 mins and when it come out it only 2 pieces  WTH??? Not just that I got charge 20% tip for party of six when my 2 kids one is have not enough food and one not eating because he only 3 . Never come back

One of the worst plays ever there food is dry 
There customer service he's OK but whoever sits in the kitchen doesn't seems like taking care of the food taste my first and last time.

The best family or group gathering spot, and really fresh noodles to boot!  The eats are simple, fresh and need very little in the way of an adventurous palette to fill up and get on your way.  Close enough to the venues where I work but right smack in the middle of Chinatown Vegas to get the atmosphere and good, reasonably priced eats with fast-food or gourmet getting in the way.

Not digging this place! Too much rice, paper thin fish, and all the rolls are drenched in Mayo!

$20.95 for lunch and $25.95 for dinner AYCE. The sushi orders came and each had a HUGE chunk of rice and a paper thin piece of fish. The quality of fish wasn't very fresh either. The restaurant was pretty dead on a weekend night, which is a good indication of the quality. We also ordered a few appetizers to share and all the meat dishes were absolutely disgusting, super dry and the meat all tasty rubbery and not fresh at all. The rolls were also not very good, overly sugary and full of mayo and other dressing. Service was nice but the food did take a while to come out. 

Would not go out of my way to come here!

I never heard about this sushi place until I ate here for a friend's birthday. It's kind of hidden away in the corner of the plaza so it was a bit hard to find. We came around midnight and I was expecting it to be crowded since it was a Friday night, but surprisingly it wasn't bad at all. 

We all got AYCE. My favorites would have to be the garlic tuna nigiri, the Threesome roll, the uni (of course!), the Cowboy roll, and shit I can't remember what else we ordered but we just kept on going. Their menu has so many items to choose from & everything we ordered was delicious! Except for my miso soup. Kind of watered down but hey no one goes to a sushi place just for miso soup.

The nigiri fish-to-rice ratio was pretty good. There was more fish than rice, hallelujerrrr.

There is also a bar & karaoke but I'm not sure when they hold karaoke nights. Our waiters were super funny & nice. Didn't even charge us for our leftovers :)

A freaking + on this place. This is my new go-to for AYCE.

So disappointed this was my last sushi experience before I found out I was pregnant! Horrible! Will never be back! 

I did AYCE with no rolls or rice, just raw fish items and quality and flavor was really lacking. 

One of the items in my sashimi salad had gone bad, but since it's chopped, I couldn't tell which 

The screaming "o" was a huge disappointment. The dressing is awful and portion is a joke 

The cooked items were decent

Went there last night for a friend's birthday . Fast seating for 13 , but it was really fkn hot in there. The lady said "the ac is working, it's just there was a large group before so that's why it's hot " .... That doesn't even make any sense =.= ... I had to complain 3x to get a water filled with ice . That was there first mistake . Can you see that were already complaining about how hot it is and you give us water with no ice . Logic women . So many other things went wrong and I'm definitely sure my friend will write a more thorough review... But never going back

"What"?, "Huh?"  "Say again." That about sums up the conversation my girlfriend and I were able to have in this sushi spot. I must be getting old because it was just too loud. The server was a complete DOLL and moved us out from underneath the speaker, still too loud. We ordered a la carte and the sushi was a-ok, nothing to get excited about. In a sea of sushi spots, this spot wouldn't be on top of my list. The decor was super cool though.

Yikes. Food was decent but the whole experience was definitely not worth the money. Slow service. Lots of food given to the wrong tables. Dirty bathroom. Manager with an attitude. Food forgotten completely. Server MIA for most of the meal with different bus boys/girls helping us instead. Last but not least- no working air conditioning during the middle of summer.

I go here all the time and am always greeted with a great attitude. The sushi is fresh and always delicious. The staff is full of life and always having a good time while providing excellent service. I would recommend this place to any sushi lover every time.

My boyfriend and I absolutely love Jjanga! Their AYCE price is great and they have a happy hour from 11pm-1am that we frequently come to, so we've always found that we get our money's worth. Their menu is very extensive so there's great choices for everybody; we've been working our way through everything and we love all of the rolls! The staff is also super friendly and attentive, great service. If you're coming in a group it's also worth doing the karaoke, so much fun. My favorite roll is the Playboy Special :) we highly recommend Jjanga! Our favorite restaurant!

Went here yesterday to get our sushi fix after a nice day of hiking icebox canyon.  Our party of 6 was famished and was quickly seated for lunch.  It wasn't very busy as it was a weekday and we were having a late lunch.  "The sooner I can sit down, the sooner I can get started on stuffing my face!" is what I say.

I know it's difficult to have a large party go for AYCE, but when the staff forgets about what you ordered and constantly have to be reminded of it, you know there's some organization issues in the back.  There were a couple of dishes that didn't even make it to the table before our check did.  Regardless, it was a good start, but the staff couldn't handle our giant appetites towards the end.

Some notable dishes we had involved fresh fish and good flavor combinations.  Their maguro (red tuna) was excellent that day!  I'm normally a fan of salmon, but the nigiri to order was the maguro.  The redder, the better!  I also really enjoyed their Spider Roll (a classic) and their Double D Roll.  The Double D Roll was listed under their shrimp tempura special rolls and had great intermingling of flavors along with a little kick at the end.  It was one of our favorites!  Another plus was that they do not pack on the rice!

Now on to the not-so-great dishes.  The shiro maguro (albacore) that we ordered came seared when we were under the impression that it would have been raw.  Upon eating it, you could definitely taste a distinct fishiness, which shouldn't be the case if it were fresh.  They also topped it with what tasted like the garlic sauce they usually put on top of garlic tuna.  Since this was my first time here, I wasn't sure if this was their norm to sear the shiro maguro.  I honestly think this fish was on its way to going bad, so they needed to serve it but mask the extra fishy flavor.  Another one that wasn't so appetizing was their super white tuna, which isn't listed on their menu but somehow had it when we asked for it.  It was a little disappointing because the freshness wasn't there.  There were a couple of other nigiri that just didn't cut it to my expectation of freshness, but these two were the most distinct.

I would like to see this business succeed because the ambiance, decor and cleanliness of the restaurant is excellent.  The staff really has potential to excel!  Our server was very accommodating and attentive, but unfortunately the lunch staff in the back couldn't accommodate our large orders. I probably won't be back unless they make some changes to their organization and quality.

P.S. If you're in a bind for choosing your dessert, get the green tea mochi.  It appears to me that it is homemade and you really taste the yummy green tea flavor!  You won't regret it!

There is an AYCE Sushi place on 215/Durango I used to patronize religiously, until certain rolls became dinner only.  Based on the Yelp reviews, decided to give Jjanga a try.  The other reviewers were right about the wait, but it was well worth it.  We also grabbed another couple (we had no idea whom they were) and table shared, which I think startled the staff but made wait times shorter since a lot of us were just tables for two.  As a result, we got amazing service.
The Red Bull roll is amazing--just the right amount of hot with a touch of sour/bitter.  Also great was the garlic tuna nigiri, the poki salad, and the cowboy special.  I was not impressed with the Arizona Roll, and that was the only downer of the night--without the ginger sauce it's very bland.  
The fish was fresh, the service was as fast as it could be for a packed restaurant, the servers were attentive, and it has a really pleasant atmosphere.  We're new fans!

Huuumazing, this place was absolutely fabulous. Could not recommend more and I am a total sushi snob. Very creative, yet still traditional rolls that were all amazing in quality. Can not wait to go back!
Great place , perfect renovation. Jina was great and food is amazing been coming here for years

The only place you should be going for all you can eat sushi!! Crunch Roll is a must try, and don't forget the Spider roll!! Definitely coming back... again and again! And Jina is amazing... so is her name tag!

good food I love rolls delicious!!!!
nice atmosphere 
everyone is friendly
yummy desert
Best all you can eat sushi I've had in a long while! Atmosphere is great- I don't think it's divey at all. Service was super friendly and the food quality was high. Definitely going back for more!

I was looking for a sushi buffet and I came across Jjanga. Reviews and pictures looked good so we made the trek out here. It's not too far from the strip if you have a car. It's located in a janky plaza, but the inside is decorated like a fancy establishment - the kind that you would find on the strip. Jazzy atmosphere here and the service is excellent. 

The manager greeted us and would walk around to make sure everything was running smoothly. We did have a dedicated waitress but everyone pitched in to make sure our drinks were filled and our table was never bare. Great service! 

Dinner was $25.95 per person. 

The sushi was pretty fresh and the chefs are creative. Here are some of my favorites:

+ Crazy Ass
+ Monkey Burrito
+ Jackpot Special
+ Nigiri!! 

I can't believe they had uni on their AYCE! Wow~ My only issue for it not being 5 star is that when we asked them to recommend stuff they recommended stuff we ended up not liking. They recommended the Jjanga Special, and the Something Wrong #69. When my hubs tried the first piece he was like "something's wrong" and almost spit out his food. So I would be careful about taking their recommendations. 

For most of the meal I stuck to just getting nigiri. We also tried their mochi and ice cream. Not sure where they're getting their ice cream. It tasted slightly different. Not bad, just different.
This place is awesome, the customer service and the food! The chefs and servers are really really nice and the chefs do an amazing job! Come to the sushi bars for the awesome experience!!!

Totally worth it for AYCE $26 plus you get unlimited ice cream or an order of mochi per person. Servers are really nice. Restaurant has a very cool interesting vibe. Highly recommended for sushi lovers! Definitely coming back for more

We stopped by here for a snack as the day was getting away from us and it was just what we needed. Such lovely ladies to greet us and make us feel welcome. The sushi rolls were flavourful and generous in size and usually I don't even comment on soda drinks because you take it for granted but their colas were somehow amazing (maybe recently changed and we'll carbonated). Anyway, love this place. Will definitely return when I'm in the area.
Loved the AYCE! The no-rice rolls sounded weird to me, but they were delish!!! Especially the tuna one!

Want Great Sushi away from the strip crowd and overpriced items? Come here! Their AYCE is the best deal! I come here at least once a month, perhaps every other week is more accurate. 

Things to try off their menu:
garlic tuna
Yozu Yellowtails (refreshing, lemon-y yellowtail)
XXX
Taste like your ex GF
Monkey Burrito
Jjanga burrito
Pink lady
tuna naruto (sauce on the side, if you like it less messy)

I have been following Jjanga since his days at Sumo on Warms springs! I'm glad him and his crew went on their own, so they fully explore what they can do with sushi.

Honestly you cannot go wrong with anything, depending on your taste. Also had the Bulgogi on the menu, sometimes it can be very onion-rich, but it's still good.

If you are in Vegas for a visit and want good off-strip food, this place should be on your must list!

Best service for AYCE sushi in town. The dishes come out fast, the orders are on point and service friendly. You can't ask for much more out of an AYCE other than a larger variety of fish and more desserts (perhaps cheesecake or offering something similar to Goyemon's dessert menu). That's nitpicking though because everything here tastes fresh and delicious. The yellowtail here is among if not the best one for Vegas AYCE. Prices here are about the same for dinner but the speed, accuracy and friendly service sets Jjanga high above other similar restaurants. Definitely recommend

Went there the first week they opened late night and the food was pretty good so decided to come again for AYCE which was ok, I probably would not be back the food was ok not as great as I first thought. The place is nicely decorated and got some good music going.

My family was pretty excited to try out JJANGA, but we were somewhat disappointed. We got there at around 7:00 pm and ordered about 5 minutes after that. However, the appetizers that we ordered didn't get to our table until 8. The wait was pretty long but it seemed like the rolls were coming out at a fast pace. But we started receiving a bunch of rolls that weren't ours. We had ordered around 25 rolls and 14 of those orders were wrong. The customer service was pretty good until they started to talk back to us. The one waiter claimed that we ordered 7 of the same rolls when we didn't even order it in the first place. All in all, it was a pretty bad experience. Also, thanks for the 10% off. :^)

I just cant stand the fake korean waitresses here who have attitude and pretend to be nice.  Not sincere. Korean robots is how i describe this waitress who served me today. Ur serving Ppl here.  Be genuine or find another job! Owners are nice. Sushi chefs are awesome.  Just do a poor job at picking Ppl on their frontline.

On a night when Goyemon didn't offer their salmon belly special, we ended up trying Jjanga. The nice thing was that there was no wait for dinner. The limit for the AYCE was 1 hour, but I don't know how strictly that was enforced. Dinner was $25.95, which is comparable to most AYCE sushi joints.

Some of the highlights of the menu include the sashimi (choice of one item per person), hamachi kama, bulgogi, tobiko, sweet shrimp, oyster, and uni. Despite the lack of salmon belly here, the regular salmon nigiri was perfect as well as the version with the apple mayo sauce. I also really enjoyed the yuzu yellowtail. We skilled most of the rolls, but did try the hand's job. As one might expect, it was drenched in "yum yum" cream sauce and quite messy.

I was pleasantly surprised by how great all the nigiri was. The dessert included a delicious coconut flake ice cream, with flavors including green tea, which was quite creamy. The downsides of this AYCE menu are the lack of any specials, a much smaller nigiri menu, and less variety with the desserts. On top of that, our waitress denied us ordering more than one dessert even though the menu does not state a limit.
Exactly what you want from an Asian buffet in Vegas. Great service and solid food. Don't forget the Snapchat worthy menu.

I've been looking for a new sushi place and I think this is definitely one that I would come back to.

Atmosphere: Pretty dark. One thing I didn't like? Our table was awkwardly really close to the table next to us and it was hard to get in the chairs. Their tables and chairs are different from most places. 

Service: Very attentive. Waiters and waitresses came up to us constantly and made sure that we had everything we ordered or to check if we wanted to order anything else. 

Food: The nigiri was pretty good. I really enjoyed the beef and garlic tuna sashimi. We didn't eat too many rolls

Janga burrito handroll: It had a little kick in the end of it. I really enjoyed this because it was different from what you see at other places

Lion roll: Pretty tasty, but it had a lot more rice than I'm used to so it got me pretty full at the end. 

Dessert: You can only have one mochi ice cream, but you could always choose one mochi and one ice cream!

Not bad.
Fun place.
Friendly.
I might come back. But the quality of the fish is not that high.

I'm suspicious of some of the "one or two review" people" who've posted here.
This is the core flaw of the Yelp business model: jamming the reviews for a new restaurant so that they get some heat....
Is everything in life a hustle?

For AYCE sushi, Yama Sushi is better. 

For pure sushi: go to Sen of Japan.

For spending a lot of money on tiny pieces of fish from exotic locations that in the end don't provide much pleasure, go to Kabuto.

I usually come to Jjanga and usually enjoy the food and service but this time I was extremely disappointed. The only reason why this review is getting 2 stars is because I enjoyed the food. But honestly the best tasting food can make you change your mind when it takes 30 minutes for you to get your first roll. 

Upon entry the lady (guessing she was new because she DID NOT know how to serve at all and I'm a server so I was giving her the benefit of the doubt for the first 20 minutes) took our drink orders, which you think wouldn't take so long since all I ordered was water but no I had to flag down another server after 15 minutes of just sitting and waiting before I got my glass of water. 

Placed our order and I did not get my first roll until we were sitting there for 30 minutes. Not to mention that all I ordered was nigiri! Later I asked for them to put a dash of Masago on top of my baked green muscles and our server proceeded to charge me EXTRA for a dash of Masago.

Extremely disappointed and will definitely not be coming back to Jjanga. Definitely letting my friends know not to come to Jjanga unless they want to be charged extra, get horrible service and wait 30 minutes for the first roll to come out.

My boyfriend introduced me to this place a little while ago and I have to say that it is awesome. It is not expensive and they have something for everyone. He is like a sushi connoisseur and loves to eat everything single thing on the menu. I, on the other hand, can only stomach a few pieces of raw fish before I tap out. JJANGA has an All-You-Can-Eat option and it doesn't have to apply to everyone at the table, which is great because my bf can pig out while I enjoy the few rolls that I love. Speaking of their rolls, they have so many and the ones that I have tasted have been deeeelicious!

This place is reallyyy good!

Very cool vibe and chill sushi chefs. Def a must try!

So disappointed in the service today. The waitress was unfriendly and never returned to our table. I had to flag down other people to make my order or get refills. My 7 year old son had to pay full price for AYCE. I don't think I will return.
Pretty good rolls but not satisfied freshness  sashimi . But variety are great and nice deco and fun place .

Giving it 3 stars for the service only for the food unfortunately I would give it 1 star. I I've been to discuss some before when it was Kanji and it was absolutely amazing. I have seen really great reviews for this place so I expected more. Only came here for my husband's team dinner so the food was free. I have never been to a all you can eat sushi place and don't think I'd ever try one again. The sushi and everything else besides the fried rice was bland and I mean completely without flavor unless you added soy sauce. The fish tasted like fish there was just nothing special or memorable about anything. Would not go back unless it was another team dinner and would not pay to eat here even if it is all you can eat.

My friend wanted to do AYCE sushi, and we thought we'd try a place we've never been to. Jjanga has been on my list for awhile, so why not. The price was right, coming it at a buck or two cheaper than Umiya that I usually go to. Our server was friendly, dealing with our rowdy bunch throughout our meal. All the food was good, but they did forget a few things along the way.

I definitely wasn't a fan of how they handled the check, which bumped them down to 3* instead of 4*. I believe it was the manager who came over and handed us the bill, and then awkwardly stood there as the 5 of us pulled out cards and cash and tried to figure out how we were divying up the bill. I get that we were there for a long time and they were effectively cutting us off, but there were more tactful ways of doing it. Not sure if our server asked the manager to handle it or he took it upon himself, but again, there are more polite ways to bring us the check and give us time to sort it out.

I'd go here again, but if I'm picking, I'll stick with Umiya.

This is my favorite AYCE sushi place in Las Vegas. The food is always fresh and tasty with good portions of fish. They have an incredible assortment of items to choose from, and the staff is always polite and friendly. I recommend sitting at the bar for the best experience. Andy is a great chef as are the other guys behind the bar. I've been here a number of times, and I've never been disappointed.

Food is not as good as it used to be. Different menu, food was served in a very messy way, not impressed with new management, every crew looked so stressed out, but still mananged to smile to every costumer that comes in. Mostly of the rolls were full of fake crab meat with very little fish. This used to be one of our favorite Japanese AYCE place but now i wouldn't even recommend it.

The place to go to for AYCS in Las Vegas. I always come to JJangga everytime I am in Vegas. A large selection of different sushi and rolls, fresh ingredients, friendly staff and most of all delicious food!! Reasonably priced for the kind of food you get, too.
AYCE is great!  Bento box is on the small side.  Friendly staff. Kitchen is  a bit slow (maybe because it's Christmas Day).  I will definitely eat here again.  Good value and fresh food.

I can't rave enough about this place. They just opened in February 2014. I discovered them through yelp and so glad I did. We've been here 3x in the last 2 weeks. Why? Excellent service hands down! Their sushis are so fresh and really, really good  JJnga is such a fun atmosphere. It will truly give you one of the best dining experience. It's also kid friendly which offers a variety of bentos for children.

Jjanga has two locations, which both are good. I would say the newest one that opened on Ft. Apache has better customer service. 

They have an excellent AYCE - All You Can Eat - selection and they are not stingy with it. You can order as much as you want. They say the Salmon Belly nigiri is limited, but you can easily order three pieces per person without them saying anything. The best part about this place is their epic hand rolls. The Lisa Hand Roll and the Jjanga burrito is very unique. 

The Lisa Hand roll comes with fried tempura, spicy tuna, crab, and avocado. Add a hint of soy sauce and wasabi and you have yourself one of the best hand rolls ever made in town! The Jjanga burrito is wrapped with soy paper, crab meat, green onion, and shrimp fried rice inside. This can be eaten with soy sauce or alone. it is all based on your preference. 

The nigiri pieces are decent. The rice to sushi ratio is reasonable. They are not too strict, but will encourage you to take it slowly. However, they can keep up with you if you decide to order a lot. I recommend coming here not during rush hour because this place gets pretty packed on the weekends, during lunch, and dinner time! It is an awesome place to Karaoke as well. There are limited rooms, but you can request it, eat sushi, drink, and sing your heart out with your friends! Also, get an order of the chicken wings. They are really good. They take awhile to make so order it early and let it cool down when it gets to your table. You don't want to burn your tongue! 

The seating is okay. Sometimes it is a bit uncomfortable when you have to sit in a booth and the table is too far away from the booth seat. So I recommend getting seated somewhere you can have control of the table and actually move it closer to you. I recommend coming here on an empty stomach since it is all you can eat. You want to make sure you get your money's worth. 

Remember, the service is not the best. The Ft. Apache location I experienced better service at. Sometimes these people have a language barrier and it gets super busy so they can become overwhelmed quickly. You will need to be patient and enjoy the company of great people as you wait for your server to come. There is always Japenese pop music playing in the background, which is always fun to listen to while you eat.

Try to different fruit sake. They will not get you too tipsy, but they are tasty to drink. For desert, I recommend you try the vanilla ice cream. Yes, it seems plain, but it really is THAT good.

Let me just start off by saying how bad the service is. I did the all you can eat with some of my friends, and they never came back to ask us what else we wanted. I constantly had to get their attention. Also, not to mention I asked for a refill and one of the girls just looked at me and walked. If they didn't mandatorily take gratuity off of my bill I wouldn't have tipped them.

Hate to leave a 5 star review and have this place get too over crowded lol but they deserve it! It's in an unsuspecting location in a small strip mall. Not much to look at on the outside but once inside it's really nice and inviting. We went about 6pm so it wasn't too busy no wait at all. Ordered the AYCE sushi and appetizers. Best decision we ever made lol we tried just about everything and everything was delicious. The Ahi poke was great and the hand rolls were awesome too. There wasn't anything we didn't like. Service was on point they brought out everything well timed and not too much at once. Best $26 bucks ever spent on dinner. Will definitely be back and maybe checkout their karaoke rooms too :)

I haven't been to an AYCE sushi place in a long time because I generally eat too much and the quality doesn't compare with some of the more upscale places.  That being said, I was glad to come to a birthday lunch at Jjanga with some friends.  And yes, I did overeat!

Sushi restaurants seem to try to outdo each other with names for rolls and for fillings as a hook for customers.  Dancing eel, Burning your ass, and Jackpot just to name three--all of which I fully ate or shared with others at the table.

The burning your ass is an example.  It has soft shell crab and spicy tuna but you couldn't taste the seafood because it had to live up to its name.  The tuna was spicy tuna but it was overwhelmed by the spiciness of the roll, the sriracha on top, and then slices of jalapeo on top of that.  But, that's what I wanted and it was good.  It was very hotly spiced rice.

The Jackpot roll and Mel's roll were good.  The crispy things they put on the rolls are interesting and add texture.  It was the first time I'd had them.

For the finale, I had both red bean and green tea ice cream.  It was a nice way to end this food orgy.

Service was first rate!  With a group of 14 people calling out orders to the server things sounded hectic.  She kept right up with us and things were served in a timely manner.

This is a fine place for a group dinner with privacy like this.  It was such good fun to enjoy ourselves in our own room.
Here having lunch just 2 days after the new renovation grand reopening change of owner. It is much more roomy and airy. Wow the food and fish is fresher and better.

They have a great variety of rolls and the fish tastes really good! I came with Amy partner as well that does not like fish but they have many different options of appetizers to choose from that are also really good. The service was outstanding since our server continuously checked up on us incase we were ready to order more and refilled our waters constantly. I asked her about her opinion on certain rolls and she responded honestly and was happy how she was able to give me options based on my preference. Definitely will be coming back!

3$ sushi....awesome instead of ordering all you can...this is a good way of trying a lot with very very cheap price...if u are interested in all u can eat for lunch it's $20.95 and for dinner it's 25.95...or else you can just order whatever u want they have really good cucumber salad..love it...

Great new spot!  Most employees are previously from sumo sushi on SW side of town.  Really good service and quality of fish.  The jovial manager made our night, he hooked it up with yellowtail sashimi and tall asahi beer.  Checked up on us and recommended some popular sushi they had!  Suggest checking out photos and picking your selection from there before ordering.  Big plus is they're open late and the decor is clean Japanese new school.  Will come again soon.

I hate that I have to live two states away in Colorado, knowing that amazing sushi is so far away.  I think about JJANGA almost weekly when I crave sushi and realize that the stuff around here just doesn't cut it.

We went to JJANGA at the tail end of our wedding weekend, hours before our return flight home.  We wanted something off-strip, affordable and AYCE.  We wanted to be able to drive there, park without a valet, and then return our rental car in time.  Yelp led us to JJANGA and I can't wait to go back.  I love the vibe of the restaurant.  It's heavy in dark woods with booths that sort of resemble pagodas.  There's a nice long sushi bar tucked in the back.  The sushi bar was popular but we were lucky to score two seats right in the middle of the sushi-making action.

I can't remember everything we tried but the rolls were innovative and plentiful.  The sushi chef handed us small bites and tastes along the way.  I think JJANGA's special hook is their "burritos," which are small bundles of fish or rice noodles and fish or other fixings wrapped in soy paper.  We ordered one that was wrapped in pink soy paper and drizzled with a pink sauce.  

Fish was premium and veggies were fresh.  I didn't feel like I was eating AYCE.  Most AYCE sushi restaurants shove you full of rice, mostly, and make you want to calculate the price of each roll so you can ensure you've gotten your $30 worth of food.  This sushi restaurant makes you want to take a minute to appreciate the cuts of fish and their garnishes.  

I'm not sure how long JJANGA has been open but I hope they don't make too many changes to their menu, philosophy or prices before we can get back to Las Vegas.  I know it will be near the top of our list of restaurants to visit the next time we have a weekend getaway.

If I can only use one word to describe my overall experience at JJANGA, it would be "mediocre". No offense, but I am somewhat skeptical to try any korean-run Japanese restaurant. As stated by another yelper Philip T., "Calling this Japanese is very misleading". This restaurant is not your typical traditional Japanese restaurant. A lot of fusion style/unique, rather unnecessary touch added to sushi. 

SERVICE
Nothing bad to say about the service here. Fast and friendly service. All the food came out quickly and place was clean.

FOOD
I love sushi, but not a fan of fusion/innovative rolls. I don't know if it is because I am still traumatized from my first fusion roll experience where I ate a sushi with cream cheese and mango (it just doesn't go together...just no). I stepped out of my comfort zone and tried one of their deep-fried sushi called Touch Down. $8 for 5-7 small pieces and it was nothing special.

I also tried their Alaska roll. Very simple roll with just avocado and thick slice of salmon inside. Decent portion for the price and I enjoyed the thick cut of salmon in it. I would order this again if I ever come back. 

I also tried Unagi bowl which was another mediocre dish. Thinly-sliced Unagi on rice. Nothing special.

CONCLUSION
This place seemed overpriced for their mediocre food. Everything I tried wasn't anything spectacular.

Please don't First off I would like to say JJ "the manager" is super SEXY lol. He is really nice and the customer service here is impeccable. All the wait staff are very attentive. OK.. now about the food, AYCE is great. Best sushi I have ever had and I am from California where we have sushi places everywhere. I seriously have to go to Las Vegas, specifically JJANGA, to get my sushi craving fixed. Love this place!!! Would totally recommend this place. 5 stars!! Recommendations - Tastes like my ex-girlfriend roll, Double D roll, Fresh men roll, Screaming orgasm, poke salad, Japanese lasagna,  and their green tea ice cream is to die for.
Best late night sushi spot, for those late night cravings! Great service, great food, and even better memories!

The best sushi spot in SW Las Vegas! They have the best all you can eat sushi & they offer half orders of rolls, which allows you to order and taste more sushi rolls! I love the fact that they are open until 2 am as well! :)

Jjanga is AYCE for $25.95
Jjanga is new and not busy
Jjanga has excellent service
Jjanga is a good pick if you're looking for some Yum Yum Rolls. 

I'm not a sushi snob, but I do prefer Sashimi's and Nigiri over rolls.  It's been forever since I've had a Yum Yum Roll.  For some reason, I was craving these California Rolls drenched in mayo. It's been awhile. It's been a very long time.  So, when the gf suggested sushi for our Valentine's Day dinner instead of our usual steak dinner, I couldn't help be get a little excited about it.  

From the time we walked in to the time we left, we had nothing but excellent service.  The team at Jjanga can sure teach a few other sushi restuarants out there about customer service.  They know what's up and they knew how to treat me and my special lady.  Good Job, Jjanga!

My Items:
Mells Roll:  This was my first roll of the evening. How could I not get this roll, right?  Inside was crab and shrimp.  This roll has a spectacular name, but was just okay when it came to taste.  
 
Jjanga Burrito:  This is a hand roll with shrimp, broccoli tempura, and crab wrapped in soy paper.  This was actually pretty good and great light option if you're looking for something that isn't going to weigh you down. 

Jackpot Special:  Jackpot!  I think I found the king of all Yum Yum Rolls.  This one had shrimp tempura on the inside with spicy tuna, shrimp tempura, and of course a ton of mayo sauce on the outside.  If you're going to eat bad, might as well get this. I probably could have gotten two of these rolls. 

Freshman Roll:  This had everything...tuna, salmon, and crab.  Wrapped in rice paper, my taste buds were a little confused on what it was tasting because there was so much going on.  But I still thought that this was good.  

Teriyaki Chicken w/Brown Rice:  What was I thinking?  The brown rice wasn't the best and the chicken was a little bland even with Teriyaki sauce. My bad...I shouldn't be going to a sushi restuarant expecting great chicken. 

Regarding their food, I only had 4 full rolls, their Jjanga burrito, Teriyaki chicken, and Green Tea Mochi.  Needless to say, I was stuffed.  I thought that the sushi was fresh, the rolls were tight, and all were packed with taste.  Bottomline, the food is fresh.  On my next visit, I will probably go back to Sashimi's and Nigiri's because that's what I prefer.  But from someone that doesn't frequent a Yum Yum Roll, I recommend this place. I

PS:  They got the same rolls as Sumo. So if you're a fan of Sumo, then you'll be a fan of Jjanga.


YELP PERSONAL CHALLENGE - (048/366)

I've been to JJANGA twice now, and I wish I could say I love it but I don't...  Don't get me wrong, it's ok. I just know that when I want AYCE sushi, there are other places near JJANGA that do it better. 

Both of my visits have been for lunch, right at opening (11:30 am), and I sat at the bar. 
On both visits, waitress service was on point. No orders were forgotten, and drinks always refilled. 

On my first visit, Choo-Choo was the sushi chef. He was great, tons of personality, and he hooked us up with his special off-menu creation which was delicious.
On my second visit, I overheard the person seated next to me ask the chef to just make him his favorite, off-menu creations. The chef told him he would only do that if the customer paid the higher AYCE dinner price, which I thought was pretty lame. 

For nigiri, I find JJANGA's offerings to be ok.. decent enough fish quality and fish/rice ratio.  For rolls, some of the speciality rolls sound like they could be interesting, but sadly most of the ones I have tried have fallen flat flavor-wise. And I can't get past that weird pink sauce that is on some of them...  I did like the rice-less Tuna Naruto a lot though!

Overall, I suppose JJANGA would do in a pinch, if other spots were too busy. Personally, I prefer to do my ACYE sushi eating up the street at another spot though...

My budget will not allow me to consume the copious amounts of sushi that my tummy craves.  Enter Jjanga.  You know the age old concept of it is has less calories, you can consume more of it?  Well, apparently I think because it is cheaper, I can buy more of it, as I find myself here embarrassingly often. I have yet to dine in, but regularly get to-go orders.  I try to limit my take-out orders here to once a month, but it isn't easy.

It's not Soho or even Sushi Koma, but I recommend it for good, affordable sushi.  Also, service is great and every roll we have tried is very good.  Our favorites are all of the nigiri and the spicy rolls.

What a great place! We ordered the AYCE sushi and it was definitely worthwhile. My friend and I must've ordered 8 plates each and we had no complaints on any of them. The fish was definitely fresh and delicious and the service was excellent. We had several workers check in on us repeatedly to be sure we weren't overlooked. I think a more organized waiting system may help them in the long run so that customers aren't asked the same questions repeatedly though! We had to tell servers that we had already placed an order pretty often. We did visit during peak hours so that may be the reason for the extra care they took to be attentive so no one was overlooked though. Our food was superb from appetizer to desert with a good balance between rice and fish throughout. The portions were also excellent to allow for a wider selection before getting full. We were both very pleased with our first visit here and will likely come again, next time for the karaoke!

This is one of the better AYCE sushi places in Vegas.  

They have karaoke rooms if you're into singing with your sushi.  Didn't ask about pricing, but that was interesting.

The food itself comes out to about $30 after tax per person.  They have a bunch of rolls and sushi to choose from.  They separate their rolls in categories such as shrimp tempura based rolls and no rice rolls.  There are a few items where they limit one order per person, such as Uni, sweet shrimp, and a handful of other items.   The rice to fish ratio is just OK here.  There are other places that give you more fish though.

Parking is in a strip mall.  Not really an issue. The 3 stars is relative to other AYCE sushi joints in vegas.  WIth that said, if this were in LA, it would be 5 stars for sure.

I've been to a lot of the "popular" sushi places in town that I won't name simply because Jjanga is above the rest and don't fall in the same category. Lots of great tasting sushi choices! Service is on point within 3 minutes of placing our order 2 of our rolls made it to the table, and this was on a Saturday night. Staff is great very attentive and they work as a team which is nice to see. Highly recommend this place to everyone who likes sushi and quality service.

My sister had recommended this place to me. She had found this lil gem while looking for a last min sushi restaurant. My bf and I decided to check this place out and we thought the sushi restaurant was really good. They had all you can eat and the service was great. We didn't even have to wait too long compared to other sushi restaurants. The sushi tasted fresh. We enjoyed the banners of the chefs on the walls. It was funny how they made it look like Iron Chef :) Will be going back to try out other rolls!

Ate there Saturday night - 4 of us, the sushi  was pretty good -the AYCE deal was priced about right .. The service was really good attentive and enthusiastic..    I have had better sushi but I paid significantly more . I also ordered non-sushi sides (bulgoki and  tempura) and they were very good . ...   The music was obnoxious, but I think that in this case I am just an old fart...
Delicious sushis rude boss + slow waiters but delicious what r u going to do about it!!!

The sushi restaurant  quality of sushi So bad , yellowtail fish is not fresh, all are very salty, 
Sushi has a lot of rice and very few fish?
We were not busy when we went to eat, but when they were busy, they did not serve my table again.
Again sushi is not fresh and Very unpalatable?
Food is very salty. I have been drinking water all time . They hope we don't eat too much.
I will not return to this very bad sushi restaurant anymore

Awesome hidden Gem! Everyone was very friendly! The atmosphere was great! And the sushi.... was bomb. Com! Everything was very fresh. Very unique and super tasty rolls. Can't help but eat myself into a coma. Will definitely be back!!

Jjanga never fails to take care of us whenever we come here! I love it!!! 

We are always greeted warmly -- the way you greet family that you haven't seen in awhile. 

Food is always sexy and amazing!!! Today's special, they have the "Salmon Skin Salad".. So good!!!

Of course, JihWan is always so engaging and such a ball of energy! He just adds to the experience.

Our server/s are always quick and attentive..

Overall dining experience is always great! And these are the reasons we keep coming back to Jjanga Sushi!

Yeah, I'm not so sure about this place anymore.

I wanted to eat elsewhere tonight but, long story short, it's a place with long wait times and they gave away the table when my out-of-town friends were late to arrive. I chose JJANGA as the backup AYCE sushi restaurant because I'd enjoyed it in the past and because it was just a couple of miles from plan A.

Most of the food wasn't too bad. I had a lot of the same things as in my first review, so I'll make comparisons as I can.

Screaming orgasm and golden scallop were still pretty good, and I can hardly ever complain about any baked green mussels. Hotate ebi skewer was alright, but I did feel that the lone bay scallop (a tiny cylindrical piece) didn't represent the "hotate" very well. Pike mackerel was annoying because I kept having to dig out pieces of bone, and I thought the accompanying sauce was too vinegar-y.

My nigiri favorites from last time all held up: beef tataki (the best of the bunch), super white, salmon, yuzu yellowtail, and unagi. I do feel that I would have enjoyed the salmon and super white more at other places though.

The monkey burrito was still tasty. Screaming honey seemed to have less of the sauce than last time, and the presentation inside a bowl instead of on a plate struck me as odd.

Now for the escalating series of bad news. First, I learned from the server that the hotate nigiri would definitely also have been bay scallop, which is unfortunate when I can get fresh scallop at my favorite place just a couple of miles down Decatur. Another mystery that was taken away was the amaebi, which I found out was too mushy. The worst part, however, was the uni. After I ordered it, I saw that another person had received uni that appeared too dark-orange, even brownish. I tried to wave a server down to cancel my order, but by the time I managed to do so, somebody had already brought my uni out. This order appeared pale and even gray. Obviously, I refused to eat it.

I might still consider this location as a plan B, but only for desperate situations such as tonight. However, it's no longer a top tier AYCE sushi restaurant in my book. I can see why Michael K. would have lost interest in AYCE if he been eating here. If you're reading this, buddy, there's still other great places in Vegas!

Had the tempura shrimp entre--nicely cooked, good amount of shrimp with the order, and inexpensive. One of the sides was kind of strange--is that their "sweet mushed potato"? Cold, pale pink, mostly mashed with some chunks of potato. I thought it was a rather mild potato salad.

Much better experience overall than last time. Music is still too loud, though.
Pretty mediocre. Nice staff but quality was average. Won't be back. Decor is old, staff in t shirts. All You Can Eat menu is basic

Went for the lunch the waitress was kind of rude and we had the to wait for her to get our order 
And every time she forgot some items 
The sushi are OK but not great and the portion very small

This store used to be my favorite sushi store, ever since they changed management and the menu, only the ice cream was satisfying... the seafood isn't fresh anymore, from the sweet shrimp, uni, soggy seaweed wrap and overly aged salmon egg... really disappointed... 

Three server serving 5 tables, only offer to refill tea once and couldn't find a server to order for 10 min, overall wouldn't come back ever.

First time here, we did AYCE and the food was great! Lunch price $20.95 and dinner price $25.95. Fish was fresh and the uni was delicious (uni is usually hit or miss and this was def a hit!). This is my mom's favorite sushi place and now mine too! Will def be back.
Best all you can eat iv had in a long time. Very fresh and the restaurant is extremely clean.
Delicious sushi! I wanted to try every roll they had but I ran out of room! My friends and I had a great time drinking, eating, and hanging out. Fabulous place for dinner with or without the kids!
Very cool place. Great food. Friendly stuff. All you can eat menu.

Been here at jjanga a few times before, and came back after they recently renovated.

We tried the new lobster roll additions to the menu and were surprised at the taste. It was very nice and pleasant clean feel.

The portions were nicely sized, the baked and deep fried rolls were nice and fresh.

For an all you can eat restaurant a very nice joint. Good atmosphere, good quality to value ratio and a broad selection of food. Both in cold and warm.

We went here with a local friend who comes here often. So don't know if we had a special treatment, of a normal one. But all together a nice experience.

The food is delivered quickly to the table. Most things together. You can order multiple pieces at once. No hars rules. Only thing we noticed was that we liked the nigiri much, much more than the rolls. But that can be a personal thing. Something we would really recommend is the salmon belly. Very good.

We will definitely visit this place again when in town.
First time here and we loved it!  The atmosphere was great and the food was delicious!  My favorite was the Dancing Tiger Roll.

Great sushi!!  We both had the AYCE lunch special and all 5 rolls we picked were delicious, the fish was fresh, rice was in the perfect amount and not hard, and the flavor was perfect!   

Side note:  Their cucumber salad is rather disappointing and bland . . . but you don't pick a sushi restaurant based on the cucumber salad, thus is super minor!

The missing 5th star would be for the service.  Our server was neither here nor there, but definitely not where he needed to be when he needed to be there!!

We had lunch here at the suggestion of a local friend of ours while visiting Las Vegas. Jjanga is a hidden gem, located in a Chinatown strip mall about 20 minutes off the strip. You'd have to be a local to know about it; but it's well worth seeking out! 

All you can eat sushi for $30 made me a bit nervous. There's nothing worse than bad sushi. But this was some of the freshest fish I've ever seen! The miso soup was yummy; but my son's yakisoba arrived with severely undercooked chicken. When it was brought to managements attention, they immediately apologized and took it off the bill. 

Overall, they lose one star for raw poultry, but still rate highly for great sushi at an amazing price.

Where to start with a sushi place this bad?

Well... it's not absolutely horrid, it's just not good with terrible service.  As I write this first paragraph I am torn between two and one stars.  It's been settled one star.  Let me tell you how I got there.

Food:  The food... is not good.  I didn't get sick, I didn't think the fish tasted terrible, it was all just so very bland and off.  We started off with one of the "burritos" which was fish, krab, cucumber, and avocado, wrapped in rice and a rice paper wrap.  This was the best thing we ate.  We actually said to each other, "If this is what all their food is like, we're totally sold on this place!"  That is, however, where things started to get worse.  

We ordered about 2 dozen orders of nigiri with various fish on top.  Salmon, yellow tail, tuna, squid, and scallops.  My usual thought is that the rice should have sushi rice taste and the fish should be a decent thickness with a good texture and a little chilly.  This place basically gave us plain rice (little to no vinegar taste) with fish that I didn't know you could cut it that thin.  The most confusing part to me was that the fish was warm.  Not room temp, but warm warm.  Like, it's been sitting on top of an oven that was turned on and it didn't cook but got warm.  This made my stomach question its freshness.  

I also ordered a couple of cut rolls, rice-less rolls, and a hand roll.  The alaska hand roll to be specific.  Or as I like to call it, salmon slurry shoved into seaweed that looks like a dog just puked up a piece of salmon gristle.  I couldn't finish it to say the least.  

Food being mediocre, ok that's a 2-3 star score so why the 1?  Service.

After 45 minutes of being seated.  We had ordered twice and eaten once.  Funny how that is since their menu says, "Ordering time limit is 45 minutes".  I mean seriously, 45 minutes to cut fish in a restaurant that is NOT busy on a Friday afternoon.  When i say not busy, I mean there are 3 tables that have people at it and 6 people at the sushi bar.  45 minutes!!! The waitress responsible for our table kept on walking past us and avoided eye contact and to add salt to the wound, in the end, she charged us for dinner prices instead of lunch.  

Will i come back?  NO.  Do I think it's worth suggesting to others?  NO.  

TL:DR - Avoid at all costs.  How does this place have 4.5 stars?
One of my fav ayce sushi spots in town. Not many people carry smoked salmon but they sure do and I love it **update still super bomb!! Came in and crushed a ton of sushi within minutes.
Amazing sushi and close to my house.  Always fresh, the service is great and selection is varied.  Highly recommended!

Jjanga on S. Fapache is our favorite sushi place and this branch (which is now not associated with them anymore) is the worst. Came on today for lunch and we like to sit at the bar, the hostess told us the chef feels overwhelmed if people sit at the bar and he's by himself. Wth? There's 3 people in the entire place. That's a joke! We've come in here 2 other times and sat at the bar. The chef forgot to put cream cheese inside the roll that we ordered. Both times. Today we just got up and left really irritated. We won't be surprised if this one ends up closing. Sub par service, they're lucky there're getting 1 star by default!

Oh hey! Did I just go to the best sushi joint in  Vegas or what? This place is owned by Koreans, which I am always excited to see my fellow people... :)

We got the dinner AYCE, which I believe was $25.99 and Lunch AYCE is $20.99 and only goes till 3PM. 

I was able to enjoy a lot of things from their menu because we went with a large group. My favorite was their poke salad and their udon. Their garlic tuna, halibut, poke salad is a must try item! Their miso soup was super bland but hey, the fishes made up dor it!

I wasn't impressed. We went as a group of 10. Service was a bit lacking and our orders
came out so slow. Half of the items that we ordered never came out and after about 1.5 hours I called it quits. I never got my udon, various nigri, etc. Maybe because it is fairly new that they have to work out the system, but for now I will remain loyal to the places that I know will give me what I ordered. 

Fish quality was ok. I did try an oyster even though it is not oyster season but it was definitely not a good oyster! I can't exactly remember anything that stood out to me that said this place is UH-MAZING. It was nice that there was a bunch of variety. 

Overall, service was lacking. We couldn't find our server for a good 20 minutes and food was ok. I wouldn't be back anytime soon.

This place already has raving reviews what more can I say?! Great price, great service and great food. The yuzu yellowtail in particular impressed me the most. Oh and the fish to rice ratio was perfect too!

Sorry to say, this place is no longer owned and run by Janga.  He tried his luck in a nearby place that was Sushi Tapas and Kareoke, and it was a bomb.

Has a new place on the East Side, but I have not been there yet.

Nice all-you-can eat sushi restaurant that is very friendly and not stingy on the portions. My 15-year-old son has a hollow leg and can easily put away a small fortune in sushi, so we were hopeful this place would satisfy his craving and meet his high standards. It did not disappoint. 

Super friendly staff that can't do enough for you, even making sure you don't want just one more order of nigiri and don't forget your dessert!

Yes, the nigiri and sashimi portions are smaller, but the quality of fish was excellent, we had various kinds including salmon (including roe, hamachi, octopus. Hand rolls are generous, and they don't mind some customization. There's a nice selection of specialty rolls, and they are all normal sized. 

I'd skip the shumai, it was fried for some reason. , and the soft shell crab roll was mostly surimi mix. Chocolate mochi for dessert was a nice finish. We'll definitely hit this place up when we return to Vegas.

"WHO SAYS SUSHI? I SAY SUSHI, LET'S GO GET SOME SUSHI"

5STARS, this place is tucked away on the side of Grn Valley Grocery on Decatur/Twain.  Please do not be frightened by the surrounding location, ok so it's a little hood but if you are driving along that area of town you already know this.

We went in w/ a game plan (don't drink a lot of water, don't over do it on the appetizers, and no need to rush and stuff you face 'despite how good it may be' PACE OURSELVES)

EPIC FAIL: it was so GOOD, that I could not stop. We started off w/ spicy garlic endamame, shrimp tempura and seaweed salad.

SEAWEED SALAD: fresh, nice crunch, it is not soggy and oversaturated w/ dressing.  You have the pleasure of enjoying both the crunchy-ness of the seaweed and the sweet/tangy-ness of the dressing.

I'm not big on cream cheese and sushi rolls but the FAT ASS: a mixture of tuna, salmon, tuna w/ cream cheese and a mayo sauce. oh yea, and its DEEP FRIED.  The cream cheese is not the STAR of the roll, I find that rolls w/ cream cheese tend to be heavy w/ cream cheese.  This was not, the variety of fish that this roll is made of is the STAR.

Other rolls we tried:
Crazy ASS
Joe Special
Tiger Roll
Crunch Roll
I Love My ASS
XXX

ok, so I'm fascinated w/ A$$, these rolls are so good though, ijs.  I want to say that they have almost close to 100 rolls on the menu, the even have SUSHI BURRITOS (which I will try on my next visit)

All in All I'm hooked on this place, no not because it's walking distance from the house (it's a (+) that is walking distance) but it is AWESOME quality fish being served.

Very nice atmosphere, the restaurant is lighted and clean. (you're not sitting in the dim lighted room, trying to make out what placed in front of you.  The staff is Amazing and so nice, don't let the outside appearance detour you from enjoying GREAT sushi inside.

Sushi is good here but their chicken here isn't good, it taste fake. It use to be good but not anymore. Use to compare their food as good as Benihana, now it's ehhh... will update if it gets better again.

horrible and slow service who can't keep your order straight.  food wasn't terrible but wasn't good enough to have me come back. one and done and would NOT recommend anyone to come here when there are other, better options for ayce in Vegas.

The servers are nice. The portions are big. The food is delicious. My BF and I always do the buffet for all you can eat at 24.95$ the only down side to that is we don't have the option of ordering more than two of our favorite dishes (which is uni and oyster shooters) they do however have plenty of unlimited hand rolls that are scrum-dilli-umptious!! I rate this at 4 stars because they don't serve alcohol. Bring on the sake next time JJANGA
Best sushi in Vegas!  Great quality, fish vs rice ratio and not to mention the best chefs in town!!  You won't be disappointed!

My brother and his fiance were in town and they said that they wanted some AYCE sushi. They only have one AYCE sushi place near where they live and they said most of the rolls are basically cream cheese and rice rolls with a sneeze of fake crab or tuna. Those poor kids. 

So I went on a mission to take them to fun and decent places for AYCE sushi while in Vegas. This place has such a large menu and I also liked that they had "normal" food for my Dad who has an aversion to sushi. He was happy as a clam to order an a la carte teriyaki dinner and he loved all of it. His only complaint was that he asked for french fries but he got mashed potatoes instead.

The other 4 adults in the party did AYCE and we went pretty hard on the rolls and nigiri. The variety was pretty cool although some seemed to be a lot of repeats with maybe a small variation in an ingredient. But I do I like that they had a variety of no-rice rolls, Tuna Naruto being my favorite. My second favorite was the Big Easy roll with their garlic ponzu sauce. The poke salad was a little off and did not taste very fresh to me. 

Sometimes they were a little slow in coming back around to get our orders again and it was not busy just yet because we had started eating dinner at 5:30pm. The waitress was sweet but seemed very inexperienced. She brought us the wrong roll a couple of times and did not know the menu very well. Even just trying to get them to give us the check took a while. By that time, people were lining up waiting for a seat, so we wanted to get out of there so the table to could be turned over. 

Ultimately, we all left very stuffed and satisfied. All of that accomplished without ordering a single gross cream cheese roll.
They gave me food poisoning, I had no food prior for 7 hours.  They need to double check their fish. This was my second visit here, I really enjoyed my first visit but never going back again.

it was fun to be able to eat sushi and do karaoke at the same time. the venue could have been more organized. the service was good. they shouldhave the bigger room situated to take karaoke too. had a blast with my co-workers. hoping the venue will serve alcohol soon.

Service is great, I do think that they put too much crab meat stuffing into their sushi. 
That's in almost every sushi dish I had, not too happy about having authentic sushi with stuffed crab meat.  Decor is really modern and woodsy.   Service is great, staff is attentive but otherwise stop the crab stuffing and I will come back more often.

Jjanga' restaurant serves quality sushi and  sashimi. By far, it is in my top 3 sushi restaurants in the world.  I know my sushi, and his place blows my mind. Their all you can eat menu is beyond generous and it has us coming for more. Jjanga, I hope you expand internationally, especially come to LA, you will give the 5 star Hollywood restaurants run for their money, especially since they all overcharge for tiny rolls which are not nearly as fresh as yours! Good luck, we will be back

Favorite sushi ayce in vegas!! Their super white tune is delicious ! All their fish are fresh for ayce spot. The have tons of appetizer to choose from such as agedashi tofu, skewers, salad, chicken wings (lemon pepper) , dynamite (must try) ! I took off one star because there's not much dessert to choose from except mochi and ice cream :( but I will come back for the quality of their sushi !!! They also have stamp cards ;)

Our friend made reservations here after our comedy show.. We had our own private room.. Most rooms have karaoke as well. But we chose not to have one.. Staff are so fun and friendly.. Sushi and sashimi were outstanding and delicious.. I want my other friend's and family try out this place.. They just opened 3 months ago.. Our waitress Yuhi and the other guys were on top of our dishes.. Best AYCE sushi in Vegas..
Have a cold? Vegetarian ramen with thick noodles will cure any ailment! So so yummy. I'm not vegetarian but I can appreciate the veggie boost! It's a must try.
Great food , a little busy some times and really fresh sushi

If you are looking for an affordable option outside the strip, I totally recommend JJANGA. The sushi is cheap ($3-$8) as well as the appetizer ($3). There's also an "All You Can Eat" (AYCE) dinner option for $25. My family and I ordered a la carte which was enough for everyone. I would say the rice and fish ratio is pretty fair. The chefs don't skimp you on the fish nor do they over stuff the maki rolls with rice. 

My favorite specialty rolls (not a huge sauce fan):
-Arizona Roll
-Spring Mountain Roll

Beware of the wait. Wait time seems to vary due to the AYCE option, but the staff is pretty efficient and friendly. Also, they have karaoke rooms on the other end of the dining area. The karaoke side doesn't seem to be very disruptive to the dining patrons... at least I didn't hear any random wailing sound during our meal. Overall, we enjoyed our time at JJANGA and will recommend this place to other visitors.

Friendly fast, real fast service with quality sushi. I just found a new sushi spot in Vegas. The servers were really attentive and always kept your cups and plates filled. If your interested in trying some Vegas sushi come over here.

Great deal for the peice. Lots of variety and delicious food. The servers did take a while to get some of my orders but there's a ton of servers around so it was easy to reorder over and over again. It's a great place to eat in Las Vegas, you just have to taxi over here from the strip.

Worse all-you-can-eat-sushi buffet ever! I wish I could give them no star. 
The sushi rice, sushi, and service was poor quality. 

The sushi rice wasn't even sushi rice. The rice would fall apart. 
The food takes forever to come out. Something like a house salad will take 20 mins. It's not even busy in here but it takes 20 mins for a house salad! 
The sushi was definitely not fresh. They give you very little sushi and alot of rice in which we will get charged for left over... rice! Really?

The service is even worse. I would have to get up to look for some service. The waitress would look at our empty cup of water still no food on the table ( in which the food takes 45 mins) ask if everything is okay then walks away assuming we are okay. Helllllloooo?

When we placed an order in which each of us got 3-4 rolls she goes "you guys can finish this? You will be charged". Excuse me, if we couldn't finish it we would never order.

The place has fans. Fans! No AC when it is 100 degree outside. Who wants to eat sushi when it's hot INSIDE. 
The sushi can't be fresh.
Worse. ever.

I came here on a Saturday around 4:30PM and it wasn't that busy. Seating was easy. Service was top notch! The fish was fresh and the fish to rice ratio was good. I really liked the screaming orgasm dish (or something orgasm) on the AYCE menu. The sushi burrito was also delish and light, so you can eat lots of those without getting too full. I like to try the volcano roll everywhere, but I didn't like this one much, only because it had cream cheese. I just took out the cream cheese and that seemed to solve the problem. There are many roll options including those with rice and those without rice. You can get hand rolls or regular rolls.

I like that everything on the menu comes in small portions and/or they offer a lot of items not too heavy on the rice so that we get to try a variety of things without getting full too quickly. To top it off, my friend had green tea ice cream and I had red bean ice cream for dessert. Both were good! I've had red bean elsewhere but not as good as here. My #1 AYCE sushi joint in vegas.

My friend and I came last night and we loved it. My friends been wanting to eat here and we finally did. 

I think the best part is they offer sushi with no rice which I loved. I'm craving for some right now.

Everything came on time. Except I had to order my miso and edamame twice which is fine. But service was excellent the sushi was out this world. They're very creative whereas most sushi places would have the same choices. 

I'll definitely be back (craving for the no rice sushi's again) since our server offered to give us a stamp card. Which at most places they'd be stingy about it unless you ask for it.

Came in both times with large parties. Last night we had a party of 18! Their staff is awesome ( I think his name was MOON?).  Service and sushi is on point. Wish I took pics but was too focused on eating everything on their AYCE menu. They also had a lot of differ selections as well which was awesome.  The only downfall was their dessert. Mochi ice cream tasted weird, mochi part was not soft and chewy like it's supposed to.

For an AYCE place in Las Vegas, I am quite impressed. My friends who I came here with raved about this place, saying how we MUST go here... They kinda hyped it up for me, but it didn't disappoint.

I would give this place a 4.5/5 rather than a 4, but that's just me.

The nigiri was super fresh and it didn't have that very slimy texture like other sushi AYCE places. 

I was quite pleased with the other rolls and the house salad was on point. When I go to sushi/japanese places... I tend to judge on their House Salad..

LET ME TELL YOU... it was on point. 


If you are in Vegas craving for some AYCE sushi... COME HERE. So worth the wait.

Created a yelp account just so i can give this place "5stars"! This is my 3rd visit here in10 days....goes without saying this is amazing. The food is to die for and the service is beyond excellent! Always leave here full and happy! Oh and JJ's the best!!! :)

Newly remodeled. Open space. I love how the place is bright. They have the Same great food. Our pick for AYCE sushi. Their tuna is fresh and sweet. The garlic tuna sashimi is the bomb. I always get green mussels. Their appetizers are as good as the entree. A definite recommendable sushi place.
Wow, this place is fantastic!  Get the Karai!  Great sushi, great sushi!  Sit at Choo Choo's station...he's a riot.
So yummy here. But it could have a better atmosphere. Try the Surf and Turf roll. It was the best and tonight I'm going home full and happy and my man is definitely getting his dick sucked tonight.

I ate here a few nights ago and was not really impressed.  The only thing I really liked was the bulgogi, nothing else was very memorable.  The food also took a really long time.  We were there for almost two hours when we could have been done in an hour.  It also had kind of a weird smell in the restaurant.

Best AYCE sushi we both had EVER!!! 

Why?

My boyfriend and I were visiting Las Vegas over the past weekend. We decided to steer away from the pricey and potentially over-hyped restaurants along the strip and try the local restaurants in the city.
