We looked on Yelp and this new AYCE place was rated 5 stars - was a given that we should give it a try!

We came here just after lunch time so it wasn't too much. The first thing that struck us was the welcoming decor and matching cool restaurant t-shirts of the servers! It's so refreshing to go to an AYCE sushi restaurant with the ambience and feel of a a la carte sushi place. 

The menu offered a wide selection of nigiri and rolls. They even had Hamachi yellowtail included in the AYCE pricing (this is very rare in Toronto where we're from). 

Service: friendly staff, server was somewhat helpful with the wide selection of menu, orders came quickly, the pace of the orders that arrived at our table was perfect to our eating pace, plates cleared off of table promptly.

Food: the ratio of fish to rice was perfect (not too much rice), sushi tasted very fresh, rolls were very creative with many types of combinations of ingredients and extremely tasty (it's obvious that they had spend a lot of time in finding the right combinations that complement each other). 
Favourite nigiri: hamachi
Favourite rolls: candy cane, playboy special

Price: very reasonable for the quality of the food

Will definitely try to visit again next time I'm Vegas!

Went here for lunch the other day. We were actually looking for the place that sells the sushi burger but I guess it isn't this place... BUT we walked in a very clean good looking restaurant so me and my coworker decided to eat here. It was great. Good service. Good sushi. Will be returning.

i was debating whether to stop at Jjanga or Sushi House Goyemon -- i so wished i went to Goyemon instead because I did not have a good experience at Jjanga. 

we got there a little after 12:30pm and it was not crowded. We were seating and ordered right away. The menu says you have 45 minutes to eat for AYCE lunch. The service was SUPER slow. I didn't get my 2nd plate until 45 min later. I was thinking, they better not kick us out, I'd be so pissed.

The first round of hamachi looked incredible and tasted great. The 2nd round of hamachi were poor looking and was warm temperature! 

The only fish that tasted fresh were hamachi and salmon, the rest of the fish, i can pass. 

I just cannot stand sashimi to be warm -- just not sanitary! 
and these fish weren't thick cut either.. they're quite thinly sliced.

some of the rolls were okay; spider roll was fine. I wish they would serve us faster so I can try different items. 

the waitress wasn't great also, she forgot one of my order and charged us for dinner price instead of lunch. And no matter how i try to make contact with her or wave my hands around, I cannot get her attention at all! I was just annoyed. I was very temped to just walk out the door and not pay because service was that bad. 

no, i will not visit Jjanga again. I was glad that I didn't bring friends here, it would have been an embarrassment.

Please Note:  This review is entirely based on the quality of food. 

I am certainly not one to leave negative reviews, however this place definitely requires one. I turn to YELP quite frequently and until today I can honestly say I'd never been let down. The fish was far from fresh, and the sauce had a funky taste/smell. For a moment I thought perhaps I was ordering the wrong items on the menu, but after looking around at other people's orders I was quickly assured that wasn't the case. 

Side Note: Staff was very pleasant and the service was exquisite (with the exception of the food) 

Those of you who choose to try this place... Good Luck!! I truly hope your experience will be better than mine. 

Perhaps I just picked a bad day to visit JJANGA.

This is my new favorite sushi place in town! It's been a few years since I've been back but let me tell you, this second visit was well overdue. Upon walking in I was surprised to see the new decor. Tbh, it looked really commercial, I liked the decor they had previously. Any who, I was hoping the sushi was just as good as I remember. 

IT WAS!!! Everything tasted super fresh! Their ginger was the best I have ever had! 

My favorites: 

Nigiri:
Garlic tuna 
Super white

Apps:
Deep fried scallop

Rolls:
Joe 

& They have GREEN TEA MOCHI! DELISH!! 

I will definitely be coming back!!

Cannot go wrong with some JJANGA!

Been here a couple times with friends and once on a date. The atmosphere is set for you to relax and enjoy time with your friends while you have no choice but to listen to Asian (mostly Korean) music play throughout the restaurant. 

Come hungry since they do offer AYCE for a great lunch price of $20.95. The variety of rolls are good, and the seafood quality is good, but I always look forward to their Chef Specials. Just let them know what fish you enjoy the most and they will prep something up for ya. What I could not get tired of was their Oysters! They are prepared perfectly with a kick  Unfortunately they have a one time order (3 per person). 
Another favorite of mine to look forward to is the Grapefruit Sake! There will be a party the day I No worries on paying extra for it since it comes with your AYCE. Personally I am not a fan of grapefruit, although it really compliments the sake itself.

Big thanks to Hickey for getting me a hickey that one night.. nahh, those days are over. He sure can make one hell of a salmon special though.
To Jjanga himself, you are appreciated for hosting me and my Yelp buddies, as well as preparing us a birthday ice cream dish. 

I would have to say that the biggest problem is usually making contact with the servers. Like many other places that I have been to (which is why I cant complain much), they seem to act def at times.

JJANGA is definitely on my top 5 for AYCE sushi and I plan to visit many more times.
Food is great, service is great and the price is right. The poki salad is a must order for you garlic lovers. Also, the chef is hilarious.
Soon to be one of the hottest spots off the strip in Vegas for legit sushi and an awesome atmosphere. Staff are all super friendly and great! A definite must each time I'm in town.

I was both curious and hungry when I visited this place. It seems that lots of folks love to eat here. What a disappointment!! I left both hungry and convinced that I will not return.

I'm never a fan of Americanized sushi rolls and its creations, but I could still chow them down when I'm hungry as long as rest of the a la cart menu and the appetizer menu are OK.... Sorry.. the rolls are blend and the rest of the non-sushi stuffs are soooo... bad. I'm not returning.

Service was pretty good though...

I had JJANGA bookmarked for a while due to its high Yelp rating. I went with three of my foodie friends who were all excited to try a new AYCE sushi restaurant. 

JJANGA is pretty small yet very inviting in decor. When you walk in, the sushi bar is to the left and long wooden booths and tables for seating straight ahead. It's dimly lit with colored light up lanterns hanging from the ceiling which totally sets the mood for a sushi restaurant. They also have huge blown up posters of their sushi chefs on the walls which I thought was kind of hilarious and enjoyed!

We of course did AYCE and for drinks had some Mango Soju (which was absolutely delicious, tastes like juice but the alcohol creeps up on you) and cold sake. The house sake is cheap here, $3 for a small and $6 for a large! 

For AYCE entrees, we tried a little bit of everything. Salmon, hamachi, garlic tuna, tuna, and super white tuna to name a few nigiri. We also got seaweed salad, poke salad, hotate ebi skewer (grilled shrimp), dynamite, Shu Mai, grilled mackerel (comes out whole), baby squid, fresh oysters, and a few of the rolls. 

Pros: 
- Nigiri comes in small portions but the raw fish tastes fresh and delicious. The super white tuna is incredible!
- Very tasty rolls. At one point we asked one of the servers to surprise us with her favorite roll and it was to die for. Shrimp tempura wrapped in tuna, topped with crab salad and drizzled in a creamy sauce. No rice and no seaweed! SO good!
- Grilled mackerel was bomb. Came with a tangy ponzu sauce. Had to be careful picking around the bones since they bring you out the entire fish
- Seaweed salad was great but the portion is tiny. My advice would be to order two 
- Shu Mai was very good! Not a dish you would usually see on an AYCE sushi menu but all of us thoroughly enjoyed it 
- My friends tried the uni (sea urchin) and really liked it. Said it was less saltier than other sushi restaurants and had a nice flavor to it. I thought it looked disturbing. Still haven't built up the courage to personally try uni...

Cons: 
- Oysters tasted a little too much like the sea. It had a light ponzu sauce on it but the fishiness was overpowering 
- The dynamite was really odd. Didn't look nor taste like your typical dynamite. When I order dynamite I expect like a baked concoction of seafood smothered in a creamy light orange sauce. There wasn't much creaminess about this dynamite. It was brown in color and had an abundance of sliced mushrooms (?)
- Whatever the poke salad was marinated in tasted sour 

I would definitely say the pros outweighed the cons and the service was pleasant. I enjoyed my experience here and will be coming back for some AYCE!
The service was outstanding. The food was off the hook.  I have been a loyal customer to another sushi spot in town and I have been converted.

Awesome. All u can eat sushi for $26 is a very good deal. 
Love that screaming orgasm.
Anything with "Ass" in the name is good. 
Sake was at the perfect drinking temperature. 
The servers all had personality and spice.

I usually go to jjanga on Fort Apache because it's close to home but this jjangas taste is better. Everything is delicious! Erica is still training but she is absolutely amazing! Her personality made our experience ten times better. I'll definitely be coming to this location from now on. I was told they are under same management though just the same name.

On the way into LV at lunch time I was starving. Thank you Yelp for directing me to JJANGA.
Near the strip, the outside is typical storefront but the inside is nice. Food was delicious. I sat at the sushi bar and told the chef I wasn't that knowledgeable about Sushi and he was very helpful. Waitress was friendly as well. I will be back.

Horrible service the owners rush you out and really generic fish served "fancy" really a joke pleas do yourself a favor and go somewhere else. I hope this one review turns 10 people the other way please don't be fooled

I almost don't want to write this review so that this place won't get too popular without me being there, but hey...the owners worked hard for this!  My friends and I came to Jjanga to celebrate the birthday twins and it was probably the BEST all you can eat sushi experience I've ever had....

1)  Without going into specifics, I will tell you that Jjanga's service is EXTRAORDINARY.  Warm, hospitable, fast, and adaptive - they'll make you feel like royalty.  These servers move so fast that if you order sake, sake will appear almost instantly.  At one point, we lost who our main server was because there were so many people handing us food and clearing plates all at once!

2)  The rolls...were delicately crafted and really creative!  I was really impressed with the variety.  If you see some of my other AYCE reviews, you'll note the various strategies that AYCE restaurants use to devalue your experience (too much rice, too much sauce, too many rolls per order, etc).  Not the case here.  Everything was delicious and contributed to a great eating experience.

3)  Uni.  All the uni you could ever want!  So yum!

4)  My list of favorites:
- Who's your daddy
- Baby octopus
- Chicken wing
- Grand canyon roll
- Big easy roll (garlic + ponzu sauce mmMm)

5)  AYCE menu includes soup, salad, sides/apps, and even dessert!  For those craving a lighter fare, this menu offers a variety.

Don't bother rubbing your belly too long, be sure to check out the karaoke rooms!  An hour of karaoke was a great transition from dinner to dancing later.  Food + libations + friends = good times at Jjanga.  Will definitely be back!

A must for all you can eat sushi. Friendly staff and the food was excellent. The restaurant is accessible; there is a variety of sushi and the selection is outstanding.
The orders were fast and severa waitress per table.
Our Favorite sushi spot. Great, prompt service and food is always good. Now if they could only get their liquor license back...

Didn't really know this place is essentially an All You Can Eat (AYCE) sushi place. If I had known that, we probably wouldn't have come here in the first place. But maybe if you like AYCE places, this might be a good choice for you.

So we ordered from the a la carte menu. Had the unagi-don, and while it tasted OK, the serving size was really small. On the other hand, my wife had the chicken katsu, which was nothing special; but it was huge. Talk about inconsistent serving sizes. 

Plus, the food was complemented by indifferent and poor service until the wait staff saw me trying to write a Yelp review on my smart phone. Then they started paying attention to us. But at that point it was too late.
No alcohol! Okay, now that we've gotten past that (!), we had the all you can eat and everything we had was good. Fish was fresh, service was great.

AYCE sushi: The sushi is very good. Expect to wait for a long time for the food. The sushi menu isn't too diverse or different. Most sushi rolls are the same with 1 or 2 differences from another sushi roll that's on the menu. The ordering time is 45 mins for lunch. Order A LOT when they initially take your order. Also, keep track of what you order, chances are.. You will not get it.

Service: Not the best in the world. The staff are so so. I actually witnessed the staff argue with a customer about the wait time. "Sorry, you have never waited for food? We are busy".

I have to be honest this is some of the best food I have eaten in a long time! The service and the dcor / ambiance of the restaurant was top notch. Excellent recommendations from the staff, the Fresh Man no rice roll is outstanding, along with every other item on the menu we tried. I cannot recommend Jjanga enough, we drove across town to eat here and it was well worth it! Best service, best sushi, best ambiance of anywhere in Las Vegas!! You wont be disappointed.

I always love coming here!! 

The A.Y.C.E sushi is awesome. They have so many great choices!!  And the service is awesome if you have one of the waitresses helping you. But if your server is a guy your gonna have to be on him about helping you.
The food is amazing and the service is amazing.  AMAZING X2  Looks like I will coming back here again and again.  I think JJanga is going to be my new favorite sushi spot.

Stopped in for lunch. Not a fan of AYCE....I prefer quality to quantity....  so just ordered sashimi..... salmon was really really good, they have a spin on hamachi jalapeno that was different and  good, I like the thin slices of the hamachi and it was very fresh and tasty. The tuna (maguro) was also fresh and really good.

I will definitely be back.

I this was ourfirst time using the waiter was very patient recommended 10 different new items to try and was very helpful. I will not only be recommending as friends and family I'll be coming back for as long as this place stays open.

Negative 2 stars for crappy service. Server was rude. Never refilled our drinks. Had to keep walking to her to get her attention. Server was never here. Kids were eating rice and had some that they dropped on the floor. Asked for spoons for the kids to eat their rice but server kept forgetting so they stopped eating rice. We were the only ones in the restaurant so they weren't busy. She kept disappearing and forgetting our orders but make sure to threaten us with leftover charges twice when we didn't even finish our food yet. Food taste terrible. Fish is not fresh. Uni tasted bad, had a rotten smell. I clearly do not understand the high ratings here. What a miserable dump. We had to walk to front to get server's attention to pay so we can leave. Server said she has to check our table and walked to our table to make sure all our food was gone so she would charge us for extra food. Server warned us she will charge us next time if we dont finish left overs. I told her to go ahead and charge us and left her a big fat zero for gratuity. I just don't understand where this hostility came from. Guess wat? We will never come back and that $15 leftover charge is ur tip!!!

We were hung over and really hungry so we decided to hit up Jjanga because of the yelp reviews. We weren't expecting much especially considering most ayce sushi places use poor quality fish and pack in the rice so hard that its like you are eating a rock, but Jjanga ended up pleasantly surprising us.

We ended up trying a lot of the nigiri and rolls and there were definitely some ups and downs, but I would mainly say ups. One thing to note when coming here, don't expect something more traditional like what you get at Kabuto, but that's one thing I do like about Jjanga that they have some fun rolls and the iron chef banners of the chefs on the back :)

Garlic Tuna - I liked this one because it had garlic, some spice, and a decent fish on top.

Cajun Albacore - I wasn't a fan of this particular dish, I didn't feel that the flavors went well together.

Salmon - The fish was decent, but definitely not as good as the salmon I get in Seattle.

Three Some - This was by far our favorite, really enjoyed the flavors and how can you go wrong with deep fried cream cheese :p

Gyoza - Its a standard gyoza lol.

Bulgogi - I was surprised I liked the bulgogi here since I am very very picky and typically only like my home made bulgogi.

Chicken Wings - These were tempura fried chicken wings, they were surprisingly good but very hot when you first get them, like burn your mouth and continue burning your face as the oil drips down as you're screaming and trying to get a napkin to wipe it -_-

We got plenty more, but I don't remember the exact names of the other rolls. Another thing I really appreciated was that they put a normal amount of rice for the nigiri, unlike other ayce I have been to where they progressively put more and more rice as you order. For an ayce we felt that the quality was very good and even better then some of the a la carte sushi restaurants we have been to. And to top it off the service was also good. I would definitely come back the next time I am in Vegas.

I went for dinner last night around 9pm, there was a little wait. I was surprised that they didn't have their liquor license, but they said they'll get it back in a few weeks. I'd call thought of you're interested before you go down. 
We went here because they have an all you can eat option for $26. Which is a really good deal, you can choose anything on the menu. 
I'm not an all you can eat kind of girl, so they also had an ala carte option. I ordered the spicy scallop and crab roll, eight pieces for only $3! And the roll was spicy, normally things aren't when they say they are, so I was very happy that they weren't lying. I normally use sriracha like ketchup, which is about a 2 for me. This roll would have been a 7. I also ordered their kabocha soup. This was surprisingly sweet, but not overly sweet. I liked the consistency as well, loose with a little grit. 
The service as interesting. I believe that everyone is pooling, so everyone helps everyone. But at times this seemed like it causes confusion because they didn't communicate with each other. Everyone was friendly which is good. At times I felt like they didn't understand what we wanted, but I'm not sure why.
The restaurant itself is cute. Asian designs. Nothing to complain about. I noticed they also had karaoke rooms available, but I'm not sure how they work. 
I'd love to go back here to try more items in their menu.

The all you can eat sushi is a great deal for only $25.95!!
The sushi here is amazing!!   I think I posted about 7-10 pictures of some of the different items we ordered off the all you can eat selection. There wasn't anything I tried that I thought was not good. I just preferred some favors over others. 
I would and will come here again...and again. 
I will also bring friends from out of town visiting and requesting sushi, because this will impress even the most die hard sushi eaters!

OK but when I ask for matches they have none if you ask   you have a restaurant in somebody smoke you must have at least one lighter or one matches so I guess tomorrow I have to buy a box of matches for the restaurant I will never go there again so if you ask me know

Jjanga and his crew are the SUSHI BOMB!!!!    

If you're like us and picky about your sushi then this is the place for you!!!  The atmosphere is always lively and fun!  Jjanga and Scott are always on patrol to make sure your experience is the best it can be!  

When you go make sure to get a Sushi Bomb,  and a Choo Choo special.   

Jjanga has figured out the right combination of food and atmosphere!  This is the only place to go in town for sushi!

Definitely the best all you can eat japanese sushi place I've been to. The portion is small which allows you to try varies different items. Each dish is very well made and delicious.  My favorite include uni, sweet shrimp, sweet sticky rice, Grand Canyon baked roll, agedashi tofu, etc. Price is very reasonable $20 lunch and $25 dinner. Service is also really great. Our server patiently explained the different appetizers and recommended varies items that turn out to be really good.

Probably one of my favorite AYCE sushi spots here in Vegas. From the service and the quality. I believe it's $20 for lunch and $25 for dinner. I usually order multiple orders of their super white because it just melts in your mouth. My favorite roll would be the Kiss of Fire. The service is fast and you get your food in a timely manner. Their sushi rice is a hit or miss sometimes cause it'll fall apart at times when dipping it into the soy sauce but not the worst first world problem. After you've stuffed yourself with enough sushi, if there's room left in your stomach they do offer mochi ice cream or just ice cream for dessert. I typically go for their green tea ice cream because it's my favorite. I love this place and it's my go-to spot when the sushi cravings kick in! Enjoy :)

To be completely honest the only reason why I made a yelp account was to write a review for Jjanga and how terrible their customer service is.

As someone who comes from a customer service professional background, Jjanga left a very bad impression on my family and myself after tonight's dine in experience. 

Jjanga is extremely unorganized and super slow when it comes down to their service. From missing orders from our appetizers and sushi and providing extra food of any appetizer or sushi we didn't order. They took over 15 minutes to give our octopus nigiri roll. Seriously? We had to constantly keep asking and checking on the order, but the waitresses showed no concern and if we hadn't checked on it so much we probably wouldn't receive our octopus nigiri just like the other items we ordered that was never obtained.

Also the waitresses would just place our orders on the table and run along immediately afterwards. They never once initiated and asked if everything was okay, or if we would want to order more food, but we were the ones always having to try to catch them to place another order. I assumed that since we were in a big party that they would be more attentive but I was wrong. I was trying to order ice cream from this waitress, but she literally looked at me and ignored me. That definitely did not sit right with me once she did that, so I did get a little loud and told her what's up. Other than that the only positive feedback I'm able to provide is that they were quick on the refills on our drinks.

Never coming back here again that's for sure.

Excellent AYCE sushi bar. Stumbled upon a top 10 AYCE sushi article for the US, and saw this place on there. Came to Vegas for a conference and decided to give it a try. It's off the strip and has the feel of a regular AYCE sushi place, not the Vegas strip feel. Excellent prices and absolutely excellent sushi. Highly recommend coming here.

How can a sushi restaurant in Las Vegas operate with no A/C and rely on numerous fans placed throughout the dinning area of the restaurant??? At first, I thought it was me having an pre-menopause hot flash...but turns out I was not!! Or perhaps the a/c crapped out. It did not!! It was too darn hot n stuffy inside due to the lack of the a/c running!! Reading previous Yelp comments, this place is known for operating with fans to "help" cool off the place!! Nice try but what an epic fail!! Such a joke and takes away from the ambiance with having noisy fans scattered all over the dinning floor, buzzing and humming away!! 

I met my friends and co-workers for a late dinner after work. They were already seated and had dishes being served to them when I arrived. Everyone at our table decided on AYCE sushi. The service was great and the food was good. One does have to eat their sushi quickly because if not, it starts to lose it's freshness due to lack of cool air! The hot dishes were tasty: stuffed mushroom, beef skewers, fried tempura, etc...
I would have given this place 4 stars, but the lack of a/c due to extreme cheapness from the restaurant owner is just not acceptable for a great dinning experience!!!
Come here all the time for all you can eat sushi. Quality sushi rolls, sashimi, and appetizers. They also have a late night happy hour which is a plus!

I was intrigued by the enormous number of high reviews in a short time, but was never sure when I would make it here.  Saturday night was double date night with our friends who are getting married at the end of the month.  We both had Hachi coupons for Red Rock and carpooled from Henderson to eat there, only to find it mysteriously closed without notice.  We all wanted sushi (well, Steven S. doesn't eat sushi but will eat cooked stuff) so I angled for Jjanga and Nicole B. begged for Oyshi.  I won since we drove, and off we went :)

Upon arriving at Jjanga, we walked into a really nice, spacious and well-decorated atmosphere.  The guy greeting us was so full of energy!  We had no wait thankfully and were immediately seated at a booth that had an impressive structure to it.  The booths are very spacious and sort of private, which was cool.  The service was truly outstanding throughout the night!  Our primary server was Jane, but everyone on the team including Mr. Energy were checking on us.  The food orders came out so fast that we were never waiting too long, except for the cooked meal.

We started off with iced green tea for me and Steven S.  Eric R. got hot green tea.  Our gripe was that the tea was basically water with a dash of green color.  No flavor - Eric R. asked for a pot was told there is only one for the whole restaurant.  We got refills but these items are not worth the cost in the future.

Steven S. went with the salmon teriyaki and subbed brown rice - this took quite awhile for him to get and initially the rice came out white - instead of leaving his hot plate and bringing him new rice, it was taken away for awhile but did come back steaming hot...except his side dish of "mashed potatoes" was a cold pink potato salad which freaked him out.  I tasted it and it was fine, but I do not think Americans like cold mashed potatoes.

The 3 of us did AYCE, and there were many items to try.  My first round included yuzu yellowtail, a salmon skin handroll, scallop sushi, and mackerel.  The salmon skin handroll came out surprisingly fast and it was quite excellent, crisp, non-greasy, with gobo, avocado and cucumber.  The yuzu yellowtail was pretty good.  The mackerel was covered in this ginger dressing that I found odd for pairing, but the scallop was great - nice hunks of scallop mixed with masago and green onion.  Eric R. got the Washington roll (salmon and avocado but with that ginger dressing again, which he did not like and Steven S. did not like on his salad - it was kind of creamy) and a few other pieces (tuna, halibut).  For apps, for grins I got who's your ex wife (jalapeno stuffed with fish) and agedashi tofu (teeny tofu square, tasty but more room temperature).  Eric R. got the ebi hotate skewer which he said was covered in some sort of mustard sauce.  We also tried the bulgogi app which was actually really good - with onions on a hot sizzling plate.

Nicole B. got James Bond, California, and Spider Rolls and seemed happy with them - they were able to make rolls with brown rice too.  Eric R. then got the sashimi salad (he said it was okay) but was happy with the poki salad.  Our next round of nigiri was ikura and beef tataki for Eric R. and tako, ika, and amaebi for me.  The amaebi was really good.  I asked the energetic guy up front for the fried heads which is happily offered to get for me upon request.  I ordered 2 but since they took awhile he brought me 4.  Next Eric R. and I got negihama handrolls, and I had jalapeno slices added and he got surf clam.  My final order was another round of scallop nigiri and uni.  The uni was all excellent except for one piece which was darker and when I bit into it I hit a huge piece of shell.  I showed it to a server and it was no big deal - but she did apologize.

Eric R. got mochi and ice cream and Nicole B. got mochi to finish.  The highlights of the experience are the ambiance, the great service, and the very fast delivery of food.  Nothing was ever forgotten, food came as soon as it was ready, and many servers stopped by to check on us and take more orders.  No one ever seemed rushed or trying to time us.  What I recommend from my experience are the salmon skin handroll, scallop sushi, bulgogi, and the amaebi.

Came here with five friends last night and had a great time. All but one of us ordered the all you can eat sushi and that was only because they don't eat fish. I was told the all you can eat included everything on the menu, which is weird because on one couple's bill they had other charges but didn't want to dispute the charges. I'm between a three and four stars only because when we did our initial ordering of the sushi and the plates were brought out and the service sort of just stopped there and we only got to order more or get refills on beverages after flagging them down. The rolls themselves were actually really good and great quality for the AYCE price.
Place is a must!!! Really good lately and especially after the remodel. Get the Q roll, Janga burrito and oysters. Great music too. Yummmmm!!!

This AYCE sushi place came highly recommended, & it did not disappoint! Great selection of rolls, especially the surf & turf and lobster rolls, and cooked appetizers. The quality of the nigiri was fresh, & they had a lot of special ones like uni, amaebi, & fresh oyster. Overall, we really enjoyed it!
I love Jjanga.  I've been coming here for years. My only critique is the recent change in some of the sauces! I hope they bring back the old ginger sauce for the fresh men roll!

Used to come here all the time when it was a Korean barstraunt. They upgraded the interior and it looks nicer than before. Sushi was super fresh and appetizers were really tasty. All the appetizer portions are small which is nice for someone like me who can't eat 100 pounds of all you can eat sushi. Adam our server was great and really helpful. Would defined come back again!

I really wanted to like this place especially since I had a bad experience my first time here a few years ago. We were a group of 14 at 11pm at night and the restaurant was almost empty on a Friday night; that shouldn't been our first indication but we had kids with us and everyone was hungry. 

We were seated promptly and about 5 of us decided on AYCE. The AYCE menu is so limited, most of what you can order are rolls and nagiri. The rolls are huge portions and they don't offer half orders. Most AYCE sushi places offer half orders and include more choices (meat options, soup options, etc) 

The flavor of their rolls were mostly sour. My husband ordered the 4 rolls that people can order only once and all 4 of them had some sort of sour component either lemon infused or powdered with something tasting like tajin- which in Japanese is not something one expects. 

For the price and the limited options, people are better off looking at other places on spring mountain. 

The upside- the service was great (I mean 3 chefs and 4 waiters for 18 ppl ratio)and  the fish was fresh. 

Probably wouldn't come back with all the options on spring mountain.

Food was good....the bulgogi burrito was my favorite.  Sushi was excellent... Service was awesome.  Here's the downside...why would you add on 18% for a table of 5.. we seen that it's automatic for a table of 6 or more?  Was it because we came in before closing? Was it because there was 2 big Hawaiian and you counted us as 1 1/2 each?  Or was you hoping for us not to see that charge on the bill  and tip you on top of that? You would've gotten $48 if we didn't see it...but instead you got 18..  Not too smart.
But like I said food and service was great...
Food was so delicious and we loved the persistence service by our lovely waitress "Yearan" and her assistant was amazing and on point definitely coming back soon
Love This Place ! There Fish Tastes So Fresh. & They're So Attentive To Your Every Need. So Thankful My Bf Brought Me Here.

Went a few nights ago and can't understand all the rave reviews. 

On the plus side, the prices are very reasonable and the service is very good. 

But where it truly counts for me--THE FOOD!--Jjanga is mediocre at best. My friend and I ordered about 10 items off the menu including hot "appetizers" from the kitchen and sushi/rolls from the sushi bar, and found almost every dish to be over-cooked (ex sushi of course) and under-seasoned. 

With all the better sushi options around town, I won't be going back.

This probably my most favorite Sushi spot. The decor is cute and the sushi is so fresh. Every roll is on point. My boyfriend first took me here and I am in love! My parents loved it too. I recommend the salmon belly and white tuna rolls. NOMMM.

The food is freshly made to order.  The bento boxes are great. You choose your items and the variety is good. You get plenty to eat...
I wish I knew about the ALL U CAN EAT SUSHI. $20.95 for lunch and the menu is incredibly large.  Conning back tomorrow!
Great sushi, by far one the best in Las Vegas. Definitely a hot spot to say the least. The fish is pretty fresh considering it's in the desert. Top 3 of Vegas for sure. Reasonably priced.

This place used to be my favorite but I have a feeling I'm gonna need to find a new AYCE go-to. Maybe it was because they were busy? & there were only like 2-3 servers but I just don't think poor service is excusable. We had to ask if we could order, ask for water, & just keep asking if we needed something. When we did ask for stuff, the servers acted so annoyed??? I was very confused cos they are usually so nice. We were not asked, not even once, how everything was or if we needed anything. If I didn't place my card & my stamp card at the edge of the table, they probably wouldn't have gotten the hint that we wanted our check. I'm hoping this doesn't become a norm because I really do love this place. 

Other than the subpar customer service, the food was really good. Order a spicy yellowtail hand roll with spicy mayo on the side!! Super delicious.
This place is probably one of the best AYCE places I've been to. Anytime I'm in Vegas, I don't miss the opportunity to stop by for their fresh food. Their service is also really friendly and prompt.

Whenever I head to Vegas, I always make it a point to either dine at a buffet (i.e., Bacchanal) or check out an all-you-can-eat sushi spot.  I've tried Island Sushi & Grill and Umiya in the past.  This time, a girl friend and I were curious about the 4.5-star rated Jjanga.

We came in for a super late dinner, around 10:00 pm, on a Friday evening.  The place was probably half full so we didn't need to wait for a table.  The staff happily greeted us with a smile and explained hot the AYCE deal works.  We dove right in and ordered the favorites, which turned out to be the ones that can only be ordered once -- the uni, poke salad, sweet shrimp, golden scallop, and beef tataki -- all of which were delicious!  I remember ordering the unagi more than once too.  What I especially liked was this off-menu item, the pork steak with miso?  I don't remember what it was called but our server suggested it in place of one the items I pointed out on the menu.  It was divine...like melt in your mouth, gimme-my-rice, sort of divine.  

What I also liked about Jjanga is the candidness of our server.  I forget her name now, but I truly appreciated her honest opinions on the various menu items.  I was going to order the fried rice and she basically vetoed it because it wasn't worth the tummy space.  She also steered us away from the special rolls because she wanted to get the most of our money by indulging in the nigiri and classic rolls.  Some say she's a buttinski, but truthfully, I appreciated her two cents!

I would totally return to this spot for AYCE sushi!

Only takes reservations for party of 6 of more??? You kidding me? And the last few times me and my partners have been in there, and we frequented it a lot, they can't seat us because they are holding the table. After the previous manager left, who was cool and catered to us because we came in a lot, this place has gone down hill. Trash management now.

This place had something that I had never seen before and that was three dollar sushi rolls
We were lucky to have a break on the sushi because we had ordered so much alcohol
We didn't order that much food but from what we did get Mike and avocado crunch and the lasagna sushi we had some steamy fried dumplings shrimp tempura and garlic edamame. 
I accidentally dropped my phone and when I bent over the table movement and everything came down and I bumped into another table and when I got up I am most fell into someone else's lap!
It totally wasn't the restaurant for but it was really funny when the server came over and said "I saw that that was hilarious it's okay you're top-heavy"
Very Las Vegas 

This place was good!

Omg can this place be anymore perfect?! I almost want to keep this place a secret and not post at all but that wouldnt be fair. Lol. Nice neighborhood feel and amazing staff that make you feel at home. The food is amazing and fresh. The chefs are fast, friendly, clean and on point. They also dont mind making special dishes to fit your taste. The owner himself is amaz-balls. Def our go to sushi place.

I only leave a review for 1 and 5 star places and this is a 5 star place!!!!
Fresh fish like I was at a a la cart sushi place.
Go see JJANGA along with Choo Choo, Koo Koo and Hickey.
Just ask for few of yer favs and let these guys choose the rest for you. It also helps if yer sitting at the bar :)

We had delivery from Uber Eats tonight and it was terrible! Got the Grand Canyon roll thinking it would be delicious baked roll with scallops and a creamy sauce (like most sushi restaurants do), however it came and it was a weird mushroom/onion/scallops and maybe a parsley topping....very weird and not good at all. Got the popcorn shrimp roll, the picture looked very appealing, it came and it literally was fried popcorn shrimp sitting on sushi...kind of weird. Reminded me of Captain D's or something bad like that. Anyhow overall food was not good at and would never recommend or ever order again. Waste of $50 and we went to bed hungry. Boo.

This place is good all around!! Don't really mind paying the extra few bucks cause literally everything on the menu is all you can eat which includes sashimi and poke items which is very rare to find in Vegas. There's so many options and appetizers, and they even have fries!!! Definitely worth the money. But gratuity for a party over 6 is 20%, but wouldn't really blame them for the high demand of all you can eat sushi. Ultimately we left super full and satisfied.

Hands down this place is a must try for sushi lovers!!!! For an all you can eat a place, the sushi rolls are top of the line! Every roll we ordered was delicious and they have so many rolls to choose from and other small plates too!!

The best sushi place in town. I've gone to several but Jjanga is my favorite by far. The prices aren't too expensive and all the sushi rolls taste amazing and looks perfect every single time. And there's more than just sushi too. Try the desserts; the mochi is very delicious.

I think there was an Indian proverb that talks about being fooled once was regrettable but being fooled twice then you are the fool. I am the fool. I tried JJANGA in west of 215 a while back because some iPhone repair guys said JJ was way better than Sushimon. Since I live close by the west location off I went to that one.

No, it wasn't better than sushimon by any imagination, save for the bigger space and fancier decor and benches for my derrire. But then again I came to eat sushi not sit on sushi. At the west locale, I did not like their sauce all over the sushi and was not fond of the service there. I swore I would never go back again. A friend said the original place was better and wanted to meet there and try it out. Well, guess what? This place is worse. 

The tuna fish is weird. They don't look fresh. The tuna is not firm but almost like its been lightly ground thru a grinder. But it's very red probably due to food coloring. It looked like the tuna and salmon but had liberal amounts of color added in. The salmon looked rubbery so I did not even bother to try them. I don't like sauce drizzled on my sushi either. We aren't eating salads here. The eel came out big but it got leathery when cold. The salmon roe did not look or taste that fresh. They looked like they were starting to gel together.

The rice less rolls were good but I don't like sauce on top of them. The nude rolls and octopus were 2 good items here. The rice rolls are either wrapped in rice noodle sheets like spring rolls or they are in cucumber sheets. These rice less rolls seem to be their signature. The miso soup is an experience into the bland devoid of tofu or seaweed. It tastes like they diluted the bottom of the pot with more water to serve more people.

The service was good and bad. While they cleared the plates away quick, no one bothered to refill your water. Until the check came out that is. I'm guessing they want you alive to pay the bill. As it was a 2pm lunch, there weren't that many tables eating to begin with. On the menu it says there is happy hour from 11pm-1am. I am guessing you can get the lunch pricing and menu at that time. Well I am not impressed when I am sober so I don't think I will be impressed when I am drunk eating at that time either. Pass. Believe the 3 star Elite reviewers, just go to somewhere closer like the one near Tea Planet.

Lunch is $20.95 and dinner is $5 more. Pricing is in line with other sushi restaurants in the valley.

this sushi place is one of hot new sushi restaurant in chinatown!!! if you're a sushi lover, you should try this place!!i'll promise you! you'll love this place!
never seen any other sushi place offers like this place!!
usually, lot of ayce sushi restaurants are like they give you so much of rice and thin sashimi so you can be full after couple of dishes but this place...i was really surprise!! i even said damn...look at this art!!lol seriously!! it's not about making people full fast..it's for the people who enjoys the food,environment and energy.
all the staff and sushimans are really friendly and kind..they don't care if you stay there longer and keep eating as long as you enjoy..they're really great!!!! they think about the customer first then their profit i guess lol
i love this place!

I previously rated this much higher but new ownership has brought changes we do not like. First they got rid of the frequent diners card.  So ok we can live with that, Today we went in to find entirely new menu and most everything we liked (or costs a little more to make) is gone!
It looked like every cheap ACYE that we have walked out of before! We 
did not waste our time and walked out before  ordering. Another buyer that is going to fix what aint broke and fill his pockets!  The place was empty and will most likely continue that way. We do not recommend the restaurant to anyone now!

Walking in on Thursday night, I walked right into owner, a sweet Korean lady. I was immediately seated and was recommended a cold house sake at a great price. My chirashi came within 10 minutes and the portion size was more than enough to satisfy my big appetite. (I can't imagine how much I would eat with AYCE)
Gia the head server is very attentive and two other servers were amazing as well. I'll definitely be returning as the prices are reasonable and the fish tasted great. It's rare that I walk over to the bar to thank the sushi chefs. A great environment and decor :)

Came to try out this AYCE sushi place for lunch, wasn't disappointed! We ordered salmon belly instead of the regular salmon, and it was delicious! Everything we ordered was pretty unique, especially the no rice rolls.

Our server, Kara, was also very attentive and friendly. The place had a nice, chill vibe to it since we came on Labor Day and everyone was probably dead from partying. Overall this place is a good sushi place to stop by and try :)

I'm definitely a huge fan! My co-worker found this place when she went a while back based on a recommendation by a family member. I'm SO glad she told us about this.

The place does take reservations, but when called they said they had more then enough seats for us. We got there on a Wednesday around 5:30pm. So you can order just from the regular menu, but I don't know why anyone would. For $24.99 (dinner) you get all you can eat items. The items highlighted in red (their uni, mochi, scallops for example) are only one per person. However, if someone in your group doesn't particularly like those items you can enjoy theirs.

We got so much stuff. I highly recommend getting the scallop appetizer, the garlic tuna, the seaweed salad, their garlic edamame. Honestly, everything we had was super fresh and tasty. The servers came around often and food came out fast. 

I cannot wait to go back there!
My go to AYCE sushi place! If you can't decide between the sushi joints in Chinatown definitely check this one out. They offer a good assortment of rolls and apps and sashimi

Please scroll down for original review- this is an updated edit. 


Sadly, this establishment changed ownership and starkly changed their menu. It no longer features the things that made this sushi spot unique. Instead it's now just another general sushi restaurant. The veggie options have been reduced to the basics. There is no longer the wonderful creativity in the veggie options. I wouldn't recommend this restaurant for veg heads anymore. 


This is one of my favorite sushi restaurants in Las Vegas, it's clean and extremely friendly. It is extremely pleasant every time I've eaten here. While I've never had there all you can eat special every roll I've had has been fantastic. 

Some people may not like this, but it adds authenticity and excitement for me, but the rolls can be inconsistent based on the chief that prepares it. The basic flavors are the same, but they have a slightly different personality. This shows the talents of the chiefs along with their ability to add their own artistic flavors to the food. 

They also have a good range of vegetarian options, which is always refreshing for veg heads like me. If you are in the area, give it a try. 

I can't wait to visit here again! 

P.S. On my last visit, Yuna our server, was very bright and friendly

I've been here before on several occasions, brought many an out of town guest here for sushi. Ever since the loss of their liquor license, the service has gone downhill. Today, I arrived at 9pm for a seat at the sushi bar for one. I looked at the list and inquired about the wait. The host told me ten to fifteen min. I said that would be fine, until I looked around the corner at the sushi bar. Every seat at the bar was EMPTY. I looked back at the host and he said he had guests waiting for the seats. It was myself,  and three people waiting for a table. Do I think it was deliberate? Definitely. With no liquor license and this type of service, I won't be back any time soon, and it was my go to sushi bar in town.

I love this place! It's an all you can eat place that has more than just sushi. My favorite thing here is the bulgogi burrito. I get it with no crab (because I'm allergic) and I add cream cheese. It's so good!!! Another thing I really like is the calamari. 5 stars for Jjanga because the service is as great as the the food!

The servers were polite and very knowleageable, but they are eager to take orders. Frequently check back tables.
Appetizer is weak.. not very many options but the quality is pretty good. I like pumpkin porridge although they added too much starch in it.
Sushi quality is as same as other AYCE sushi restaurants.

Haven't been here in over a year and that last time was great.. But this time had to be the worst I've ever had...
Screaming O smelled and tasted so awful i had to return it right away because It wAs so bad.
Spicy tuna also had a smell to it..
Ordered a terryaki chicken for my son and it couldn't of been chicken on there it had a paper taste to it.
And to end this the service was the worst.
When I mentioned about the food tasting bad I tried being polite about it and the server made me feel like it was my fault the food was disgusting.
I'm so disappointed I used to love coming here and this experience was the worst.

I loved this place! The food was good at a decent price especially during Happy Hour. Although the last time I was there was when they told me they temporarily lost their Liquor license...it hasn't come back since and neither have I.

Jjanga is my new favorite Sushi Restaurant! I have not written a review in a long time, but the food and service at Jjanga is top quality. 

We had the great pleasure of being served by the Sushi Hero Captain Choo at the bar. At some point it just became an Omakase situation. I was unable to find a fault with any aspect of Jjanga. 

We pretty much ran the gauntlet on the Nigiri section and not one piece disappointed. So if you want my opinion as to what you should order, close your eyes and point because its all good. I have a few friends who usually do not like things like Saba, Unagi or Tako. I would take them here because Jjanga could change their minds. I personally think they have the best cure on Saba in town. 

I am not a big sushi roll person but there are a lot of selections on the menu that excited my taste buds. I am still riding a food high right now so I will have to get back to you with a list of what rolls we tried. I have never had a riceless roll before, but Sushi Hero Captain Choo has introduced me to some great dishes. He also made a couple of special dishes for us which I am still smiling about three hours later. It pays to let him have creative license on your sushi. After a few orders he seemed to have nailed our preferences. He's a great chef. Also met Jjanga himself and I can't wait to eat his food. They were all super cool and fun.

So the sushi is excellent. No questions about that. The appetizers are equally as great. If I was a fish, you would catch me by using Fried Chicken as bait. Jjanga is now my favorite chicken wing place. I do not suggest things often, but I would not hesitate to recommend the Chicken Wings. Jjanga could sell that alone and I would still be a regular. The Bulgogi is also perfectly executed. The memory of the Bulgogi has me salivating as I write about it. The meat and the marinade are perfect IMO. Try that too. If Jjanga sold Galbi it would be my favorite Korean restaurant as well lol.

Well this review is already too long. You get the picture. I really like this place. High quality food and service with great prices. Easy 5 Stars.

Good but not as great as Sushi Koma.

I used to work down the street and we'd come to Jjanga since it was a mere 5mins drive.  The rolls here are huge!  It takes almost 2 bites to eat 1 piece, so be conservative when you're ordering AYCE and ask for 1/2 rolls instead.

Fish is fresh but rolls are very drenched in sweet eel sauce or mayo sauce.  I am a fan of nigiri so heavily sauced rolls is not for me.  Coworkers are always happy to come here.  Plenty of rolls and appetizers offering on the menu.

We've never had to make a reservation or wait long for a table here during weekdays lunches.  Not a bad spot to visit if you're near the Strip
Now we found our 2nd favorite place for sushi...... great food

This place is pretty good when it comes to the all you can eat (AYCE) deal, a lot of options (maybe too many in fact) and great service (servers are a lot of fun and lively). Maybe a bit pricey for your standard meal outside of the AYCE deal, but for $20 lunch or $26 dinner all you can eat, you really can't go wrong. Overall good quality of fish, but not necessarily superb. On one instance had a plate of Uni that was unpalatable. If you are a sushi snob, you might not enjoy the atmosphere of this joint as it can be haphazard, hectic and loud, which I guess is expected for Vegas. All in all, experiences here have been worthwhile and I'd definitely come back for seconds.

This place is one if the best if not the best Sushi place in town! The Service, fish Quality and variety is amazing!

Jhanga is an awesome sushi chef with a lot of unique creations. Definitely worth the drive for quality Sushi. 

I can't even say what our favorite rolls are because everything was super good. We will definitely be back! 

Thanks guys for finally getting a Sushi Restaurant right.

Funny sushi names & great service!! 2nd time here & I'm still a happy customer !! Definitely recommend getting the sushi roll named "Fat Ass" 

First time getting the $2.00 miso soup  & ehh, it's small and also, NO NOODLES in it!

The place has good food and very good service. In most other sushi places the restaurants do not have as many servers walking around asking if people would like to order anything else. I like the fact that servers are not assigned to specific tables and can help anyone. This can be a drawback for the servers because lazy servers can leech off the good ones when tips are pooled, but everyone at the restaurant was friendly and eager to take another order from us. The price for all you can eat sushi is comparable to other restaurants.

By far the best AYCE place I've had in Vegas so far! Fresh fish, great service, friendly staff! 
Yumyummmm! Will definitely be back!

Love this place!  Come here at least once monthly with the family and enjoy quality, delicious and fairly fast sushi, and friendly service. When I can't make up my mind on the order, I ask for something special from the chefs and I get some incredible stuff. The rolls aren't soaked with mayo like most other places and the fish tastes fresh and appetizing. Decatur/Twain great food and affordable price. AYCE  $20 for lunch is a GREAT DEAL for the quality and service. Try it out, I've never had a regret here.

Inconsistent with customer service. 

This has honestly been my favorite sushi place for months,but after today, don't believe I'll go back. To be honest,the best thing about this place is the food. 

We asked numerous times for a utensil, didn't recieve what we ordered, and wait for for it... the gentleman told us to leave because " there are other people waiting" which,  Idk I felt was rude because I've worked in numerous restaurants before and you never tell the guests to leave lol.  I could understand if we were being rude and loud but it was probably a few minutes after we ordered dessert that he told us that. 

It's ok Jjanga, I won't completely give up on you.  I'll give your other location a try.

One of the best sushi place ive ever been in las vegas...i would recommend with my friends
The three some special is my favorite

Let see.... I think I had one of each that was on the menu and all I have was awesome, it's a modern sushi joint... I didn't have any rolls but the sushi I had was all fresh, super white tuna, scallop, octopus, sweet shrimp, salmon, hamachi.... Definitely will be back again

Wow. Amazing food! Improvement from last time I came. We came in around 10:30pm and it was a little busy. We were greeted right away, and our order was taken. Within 3 minutes we were already receiving our orders. Some of the things we ordered were;

Salmon nigiri - so amazing, melted in my mouth. 
Garlic tuna nigiri - well seasoned and juicy. 
Monkey burrito - *Drool* so orgasmic.
Fresh Oysters - already comes with hot sauce & the goods, I'm so glad they have it.
Unagi - I'm usually not fond of unagi but the eel sauce is da bomb
Sweet shrimp - soo fresh and so yummy!
Crab balls - perfectly fried goodness topped off with delicious sauce 
Poki salad - I love when it's not actual salad. Just seaweed & tuna drenched in sauce. Other places the poki salad is served in a big bowl with a lot of salad and hardly any fish. They hook it up here! 

So, to sum it all up, I had a very satisfying experience. I've never had our food served so fast and we ordered so much. Their customer service is outstanding and the fish is one of the freshest out of all AYCE sushi joints. It's also cheap! $25 AYCE and lunch is $21. If you come in from 11pm-2am the price is $21!

Went tonight Dec 21 -- 2nd time in 2 weeks .. and just as good as the 1st time.
FRESH FRESH FRESH
Tuna, Yellowtail, Albacore, Halibut, Uni
Enjoyed several different rolls.
Good proportion of rice to fish on Nigiri
Large selection of rolls with cucumber instead of rice.
Several Sashimi Salads
Lots of spicy choices if your'e into that
Very good service
Good sound system playing good music - not too loud - not too intrusive - just enough to allow you to have your own conversations and not listen to everyone else.
Clean Clean Clean
Definitely superior in every way than (dare I say - that place that serves sashimi on AYCE)

They say it is new owners so they are awaiting liquor permit - so no beer/sake yet.
Did not inhibit our enjoyment either time - and we will be back for sure!

One of my favorite places to come get sushi.
The staff is always so friendly and prompt. No matter what time I've come in, afternoon, evening, busy, slow, they are always so attentive. They constantly check to see if you need to order anything else, or coming by to pick up empty plates out of the way!

Their garlic tuna sashimi is amazing and I really could come here JUST FOR THAT. 
The menu is packed with lots of options for appetizers that are amazing, try the pork mini skewer, it's pork belly & amazing!! Pok is great as welll! I love spicy sushi & they have tons of specialty rolls to pick from that are very spicy. All in all their food is awesome and so is the staff!

I cannot emphasize this enough, but the service I experienced was SO bad. 

We had a small, young, korean girl as our waiter for the first 40 minutes, then all of a sudden, she just decides to disappear on us and leave our table. She would pass by our table and just smile at us like she had nothing to do with us. We waited for about 15-20 minutes to get another waiters attention and she didn't even seem apologetic at all. It was so unacceptable we had a waiter in training take our order (we didn't know until he told us.)

There were 6 of us, and that could of been a huge tip but nooo. If you get a korean girl who is super small, be aware. When we went, we had on a blue ribbon beneath her bun. So disappointed because the rolls weren't bad at all.

Went to Jjanga recently and was very excited to learn they do "all you can eat" special. It was my first time at their Decatur location. I've been to their location on Fort Apache at least 1000 times.

My first time at the Decatur location was awesome!The food was delicious, very flavorful and extremely heart healthy! The server Erick was very polite and knowledgeable of all food items. My tastebuds and tummy agreed with all of his recommendations.

Came here for ayce sushi lunch time right when they opened lol (11:30am) on a Saturday with the wifey. Right after us we seen about 2 other groups walk in. We had one server, a younger gal who I didn't get to see the name of, but she was really attentive and one thing I like is when the server will come up to you and ASK if you'd like to order more. 
The bus person also came frequently, to take everyone's finished plates out of the way. 
And the quality of the sushi was very up to par, 
adding also that our orders came pretty quickly! 
We ate so much that our last roll had 2-3 pieces left and we had it sitting on the table for a bit worrying about being charged extra because we were way too full to finish it all haha, and she was kind enough to take it away and ask if we wanted any dessert before receiving the bill. Very nice service! 
Only downfall in comparison to my favorite sushi spot is the fish to rice ratio (the reason for my 4/5 star rating). Just felt like the rice was a bit on the 'massier' side, but overall 9.5/10 rating! 

----Overall----
Service 10/10
Food 10/10

Thanks Jjanga!

There are plenty of sushi places closer to my house/work/life, but I go out of my way to come here. Service is AMAZING. All of the staff is friendly and very responsive. The food is also great -- We always do AYCE and it's a great value. I can never remember what I order after I leave, but I've never not liked anything I've gotten here, so that's a good sign. It's a cute little space, too, with great atmosphere.

Omgeee  Everything we ordered was amazing! Even the baked roll that we accidentally ordered and originally didn't want... Yeah, glad we kept that. I highly suggest you try the Grand Canyon. Seriously! We'll be back, Jjanga Sushi, and we'll be bringing friends.
Placed a delivery order for baked mussels, double D's and what looks like an imitation crab roll only for $10. Very disappointing but at least delivery was quick.

JJANG JJANGA!

Man, this place takes me back to when it used to be Shobu and back to when I had my summer job serving drunk people and cleaning vomit off the toilet in the women's restroom... Ahhh nostalgia! LOL back then it used to be owned by Geisha House and now it has been taken over by JJanga and his cousin! We've been here twice now and most everything has been delicious,, some fish fresher than others but the 2 standouts for me are the ama ebi & the yuzu yellowtail... mmmmM! In addition to nigiri they have lots of rolls, rice-less rolls and appetizers.. Service is hit or miss... Some of the servers are awesome and some (mostly the females) get super stressed out when it's busy but I can understand that! Even on a busy night the food comes out at a good pace...I've never had to wait for a table and they are like a dollar cheaper than Goyemon ;) plus they also have karaoke rooms here! 

HOT TIP: Get a stamp card!!!!!!! And sit at the sushi bar!

I do enjoy AYCE sushi and this place was wonderful.  Many AYCE places has lots of restrictions like ordering so many plates at a time and service is slow but here you can order ALOT and they serve you real quick.  The only restriction is a  45minutes ordering time but this is plenty long for me.  Great selection of sushi, roll and even some sashimi.  LOVED IT!!!

I had a decent experience at Jjanga. I read that is was one of the top AYCE around, so I decided to give it a shot. As a starter, I had a reservation for 6 tonight (heads up, 20% included gratuity of 6+ parties). We were welcomed by the hostess and staff members, which is common in many Japanese restaurants. 

It took us a while to decide who was doing AYCE, but we got it settled (1hr time limit on ordering, no time limit on dining. I'll get to this in a moment). 

My personal orders: our first round of sushi came out rather quicker than expected, which gave them some pretty good kudos. 

Dancing Dragon: dragon roll with some shrimp tempura through out. Roll slightly smaller than I've seen in other establishments. Rice to topping ratio was good. Pretty fresh. 4 out of 5. 

Spider Roll: soft shell crab and California roll combo. Again, smaller roll than other places. Personally, could have topped with a little more eel sauce. 3.5 out of 5. 

Beef tataki: 2 quick seared beef nigiri for you rare meat enthusiasts. Standard nigiri size, rice was seasoned in a unique way which complimented the beef. And a dish not found in many other places. 1 order limit per person 5 out of 5 (I like my beef rare). 

Cowboy roll: crab and cucumber filling with seared beef on top. Again, rice seasoned uniquely which was new and a fan of rare beef. What threw it off for me was the crab meat, but never know until you try. 4 out of 5. 

Sunset Special: shrimp tempura and cucumber topped with spicy tuna, salmon, spicy mayonnaise, and eel sauce. Had a bigger kick than expected, especially with the spicy mayonnaise. Freshness of the roll was decent. 4 out of 5

Golden Scallop: deep fried scallops, cut in half, topped with spicy mayonnaise. Fried beautifully. As a whole scallop, is a medium size. 2pieces (1 whole scallop), limit 1 order per person. 3out of 5

Now, as I mentioned earlier, the orders came rather quick and was pretty nice to get an early start. As we made our way to round two, the orders started to come a little slower. At the same time, they brought us rolls we did not order and they had forgotten a few. Towards the end of the 1hr ordering time, servers began to make themselves slightly scarce, other than to clear off plates and refilled water. Now here's what got to me. Granted we did order a few passed the 1hr mark, but there was a steady turn over so we did not over stay ourselves, but it's hard to order when the servers are not around. The manager then came over to our table with the check in hand (more or less telling us time to go) while a few in the party were still waiting on a few rolls. We asked for the desserts (ice cream or mochi ice cream) and were given some sideways glances for staying even longer. 

Big points deduction for customer service (not worth the 20%). Kudos on a variety of rolls and unique items. The freshness was great (for our party, pretty picky group) and roll were well seasoned/topped. Go for the food not the service. 

3 out of 5 over all

They asked us to leave our table because "20" other people were waiting. When we got up there were 6 people waiting. And they added in the gratuity themselves. I would have tipped a lot less after they asked a table of all you can eat orders to leave.

I was really underwhelmed. It was basic, decent sushi for a basic, decent price. I think if you're looking for a type of place that does All-You-Can-Eat, you're not necessarily concerned with quality, which is totally fine. Just know that going into this place.
best as always. rolled in 12. was nice to seperate to 5 checks. rememeber to bring cash if big group :)!

I have been in many sushi restaurants and I'm big sushi fan so it's really hard to impress me and easy to disappoint. This place definitely not in my top list after all. My visit was spontaneous because I was in this area to shop some groceries and got hungry. 
Location and parking is ok I will not say anything bad about that but rest was one big disappointment. 
There was single waitress working but she was really confusing. I know that during lunch time not so many people come to such a places and they try to save money on staff but common she was unprofessionally or not trained properly. 
After we selected our items from menu she brought us our order after some time. I ordered spicy lobster roll but it was not spicy as usual it is in restaurants it was damn hot. I explained to her and she said " that's why you drank so much water, haha I was surprised how much water she drinks" (me). I was shocked by this comment because I don't drink soda or any sweet drinks and I like to drink a lot of water any usual time. I realized that she is unprofessional and just ordered another maki salmon roll. 
We asked for check and payed with cash exact amount and she took it immediately in front of us. I never ever saw in my life that waitresses or bartenders take bill before customers leave.
Flavored sake bombs are amazing!! Service was a little slow the night we went in, but my local friends assured me that never happened before.

This was our first time coming here.  My wife's friend recommended this place, so we thought we would check it out. 

I'm not the biggest fan of this side of town, but the food and the service was really good. 

The prices are reasonable and there is a time limit, that isn't enforced. 

I would recommend this place to anyone who like Japanese food all you can eat, at a reasonable price. 

The food that was served was incredibly good as well.  We will more then likely be back.

My experience at jjanga was nothing memorable.  First off, the server didn't bother to ask how we're doing until 35 minutes after he took our order, and when he did, I had to tell him we didn't receive any of our food, the restaurant was not busy at all, with only two other tables at the time.  We waited 40+ minutes for our food order! No apology from the staff, they just pretended like nothing happened.  I definitely think Goyemon and Yama sushi are far better AYCE sushi joints.  The quality at jjanga is pretty horrible, the only think I enjoyed was the baked rolls, where the quality of the fish is mass by sweet and spicy sauces.  If you're into nigiri and good quality fish, this is not the place for you.

The best quality for both food and service!  The chefs are amazingly entertaining and the menu is just down right awesome.  Best sushi I've had and I just moved here from NYC.  If you're on the daring side try the Burning Your Ass roll!  Oh and all this at an all you can eat sushi restaurant! 

best value for the money and it's also so entertaining!   A show and a meal!

By far the best sushi place I've been to. Been here a dozen times, and Hickey Son is a great chef. Great at the food, and fun to hang out with at the bar. Jjanga is also super cool, and you can't go wrong with any of the other chefs. Just moved to LA and wish I could take Jjanga with me!

Similar to another recent reviewer, the service was so awful yesterday. It's like the servers had no idea who was in charge of our table. We were never offered a refill on our drinks. We literally had to flag down someone to order more food. Servers were gone for ten minutes at a time - nowhere to be seen. A third of our order completely disappeared with no apology whatsoever. It was so frustrating. The food was delicious as always, such a shame that we were ignored. Hope this was just bad luck because the food is awesome for AYCE.
One of my favorite sushi places ! I ordered a Lisa Hand Roll . Their sushi is absolutely delicious !! They also have a late night happy hour All You Can Eat for $20!

This place took me by surprise. I've ate at so many AyCE places and this place did not disappoint. They even brought dishes that we didn't order but LOVED!!!!! They are attentive n the vibe is nice even though not a fan of K pop but food makes u forget about that!!!

Went here for our trip to vegas after doing some yelping of sushi buffets. Totally worth the price paid for dinner of $26 a person. There is plenty of variety to pick from the menu. I was debating on here or another location as I prefer to not order off a menu but again well worth it. We ordered a variety of nigiri, rolls, and salads. I like the fact that they have a number of rolls that have no rice but the bummer is a bunch of those rolls have tempura in them which I dont like. HOwever, everything else was fresh. They are FAST too. Only downside is the portions are very small in comparison to a regular sushi roll but that's how they portion control i guess. 

If I go back to Vegas, will def go back to visit.

The first time we came here, the decor was cozy with private booths. They also played a fun mix of Kpop music. 

Now, it's remodeled with a cold, uninviting open floorplan and the music sucked. The food was fairly good both times, but we much thoroughly enjoyed our first visit and not at all the second.  

We'll try other places before coming back but most likely won't return. It was the decor and music that made this place unique. 

Now, it's just another cookie cutter restaurant theme with food you can get at any other comparable place.

Get the AYCE if you love sushi and hate yourself. 
SO much good fish, definitely worth the price but 4 rolls in, you want to die... would definitely do again.

Jessie and I wanted to do AYCE sushi and both hadn't tried this place. We got there right at 11:30am when they opened, but still had to wait for the sushi bar to set up. 

After a little wait we sat at the bar. They have such a large menu it was seriously hard to choose. I over heard the guy next to us ask the chef to just make him whatever he liked. I thought it was kinda crappy that they said they'd do it, but at the cost of dinner. 
I didn't really enjoy all the rolls that we ordered. I did enjoy the Fat Ass roll. How could it be bad it was fried! The Philly roll had to much cream cheese. I really loved the fried baby octopus from the appetizer menu. The XXX roll was supposed to be super spicy, but lacked the spice I had expected. The worst roll of them all came off of the rolls with no rice, but used rice paper instead and was called the Fresh Men roll. It was covered in some pink sauce that literally made me gag. 

The service was great and our water glasses were kept filled. It seemed clean, but the backs of my calves from sitting in the chair felt itchy the whole time we sat there. Really odd!

I was hoping for another tasty sushi spot, but this place just missed the mark. I'll for sure stick to other places I know are yummy in the future. I felt very disappointed with the flavor. Meh.

One of the best AYCE sushi places in town. 
But the most special thing about this place is that they have a female sushi chef. So rare! Never seen such a thing. 
I've been here around a dozen times, and I can say:
The food is consistently good. Fish is fresh. They have the high quality stuff. 
I always sit at the bar, and the sushi chefs are a lot of fun. They drink and joke around with guests. Sometimes they send special creations our way. The four chefs are Kookoo, Choochoo, Hickey, and Sponge and they have epic portrait banners behind them. It's a unique place. 

The one time I did sit at a table, the service was lacking a bit. The server seemed to avoid us.

I would say in all the times I've gone here, there's never been a wait, except for once it was 10 minutes (weird because the host didn't tell us how long to wait), and an hour and a half one super busy night (very unexpected).

I used to love this place. It was best sushi place in town. 
I don't think I will go back to this place ever again..quality is going down.
We all did AYCE sushi ..but it took forever to get food. Our table didn't even have food majority of the time. 
Our party was 5 adults + baby (15months) and they add 20% on our check and didn't even tell us about it. How shady!!! 
Well.. I guess I will never go back to this place again even though we have one free AYCE sushi coupon. I rather find better sushi place in town.
I'm literally only writing a review so that I never forget the name of this delicious place. Yuzu Yellowtail. Get it.
Absolutely great service! All the rolls were very good! Birthday dinner was a success! Would definitely come back!

Hhhhmm, this place deserves two reviews, one for food and one for service.  Went on a Friday night with a party of 4 people.  We all opted for the all you can eat option, which should be called the all you can order option.  You get an hour and pretty expansive menu. 

Food was worthy of 3 stars, was ok sushi not great not bad.  However, the service was 1 star at best.  They failed to bring several things we ordered, even after we mentioned it twice to our server.  At first I thought it could've been a language miscommunication & noise issue (very hard to hear inside due to LOUD karaoke).  

I might go back at lunch, but definitely not rushing back anytime soon.  Too many other options in the area that are better.

I rattled off a long list at my friend for lunch and this caught her attention so off we went with her two little ones in tow. 

It's a AYCE place, but if you want to go a la carte, I was surprised at how reasonable the prices are. It's cheaper than the average, but the quality is better than the average too! 

We decided on the AYCE though to be able to try a bunch of stuff. 

NIGIRI 

Yellowtail/Yuzu Yellowtail - this was my favorite of the items as the yellowtail was super fresh. The yuzu yellowtail has tomato and onion salsa on top which was pretty good texture. 
Mackerel - had a solid brine on it and not too salty. They put a dab of cream on it which is different from other places but I liked it. 
Garlic Tuna - the seasoning was what usually is on cajun albacore/salmon preparations and garlic ponzu. 
Scallop - these were small scallops mixed with masago. I prefer larger scallop nigiri but this good. 
Albacore/Cajun Albacore - also very fresh. 

There really wasn't any bad fish today that I tried. 

ROLLS 

I love that they have riceless rolls! They don't do half rolls here so thats the only "bad" thing I can think about. I tried a few pieces of my friends rolls and they were good. 

Q Roll - wasnt quite a roll but more fish tartare on a slice of cucumber, but the wasabi cream sauce on this was good. 
Tuna Naruto - Im a sucker for cucumber wrapped rolls as they are refreshing and this was no different. 

I love my ass- this was my only with rice roll order and the rice ratio was good. 

APPETIZERS 

Whos Your X Wife - this is a spicy tuna and cream cheese stuffed jalapeno. Standard, but good.

Service was friendly, but there were times that we had long waits. We sat in a booth and while we appreciated the booth dividers for privacy and so her kids wont bother the people next to us , it made it difficult to wave for a waiter since they can't see you. Im going to try to see if dinner and sitting at the sushi bar is a better experience next time.

The fresh fish and interesting offerings means I will return.

This is mine and my husband's go to sushi place. You can not beat their AYCE deal for $19.95 at lunch time. The menu selection is incredible, ranging from spicy sushi, nigiri, tempura, sides, dessert, sushi burritos, it goes on and on and on!

The service is slow, but they're very friendly! Love love love this place.

Came in on a Friday night, had to wait about 20 minutes. After getting seated, realized there were a couple of open tables. Not sure if they didn't have enough staff to sit all the tables but that is why I gave this place 4 stars.

Ive been to a handful if AYCE sushi in Vegas and this is probablt my top 2. Not the biggest place compared to some of the other ones but FAST service once seated, servers are extremely friendly and tentative and always answer your questions or gives wonderful recommendations.
