Quality of the fish is fantastic for an AYCE place. And they also do rewards go there 10 times get a free AYCE!!! Can't believe they do that. Good place to go in small groups so you can try a whole bunch of different rolls and appetizers, extensive list of options.

Best sushi I've had! So many different items to choose from. There's a lot of items on the menu that other sushi places charge more, but here, it's all included in all you can eat. The flavor and spices they use are amazing. I recommend this place to any friends that come from out of town.

I love ALMOST everything about this place. :-)

Let's see, FANTASTIC prices on regular rolls for to go. $3 for rolls such as spicy scallop, spicy tuna, california roll, yellowtail roll etc. These rolls are normally $5.50 everywhere else.  So when I'm not up to paying for all you can eat, I load up on 4 or 5 rolls to go and only pay $15 vs $25+ for the same amnt. 

AYCE - I love that they have several rolls that don't include rice and are wrapped in cucumber. I have always enjoyed these and it's rare to find and Sushi Koma has 1 available but it's very small and you're only allowed to order 1. Here you can order it as many times as you like. 

Reverse Happy Hour after 11 pm (you only pay the lunch price of all you can eat) HELL YEA!!!  

My ONLY... complaint is their spicy tuna is made a bit differently than other places.  It's definitely not bad, I've never been sick from here or anything like that, but it does definitely taste a bit different and I'd almost say a bit more fishy tasting.  

Otherwise..

GREAT prices, menu, food/quality, and wonderful service!

I have been here several times already and I will continue to come back. 

The location is a bit tough to get to, parking is very very minimal and the restaurant is in a small plaza. but it's definitely worth it, and once you're inside, it's beautiful. 

I definitely recommend this place to anyone for both AYCE and regular menu with low prices.

I've been here several times, with different sized groups at different times of day, end each time service and food has been perfectly on point. AYCE prices are very reasonable, but they do have rules to follow, however they've never been a problem for anyone I've been there with. Everyone in the restaurant is super friendly and although you have a waiter, everyone who works there is willing to take orders, run to the kitchen, and generally help you with whatever you need. Food comes fast after being ordered and is always as described in the menu. 

Food is delicious and yummy and tastes fresh. I love the I Love My Ass Roll, but the Pretty Lady Roll is always popular, and I don't think I've ever ordered few than 5 orders of the Salmon and the Garlic Tuna. The menu is extensive and for those who are not into fish, or raw fish, there is a cooked menu as well including bulgogi (which is delicious) and tempura among others. 

I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who's looking for great sushi in the area!

My buddy and I ate here about 12:30 am Sat/18 Oct (which is Fri nite):
5 Stars because:
- Got Sapporo and Kirin Light bottles, I think $4.50/ea and they were the large bottles.
- Tasty sashimi options and the sushi items came with minimal rice (I dislike eating sushi with a huge chunk of rice).
- We enjoyed everything we ordered including the stuff from the kitchen/grill.
- The 2 sushi chefs were cool and took care of us (we were sitting at the bar).
- Place is walking distance from my home so it's my top choice for AYCE Japanese.  The same plaza contains "Japanese Cuisine by Omae" and has a new Thai restaurant opening.  I hope the area becomes the next Seoul Plaza.

Misc:
- Staff was mostly Koreans (nothing wrong with that).  I can't think of a AYCE sushi place in Vegas that's Japanese owned/mostly staffed.  Sushi Kaya and Geisha House were Korean oriented.  I'll be trying Sen of Japan next.

An AYCE sushi restaurant for those who don't like sushi.  Jjanga is about sushi drowned (literally sitting in a puddle)  with sauces that mask  the taste of the seafood.

Typical AYCE quality; previously frozen, gassed and thawed fish and color added fish eggs atop mediocre quality, sticky, seasoned, over compacted short grain rice.  

The nigiri rundown:  Maguro, hamachi, and salmon previously frozen, tako rubbery (not tenderized prior to cooking), the amaebi previously frozen, sticky, ammoniated taste, beef tataki tough, tamago over cooked.

Appetizers are in line with other AYCE joints.  Bought in gyoza and shumai, mayo coated baked mussels, overcooked but flavorful scallop and shrimp skewers, OK teriyaki chicken drowned in cold sauce, chewy steak, overcooked but well seasoned grilled mackerel, and the ubiquitous elongated shrimp tempura (shrimp split lengthwise, heavily coated and fried crisp).

Vegas style rolls are a disaster.  The "dragon roll" (Cali roll with a liquid mayo filling topped by rubbery eel and drowned in a cloyingly sweet, sticky, soy concoction) and the "Jack Pot Special" (Oily shrimp tempura, crab and cucumber surrounded by oil soaked rice topped with spicy crab, shrimp avocado, tempura cast offs and eel with a watered down spicy mayo spooned over all are enough to stop you from trying more.

Fun ambiance.  Fast service at the sushi bar.  $20.95 lunch, $25.95 dinner.  There is a time limit for ordering.  It was not enforced on two visits.

Falling below the pack of AYCE options in Vegas but an option if quantity is all that matters.

Very deliciouse Japanese food great for pre gaming night out great for date night !!!! Love the sushi and ay.c.e. prices are worth every penny!!! Great staff very helpful and courteous very friendly and attentive waitress and buses very attentive to water and dirty dishes very well recommended!!! ENJOY
Love this place. The fish is so good. Their special rolls are unique and very tasty. Highly recommend the Big Easy Roll and Something Wrong #69.

A little bit off the strip but so worth it! All you can eat sushi available and is fresh and really delicious.(melt in your mouth delicious). Great customer service, very attentive staff. Extensive menu for both nigiri lovers and roll lovers. If you're a local or just visiting Vegas make the stop if you're in the mood for sushi! You won't regret it :) Fish to rice ratio is amazing!!! Hours of operation gets overlooked... open past midnight, perfect meal before clubs, if you're into that sort of thing.

Jjanga was my go to spot for Ayce when they first opened. I'd come here at least once or twice a month. One of the owners was always so friendly and very helpful so was the servers I've always had. But the last 3 times I've gone the owner I like is never there when I go and I end up getting below average service. I feel that I always need to get someone's attention whenever we wanted to order or needed our drinks filled. I also feel that the nigiri is now much thinner slices with a whole lot more rice. The Saba is also very dry and our appetizers would sometimes never show up or show up long after the sushi had already been eaten. I kept it at 3 stars jus because I used to love this place. I hope they become more consistent.

Jjanga is a fabulous sushi restaurant. It has a great selection of fresh fish. My personal favorite wherever I go would be the garlic tuna. They also have this yuzu yellowtail, which has just the perfect amount of tang. The service here is not the reason why I come back. The servers are not very interactive and they become negligent as the night goes on. They tend to forget to refill drinks or take new orders when you have already made your first order of AYCE. Also, the a la carte menu is actually very decently priced for the sushi. I went in one day and I wasn't too hungry so I ordered a la carte and I was full and satisfied. However, for future note, you cannot upgrade from a la carte to AYCE. The oysters served here are odd-tasting compared to other locations because they put the fish eggs on them (and I personally hate fish eggs LOL). Overall, the restaurant has a great selection of rolls and nigiri. This place does not offer a lot for dessert though. You can only order one mochi per person. But the ice cream here is literally the best thing here! It is so rich, creamy and buttery. One time I went with my boyfriend and friend and we had a pretty large meal of nigiri, appetizers, soups, and salads. We also ordered three mochi (green tea and mango), and my friend started out with one red bean ice cream and one vanilla ice cream. And the ice cream was so good, we ended up order a total of 2 red bean ice creams, 2 vanilla ice creams, 1 green tea ice green, and 1 chocolate ice cream (this is for three people LOL). The chocolate ice cream had little oreo bits in it and it was so delicious. Overall, great place to dine. I used to go to Goyemon and Sushi on Tropicana but this place trumps all the others by a long shot. PS. If you're going to try the wings, do NOT get the spicy or the lemon pepper one. The only good one is the garlic wings. The lemon pepper wing was too overpowering and the "spicy" wing had a weird ketchup sauce on it that tasted like the "sweet n sour" sauce for pork ribs or chicken. It is not very good at all.

Every time I come across the newest latest and greatest AYCE sushi spot, I feel like I've cheated on my current "go to" and have to file for divorce. 

Bye-bye ( _______ ).

Enter JJANGA...

The Good:

Quality of Fish! You'd think you were eating at a hip a la carte sushi joint the way the fish was so fresh.

The variety of rolls on the menu were outstanding. I'd say they have 80 different rolls in all. I recommend going with the "non-rice rolls"...it's not filling and each comes with an awesome sauce. I think I tried 4 of them and couldn't even take a picture they were gone so fast. They are on a separate section of the menu.

Appetizers were pretty standard, the fried shrimp with crab meat I think they call it "who's your daddy" was good.

I told the chef named "Koo-koo" that I loved yellow tail nigiri with sliced jalapeno and lemon and he hooked me up with a fat plate. Perfect.

I'm usually needing extra wasabi and ginger at some point in the middle of the meal, but one thing I noticed is that I hardly used any wasabi/soy sauce and ginger throughout the entire meal...it's a credit to how good these rolls are and how well the sauce compliments them. 

They also have a Caucasian guy helping to serve the tables and help expedite along with the Asian servers which I thought was smart.

Water was always refilled and ESPN played muted behind the bar. I really can't find anything to dislike about this place. Even the Iron chef style giant posters of each chef working behind the bar were in good taste.

When they said, "Thanks, see you tomorrow"...I actually kind of thought about it.

Bravo JJANGA, well done.

I have to admit, I was a bit wary of the restaurant's surrounding area at first. The restaurant is located in a run down part of town. However, my doubts were instantly shattered as soon as I entered the restaurant. The place is clean and well-lit, and the employees immediately greeted us.

My boyfriend and I chose to sit at the bar. There are huge banners with pictures of each chef along with their names, which I found really charming. The head chef, who goes by "Captain Choo Choo", is really funny and charismatic. He went out of his way frequently during our visit to make sure we were having a great time.

The food was absolutely delicious. It was decently priced - the most expensive food items were only $8. The chefs really make sure that the food they make is up to par before they hand it to the customers. I highly recommend the Volcano roll and the Threesome special most of all!

Overall, this place is great! The food is great, the chefs are great, and they even have karaoke rooms in the restaurant! I WILL be back here one day, that's for sure.

I looked up the yelp and would like to try. I almost left without any food because it was the long wait since they have the big party to serve. But the staff was very friendly and came to apologize , they also gave some speciality sushi to try. The food was good and definitely will come back

This place is our favorite sushi AYCE restaurant in LV. The service is fantastic with the manager leading the charge. Everyone is friendly and eager to offer suggestions from the extensive menu. Some places almost make you feel guilty about ordering a lot of sushi, but JJanga is different. You feel like they want you to try as many rolls as possible and don't rush you on ordering. If anything the manager brought us extra desert and some items like a pork dish that wasn't even on the menu. We will definitely come back!

Seems like AYCE sushi spots are popping up everywhere in town!

Glad to say, JJANGA is above the avg when it comes to FRESH taste and extremely fast service...almost TOO FAST!!

I usually start with an order of Sake, Hamachi, and Ahi to test the waters on how fresh/enjoyable my experience will be.  Happy to say that they were offering one of the better cuts in town during my visit.  They are on par with some of the best choices around here IMO!

They also offered a couple different options to separate themselves from the competition:

I really enjoyed their Yuzu Hamachi.  The hamachi was fresh, and the yuzu was a nice compliment to the fish! Not overpowering like yuzu can be sometimes.

Hotategai. The scallops were delicious, and the masago was a nice consistency combination. 

Hotate Ebi Skewer. The scallop and shrimp were cooked well, and doused in a mayo like sauce. Not bad!

Calamari Ring. Good! Fairly tender, with a very soft and flavorful breading with a mellow sauce drizzled on top.

My food came out extremely quickly...because I was taking pictures of the food once it arrived, it felt a little overwhelming how fast they were coming out.  Order in SMALLER batches than you are used to when eating sushi!!

Have fun :P
We love this.. Always Clean, Friendly & Efficient. It is a true hidden gem. You will not be disappointed. I have brought in several friends of mine & they all fall in love.
They are so cheap...They need to change half price for all age kids...full price for 8 and up...plus 20% tips on the bill for 6 ppl or more include the kids... Never gonna go there again ..

Jjanga has become one of my favorite places to eat while in Vegas.  Actually, we came here twice during our short visit to Las Vegas for sushi based off a raving recommendation from a local who I trust and I have to agree that this is the top dog sushi establishment in Las Vegas and a must visit in my book from now on whenever I come to Vegas.  Excellent quality, fantastic value, and a dining experience that will leave you with wonderful memories.  *Visualize homer drooling.

Parking is plentiful, and this restaurant is easy to find.  The dinner menu and lunch menu are similarly priced so I would suggest you go with the dinner menu since it comes with some premium items that are oppa gangnam style quality and delicious and will most likely make you a fan.

Located a few minutes away from the strip (I don't recommend trying to walk here from the strip though), i will repeat my sentiment that this is THE place to come for delicious all you can eat sushi.  Their hot tea was also nice and their dessert ice cream were good as well
 Most of the waiters were cool with exception to one that my  wife didn't like very much.  They all speak English here so don't feel intimidated.  Only down side I can think of for this place is (thinking long and hard for a negative)... Well, I heard they can get really busy so this can lead to a wait for food and seats.  Otherwise a-ok USA!

4.000000000001777 stars rounded down make this one a super saiyan solid 4 glowing Yelp stars in my book.  Thank you Jjanga and keep up the good work. Have a positive day.

Our favorite sushi place!  The fish is fresh and amazing and service is fast and staff are very attentive!  Our whole family loves this place and it's the only spot we go to for sushi...  The location isn't the best, but honestly the only place we go to for sushi.  WE love all the fish, but my kids love all the other appetizers on the menu - especially the baby octopus and crab balls.  The most important thing is that for sushi - the fish needs to be fresh... and it is!

Yummy!!

Went in at 7pm on a Friday night, and it was slammed with a wait at the door. About 30 minutes, not bad.

Our table was really close to the table next to us, but this didn't bother me in the least. The atmosphere is really loud and fast-paced, with music going and conversation filling the whole place. People from the karaoke room even danced by in the dining area at one point. 

My 3 favorites were I love my ass, Taste like my x girlfriend, and Screaming Honey which I think is a must-try. The salmon was perfect as far as temp and texture go for a fried item. I almost didn't order it, so glad I did, because it was my favorite!

I had hot green tea and my cup was never empty :) They walked around with the teapot with perfect attention. And it was only $1! For being as busy as they were, they were well staffed, attentive, and fast. The host, waitress, food runner, and busser, and maybe another server or 2 stopped by without being intrusive to check our table and clear and refill. Very good!
 
Definitely do AYCE, especially if you're with a few people. Prices are awesome. Would definitely go back.

$20.95 AYCE lunch. This was the shortest amount of time I've ever spent in an AYCE sushi spot... We left without getting nigiri.

Maybe we just came on an off day. The place was almost empty during prime lunch hour. It's located in a weird unsuspecting strip mall, which has a billiards place we used to visit in our dating days. Oh, the memories of our young love! Anyway...

Le sigh. Our rolls, even the hand rolls, were falling apart. The fish tasted a bit off- the salmon wasn't rich and buttery. I asked for a veggie roll, even clarified twice after he asked, and still got a veggie tempura. Everything was covered in sauce, especially eel sauce, even though there was no mention of it in the description. Normally, sushi spots are very good about listing everything in and on the roll. All of the rolls we ordered tasted the same, oddly enough. The Naruto roll was filled with so much imitation crab and so little of the other fillings that were supposed to be in it that I had to force myself to eat it. And right after that is when we left. 

The hostess and waitresses were so sweet though. And our ice teas were also delicious.

Unsatisfactory- this is what I get for cheating on Umiya.

Their menu online says the classic rolls are 3.00$ but when you go to the restaurant they give you a different menu saying they're 4.50$. 
A classic example of 'bait and switch' that is definitely not suitable for a restaurant that relies on locals. 
Nigiri and sashimi were ok but the sushi wasn't good at all. 
At least the waitress was nice but that's not enough for us to come back.

This was my first time to a sushi restaurant with an eat all you can style without it being a buffet with just ok sushi. Although you can order straight from the menu, your also have the option to do the set price meal but order as much as you want from anything on the menu. The service was fast! We ordered a little at a time to minimize waste and we waited less than five minutes for our orders to come to our table. The sushi tasted fresh and was delicious! The staff is super attentive and friendly. Dessert (with the exception of the Mochi) was also unlimited. Got to try that red bean ice cream! Needless to say, I got my fill and was totally satisfied. The $25 fixed dinner price was totally worth it!

I have eaten at this place once, and it shall be my last visit ever. Perhaps it was just a one time incident but overall...it was a terrible experience.

Quality:
1.) Fish Meats on Nigiris are not fresh at all. You can tell it is kept for days.
2.) Rice is not compiled correctly, loose af.
3.) Disproportion amount of rice vs. meat. It's like they are stuffing you with rice.

Customer Service:
1.) I've asked one of the employee (presuming it is the manager or owner) what is the reason for the qualities of the sushi, and in response he told me "Idk, what do you want me to do, you want me to ask the chef out and talk to you?"
2.) The waiters and waitresses were polite, except for one of the employee's bazaar behavior.

Honestly after eating at Hikari, so far there isn't a local AYCE sushi better than them (Again, excluding fine dining sushi restaurants). In addition, lol I do not represent anyone except for myself.

Been wanting to go to this spot finally did tonight with my family... I would give the food 3...  in the beginning it's was good up until our first order came and that was it literally worst service I had in town filled my water once and I had to ask to put in another order and after that was a wrap as if they didn't want us to order no more our bill was 100 and I tip off what kind of service I got and yea that's that

Hands down my favorite sushi spot in Vegas. Very lowkey and chill atmosphere during the day and lively on weekends (fri-sun). Food is great but could improve on the customer service. Staff sometimes very short in response ti any of your questions or submission of your order with waiter. Overall good food!

Alright so fellow elite yelpers ive been reading your reviews and your great words about this place have lured me to come try this place. I honestly order the same thing everytime i go to sushi and figure out what i like best. 

Appetizers-4/5
Baby Octopus (5/5)- This was my favorite
Shrimp Tempura
Salmon Collar 
Oysters 

Nigiri- 3/5
Garlic Tuna 
Super White Tuna
Albacore
Yuzu Yellowtail- this was good
Masago
Amaebi w/ shrimp Heads

Hand Rolls- 3.5/5
Salmon Skin
Spicy Scallop

I really think its comparable to other sushi restaurants i didnt eat as much as i wanted to because im trying to watch what i eat but i did have 2 rounds of nigiri so was pretty full. The service was awesome everything came out quick and multiple people were there to fill up my water and ask me if i liked and everything was ok. Only bad thing i can really say about this place is it didnt wow me ive probably eaten at AYCE establishments all over town and they have a similar taste to everything.

The place had a great ambience to it and i look forward to eating here again but still this would be my second choice. Id still go to my favorite first

First time coming here yesterday for my friends birthday! We didn't wait too long to be seated, which was nice. Their nigiri just melts in your mouth. The fish tasted fresh and yummy. At some point we ordered more, and had to wait 20 minutes before another waitress came by to check on us and take our orders down again. Turns out our order was never put in?? The service was overall good, so was the food and the atmosphere. Definitely will come by again.

Sumo sushi2 used to be my favorite spot till they changed management and everything I loved changed too, from food to the staffs! Ive tried to look for a new spot but nothing came even close. that is till I found out the old crew are all in a new location. Well hello there JJanga! First time I came here, I saw all of the crew, even some of the servers. Felt like home lol
Ive been back here so many times after that.

Today, I was craving for some fried rice cake but I was told they were currently out of it. Bummer! But we had the regular sushi, sashimi and rolls. Awesome as always. 

We always order fried baby squid(extra crispy). Yum-O! Sorry squidward. 

I was happy they included the age dashi tofu to their AYCE menu. Its a must for me. This and the rice cake. 

And this is the only place that caters to my extra strong ice green tea. Thank you guys. 

I tried the threesome special. It has spicy tuna, crab, soft shell crab but it had me with deep fried cream cheese. Come on! Cream cheese?? And its deep fried?? Me likey! 

Now for the staffs... everyone was great as always. Nothing new there. All were attentive, nice and fast. Too bad choo choo wasn't there. He's a riot! 
This particular lady server was too sweet when I was ready to pay she asked me if Im full already and if I still want the rice cake? Turned out it was just delivered. Aawww... bless you. 

The location is now a bit far from my place. But close to my favorite boba place lol. Its clean, organized and well lit. There's tv and background korean songs. Love it! Can you guys play more 2ne1 songs, please???

I will definitely come back unless you guys move again! Please let us know

I have been to Jjanga no less than 10 times and have NEVER been disappointed with either the food or the service.  The AYCE doesn't even feel like it as the sushi has always been individually crafted and served up fresh and the variety is endless.  Until shown I'm missing something, this will continue to be my #1 sushi spot in Vegas!
Can't beat the all you can eat  plenty of menu options, sushi rolls, and dessert. Overwhelming amount of choices and there is something for everyone.

This is my second time here and I come here every time I'm in Vegas. The atmosphere of the place they give to us is amazing every time. I always feel super welcomed every time I come back. 

Quality has not changed since the very first time I've been here and I hope it stays like that for a good time. Please do not ever sell out and move locations. It's kind of good that you're off the strip so it doesn't ever get too crowded. So far, I've never had to wait in line at this place. Seating is always instant and immediately.

This will be my all time favorite AYCE place, even from California. I can't possibly think of any other place that beats this place. Keep doing what you guys do and you'll stay good. Customer service always on tip top point and you guys are great, thank you for the awesome experiences!

Food quality is pretty average given a lot of the other options in the area. Has AYCE, but nigiri is pretty heavy on the rice. I would return to this place but when I went I had a bad experience with the staff. the server and chefs were obviously talking about me and my gf and went as far as to point.

Great place for all you can eat sushi! Even if you're allergic to seafood, like how my girlfriend is, then there's still a lot of stuff to choose from, like: French fries, lemon or garlic wings, miso pork, and different soups and salads. 

The service is also great. Most of the food came out fast and it surprised us. The severs are nice and they wear cool name tags that light up. 

Definitely a place that I'll always be going back to!
A real gem tucked away in a small strip mall. Great sushi choices all made fresh to order. All you can eat lunch and dinner choices or order by the piece.

I came here with my family of 7 including myself. We were seated right away and the ambiance of the restaurant was lovely with nice decor and it was very spacious. The food itself was pretty good. I love the creative combinations of different ingredients in many of the rolls that were very flavorful. I also definitely liked the garlic tuna nigiri and highly recommend it. However, the service was awful. Our server was nice, but the first strike was when she told us we couldn't order anymore surf clam because apparently 4 orders was the limit, but that seemed like an arbitrary decision because no where on the menu did it say there were limits on certain items. The second strike is the lack of service throughout because it took so long for her to come back to us to take our orders and the wait became longer after every order, and we didn't even order frequently. The final strike was when we ordered a single item (I forgot what it was), and had been waiting for it for probably 10 minutes to be informed that they had it, but it was going to take a long time to cook it and we politely understood. Another 10 minutes later, we started to become skeptical of why it took that long, then another server informs us that it's actually "MIA" and that they actually don't have the ingredients for it, so they pretty much lied to us about it and were bold enough to think we'd believe them. So considering all the strikes, that's when we were pretty sure that they didn't want to serve us anymore because they probably thought we ordered too much or maybe because they thought we were sharing with some of my family members who had a la carte. It was just an awful experience of feeling like they wanted us to stop ordering and just leave because we "exceeded" the cost and they were probably losing money so they felt as if they had to solve it by trying to avoid us.

I came in during lunch and we had to wait to be seated for a party of 3 for about 10 minutes. From there we waited for our drinks for 5 minutes and we have been waiting for someone to take our order for about half an hour. After waiting we witnessed tables who sat AFTER us getting their food. So we decided to not dine in anymore. It was hard enough to wait in general but we had to wait for the server to come to let him know we weren't dining in anymore. He came to our table and asked, "did you guys order already?" And I said, "no" and that we were actually not going to dine in anymore and he asked, "why are you leaving?" And I explained that we have been waiting for half an hour just to take our order and even flagging him down he didn't come to us. So we felt like we could be at another restaurant where they'll be able to serve us effectively. Then another customer comes up to him while we were leaving saying that her table has been waiting for their check for over 1 hour and he just said, "okay." Then walked away quickly. My party and I left, the customer service wasn't great and attentive as it used to be. I don't recommend Jjanga to anyone anymore. Seems like their staff isn't amazing as it was before.
Wonderful service, not pushy and in a hurry, and good smelling fish. What else do you want??

The three of us went there on a Saturday night celebrating our daughter's 21st birthday, sat at the Sushi Bar and got the all you can eat. This was some of the best sushi we've ever had - very fresh and very tasty. JJanga took great care of us - we let him decide what to serve us and eventually we had to tell him to stop feeding us! The Yellow Tail belly was amazing as were the rice-less rolls.

Thanks JJanga for a fantastic evening.

It was also great to see all the locals in there and the friendliness all around.

We found the best Sushi place actually better than Yamasushi everything is fresh service is good theres a guy that takes empty plates every 5 minutes Love it i hate eating good food on messy table Nate the asst mgr is super nice my bf actually liked him and thats not normal he always complains about service whereever we go and i had to tell Nate that. I went 2 more times after so thats 3x in one week. Oh and they have 11pm to 1am Happy Hour omg just perfect!!!
The food is really delicious! Choo choo is super nice and made this experience exciting! He made me a special creation, which was amazing!!! Will defiantly return.

AYCE sushi lunch and dinner! I came here a couple times for dinner and left satisfied each time. The portions are just right to sample different dishes and the quality of the fish is average. You get what you pay for. However, the food is enjoyable and the special dishes such as the beef, oyster, and golden scallops are a must.

The downside is that service can be a tad bit slow when you want to order more food. However, the food comes out fairly quickly. Beware: if you order too many items at once, one or two may never end up showing up to your table.

Never again! Visited twice in the same week and the same happened twice!
Dirty dishes , especially plates , pieces of rice and nasty stuff!
My wife had order some veggie sushi and she got spicy tuna al over the plate .
When we told the server about it she said "yeah it's from they're hands" (the guys who are making the rolls) .
On top of that I deserve a free AYCE and they had charge me the sales tax for it!

Jjanga was  nothing short of awesome!! service was spot on and every roll was amazing! 4 of us ended up sharing well over 20 rolls, we definitely didn't fill up on rice so the ratio was great too.  my only complaint was the iced green tea could have been more green...it was more like green water

During my visit, my group decided to do a la cart and we quickly realized that the food was tasteful but super small! The serving size is not justified to the prices. I do have to warn others to stray away from choosing the special hand rolls (burritos) because my brother and I ordered all of them thinking that the size would actually be "burrito sized" but they are literally as big as 3 sushi combined.

This is my go-to all you can eat sushi spot. Their fish nigiri is always fresh and they have my favorite item - the garlic gingko nut!! If you don't know what this is, you should definitely try it.

The ambient is cozy with friendly waitstaff and attentive service, most of the time.  The pricing is also reasonable - I think dinner is around $27.

Food is good and I love the place! Chefs are nice coz we sit on the bar table. That's why we can talk to them. Get the uni!!! I love their sweet shrimp also!!Food is good and I love the place! Chefs are nice coz we sit on the bar table. That's why we can talk to them. Get the uni!!! I love their sweet shrimp also!!Food is good and I love the place! Chefs are nice coz we sit on the bar table. That's why we can talk to them. Get the uni!!! I love their sweet shrimp also!!

This place has good food...period. But sometimes that doesn't cut it. I've been here twice for AYCE, and both times the sushi was fresh. My second time was tonight  for my friends birthday dinner. We expected to get a few drinks with dinner as well as take some sake bombs, but when we got there we found out they can't serve alcohol because their liquor license is expired...what!? Never had this happen before..but I brushed it off because we were still can grub on some good food. At the end of dinner, my friend ordered Uni (Sea Urchin). When they brought it out we instantly noticed it was a dark brown color, it's supposed to be yellow!! She tasted it and couldn't even get it down. I was surprised they served it to us! She told the manager that it made her feel sick...he apologized but didn't offer us anything. Normally when this happens to me at other restaurants they give you one complementary item. Although I do like this place, I have to knock off two stars for the expired liquor license and the spoiled Uni!

This was an amazing visit! I very much enjoyed the sushi which the chefs had done an amazing job creating new and unique rolls. Or my friends might say innovative! Or intriguing even. Yuri was a fantastic service. Also Diane made our night just a little bit better. I recommend this place to anybody that loves a good night of sushi and friends. I look forward to coming back anytime I come back to Vegas. We had so many different rolls! And to top it off the green tea ice cream came with toasted coconut shavings!

This is our go-to place for rolls, usually for our mid-week sushi craving. It's nicely decorated and the staff are friendly. I can't say that service is perfect all the time, as I've had Goldilocks variations all three times (one time was so-so, one time was bad, the most recent time was great). 

I feel like it's quite affordable for what you get, considering the rolls aren't ever extra small or oddly sized.

Sometimes you'll get complimentary rolls and soju. I was very fond of the grapefruit soju, I think it was sparkling as well. It was highly unlikely I would have ordered it, but now that I've tried it, I would consider it again sometime. 

Our favorite rolls are the spicy ones: mexican roll and BYA. My favorite nigiri is garlic tuna and yuzu yellowtail. We weren't a fan of the no-rice rolls, which sound like a great idea at first, but the flavors weren't outstanding. (Perhaps we just happened to pick the two that had a creamy sauce - I think it was the Q roll and tuna naruto).
The best sushi buffet I've EVER been to! And I've worked years at multiple Japanese restaurants!

Hands down my favorite in Vegas. AYCE lunch price is $20.95 and dinner price is $25.95, so nothing out of the ordinary. Their nigiri is always so fresh and their rolls are really unique. (My favorite is the threesome special and the choo choo special--off the menu!) The servers are always friendly, and even when I don't finish all my food, they NEVER charge me lol. 

There was actually one time my cousin and I had to tap out with probably a good 2 and a half rolls left. We were expecting to be charged for the leftovers, which we were fine with, but we decided to still order our dessert anyway lol. So we stopped our waiter to try and order some ice cream but he saw our leftovers and was like "Sorry guys, there's just so many leftover pieces, we aren't allowed to give ice cream." But we totally understood, considering how much food was still on the table. But 5 minutes later he came back with bowls of ice cream for everyone and said, "I felt really bad telling you guys no, so I just brought you guys ice cream anyway." AND we weren't charged for the leftovers lol. So coming from a personal experience, I can definitely say that the service is impeccable lol.

I'm giving them a 4 not a 5 though because I feel like they could add more to their dessert menu lol but that's just me. I'd give them a 4 1/2 if I could, but I can't. Sorry Jjanga lol.
All you can eat! What more can I say!!! The food is amazing, and they all have really interesting names.

Not a lot people know about Jjanga yet so it was pretty easy to get a table on a Friday night that we went. The chefs and servers are Korean.

Nigiri:
We tried a bunch of nigiri: salmon, garlic tuna, amaebi, surf clam, Cajun albacore, super white and hamachi. Fresh fish and properly-cooked rice. Beef tataki was awesome! 5/5

Salmon Skin Roll:
Crispy salmon skin, right amount of eel sauce. 5/5

Screaming Orgasm and Sashimi Salad:
These items are only offered during dinner. The sauce is not a lot and is just enough to coat the fish. 4/5

Beef Steak and Pork Steak:
The beef steak is served on a sizzling plate but the flavor is lacking. There's nothing special about it. The pork steak was fatty and pretty tasty. 3/5

Shrimp Tempura:
Comes in 3 pieces per order. The sauce was ok but the shrimp didn't seem fresh and the batter was a but saltier than normal. 3/5

Agedashi Tofu:
The tofu is served lightly battered and fried and the sauce is good. 4/5

Uni:
They originally told us they were out of uni. But a few minutes later, we got a small bowl of uni. It is quite fresh. 4/5

French Fries:
I love fries so I got excited when I saw this on the menu. I had to have it. Their fries were just alright. It lacks flavor and seems hollow inside. 3/5

What's nice is they offer brown rice. Their lunch AYCE is $21 and dinner is $26 so, it's not bad. The service is good. They gave our food to the next table and vice versa but it's no biggie.

This place is rather new so I'm not surprised their sushi is fresh and they have a good rice to fish ratio. It would be interesting to come back here after a few months to see if they'd be consistent since most sushi places in Vegas start out good but as months go by, quality and service declines.

Now I don't normally deduct stars from a restaurant based solely on horrible service because lets face it--- it's usually a hit or miss when it comes to getting a good/bad server. I don't believe good service necessarily reflects on the overall quality of food in a restaurant, which is ultimately what truly matters. However, my experience at JJanga this past weekend was SO horrible that I had to deduct a star from its otherwise 4 star rating...

TO JJANGA MANAGEMENT: FIND YOURSELF BETTER SERVERS THAT KNOW HOW TO BE POLITE TO GUESTS, NOT RUDE! 

It was my birthday and I went with my boyfriend around 4:30PM to celebrate.The restaurant wasn't busy at this time but because there was only one sushi chef working, our food took about 15-20 minutes to come out PER DISH, ITEM BY ITEM. Since the AYCE portions were very small, we finished each dish within a few minutes and had to wait another 15-20 minutes for the next dish. It was very annoying to have such a long wait time in between dishes, especially since everything was bite size. The girl that served us had a serious staring problem. I'm not the type of person to make assumptions about someone I don't know, but I swear the way she full on stared/glared at me while taking my order made me feel like she was inspecting every pore and blemish on my face. It was beyond uncomfortable and made me feel like she was judging me on a personal level, instead of being a professional server. Never once did she smile or speak a full sentence to me. She was so unwelcoming that I actually felt awkward and hesitant to order from her. To make matters worse, she only made direct eye contact with my boyfriend. At one point, my normally unobservant boyfriend even made a comment to me about her staring issues. When she did speak, I noticed that she wasn't fluent in English, which is completely fine. But seriously? As a server you should at least have some type of communication skill. Being shy and non-responsive is NOT the right attitude for the hospitality industry. How hard was it to just happily take an order? It wasn't like we were complaining about her service then and there. We walked in and immediately she eyed me up and down like I was some B*** she wanted to cat fight at the club -_-. I've had bad service before but never downright rude service like this.

That aside, when the food did mange to come out most items were decent. The quality of fish was fresh albeit the portion was extremely small, even for AYCE sizes. We're talking about 1 piece of agedashi tofu, 2 pieces of gyoza, 2 pieces of fried scallops, etc.. all of that equate to literally 2 bites for each portion. As employees of Japanese restaurants on and off the strip, we were very annoyed with the way the sushi chef made the nigiris. The rice kept falling apart when we tried to pick it up. It was so poorly made that the rice would crumble into the soy sauce dish, causing us to eat the fish separate from the rice that was drench inside of soy sauce. Anyone that is a sushi chef or works in an upscale Japanese restaurant can tell you, crumbling rice is a big no no. 

Overall, this was my second time dining at JJanga. The first time was during their grand opening. I remember service being poor back then as well, but I figured it was because they had just opened and were training their servers. Sadly, the second time around after this establishment has expanded to two locations, I realize that nothing has improved. 

Most likely I won't be going back any time soon.

We came in as a group of 6 for a mix AYCE/A La Carte dinner during the busy Thanksgiving weekend. There was plenty of space available and the ambiance was just right for a calm relaxing getaway from the strip. Service was on point and food came rather quickly. There is a difference in portions between AYCE and A La Carte, so keep that in mind when placing orders. Favorites were the uni and mochi, but those were limited to one order per person for AYCE.

Went here a couple of months ago for a late lunch. There was no wait when we got there, but the crowd followed shortly after. I got one of tier combos (ramen + sushi). Sushi was ok, it was a California roll and the ramen was good. I'd come back for the deal, but I don't think the ramen made that big of an impression on me.
Best sushi in vegas period. Great customer service, amazing quality, and the drinks are cold. The choo choo special is something every sushi lover needs to try. Cheers!

Been here quite a few times and the fish is really good. They have one of the best hamachis (yellowtail) in town. Kind of sort of melts in your mouth hamachi. Theres so many ayce sushi in las vegas but only so many can have quality fish and this place has great quality. Not as many specialty rolls for the specialty roll lovers but for real sushi lovers their nigiri is A1.

This is the best place I've came across for AYCE sushi! Everything was fresh and cooked as you order, the sushi were on point. I loved everything they had to offer, & I couldn't try everything on the menu, I left there stuffed and satisfied.

Usually 4 or 5 stars are generated on a combination of food, service, ambiance, prices, etc.  so the two stars are one each for service and prices.  Everything else is ruined mostly by the short-tempered chef.  He raised his voice, gestured, and gave dirty looks to all the servers.  When you treat the people who work for you like garbage - it's a clear reflection of how you think of yourself, how you treat your food and business.  These poor servers walked away from this idiot with tears in their eyes several times.  Not only the turn over will be high, but their dedication to the boss, the chef, the business, and the clients will be destroyed.  Shame on this chef for having no control on his emotions. Shame on him for embarrassing his staff in front of customers.  I'm never coming back because people like this rarely change at that age.  It may be a cultural thing and I get that.  I'm a foreigner too. But we are in America now. Grow the hell up and learn the rules and how to control your temper.  Sexist too. Mostly was rude to female servers and not the male.  So old-world.  Such a bad vibe.  Terrible.  I thank all the servers from the bottom of my heart for their hard work.  And remember - ITS NOT YOU.  ITS HIM!
About food.....  The Uni was old and bad.  Most pieces of raw fish were tiny.  Cooked meats were overlooked.  Rolls represent Japanese cuisine and culture in a horrible light.  The hot tea was resembled hot water. I couldn't tell actually if there was any tea in it.  "Real" wasabi was not very real and didn't have a kick.  Tofu which is suppose to be smooth, cold, and melt in your mouth was horrible dried piece of cardboard.  We both ordered Sweet Shrimp.  We got two shrimps and six heads - WTF?!?!   Quail Egg is on the menu, but when I requested it - I was told that they haven't had it for a while.  Not sure what else to say.....
I do not know why the say it's closed. I just had lunch there. The remodel is done and they're back open for business, and as good as always.
Jjanga is definitely one if the few better AYCE sushi places in town! Very friendly and good quality food. Very attentive. Will definitely be back!

Sushi was ok. Baby octopus was the best thing on the menu. Service was really bad..the server only paid attention to one big party and practically forgot about all the other patrons. Not worth coming back here again. Then he asked us to vote for them for Nevada's best...hmm, I don't think so. Peace out Jjanga.

This is a super duper late review but anywho...

My friends and I came to this location for dinner one night a while back. We usually go to Goyemon for dinner but we decided to try this place cause it was my co-worker's favorite place to eat sushi at. Jjanga seems to be quite popular since there were a lot of people waiting to get seated. We waited for a bit before we got our table. 

Four of us opted in for their AYCE (all you can eat) option while my boyfriend decided to go a la carte. When my friends and I go into an AYCE sushi joint, we just go all out and start off with 10 orders of salmon, cajun albacore, yellowtail...and then 5 orders of everything else we like to eat. HOWEVER, the server told us that it would be smarter to reduce our orders so it'll come out faster. HUH? Large orders apparently slow them down. It made absolute zero sense to us seeing as if you're cutting a piece of fish for five orders then it wouldn't take that much longer to be cutting the same piece of fish for ten orders. Well, whatever. We did as the server suggested. 

The food took forever to get out to the table. 

They also lost half of our orders. Half of our orders never came. Half of the orders that we already reduced to the server's liking. 

As for the fish itself ... it was quite lacking. The flavors seem very very mild compared to what I'm used to. I might as well be eating rice. 

We also had 2-3 orders of uni (sea urchin) to give it a try and well, it was possibly the worse uni I have ever had the pleasure of eating. It was mighty bitter. I was a little worried. I told our server that it was bitter and she just looked confused. She left saying that she was going to tell the chefs but never took the uni away. I had to get someone else to take it away. 

It also took ages for them to bring us the check. They also didn't give us a stamp card (loyalty card - every 10 ayce, you get 1 free I think.) Therefore, at the end of it all, I don't think I'll come back ever again. I don't like the service, I don't like the bitter seafood, and I don't appreciate flavorless fish. Thanks!
Awesome AYCE sushi selection! $3.00 beer but it's the "Coronita" small bottles haha! Quick service too but a couple of the servers need to get happy about their jobs.

This place had been in my bookmarks for a while, and it didn't disappoint! (well, maybe a little tiny bit).

I had the opportunity to celebrate a friend's birthday here, and truly had a blast. As it turns out, they have separate, private karaoke rooms were groups of 6 or more can have their private gatherings and enjoy some bomb food. Best part? They had no issues charging us separately for our convenience. A BIG plus there.

So why 5 starts? Here is why:

* Service: GREAT! The servers were incredibly efficient and were constantly checking up on us. Despite being almost 30 of us, the two servers were calm, collected, and ALWAYS had a smile on their face. I felt welcomed and catered to, the entire evening.

* Food- Delicious and fresh. The rolls for the AYCE are a bit small, but I actually like that because I was able to try a variety of different rolls and flavors. Every single dish I tried was yummy and had a distinct flavor profile

* Speed- I was pleasantly surprised when I saw the food arriving within minutes of everyone ordering. The food arrived beautifully presented, so despite the large amount of orders, the kitchen did NOT get sloppy. Kudos to the entire team.

* Accuracy- This is where the miss the mark a little bit. A few of us were missing some of the dishes we ordered, and some of the food that was supposed to be hot (like my shrimp tempura) was more on the warm side. However, given the size of the party, this was NOT the end of the world. Despite missing a couple of items I ordered, the awesome food and service more than made up for it. I was originally going to take away one star for this, but that would be too harsh.

Anywyas, I hope you enjoy your visit to JJanga!

Stopped by for lunch on a recent trip, and sat at the sushi bar for the AYCE

Very impressed with the freshness, the speed of service, and the variety offered for the AYCE.  Tried a couple of the no rice rolls, the cucumber wrap made it difficult for the roll to hold together, but the freshness and crisp nature really went well with the other flavors in the rolls.

Though I saw 4 sushi chefs at the bar when I came in, Sponge was doing almost all the preparation, that might slow things down a bit on a real busy day, but for the most part I was getting plates before the prior plate was finished

Definitely a place I will try to get back to on my next trip out

I agree with Nikki C. 
This place kills the competition. 
No more trial and error hunting for the perfect sushi place. Been to all the popular sushi places in LV, this one takes the rice cake. Fresh food, no warm chewy fish. 
Try the JJANGA roll and the calamari.

JJANGA has one of the best sushis in town in my opinion! The reason I say that is because they have a variety of rolls such as the no rice rolls, baked, shrimp tempura, and deep fried rolls. I've always went to this place with my girlfriend and we never get tired of it. We always order a lot of salmon nigiri in our visits and the fish to rice ration is perfect. Their AYCE (all you can eat) menu has no restricted items. You can eat everything on the menu if you wish to like to. Their service is always on point, they're quick with delivering your order, you don't always have to ask for a refill on your drink because they always make sure you have a full beverage. They offer AYCE for lunch between 11:30 AM to 3PM for $20.95. Dinner they serve between 3PM to 2AM for $25.95. I have yet tried their A La Carte menu because we've always been getting AYCE, but I'm positive that their entrees do not disappoint. I highly recommend this place for all you sushi lovers! Love this place!!

I was here for the first time based on a "Meet Up" by Mickie Choi. The restaurant at first impression was very impressive. Then I realized the staff was very disorganized with only 15 guests. Imagine if I bring my group of 20+, it will have been a very disappointing experience. They couldn't get the orders straight, everything I ordered went to the host!! They took care of the host. I NEVER got my food in a timely manner. The entre's were being served and I never received my appetizers, and I'm paying full bore! No discounts! I hate destroying restaurants on Yelp but, this place deserves a less than average review.

Ok I have been to many all you can eat sushi bars in last Vegas. At night I had hard time finding the restaurant it was hidden in a little plaza, the sign was hard to see it was in a dark blue neon sign. 
I walked in on a Tuesday night around 8:30pm for dinner the price $25.99 for all you can eat. I sat at the sushi bar in front of sushi chef choo choo who was the head sushi chef . He provided me with good service. The waitresses only checked on me for initial order of drinks. Over all hot food service was ok. It's about the same service I have received at most all you can eat sushi bars in Vegas. 
Now the food, I always go for nigiri rather than rolls to try the fish out. I find the fish to rice ratio to be okay , a little on the too much rice side. Another thing no half rolls which I wish they did. The fish was fresh overall, only one uni, sweet shrimp and one beef tataki nigiri allowed during dinner only. The appetizers pretty standard as most sushi bars. I found the freshman roll which has no rice are with rice paper and cowboy roll was good and I recommend. The tuna poke was spicy. Dinner for one with order of ice tea was $31 plus tip $40. $5 to sushi chef and rest to table waitress.
Good quality food. Good quick service. They recently remodeled the restaurant and it's a lot nicer. Get the calamari!

I want to start this review by asking you to do an experiment.   Naturally you're probably too lazy or disinterested to do it but hopefully my point will get across either way.   Do a search for "Sushi" on Yelp and look at the results.   Go pages deep.  Nearly all of them garnering 3.5-5 stars.  Wow, Vegas sure does have a lot of AMAZING Sushi restaurants doesn't it?   Either that or there are a lot of people who love Sushi no matter where they get it and generally have a very pleasant experience each and every time they have it.  Having talked to several friends and co-workers in which I believe this is the case, I've decided to implement a rule by which I will no longer go by high Yelp ratings for Sushi restaurants.   I get it, Sushi is delicious, but when I see a 4 and a half star average on a place I expect it to be unique in some sense and not simply another standard AYCE Sushi option, which is exactly how I found JJANGA to be.

This is by no means my way of saying JJANGA was bad.  Far from it   I went here for a co-worker's "going away" party, and we sat at the Sushi Bar.   Ricky was our sushi chef, and even though he was admittedly slow to start (it took a while before our sushi orders started landing in front of us), he was very pleasant and made our dining experience a fun one.   I wasn't extremely impressed with the Sushi, but I also wasn't disappointed.   JJANGA's AYCE menu reminded me most of "I Love Sushi"'s, with several sharing the same name.   Ricky confirmed that either some of the chefs or the owners came from "I Love Sushi".   Now I can go either way on Sushi:  on the one hand I like eating Nigiri where the freshness of the fish is going to really stand out, and on the other I also don't mind eating insane concoctions that are the specialty at places like this where fish plays second fiddle the the other components and sauces.   So we had our share of Nigiri and on the other side, rolls like "Sexy Time" and "I love my ass",   Everything was fine, but nothing really stood out to me as a reason to choose JJANGA over any other Sushi restaurant in town.   Okay I take that back, I decided I simply had to try to "Bacon Roll" because curiosity got the best of me.   I actually found it to be delicious as it tasted exactly as you or I would expect it to.  

I do love saying the name of the restaurant though, which almost had me bump it up to a 4.   But then the entire point from the first paragraph would sort of be moot.

If the menu was still the same from when I first visited this place it would still be a solid 5 star review. They took off a bunch of my faves though :(. The Choo Choo special and threesome special are no longer options. The rolls have changed names and the menu is now very similar to that of Sushi Loca with the same names of "tastes like your ex-girlfriend" and "I love my ass" rolls. The service is still top notch and the variety of fresh fish is abundant. The fried baby octopuses are soooo good! This is definitely one of my fave ayce sushi places in town.

Love love love. Must try is the "Fat Ass" roll and the Monkey borito. Located about 10min off strip, but totally worth the trip. W/ all u can eat option, for the price, CANT BEAT IT!!!  Will come back again and again..

Wish I could give them 0 star reason being we walked in and sat for 15 min for a table the workers saw us walk in but did not even approach us ...... We approached the waiter after they sat a couple that came after us and we were sitting for 15 min

I usually eat here after work but again usually at a table. For the first time today, I took a seat at the bar. Not gunna lie, shxt was awesome. The sushi chefs were fun to talk to and the rest of the staff was very attentive. I love sushi. I love hot saki. I love this place. FIVE STARS DAMMIT!!!
The screaming orgasm is so good! And definitely great service. Everyone was very friendly. Will come back again next time we're back in Las Vegas.

This place is awesome. Great atmosphere, quality food and great customer service. I would definitely recommend to anyone who wants a great sushi experience. Good for families, business lunches, or night out with some friends. All you can eat is insane!

Delicious!!! The food was sooo good! We were referred to another ayce sushi place, but after reading reviews that place and food poisoning, we opted for something else. I yelped it and found this place. Food was dished/staged really well, servers were really nice and everything tasted great. They have an extensive ayce menu which can be overwhelming when you first see it, but who can complain about having choices right? We probably could have saved a few bucks and a few calories by opting for a la carte, but it's hard to make that decision when you're super hungry.

My advice? If you're not that hungry and usually get full off one roll or even two, go for a la carte. If you can put it down, opt for the ayce. My only gripe is that the kids ayce price is half the price of the adults meal, even though they don't even eat that much! I know it's standard fare, but I say reduce prices for kids!

The last ayce sushi I visited was sushi neko. It was great - that is probably why I was underwhelmed with Jjanga. Their menu is still good but lacking in the sense that they have too many tempura rolls, thin slices of fish, they do not taste as fresh/expected. 

tips:
ika
ebi skewer
scallops
yuzu yellowtail

Ok so first I got introduced to this place by a friend said it was amazing. And it was food wise customer service wise wtf it took them 20 min to take our second order. Next time we will sit at the bar. That is my only complaint. 

The food was absolutely amazing so fresh and tasty it was amazing. And the beer was ice cold. I read some other reviews and I was excited about the place the we all know the customer service and kill it for all of us. I give them another shot cuz the food was that good. I never seen a manger bus tables take food get drinks he was amazing to watch I think he worked harder then the rest. I'll be back the food is amazing.

Jjanga is a fantastic discovery. Wonderful food and more importantly, excellent service. For comparison, my father and I were in the mood for sushi, so we made a reservation at Jjanga in Chinatown, and a certain pan-Asian bistro, at a Forbes Five Star property, on Las Vegas Boulevard. Both reservations were made online and both noted my father's nut allergy. The following morning, Jjanga sent us a personal email, thanking us for the reservation, expressing their pleasure in our choosing to dine with them, and what items on the menu contained nuts. I replied to this email, a short thank you of sorts, and even received a personal confirmation for this. The restaurant on the Forbes Five Star property made no such connection, genuine sense of interest, or anticipatory service. At that point, we completely cancelled our reservation with the bistro on Las Vegas Boulevard and committed to Jjanga. Once your inside, such attentive service continues. Our waitress essentially greeted us at our table, immediately took our drink orders, and visited us several times. We were not a special party though, we could see her and the rest of the wait staff constantly running about the venue, never once stopping. 

Regarding the cuisine, some may say that the sushi menu lacks diversity. I guess that is true in regards to the specific kinds of fish served, but the combinations and pairings of ingredients create a hearty and fruitful selection. Jjanga even seems to acknowledge this limitation, for it does not offer specifically sashimi options on the menu, instead dedicating space to rolls, non-rice rolls, and unique creations. A true mark of culinary skill is working around a boundary with apparent ease. Before reading the other reviews, I had forgotten the lack of strictly sashimi options. Who cares? For a traditional Japanese sushi joint in - let's remember - the God damn desert, my palate was excellently entertained.

As my father said in regards to the atmosphere, Jjanga "lacks pretension." Jjanga is dedicated to the food and service, without being too serious for sushi novices and out-of-state visitors. Everyone is welcome and appreciated, and the decor reflects that in a playful yet tasteful following of Vegas's themed design, which offers several seating options that can feel more private and intimate. It says, "We know you're here to have fun, so here's something just a taste kitsch, but properly cozy too."

Jjanga is a place for locals as well as vistors, so casual attire is most appropriate. That said, if you're travelling from the Boulevard, to taste something authentic and a little warmer, maybe show the respect to put on a jacket and some nice shoes like you would have at a comparable place at a hotel-casino. Jjanga maybe be more casual than some of those options, but it's still a class act that can compete with any Boulevard venue.

After hearing about this place from people in the sushi community I decided to try it out. This place has rockstar quality food, decor is nice, service is on point and the price for All You Can Eat is crazy low compared to the quality. Nina is the server of choice!! Highly recommended her.I do advise everyone to at least check this spot out!! Ill be back for sure!

This is seriously the best local sushi joint in town! Definitely tops most of the high end sushi restaurants on the strip. Come hungry because you will want to do All-You-Can-Eat to experience the delicious menu.  Be sure to complement your sushi with sake.  My favorite is grape fruit sake.  
The staff is always energetic and welcoming.  If you aren't too familiar with the menu, they always have great suggestions.  Bring a group of friends to experience this local jewel and be sure to get your All-You-Can-Eat loyalty punch card.

I consider myself a sushi connoisseur . I have ate at every sushi place in Las Vegas . Sumo sushi 2 use to be my spot . That is where I met Jjanga , choo choo and mr. Koo. These guys as a team of chefs make dining for sushi the most fun you will at a sushi bar.  The atmosphere is very welcoming and the staff are awesome . I wish I could give it 10 stars. These guys are like family. The best experience is at the bar and that is where you get to make friends with these guys . They are funny and very entertaining . Let choo choo drink with you . You will see what I mean. The quality you cannot beat and the service is awesome . To all the haters you obviously do not know a good quality fish and eat at some yippidy show boating spots .  When I go I alone will order 60+ nigiri plus rolls + appetizers  and they have never missed anything 

This place is great for dates , family outings , friend gatherings and any special occasion.    ALL HAIL THE NEW KING OF SUSHI MR . JJANGA!    Keep living the dream bro!

I LOVE Jjanga and its All You Can Eat. It's the best in town in terms of quality, value and selection. 

Be sure to order:

Yuzu Yellowtail
Salmon Belly
Screaming O sashimi salad
Tuna Naruto (no rice roll-wrapped in cucumber)
I'm OBSESSED with sushi and this place is amazing! Super cheap prices without compromising quantity or quality!

I came here from California and came across Jjanga. Honestly, it is one of the best sushi places ever. The food tastes amazing and the inside is extremely clean. I would come here if I visit Las Vegas again.

Fantastic experience. We opted to order off the menu rather than do the all you can eat sushi price, and let me tell you, we ate a lot of sushi for less than the all you can eat price. Delicious with fun rolls like Stacy Mom and Taste Like my Ex Girlfriend. 

There is also a little treasure chest for kiddos to pick a toy.

We'll be back.

UPDATE: This is disappointing, to leave a review to a place I've previously left a 5-star review for. This place changed ownership and thus all the staff along with it. Sushi portions are now smaller, and the fish is just not as fresh as it used to be.
I'm sorry, but we will not be returning to this establishment. Good luck.

Unfortunately after our previous two visits, last nights dinner was by far the worst service we have ever gotten. No one in our group will be returning.  Waitress came by maybe once every 20 minutes. We constantly had to flag her down to ask for something or check on our order. Time between ordering food and  receiving it was over 40 min three separate times. Mind you, this was as the restaurant visibly slowed down in occupancy. Manager apologized then came back 5 min later to make some excuse about an employee leaving. The total dinner service for us was just shy of 3 hours! Terrible, terrible service. 

Don't waste your time here. There are by far other good ayce sushi places where the service is good.

This place is amazing. Fish is very fresh. Inside decor is beautiful. Staff is very nice and attentive. 

Only complaint is that the green mussels were reaaaaaaaally watery.. I don't know if that's how they serve them or something. But.. not really the greatest when all of the "sauce" on top of the mussel just... kind of.. slides off?

What a great place! Sometimes it really pays to get off strip to a restaurant. The best way to do this place is to sit at the sushi bar and ask the sushi chef to make you whatever he wants. Wow. The sushi chef was fantastic.

Had dinner here with Vegas locals, and it was a nice experience. Dined in with 15 people and we all did the all you can eat sushi. We were able to get a lot of food. My family ordered fried baby octopuses which were really yummy. The chef came by our table and gave us a chef's special. It tasted like ceviche. It was fish seasoned in lemon. Miso soup was hot and hit the spot. There was a lot of sushi, so I'm not sure of the names, but they were really yummy. The soy beans were delicious. Finished dinner with mango mochi. Downside, you have to call the waiters to get your food, which is such a hassle, and sometimes the waiters have to tell someone else because they are not your waiter.

Everyone who left less than 5 stars should be summarily executed. This was easily the best sushi we have ever had--regardless of price. On that latter point, the AYCE is incredibly inexpensive for what you get. If you're in Vegas, don't pass this up. And if you do, reread the first sentence of this review. Thanks.

So I'm usually pretty skeptical when it comes to places with less than 100, or even less than 50 reviews. I mean the restaurant can easily pay people or urge their friends to write great reviews for them...

But lo and behold, this places deserves all five stars.

It's a really new place. It opened on February 1st. We went there literally 2 weeks after its opening. The place was completely empty during lunch. Because they were pretty empty, we got to talk to the server and the sushi chef the entire time. According to them, the night before (February 14), it was packed and there was a full 1 and 1/2 hour wait. That's great for a new restaurant!

The sushi chef, Captain Choo Choo, was really nice and friendly. The staff seems very laid back and fun. They made some recommendations on the fish and rolls to try, one of which was the saba (mackarel), which can really be super fishy at some places. Fortunately, it was actually really delicious here. It was flavorful without having that extremely fishy after taste. I was definitely impressed with that choice.

All of the nigiri that we ordered had fresh, delicious fish. None of them left a bad taste in my mouth. Some memorable ones were the halibut and the yuzu yellowtail. Both of them had light sauce, which didn't overpower the light flavors of the fish.

They also have sushi burritos, which have gained popularity since it popped up in norcal. I ordered the monkey burrito, These sushi burrito options usually come with tempura shrimp, some sort of raw fish, rice, and a soy paper wrap. It was definitely a big portion, but it was delicious!

Unfortunately at lunch, they don't offer the full menu, so we couldn't try the steak, uni (sea urchin), ebi (sweet shrimp), sashimi options, and the mochi ice cream. 

All in all, it's one of my favorite ayce sushi places. I think it tops Goyemon, at least for their lunch. They were nice enough to give us stamp cards even though we're from out of town, so we'll definitely be back soon!

Had the all you can eat and i must say it was a great just amazing the selection was to die for drowned myself in salmon, the service was great and always there when i needed them thank you for the great time
This place is delicious! Came here on a slow night so service was quick. Server was very polite and attentive. They have the best nigiri!

Michele found JJanga one night as we were looking for a place that takes reservations for a big group.  She called a few places and got the runaround.  So, out of the blue she called JJanga and it became our go to place.  

We have been here many times and I have yet to have a bum meal.  Service can differ from lunch to dinner but, that is the added human factor with eating out.  But, I would say that service has been pretty solid at night.  Scott, Janga and the rest of the night crew make it, not only a feast, but a good time.  I have never been to a place where the owner comes out and celebrates with his customers.  They treat the young ones incredibly as well.  They bring out a huge treasure chest for them to choose little toys from, a separate menu for those who are picky, and cute little plates to eat from.

When you wrap all of this up, you can see why we keep coming back again and again.  The rolls, appetizers,  and desserts are plentiful and tasty.  

A few of my favorites are:
The Freshmen
Lion Roll
Playboy
WO7
Crab Balls

We not only found a great restaurant but, a few good friends as well..

I had an opportunity to try takeout from this restaurant. I must say that I didn't pick the sushi so my review may be different if I got to pick.  We tried a tuna hand roll, caterpillar, lion, Washington, and vegas. My favorites were the vegas roll and Washington. A lot of the rolls had that imitation crab meat, which just isn't my thing. I don't usually go for the fried rolls but I did like Vegas (fried and imitation crab!)

Would I try this restaurant again? Maybe! I'll be sure to leave a follow up review if I do
Super good appetizers!! Love the baby octopus! The halibut nigiri was super fresh! Friendly and attentive service. Would def recommend!!

I gave away our card with 4 stamps at the end of the meal.  THAT'S how sure our group was that none of us would ever return.  

This isn't sushi in the Japanese sense.  These are crazy freakin rolls/inventions that contain some raw fish in, on or around them.  Calling this Japanese is very misleading.  The typical roll on the menu sounds like this:

"Tastes and smells like your bitchy ex-mother in law's 1st semester college sophomore roommate who did the whole lacrosse team on a dare and got Hepatitis C roll:  Baked inside out roll stuffed with eel, cream cheese, bbq sauce, avocado, super super super white tuna, chopped yellowtail and spicy tuna, shishito peppers, scallop, garlic and salmon on top with orgasm, yum yum, and fuck me in the ass sauce on the side."

As you can see, they used the whole "I Love Sushi" concept and took it way over the top.  This could be a potentially fun dinner (as many Yelp reviews can attest) trying all the insanity but there were enough misses to warrant my negativity.  It wasn't fun, but it sure was funny.  

- Sushi rice was off.  Slimy?  Low quality?  I don't know for sure since there was a lot of sauce.  I see a lot of reviews raving about sashimi though.
  
-Speaking of sauce...what's up with drenching sauce all over nigiri?  Several pieces of nigiri came with sauce on top as a default.  We actually had to request it without.  Freshness of the fish was ok.  None of us died afterwards.  

-Pretty sure that was shrimp cocktail drenched in a soy sauce base and topped with scallion advertised as amaebi. 

-1 order of green tea was not green but it might have been due to the lipstick contamination on the side of the cup.  The liquid was a very, very light brown.  The server claimed it was green tea despite my protest.  Magically, the next cup of tea was suddenly very green.  So that's where Dirk Arthur has been performing all this time!!

- I didn't know uni came in so many colors.  The most suspect pieces were left on the plate.  The server didn't even question it.  She just took them away like she knew.

- My native Japanese dinnermates found the tamago presentation to be hilarious.  A tamago house!

At least the unagi was good.  Congratulations on well cooked eel!  Have a good life.

This place is one of my top 3 AYCE spots! The rolls are just amazing with unique sauces and names. The sushi burrito is really good specially if you have tried it when Foodie Fest is around and they have that sushi burrito truck. 

The beef tataki roll and the garlic tuna is my favorite here.
If you have ever been to sumo sushi 2, then you know Jjanga. Great sushi and very fresh!

Came here with a large group! The service and the food were both fantastic. We always have a really good meal. They have creative rolls and the AYCE prices are really competitive. 

20.95 for lunch. 
25.95 for dinner. 

We will be back.

I had my birthday dinner here last night. I was in a group of about 17 people and I had made reservations ahead of time. They gave us our own room, so I didn't really get a glimpse of the entire restaurant.

The food was absolutely amazing. One of my friends was even able to order only broccoli tempura. The staff was really nice and would come in occasionally to make sure everything was alright. They did forget about one or two of our orders, but they really made up for it all in service. 

This is definitely my new favorite sushi place!

Great spot! 
The food was good and atmosphere very nice. Great mix of music and we had the best chef at the bar! Ask for Hickey Son.

Will be coming back again!

We love eating here, but please make sure to take a good, long look at your bill before you pay!! We have been charged the dinner price during lunch time on two occasions now! The first time we did not realize and left wondering why our bill was so big. Yesterday we finally caught on. Really disappointed to see that they did that to us. We left feeling a bit betrayed. But regardless, we love the food here. We'll just have to be extra cautious next time we come back!

It saddens me to leave such a negative review after all the times we've been here, but I just don't want the same thing happening to other customers. The service is decent. The first couple times we were here, our orders took a really long time to get to us, but the most recent times we've been the service has been great! The waitress actually recognizes that we're there almost every week! That's why I feel so betrayed because being regulars, I didn't think she could charge us like that, TWICE, and not expect us to catch on... Especially ME because I, myself, am a server.

amazing all you can eat place in Vegas! live out of town and will be coming here every time I am in Vegas from now till forever!!! the garlic tuna is amazing! service is great, atmosphere is great as well.
Loved this place before but I'm not a huge fan of the new menu. They took out lots of their vegan options . Hopefully they will bring some back in the future. Service was fantastic with ayce.

I'm still craving this place and I had it a month ago. I've tried just about every AYCE sushi place in town and this one trumps them all. Just the variations and range of selection alone makes it a top choice. Everything was SO tasty except for maybe one tuna roll that was a little more fishy than I prefer. It didn't have a sauce with it so either the tuna wasn't as fresh as it should be or I'm used to rolls being covered with sauce to mask any fishiness. I always try a roll without dipping in soy or wasabi to taste it as it should be. I can say that all except for that one needed nothing additional, flavorful in their own right. However, their wasabi is fresh and legit. A little goes a long way, not like that genetic weak wasabi crap. Ambiance is comfortable and zen-ish. Service is good, fun, and friendly. I will be back many many times as this is now my AYCE spot! Just writing about it makes me so hungry!!

AYCE based sushi restaurant.  
As AYCE places go, this is one of the better ones I have sampled. FIrst off, if you don't want AYCE their prices are pretty reasonable and you can have three special rolls for the same price as AYCE.  If you like simpler sushi/sashimi you can have up to 5 rolls.  

The fish is very fresh and they have a lot of creative rolls.  The crab ball appetizer is excellent.
