I was able to try the jackpot, grand canyon, golden scallop, crab roll, volcano, cowboy, and more.  Many of their special rolls are soft shell crab based which is not my favorite.  The menu, although with plenty of choices, seems to lean heavily in the tuna, salmon and crab arenas.  We received a sample of the salmon belly which was good.

The staff is very friendly and even has a box of toys for the kids so my daughter had a good time. She really enjoyed the Mel's roll, having three of them, and the crab balls.  There are several kids options on the menu yet surprisingly, none of them include sushi which was a bit disappointing.

The special rolls are named with risque themes so be prepared to answer questions from your child if you bring him or her.

Overall an excellent option if AYCE is your thing!

The food is amazing here. Everything tastes so fresh. The food comes out in super fast. And there's a good variety of both cooked and uncooked dishes.

If I have to recommend ONE thing to try here.. it's the POKE SALAD! Yum.. its so delicious. Not sure why no one ever thought to combine poke salad and seaweed salad and make it spicy! You can only order one per person so I ordered one for everyone and ate it all lol.

Another amazing feature of Jjanga is the service. Waiters are constantly moving around, checking on drinks, taking away empty plates, and the energy here is so fun! Its one of the best services I've experienced in awhile.

Oh and the chef sent us a free sashimi dish while we were here. How awesome is that??

Definitely coming back soon.
Five stars for food and attitude! Sushi is bomb, service was bomber. Go here at 11:30am. Eat lotsa sushi. I'll be there. Say hi to me.

Cheap all you can eat sushi that is located off the strip! I went to lunch with my gf's and saw that this place had decent reviews. The cool part is that the entire group does not have to order all you can eat, but the person eating a la cart cannot eat share food from people doing all you can eat. The menu is very extensive..I wish I had more people with me when I visited this place. I stuck to the nigiri especially the salmon, albacore, and yellowtail. There was also baked mussels which were pretty good and tried out the seaweed. You can also order dessert from the all you can eat menu and I got the green tea ice cream (yum).

Overall not bad for the price you pay at an all you can eat sushi. The service though was painfully slow. I felt like I had to order in big batches to makes sure I got everything in time. I would suggest that if you come to visit that you're not rushing because then you can't enjoy the food as much! 

Otherwise, would definitely stop by again if not in a time crunch. Service was ok, I think we had like 3 different servers, so they would keep mixing up our orders.

AYCE sushi. Went on the recommendation of a friend, who is a Vegas resident. Everything was so good.  Service, food, prices.  We ordered 24 different plates and finished everything.  And Mochi ice cream for dessert.  Will definitely go back again.

The only thing recommended but we didn't get was the peach sake. They are in the process of renewing their liquor license and only served soft drinks. Next time.

All you can eat sushi! SOOOO good! Even my dad, who is not a huge sushi fan loved it.

We cannot wait to go back on our next visit!

Went there on Saturday 01/02/16.  Yes it was a Saturday night with a 30-40 min wait so we went to the bar where we were told we couldn't sit because it was reserved.  After 40 min we observed two people being seated who came after us, we asked about it and the waitress looked up at our name and saw that we had been skipped she asked an employee why did he skip us in her language and they begin to argue then the manager came over and said that the two guys were actually sitting at the bar and not at a table.  That was a straight out lie! I could see them at a table and furthermore there were still 4 empty seats at the bar! After an hour we were seated, I asked for some edemame to be brought immediately since my girl was becoming nausea's, waitress said sure I'll get it right away, she came back 3X since that and 20 min later she finally brought it with the regular order.  My cousin waited 20 min for teriyaki appetizer and never did get two miso soups, so his girlfriend had his.  Service and wait times were lousy!! Food was decent, but considering, I will never eat there again or recommend them! Our bill was $148 for
four people.

We went for our anniversary and it was such a pleasant experience. The waiters were very attentive and our hibachi chef Joe is super nice and personable. Food was delicious and fairly priced. I was so surprised at how many choices you get for hibachi. We ordered a few sushi rolls and they didn't fail us there either. We definitely will be going back!!

We came here for Valentine's Day dinner, ready for some tasty AYCE after hearing good things about this new sushi place on Decatur near Twain.  Looking over the menu, I was so happy to see that they offered my favorite, the Lion Roll, which I've only found at one other sushi place in Henderson.  It turns out that the chefs at Jjanga (not that game Jenga) used to work at that Hendo joint, so now I don't have to go all that way to get my fix.  This place is new and was not that busy, which was just fine with us on this Hallmark holiday-no waiting for a table.  Very nice modern decor with wood accenting and quite roomy, this place doesn't feel like your traditional sushi restaurant.  Jung, our waiter du jour, was very friendly and attentive, making sure he answered any questions we had and kept the food and drinks coming.
In addition to the Lion Roll, I liked the pumpkin soup, the Johnny Roll, and dessert, of course. Jjanga had a  Valentine's Day special: fried banana with vanilla ice cream, whipped cream, and chocolate sauce, a sweet ending to a great V Day meal. Jung even took our  picture with some new-fangled Polaroid type camera so they could hang our photo on one of the walls, posted with those of other customers. We got one to keep, as well. After such an enjoyable and filling meal, we know that we shall return.

Hidden gem! So good, awesome service. This place is one of a kind never had any sushi like it. Recommend it to locals and even if your visiting it is a chill hang out spot. Definetly have to come back some time soon.

The reason why I give this place a five star Becuase they give good portion of rice. Salmon belly & yuzu yellowtail nigiri is what I always tend to get here. Happy hour is $20 AYCE after 11pm which is pretty good but certain items are excluded. Stamp card is also useful in here too.

Alright, this is definitely the last time I'm coming here. 
And I will be blunt with my reason: the manager (or maybe owner?) here is RUDE. 

What sucks about it is, I was once a customer that came in twice a week with other people, and never felt like I offended anyone in the restaurant in any way. In this particular 

We walked out, he stared at us as we walked out, and continued using his iPhone. 

With "service" like that, I'd rather go to any other sushi place here in Vegas. 
I won't be returning here until I'm certain the restaurant has changed owners or management.

We read that this place was rated top in the city . Sadly I disagree... The staff was friendly when engaged with but the service was a bit slow  when it came to cleaning  up finished plates  .We were 2 of the 4 ppl in the place .  I think it was a shift change . But My main issue was that I was served a less than fresh  house salad ( brown soggy leaves yicks and yuck )  I wish i could give a better review but unfortunately I cant

The fish on sushi is tmso thin and short... I asked for easy rice and they told me they dont give much rice in every order. compare to thin fish slice, rice is wayyy too much. I would give 0 star rating if I could. make sure u dont order rolls cuz it has much sauce and rice( they put soft shell crab inside and it was replaced wifh shrimp tempera). After ordering twice they dont come to your table even though u wave at them ; unless u shout out to get attention

Jjanga Sushi.. There is nothing bad to say about this place at all. I have been experiencing various sushi spots in town, although there are some good ones, this one just blows all the others out of my catalog for sushi spots. Their food is always, always, always fresh. I have been back there 3-4 times and not once have I had anything that left a bad taste in my mouth. 

The atmosphere of this place is one you can easily fall in love with. Day or night you are always greeted with friendly smiling faces. The staff takes the time to come up and greet you and get you to your seats right away. Once at your table, it is game on for the AYCE sushi menu. Don't be shy in this place, they want you to try all they have to offer. 

Once you are here, it is like family... We take our 4 month old in there and she loves it. It is quiet enough that she'll sleep straight through our stay there. A perfectly balanced ambiance. The servers are very friendly and helpful, always making sure you have what you need. The owners are fantastic. They help make your eating experience one to remember. We absolutely LOVE Jjanga sushi.

Amazing!  
We came here Sunday at 2:30p and paid lunch buffet prices . The fish was very fresh! I've been to Japan and am usually very wary about going to sushi restaurants.... And a sushi buffet none the less. Anyways the food is top notch... I would get Salmon and eel nigari, money burrito, and anything on the shrimp tempura slide.

I'm a local here in Vegas and of all the sushi places I've been to this is the best all around! It's just off the strip which makes their prices incredible!! 25$ all you can eat, rolls for under 5$ and absolutely phenomenal specialty rolls for 8$. I have yet to taste sushi so fresh it melts in your mouth!! MUST try their spring mountain roll, fresh men, and I love my ass roll!!!!!! The first two are riceless but don't let that scare you it has so much flavor!!! The service is over the top especially JJ! We have an amazing time EVERYTIME! Ill never go anywhere else. Definitely a HIDDEN GEM

Let me start off by saying , If you are a SUSHI SNOB This is not the place for you.  This is for those young hipsters who are starting off in sushi and think they know what they know. 

We had Hamachi, that was the ugliest color and tasted so HORRIBLE!  It did not look like your typical Buttery Hamachi.  The other Nigiri was just All Right! Nothing special and tasted a bit dated but not too much. 

We had AYCE and the Side Items they serve.... #1 the Mussels... Good Quality but FLAVOR FREE.  They had absolutely no flavor what so ever despite their desperate attempt to put some sort of Teriyaki Mayo combination on them.  Just give me steamed Mussels then. 

Golden Scallop... This title suggested a Seared Scallop , cooked to perfection. Not some Frozen Food, Deep Fried Scallop that was so dry it was Laughable. 

The Crab Balls,  DISGUSTING.. All this is , is the inside mixture of a California roll, Minus the Avocado and Minus the Cucumber Deep Fried in a Tempura Batter topped with a Yum Yum Sauce.

Did I mention they use Korean Seaweed Paper in lieu of the traditional Japanese Nori which tastes horrid with sushi. 

I am Korean and appreciate all things asian however this place sucks. Service is wack, they are all cute and nice with their greetings like any other thrown together Sushi fad but that is the extent of it.  

If you are a sushi snob like myself then steer clear from this place.

One of my new favorite places to have sushi! Super fresh fish and dynamite sushi menu! Relaxed and fun atmosphere and clearly always busy, which is a good sign of a great place! Moon was our server and was a lot of fun. The fish here was tits!

We had a great experience here. 
Usually go to the Fort Apache location for dinner but we were in the area and decided to stop in for lunch. 

We were the only people in the entire restaurant. So it was super quiet and relaxing. Fish was fresh and the rolls were so good. Def my fave AYCE sushi spot in Vegas (both locations) but this one was perfect since it was Monday lunch and a good peaceful vibe.

Menu has a great variety of appetizers, cut/hand rolls and speciality rolls. A few things on the dinner menu are not on the lunch menu like bulgogi, but who's cares. Totally worth it for 21.00 and I'm excited to go back.

We do AYCE sushi quite often and are always looking for a new place to check out. A suggestion from a coworker led us here. The Dinner AYCE is $25.95, I'm pretty impressed with the quality of fish here. I primarily do all nigiri nowadays and avoid the rolls but the roll selection is pretty vast. The nigiri I got mostly was the salmon, I love salmon nigiri and it has become my favorite the quality of Salmon here was great.. the fat content made it seem more like a salmon belly cut, I loved it (got about 10 orders of it). I also had the garlic tuna which seemed super fresh as well and had a nice subtle citrus flavor which was light and flavorful.. also got some Cajun albacore which I am a big fan of as well, the Cajun Alb here had just a little too much citrus flavor in it, it wasn't bad but for a true Cajun Alb fan it didn't match up to my previous euphoric Cajun albacore experiences.. my girlfriend got a couple rolls, all of which were good and like I said the selection is vast! We normally go to Goyemon but sometimes don't feel like doing the waiting game.. if you find yourself in that predicament this is a nice alternative and is conveniently located  in Chinatown. The service was top notch and the sushi chefs at the bar were funny, super nice and welcomed any order with a smile. Check it out if you get a chance (you also get 10% off for yelping)

Came here last time I was in Vegas. It was on the way to an outlet and not far from the strip. This place is definitely a local place in a small strip mall. I usually don't prefer AYCE sushi especially when I'm on vacation and want to splurge, but JJANGA was surprisingly good. The service was exceptional and probably bumped it from a 4 star to a 5 star. When we got there we were greeted right away and got a seat at the bar. My friends and I eat A LOT when it comes to AYCE, so much so that the sushi chef couldn't keep up with our orders, but that was reasonable. He tried his best and remembered more than I could have given that he was talking to us and making small talk all the way through. Fairly entertaining guy.. The food was great especially for an AYCE it was really good. I liked that the chef and the server both kept recommending dishes to us. Its not like we paid and they left us alone until we were full, rather, they told us what they liked and what we might like. I appreciate that, in that it shows they aren't really just trying to push customers through like a lot of AYCE places, but were there to provide excellent service. Highly recommended.

We were apprehensive to stop here because it appeared to be your average sushi bar in Vegas, but we were SO WRONG! Everyone here was spectacular! I tasted the best sushi ever today. The Choo Choo special is literally out of this world. I will never again return to Vegas with out stopping here! Btw, choo choo  was loaded with personality. Loved him

I went to JJANGA last Saturday, 1/16/16. The food was amazing, but the service was subpar compared to all the other "All You Can Eat" sushi restaurants in Las Vegas. The service was extremely slow. Great sushi, but extremely slow ticket times. Be prepared to wait a while for your orders.

I enjoyed my meal very much. The environment was very casuals but still could be a great place for a date night. My sushi was very pretty and delicious. My bf enjoyed his unagi bowl and had plenty of unagi for the price.

I found it funny that when my bf asked for soda the waiter responded with "you mean tea?" That was totally not what was asked. 

One negative thing is that we waited forever for my sister's chicken katsu...i think they forgot to make it because it took a little longer when we inquired about her dish... and also it took forever to get our check. We had to ask twice to get it. Thus, this spot gets 3 stars. It was good but I won't be coming back any time soon.

I took my parents from Japan while they were here.  We wanted to send almost EVERYTHING back.  This place is a big EEWWW!!!  This is the first time I left AYCE sushi restaurant hungry and the first time I didn't finish my favorite Amaebi.
My recommendation is not to get sushi, not to get miso soup, not to get green tea.  What should you get?  Mochi ice cream!
The service was good though.

Bomb!!!! Love the shumai , shrimp tempura,miso soup,fried scallop, fresh man roll , garlic wing, spicy wing, jackpot special, screaming orgasam,Cajun albacore!! Mochi is good here too! It's our new favorite ayce place! Very fresh fish and cute inside too! Awesome spot!!

What's not to like? Rice goood, beef goood, fish goood, ice cream gooood. It's saying that this is not long enough so it's counted as a tip instead of a review. So I'm adding this part in so I can get the free Korean ice cream for my grandma. She doesn't even know if she wants it. I think she just wants it cause it's free. This should be long enough now.

I use to come here a lot because it was the best ayce sushi restaurant in Las Vegas up until a few months ago. This place is still good, although service is quite slow. Food is fresh and tasty at Jjanga but a better spot opened up in town. If you like this spot, I think you will love Sakana's ayce.

My absolute favorite thing to get at ayce sushi is salmon nigiri. So it's always a disappointment when their salmon isn't fresh or yummy tasting. And you could tell here. The uni looked really old, too. 

Apparently they have salmon belly but I didn't find that out till when I was full so don't forget to request that if you're a fan. 

Ice cream mochi is one order per person. But they also have ice cream. I ordered chocolate but I was expecting plain ole chocolate not whatever I got. It was like rocky road mixed with something else. 

The service started out well because they weren't busy but by the end of our meal, it was a struggle trying to order some more things / dessert. Guess they were a bit overwhelmed and then started mostly paying attention to the larger tables. 

Nothing in particular stood out. They seem like a place to go to when other places have hour long wait times around dinner time (~7-8pm). 

Oh yeah, they have karaoke and sushi rooms, too. Interesting.

I love AYCE (all you can eat) sushi because I can put em down! They have the best muscles, gyoza, and a huuuuuge variety of rolls. Baked and deep fried are my favorite. I have been here probably 15 times. The customer service is great, fast and always kind. They just remolded and it is really nice. Love the restaurant, always clean and nice. Great price for AYCE and it is not so busy that I am annoyed with everyone everywhere and sitting closely like some other AYCE places here. My favorite!!!

This place is my 3rd go to ayce sushi spot after Goyemon and sushi twister. I usually go here because the other 2 are too far away.

Service here is A1 compared to most others

Their nori is crispy, fish fresh. Only complaint is the fish is served too cold here.
This place is amazing. The price you pay is definitely worth it. $20.95 for lunch & $25.95 for dinner. A must go for sushi lovers.

OMG JJENGAAAAAA! This sushi place is by far the best AYCE sushi in Vegas. The interior is spacious but has an added amount of privacy for each group. You an either sit at the sushi bar or sit at the tables. OH THEY HAVE KARAOKE TOOOOOO! Anyway the sushi quality is really great. I usually come in for lunch and sit at the bar. All the chefs are really nice and very attentive to your needs. May of their rolls have really good flavor and my favorites are the "something wrong 69" and the "burning My ass roll." The appetizers are really good too. Overall a great sushi place. Great atmosphere and great food!

If you have no idea of what a REAL Japanese sushi restaurant is come to this place.Rolls are mayonnaise, imitation crab meat,and vegetables.Fish is mackerel,rockfish,cod,and GMO farmed salmon,escolar (aka) white tuna.Oyster was like eating a piece of metal.This place is a total disgrace to the Japanese culture!!!!!!

This restaurant is so far my favorite place for AYCE sushi in town. Lunch is $21 and dinner $26 with a late night happy hour at (11pm-1am) that let's you pay the lunch price! I come here at least twice a month and the quality is superb. The nigiri is very fresh and I particularly love getting the beef tataki and salmon belly. Mmm the salmon belly is so smooth and buttery, it is just delicious. Everything I've tried here so far I've enjoyed. Some of my favorites include the Mistake, Pink Lady, Touchdown and the regular hamachi, unagi, and tobiko. All the chefs are very friendly and helpful in helping you find something that you enjoy. Also, the grapefruit soju is amazing! The flavor is great and you barely notice that it has alcohol in it, which is both good and very dangerous! If you come here be sure to ask for a stamp card, after the tenth AYCE stamp you can get a free one!

Atmosphere, very laid back joint that is open till 2am in the morning. Perfect for late night sushi cravings in Las Vegas!

I arrived to Las Vegas around 11pm on a Wednesday night, so my GF and I were hungry after a 4 hour drive from LA. We were craving sushi, so we were amazed to see an all you can eat sushi restaurant was open till 2am. Surprisingly, there was a good amount of people at the restaurant. The waiter had a thick accent but we were able to communicate. We had the AYCE, so we started with some hand rolls and a few California rolls. We then noticed they had a monkey burrito! At first I was hesitant to try it, but I ended up trying it anyways. It was actually really good. It's served in a plate and looks like a wrap. It contains crab, shrimp tempura, spicy tuna, avocado with spicy mayo and eel sauce. That would have to be my favorite item in the menu. 

Overall, this restaurant was very good. Back home, we don't have any sushi spots that are open till 2am, so that's a big plus. I noticed the shopping center was a bit sketchy, but the food was good, so it was worth it.
Mini bf steak, fresh man, and mushroom ball were my favorite. Also good price of al la cart. Friendly staffs and nice food.
Simply the best spot for sushi  Damian is an awesome sushi chief, I come here at least 2x a week.
LOVE THIS PLACE!!! Cannot wait to go back next time I'm in town. Freshest sushi in Vegas! Such a hidden gem
Never disappointed when we come to Jjanga, sushi is amazing and the staff is extremely friendly. Hands down best sushi and staff in Vegas!

When it comes to appetizers, nigiri, and rolls; this is usually my go to spot. A few friends of mine introduced this place to me and I've fell in love with it ever since. 

I've had good service here every time I came here so I can't complain about that. The servers are usually good at recommendations when it's your first time here. 

I'm a nigiri type of person. I'm very picky when it comes to quality and the amount of rice in each one. The garlic tuna and super white is a must have when it comes to nigiri here. It completely melts in your mouth. 

You know how some sushi places put a crap load of rice in their rolls? Well, the rolls here are just right. Perfect amount of rice in each roll and the quality of the fish is simply amazing. I usually order the something wrong #69 and let me tell you, it's completely out of this world. For all you Japanese lasagna fans, you must go here. Cream cheese inside and out. Enough said. 

Last but not least, don't forget to request the choo choo special! It's not on the menu, but it's an absolute favorite. 

This place is a definite must try if you haven't had it yet! :)

My stars are based on the sushi, they were pretty good considering how cheap they were .. About $8 the highest!! And appetizers were like $3 and there were plenty of selections for both! But on to the minus two stars.. 

1 star off because at the time of our visit, they weren't serving any alcohols :(. You can't have sushi without sake??? Or at least BEER?!!! ... We ate our sushi with water :( (already had enough soda for the time being) plus it's VEGAS, that's like alchy central.. It's ok I guess next time ..? Maybe..

2nd star off because.. well, I'm sure our waitress ment well.. Maybe she was new?.. But we felt pressured to order off the menu on her time.. Soo RUSHED, literally not even 5 mins to sit and look over the menu and she came back more than twice to ask if we were ready to order lol. Ok, girly.. Calm down LOL. 

No big deal because we were trying to enjoy our visit.. Hopefully it'll be a next time so we can update on our review..
Excellent fresh delicious sushi & awesome environment! Best sushi in Vegas & great location near the Strip.
Great food and service.  Lucy was amazing and my family had a great time there.  Will def be back the next time we're in town.

This was my first experience with all you can eat sushi. I was a bit ambitious. I'd say I got my money's worth. The only thing I didn't like was the calamari. It had a strange mustard sauce which overpowered the dish. The music was loud. The place was put together nicely.

Great sushi

Beware.  They charge full price for kids now. Mine is 8 and was charged full price.

Me and my three frienda found this, leaving LV after our spring break weekend. The sushi was rather cheap, and tasted fantastic! Two of us wefe vegetarian, the owner madr several tasty rolls for us. 
We also got complementary japanese ice creams when we were done eating, so tasty! 
I'm not a sushi expert, but I love decent sushi amd this place was a great restaurant to end our break!!

A super groovy new friend of mine suggested we have sushi here, I live in the area so I must have passed by a million times and never noticed it. Wow, what a great experience we had, the restaurant was busy and lively, however we were sat immediately. It is a cute restaurant that is super comfortable and cozy, I enjoyed the atmosphere. 

We did AYCE, and were super pleased with our selection of rolls. We took two suggestions on rolls from our server and she did us proud because those sushi rolls were Amazing!

I am so excited, I have a fantastic sushi restaurant so close to my house, I will be back for sure!

The two of us ordered 11 rolls and some appetizers we just split everything it was so delicious. 

I highly recommend AYCE, here because the menu is quite impressive, if you are into sushi you will love it here. I liked how the rolls were less rice and more fresh product so we could try several rolls without being stuffed from rice overkill. Their sauces are delicious, the ginger sauce, screaming orgasm sauce, yum yum sauce etc, were on point depending on the roll selection.

They were on point with clearing empty dishes and keeping our drink glasses full of iced tea and water!

I have listed what we ordered below, all delicious sushi rolls! I will have to reference my review next time so we can do a repeat!

crab ball appetizer
Washington roll
Cowboy special roll
Spider roll
Japanese Lasagna
Mountain roll
Crunch roll
Caterpillar roll
Wo7 roll
Jackpot roll
California crunch roll
Tiger roll
red bean ice cream dessert
green tea ice cream dessert

A fantastic all-you-can eat sushi restaurant.  I am amazed at how good each item is. They don't cut corners on quality. Excellent service from everyone ( I especially like Kara). Give this place a try.

Another for my Vegas AYCE asian buffet lists.
This restaurant had the best sushi that I have had in Vegas yet.  And let me specify that I personally do not do rolls, just nigiri sushi and this is the best AYCE nigiri in Vegas.
When I say that I mean that the sushi comes out perfectly seasoned and there is no  need to ad soy or wasabi, unless it is a matter of preference.
This restaurant came very close to being my first five star restaurant but the kitchen items were only mediocre.  The tempura was a little greasy and undercooked, but I was really there for the sushi and it was EXCELLENT.  
They were very busy but the waitresses still tried to be attentive.  They laughed because I ordered damn near everything on the menu.  I'm sleepy. G'nite!
My new favorite sushi spot!! Food was fresh, customer service was impeccable! I'll be back for sure!!
We had AYCE and overall were very pleased. The selection is good and the service is quick and friendly.

I love their sushi but only if you do the lunch special it's worth it to go sushi and dinner more expensive.  For example if you get two rolls of sushi a equals up to $18 at for all you can eat is $20 for lunch for dinner is $35 for all you can eat.

Best all you can eat Sushi & Bulgogi is a plus!My concern was just the server sometimes there not paying attention make sure to follow up your order that way you won't wait that long other than that food was great!

We tried the AYCE for lunch. The food was ok.
Food came out fast, and tasted decent.
Probably would not come here again, there are other go-to sushi AYCE places in town that are slightly better for the same price.
Dish is excellent!!! Best in town!!! This is my new favorite spot for sushi ..... Love love it ... Tha food is so fresh and delicious ! I'm so addicted to this place!!!

This is my favorite sushi place ever!! I recommend it to everyone! As it's gotten more popular there seems to always be a wait to sit but it's worth waiting for. Get the all you can eat sushi because you won't want to stop. They usually have to roll us out of there! Their new roll with the beef tataki is amazing! So are the rice-less rolls!! They have kids prices as well.

This place is so far the best sushi I have had in Vegas. They have lots of interesting rolls. I really enjoyed the jjanga burrito, red rock roll, washington roll, yuzu yellowtail, and red bean ice cream.I would definitely recommend this place. I also like the fact that it's open late.
My new favorite sushi spots . Incredible garlic tuna . Screaming orgasm ,salmon Hand roll . poky salad is amazing . The delicious fresh oysters .

Jjanga is the best ayce sushi around, in a city with a lot of choices. Don't know what all the negative reviews for service is but we've always been treated like vips. Especially by the only white waiter here and all the chefs. Maybe because we go here 3x a month and we usually sit at the sushi bar. Sushi is great with a lot of selection. Sure, if you're expecting  a Nobu experience for $26 then you're delirious. Keep it real with your reviews people. You wont get this kind of sushi for this value anywhere else. Chefs are a hoot and will give you awesome extras for regulars or people they like.
Huge AYCE selection and better yet, low prices for a la carte if you don't want to pig out.  Interesting sashimi salads, give this place a try!

Sushi  meets Hawaii or Texas 
Fun place with Hugh choice of sushi style...

Hugh plate so If u order must finish...

This place is amazing 
Always takes care of you 
Great vibes and the sushi is great 
Definitely my favorite place and will continue to keep coming here !!!

Jjanga is the best AYCE Sushi joint we've been to in LV. Service is great. Fish is always fresh! The waitresses are super nice and fast. We come often and everything has been consistent. Highly recommended if you get those sushi cravings.

I used to love this place but I went to go wash my hands in the women's restroom & the cold water wasn't working & I burned my hands pretty bad.  I told the waitress & she didn't say anything just went to tell the other waiters & they laughed.  I expected a little more since I'm always here.  I told the other waitress & all she said, "yeah it happens sometimes."  That's crazy! Why don't they get it fixed. I'm glad I had washed my hands before my son.  The lack of acknowledgment or trying to make things right went out the door. I always recommend this place to everyone I know.  They only way I would come back is if management reached out to me.  Very disappointed.  Used to be my favorite place.
Great sushi , awesome quality and nice service! The yuzu yellowtail is amazing and the apple salmon is definitely unique! Love coming here while visiting Vegas .

I am very picky when it comes to sushi and this place is definitely 5 stars.

The AYCE menu is amazing - plenty of items without rice! No rice rolls, sashimi and poke salads (the poke salad was my favorite!). The non-ayce prices are very reasonable too, though the portions are smaller.

The servers were very attentive.

I will definitely be going back here!

Food was awesome! Great sushi and great service. We ordered a lot of nigiri. The fish taste fresh and the rolls were creative. They have the traditional rolls but they have a whole selection of new rolls I've never had before. They even have a lot of great appetizers to go with the sushi if you like meat as well. They had some really tasty beef tartar rolls that I've never had before. Would definitely recommend Jjanga!
Great service.  Sushi just kept coming. Polite staff. So many choices. Taste great !This is the spot !

If there was an option to give more stars than 5, I would.  This place is the best sushi joint I have ever been to.  If I could have their Garlic Tuna and Yuzu Yellowtail every day I would be an extremely happy camper.  

I have yet to try anything here that I don't like, and on top of the ridiculously good food the atmosphere is fantastic.  Everyone who works at Jjanga is so friendly, funny and welcoming.  Almost every customer that walks through the door is recognized/welcomed back by one the of the staff.  Koo Koo and Jjanga have been absolute standouts for my roommate and I.  But really, everyone there makes the experience as great as it is.

Whether you're a local or just visiting Vegas, this place is a must.  You are seriously missing out if you haven't been here yet.

Once again, yelp definitely saved us on another food adventure ! Getting to the place seems pretty sketch and a little hard to find, but trust me that the find is definitely worth it !!!! The restaurant is so modern looking and really nice. I like how they have the paper lanterns placed around the restaurant. I guess you could say the ambiance is really nice (:

Went there for the dinner AYCE and I was definitely not disappointed ! Everything was super super super yummy ! I really enjoyed the Spicy Garlic Edamame ! It's a must try bcs it's something different than the usual plain salted ones. Also for appetizers, their seaweed salad is very fresh and yummy (: and I'm so happy they have FRIES ! Bcs I'm a fry addict, although I did not have the chance to taste theirs. & definitely try out their meat appetizer selection bcs it's very tender and juicy ! I love MEAT ! 

Going into the rolls ! BACON BACON BACON ! It definitely stood out, their bacon roll. I was a little skeptical bcs it said "fruit sauce" but don't be hesitant !!!!! ORDER IT ! It's very light sauce and soooo delicious ! Everything just compliments each other ! It's so perfect, especially for those adventurous people out there. My favorites included the Tuna Naruto ! It's really refreshing ! And does not have that over powering cucumber taste that I know may throw off some guests. And it's also cool how they have sushi burritos !!!! They are very unique to the menu, but it was just like a normal roll. I did enjoy the sauce though.

The best part of the night was the EXCELLENT SERVICE ! Definitely top-notch Grade AAAAA++++ service in any sushi restaurant I have ever been to (and I have been to plenty) ! JayJay (or JJ) was the best host there & he even sang to us, which was pretty great and random. Everyone is really friendly and fun ! & most important, well attentive and available when needed ! 

The only reason for not having 5 stars would be that there are ZERO pics of how their sushi would look like before you order ): it's like a surprise in a box & I had to refer to trusty ol' yelp to give me a sneak preview. And also, I had one roll that the fish was not as fresh as could be & also in my poke salad, one fish piece was not that super fresh either. 

But I WILL DEFINITELY RETURN ! They have stamp cards & this is probably my top favorite sushi place in Vegas at the moment (: even above the beloved Goyemon and my other fav Yama sushi.

*******On my other visits, the service was okay. They always walk pass by us. & it's hard to even get an order in, there's usually a wait on our rolls. They need to sort this out & assign someone to serve each table.
The staff: like family. The food: Great! Really you can't go wrong with any choices. I drive here all the way from the South West of the Valley, completely worth it. LOVE Jjanga!!
The food here is consistently great!   This, combined with the great service and attention to detail will definitely keep me coming back!

I don't know what write here, but it's one of the best sushi bar in the USA!
Food is fresh!
Service is excellent- they are very friendly and fast!
If I will in Vegas one more time I come to this  godly place)

We took a visiting family member out tonight and opted for AYCE sushi which landed us an Jjanga. We opted for the AYCE dinner, which was $25.95 per person. There was also a happy hour option that was a few bucks cheaper, but excluded most of the specialty items. For me, when it comes to sushi it's all about the rice. Call me picky, but when rice isn't the right amount of sticky and falling out of my rolls...well, it kinda drives me crazy. This wasn't the case here, so that was definitely a plus. We ordered a few rolls to start out, and none of them were special. I won't even begin to talk about their names. All in all, they were all just bland, even though they were drenched in sauce. 

We figured some saki and beer could make things more enjoyable, and while looking around for our server noticed a sign in the center of the restaurant stating that alcohol was not being served. That was a huge disappointment because we were unaware, uninformed, and at that point it was already too late to leave. We attempted to question our server about it, but she just brushed it off, and so did we. At that point, we really had no choice. Moving along, we decided to make the best of it and ordered a variety of other items. Our favorites being the tofu, garlic edamame, crab balls, and golden scallops. Everything else was again, just okay. 

Not long after we requested our check, and requested ice cream and mochi for our desert as we waited. The check came in 2 seconds, and fifteen minutes later there was still no ice cream. So, we flagged a server down and told her not to worry about our desert, and got up to leave. Overall, this was not the best AYCE experience we have had, but it also wasn't the worst. We were hoping for a more enjoyable, alcoholic version of AYCE sushi dinner for our guest and unfortunately things just didn't work in our favor. Perhaps better luck next time...well, if we ever decide to make the drive across town again and give it a go.

I don't think I've ever had worse service at a sushi place. Tell me why...

1. Tell me why the waitress gave our food order to another table. 45 mins later...
2. Tell me why I had to ask FIVE different people for my oysters- including the manager.
3. Tell me why it's 113 degrees outside yet it feels like 150 degrees at Jjanga. The A/C needs an upgrade. My FAN at home works better tbh. Unless you want to feel like you're in a sauna, then move along.
4. Tell me why you're short staffed when EVO is in town. Also, it's summer. Hashtag NOT prepared.
5. Tell me why we're not getting our food... yet we're getting food we did NOT order? Lucky them. At least someone in this restaurant is being served. =]
6. Jjanga? More like JJUMANJI- it's a MESS up in here.
7. No alcohol because they're renewing their liquor license. I need sake to deal with this service. 
8. Someone just came by while writing this review- "you guys order all this?" ... clearly not because it's not ours.
9. TELL ME WHY I FINALLY GOT MY OYSTERS AND THERE'S ONLY ONE?! 90. minutes. ONE. Oyster. My bad- the menu said oyster, not plural. 
10. Clearly short staffed. The bathroom is a natural disaster.
11. They just came by and asked us how our ice cream was. Wut? WHAT ICE CREAM?!
12. LAST BUT NOT LEAST- No Pokemon around here. What's the point?
13. "Boy bye. I ain't sorry."

I will never ever come back to this establishment. Over my dead body. It's okay- you can't catch 'em all.

I love this place! Great food, excellent/quick service. My new AYCE hot spot! So glad I tried and best of all they take reservations too!!!

Scott always remembers us when we come in every week (sometimes more) and is always making sure that everyone in my party is well taken care of. Jjanga regularly comes out and checks on us as well as prepares special dishes.

Thank you Jjanga crew!! We always recommend you to locals and tourists!
